Head.GRAM: used as the subject of a verb

Sense.DEF: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to himself or herself
Sense.EXAMPLE: I moved to this city six years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 六年前我搬到了这个城市。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not late again, am I?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有又迟到吧？
Sense.EXAMPLE: My husband and I enjoy going to the theatre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和丈夫喜欢去剧院看戏。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.TRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘than I’. Say 而要说 than me or 或 than I am/do/have etc
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They were older than me OR 或 than I was.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们岁数比我大。
F2NBox.TRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘I and Sarah/my friends etc’.Say 要说 Sarah/my friends etc and I
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: In 1972, James and I moved to Tallahassee.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 1972年﹐我和詹姆斯搬去塔拉哈西生活。

Sense.DEF: the ninth letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第九个字母

Sense.DEF: the number one in the system of roman numerals
the name of an interstateimportant road between states in the US
a person from a particular country or place, or their language
Sense.TRAN: 某国的人﹔某地的人﹔某种语言
Sense.EXAMPLE: two Pakistanis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个巴基斯坦人
Sense.EXAMPLE: speakers of Hindi
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说印地语的人

Sense.DEF: of a particular place or country
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bengali food
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孟加拉食品
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Israeli army
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以色列军队

Sense.DEF: a unit of rhythm in poetry, that has one short or weak beat followed by a long or strong beat, as in the word ‘alive’
Sense.TRAN: 抑扬格〔诗歌的音步单位﹐即一个短或弱音节之后跟着一个长或强音节﹐如alive〕

Sense.DEF: a common pattern of beats in English poetry, in which each line consists of five iambs
Sense.TRAN: 抑扬格五音步〔一种常见的英诗格律﹐每行有五个抑扬格〕

Sense.DEF: another form of the suffix -an
Sense.TRAN: 后缀 -an 的另一种形式
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dickensian characters like those in Dickens’ books
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 类似狄更斯笔下人物的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a librarian someone who works in a library
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 图书馆馆员

Sense.DEF: a group or collection of objects, papers, etc that are related to someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 一批与某人[某物]有关的物件[资料等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Victoriana
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维多利亚时期的物品
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shakespeariana
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莎士比亚研究资料汇编

Sense.DEF: relating to Spain or Portugal, or its people
Sense.TRAN: 伊比利亚的﹔与西班牙[葡萄牙]有关的﹔伊比利亚人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Iberian peninsula
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊比利亚半岛

Sense.DEF: a wild goat that lives in the mountains of Europe, Asia, and North Africa
Sense.TRAN: 北山羊〔一种生活在欧洲﹑亚洲和北非山区的野山羊〕

Sense.DEF: used in formal writing to mean from the same book, writer, or article as the one that has just been mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 出处同前〔用于正式书面文体﹐表示源自刚提及的同一本书﹑同一位作者或同一篇文章〕

Sense.DEF: another form of the suffix -ability
Sense.EXAMPLE: invincibility
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可战胜
Sense.EXAMPLE: flexibility
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灵活性

Sense.DEF: a large bird with a long beak and long legs that is related to the stork
Sense.TRAN: 鹮〔一种长腿长喙的大鸟﹐与鹳有亲缘关系〕

Sense.DEF: another form of the suffix -able
Sense.TRAN: 后缀 -able 的另一种形式
Sense.EXAMPLE: irresistible
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可抗拒的
Sense.EXAMPLE: visible
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看得见的

Sense.DEF: a medicine that reduces pain, inflammation, and fever
Sense.TRAN: 布洛芬﹐异丁苯丙酸〔镇痛﹑消炎﹑退烧药〕

Sense.DEF: of, like, or related to a particular thing …
Sense.EXAMPLE: photographic of photography
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摄影的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an alcoholic drink containing alcohol
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 含酒精饮料
Sense.EXAMPLE: polysyllabic containing several syllables
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多音节的
Sense.EXAMPLE: pelvic of the pelvis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 骨盆的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Byronic like or connected with the poet Byron
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拜伦(式)的

Sense.DEF: someone who is affected by a particular unusual condition, a mental illness for example
Sense.TRAN: 受〔某种异常状态﹐如精神疾病〕困扰的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: an alcoholic someone who cannot stop drinking alcohol
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酗酒者

Sense.DEF: another form of the suffix -ic1
Sense.EXAMPLE: historical of history
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: (有关)历史的
Sense.EXAMPLE: satirical
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 讽刺的

Sense.DEF: a missile that can travel very long distances
water that has frozen into a solid state
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you like some ice in your drink?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你饮料中要放点冰块吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her hands were as cold as ice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她双手冰冷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city spent $7 million to remove snow and ice from the roads.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市政府花费了700万美元用于清除路上的冰雪。

Sense.DEF: to do nothing about a plan or suggestion for a period of time
Sense.TRAN: 将〔计划﹑建议〕暂时搁置[冻结]
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m putting my plans for a new car on ice until I finish college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把买车计划推迟到大学毕业之后。

Sense.DEF: to be in a situation in which you are likely to upset someone or cause trouble
Sense.TRAN: 如履薄冰﹐处境不妙〔处于会惹人不高兴或招来麻烦的境况〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be late again, Hugo – you’re skating on thin ice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别再迟到了﹐雨果——你会有麻烦的。

Sense.DEF: a specially prepared surface of ice where you can ice skate or play ice hockey
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two teams are ready to take to the ice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两队都准备好上冰球场了。

Subsense.DEF: a frozen sweet food made with fruit juice
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用果汁制成的〕冰冻甜食﹔冰糕

Subsense.DEF: an ice cream

Sense.DEF: diamonds

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Thick ice was preventing the ship from moving.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 厚厚的冰使船无法开动。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The ice is too thin to skate on.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰太薄﹐不能在上面溜冰。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a layer of thin ice on a road that is very difficult to see
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Black ice on the roads is making driving conditions very dangerous.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 路上的薄冰令路况非常危险。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: broken into small pieces, for example to add to a drink
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Serve the cocktail with crushed ice.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这鸡尾酒要加碎冰。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Our driveway was covered in ice.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的私人车道上结满了冰。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The ice in my glass had begun to melt.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我杯中的冰开始融化了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Ice was forming on the surface of the lake.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 湖面上开始结冰。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We could feel the ice cracking beneath our feet.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们感觉得到脚底下的冰裂开了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a small square piece of ice that you add to a drink
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She put a couple of ice cubes in her glass.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她往自己杯里放了几块冰。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a large piece of ice
very small pieces of ice that form naturally

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The fish were packed in blocks of ice, ready for transportation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 鱼被加入冰块保鲜﹐等待装运。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A thin sheet of ice had formed over the surface of the pond.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 池塘表面结了一层薄冰。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a thick flat piece of ice

PIC.HEADING: ICE 冰
PIC.PICCONTENT: ice cube 冰块；ice bucket 冰桶；cone 蛋卷筒；ice cream 冰激凌；ice cube tray 冰格；block of ice 大冰块

Sense.DEF: to cover a cake with icinga mixture made of liquid and very fine sugar
to cover an injured part of the body in ice to stop it from swelling
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure you ice that ankle down as soon as you get inside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要一进屋就用冰把脚踝敷上。

Sense.DEF: to become covered with ice
Sense.EXAMPLE: Schools were closed when the roads iced over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 道路结冰﹐学校停课了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane’s engines had iced up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机的引擎结了冰。

Sense.DEF: one of the long periods of time, thousands of years ago, when ice covered many northern countries
a very large mass of ice floating in the sea, most of which is under the surface of the water
a firm round pale green lettuce
very pale blue
Sense.EXAMPLE: his ice-blue eyes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的冰蓝色眼睛

Sense.DEF: surrounded by ice, especially so that it is impossible to move
a refrigerator
a special cupboard into which people in the past put ice in order to keep food cold
Sense.TRAN: 〔过去里面放冰块以冷藏食物的〕冰箱

Sense.DEF: something that you say or do to make people less nervous when they first meet
Sense.TRAN: 〔初次见面时〕消除拘谨的话语[举动]
Sense.EXAMPLE: This game is an effective icebreaker at the beginning of a semester.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场比赛可以有效地活跃开学初期的气氛。

Sense.DEF: a ship that cuts a passage through floating ice
a container filled with ice to keep bottles of wine cold
Sense.TRAN: 冰桶〔用于冰镇瓶装葡萄酒〕

Sense.DEF: a container in which pieces of ice are kept for putting in drinks
Sense.TRAN: 冰桶〔用于盛放加入饮料中的小冰块〕

Sense.DEF: an area of thick ice that permanently covers the North and South Poles
extremely cold
Sense.EXAMPLE: ice-cold drinks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰冷的饮料

Sense.DEF: a frozen sweet food made of milk, cream, and sugar, with fruit, nuts, chocolate etc sometimes added to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: vanilla ice cream
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香草冰激凌

Sense.DEF: a small amount of this food for one person
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mummy, can I have an ice cream?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈﹐我能要一份冰激凌吗？

Sense.DEF: a hard thin cooked cake shaped like a cone, that you put ice cream in, or one of these with ice cream in it
Sense.TRAN: 〔放冰激凌的〕蛋卷筒﹔(一份)蛋卷冰激凌

Sense.DEF: a restaurant that only sells ice cream
a mixture of ice cream, sweet syrup, and soda water, served in a tall glass
Sense.TRAN: 〔由冰激凌﹑糖浆﹑苏打水混合制成的〕冰激凌苏打水﹐雪糕苏打

Sense.DEF: a small block of ice used to make drinks cold
iced drinks are made very cold or served with ice
Sense.EXAMPLE: iced water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰水
Sense.EXAMPLE: iced tea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰茶
Sense.EXAMPLE: iced coffee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰咖啡

Sense.DEF: an iced cake has icing on the top
the sport of catching fish through a hole in the ice on a lake or river
an area of ice floating in the sea, that has broken off from a larger mass
a sport played on ice, in which players try to hit a hard flat round object into the other team’s goal with special sticks
a piece of sweet-tasting ice on a stick, that you suck
a man who delivered ice to people’s houses in the past, so that they could keep food cold
Sense.TRAN: 送冰人〔指过去送冰上门供人们冷藏食物的人〕

Sense.DEF: the telephone number of a relative or friend that you store in your mobile phone so that people know who to call if you are badly injured
Sense.TRAN: 紧急联系电话〔储存在手机内的机主亲戚或朋友的电话号码﹐以备机主受重伤时拨打联系〕

Sense.DEF: a bag containing ice that is put on injured or painful parts of your body to keep them cold
Sense.TRAN: 冰袋〔用以冷敷受伤或疼痛处〕

Sense.DEF: a large area of crushed ice floating in the sea
a sharp tool used for cutting or breaking ice
a specially prepared surface of ice where you can ice-skate
an ice cap
a special boot with thin metal blades on the bottom, that allows you to move quickly on ice
to slide on ice wearing ice skates
very cold water with pieces of ice in it, or a glass of this
a skilled worker who deals with a particular thing …
Sense.EXAMPLE: a beautician someone who gives beauty treatments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美容师
Sense.EXAMPLE: a technician someone with technical or scientific skills
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 技术员

Sense.DEF: a long thin pointed piece of ice hanging from a roof or other surface
Sense.TRAN: 〔自屋顶或其他表面垂下来的〕冰锥

Sense.DEF: someone or something that kills a particular person or thing, or the act of killing
Sense.EXAMPLE: insecticide chemical substance for killing insects
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杀虫剂
Sense.EXAMPLE: suicide the act of killing yourself
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自杀

Sense.DEF: if you say something icily, or look at someone icily, you do it in an angry or very unfriendly way
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I want you to leave now,’ she said icily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我要你马上离开。”她冷冷地说道。

Sense.DEF: a mixture made from very fine light sugar and liquid, used to cover cakes
something that makes a very good experience even better
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a great day, but meeting her there was just the icing on the cake!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一天过得很开心﹐而在那儿遇到她更是锦上添花！

Sense.DEF: very fine light sugar that is mixed with liquid to make icing
very unpleasant, especially to look at, taste, or feel
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在视觉﹑味觉﹑触觉上〕非常令人讨厌的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was some icky black stuff between the tiles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瓷砖缝里有些令人恶心的脏东西。

Sense.DEF: a small sign or picture on a computer screen that is used to start a particular operation
Sense.EXAMPLE: To open a new file, click on the icon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要打开新文档﹐点击该图标。

Sense.DEF: someone famous who is admired by many people and is thought to represent an important idea
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sixties cultural icon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个60年代的文化偶像

Sense.DEF: a picture or figure of a holy person that is used in worship in the Greek or Russian Orthodox Church
Sense.TRAN: 〔希腊或俄罗斯东正教的〕圣像

Sense.DEF: someone who attacks established ideas and customs
Sense.TRAN: 攻击传统观念和习俗的人﹐反传统者

Sense.DEF: iconoclastic ideas, opinions, writings etc attack established beliefs and customs
Sense.TRAN: 〔思想﹑意见﹑著作等〕反传统观念和习俗的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wolfe’s theories were revolutionary and iconoclastic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沃尔夫的理论具有革命性和反传统性。

Sense.DEF: the way that a particular people, religious or political group etc represent ideas in pictures or images
Sense.TRAN: 〔特定民族﹑宗教或政治派别用来表达思想的〕图示法﹐象征手法
Sense.EXAMPLE: Native American iconography
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美洲土著的图示法

Sense.DEF: the scientific study or use of something …
Sense.EXAMPLE: linguistics the study of language
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言学
Sense.EXAMPLE: electronics the study or making of electronic equipment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子学

Sense.DEF: the actions typically done by someone with particular skills
Sense.TRAN: 〔拥有某种技能的人从事的〕活动
Sense.EXAMPLE: athletics running, jumping, throwing, etc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 田径运动
Sense.EXAMPLE: acrobatics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杂技

Sense.DEF: used to make nouns out of words ending in -ical or -ic
Sense.EXAMPLE: the acoustics sound qualities of the hall
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大厅的音响效果

Sense.DEF: a school subject in Britain which teaches children how to use computers and other electronic equipment, and how to use the Internet, software etc
Sense.TRAN: 信息与计算机技术〔英国学校的一门课程﹐内容是教授儿童计算机等电子设备的使用方法﹐以及如何上网﹑使用软件等〕

Sense.DEF: a department in a hospital that gives special attention and treatment to people who are very sick or badly injured
Sense.TRAN: 重症监护病房﹐特护病房﹐加护病房

Sense.DEF: extremely cold
Sense.EXAMPLE: an icy wind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刺骨寒风
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bath water was icy cold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洗澡水冰冷刺骨。

Sense.DEF: covered in ice
Sense.EXAMPLE: an icy mountain road
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰封的山路

Sense.DEF: an icy remark, look etc shows that you feel annoyed with or unfriendly towards someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔言辞﹑目光等〕冷冷的﹐不友好的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an icy stare
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冷冷的盯视

Sense.DEF: according to Freudian psychology, the part of your mind that is completely unconscious but has hidden needs and desires
Sense.TRAN: 伊德﹐本我〔据弗洛伊德心理学﹐这是完全的潜意识﹐隐藏着需要和欲望〕
the short form of 缩略式= ‘I had’
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish I’d said that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真希望我说过那话。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘I would’
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d leave now if I were you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要是你的话﹐现在就走。

Sense.DEF: a document that shows your name and date of birth, usually with a photograph
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll need to see some ID.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要看看身份证明。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fake ID
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假身份证件

Sense.DEF: to identify a criminal or dead body
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police are still looking for someone who can ID the body.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方仍在寻找可辨认出死者身份的人。

Sense.DEF: an identity card
a chemical substance made up of two or more elements
Sense.EXAMPLE: cyanide
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 氰化物
Sense.EXAMPLE: sulphide
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 硫化物

Sense.DEF: a plan or suggestion for a possible course of action, especially one that you think of suddenly
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指突然想到的〕计划﹔建议﹔想法﹐主意
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should talk to Ken – he's always full of good ideas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该和肯谈谈﹐他总是满脑子好主意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew it was a bad idea to leave him on his own.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道把他独自留下不是个好主意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was my wife’s idea to move house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要搬家是我妻子的主意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The idea for the book came from an old war movie.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书的构思源自一部战争老电影。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had the idea of asking Katie for help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想请凯蒂帮忙。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘the idea to do something’. Say 而要说 the idea of doing something. However, you can say 但可以说 it is a good idea to do something and it was someone’s idea to do something.

Sense.DEF: a general understanding of something, based on some knowledge about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you give me an idea of how bad his injuries are?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能告诉我他的伤有多严重吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: You must have some idea have at least a little knowledge of what happened to the money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔钱的去向你肯定略知一二。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry if you don’t understand it right now – you’ll get the idea begin to understand or be able to do something.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你现在不明白﹐不要着急你会懂的。

GramExa.PROPFORM: have no idea/not have any idea
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She doesn’t have any idea where they’ve gone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她压根儿不知道他们去哪里了。

GramExa.GLOSS: a not very exact idea
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you give me a rough idea of how much the repairs will cost?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能否告诉我修理费用大约要多少？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t have the faintest idea what to get Rachel for her birthday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我完全不知道该给蕾切尔买什么生日礼物。

Sense.DEF: the aim, intention, or purpose of doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The idea is to teach children to save money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目的是教孩子省钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The idea behind the outing is to encourage employees to get to know each other.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 远足的目的是鼓励员工相互了解。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They wanted Mike to go to law school, but he had other ideas had different plans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想让迈克上法学院﹐但他另有打算。

Sense.SIGNPOST: HOW YOU IMAGINE SOMETHING TO BE
Sense.DEF: an image in your mind of what something is like or should be like

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Chefs differ in their idea of what makes a good dessert.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拿什么当餐后甜点最好﹐厨师们想法各异。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I only have a vague idea of the kind of work I’ll be doing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对将要从事的工作只有个模糊的概念。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It helps if you have a clear idea of what you want.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清楚自己要的是什么有好处。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Chocolate milk and a piece of cake is not my idea of dinner.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巧克力牛奶加一块蛋糕并不是我想象中的晚餐。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The very idea of kissing him made her feel physically sick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一想到要吻他﹐她就恶心想吐。

Sense.DEF: someone’s opinion or belief about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had some rather unusual ideas about raising children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于抚养孩子她有些与众不同的见解。

GramExa.PROPFORM: where did you get that idea?
GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that what someone thinks is completely wrong
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 你那想法从哪儿来的？〔指某人的想法完全错误〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: No, I’m not seeing Jane. Where did you get that idea?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不﹐我没在和简谈恋爱。你这想法从哪儿来的？

Sense.DEF: a principle or belief about how something is or should be

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The whole idea of democracy was something strange and new to most people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时对于大部分人来说﹐民主这个概念陌生而新鲜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s based on the idea that all people are created equal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 它是基于人人生而平等这个观念之上的。

Sense.DEF: to be fairly sure that something is true, without being completely sure
Sense.TRAN: 猜想(…)﹐估计(…)〔指猜想确有某事﹐但无绝对把握〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not sure where my necklace is, but I have a pretty good idea who took it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说不准我的项链在哪儿﹐但我大体上猜到是谁拿的。

Sense.DEF: to think that something is true when it is not
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t get the wrong idea about Dan and Helen – they’re just friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要误会丹和海伦﹐他俩不过是朋友而已。

Sense.DEF: to act or think in a way that will probably lead to the correct result
Sense.TRAN: 〔行事或思维〕方法正确﹐方向对头
Sense.EXAMPLE: He still makes a few mistakes but I reckon he’s got the right idea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他还会犯一些错误﹐但我认为他已经走对路了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you like what someone has just suggested
Sense.TRAN: 好主意〔用于表示赞同某人的建议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Why don’t you invite Paula to come with us?’ ‘There’s an idea.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你为什么不邀请葆拉和我们一起去？”“好主意。”

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone who is learning to do something that they are doing it the right way, in order to encourage them
Subsense.TRAN: 干得好﹐做得对〔用于鼓励正在学做某事的人〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Keep your knees bent and lean forward slightly. That’s the idea!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屈膝稍向前倾。对﹐就是这样！

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize what the main point of something is, or to say that someone understands that point
Subsense.TRAN: 对﹐就是这样〔用于强调某事的要点或说明某人理解了该要点〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘You’re thinking of getting a new job?’ ‘Yeah, that’s the idea.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你在考虑找新工作吗？”“对﹐是这样。”

Sense.DEF: a very clever idea, often used in a joking way to mean a very stupid idea or action
Sense.TRAN: 聪明点子﹐好主意〔常为反话﹐用于开玩笑〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whose bright idea was it to leave the back door wide open?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是谁的好主意﹐把后门大敞着？

Sense.LEXUNIT: give sb ideas/put ideas into sb’s head
Sense.DEF: to make someone think of doing something that they had not thought of doing before, especially something that they should not do
Sense.TRAN: 使某人产生某种念头〔尤指不该做的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nick tells me he wants a motorbike. Have you been putting ideas into his head?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克对我说想要一辆摩托车﹐是不是你让他胡思乱想的？

Sense.LEXUNIT: is it sb’s idea of a joke?
Sense.DEF: used when you are surprised and often rather annoyed by what someone has said or done
Sense.TRAN: 有某人这样开玩笑的吗？〔用于对某人的言语或行为表示惊讶和生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘She wants you to do it by tomorrow.’ ‘Is that your idea of a joke?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她想让你明天之前做好。”“有你那样开玩笑的吗？”

Sense.DEF: used when you cannot understand why someone has done something
Sense.TRAN: (你)这是干什么？(你)这样做用意何在？

Sense.DEF: used when you are telling someone that something is extremely good, bad etc
Sense.TRAN: 你简直想不到〔用于告诉某人某事非常好﹑非常坏等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have no idea how worried I was.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你简直想不到我当时多么着急。

Sense.DEF: used to express surprise or disapproval when someone has said something stupid
Sense.TRAN: 什么话！〔用于对方说了蠢话时﹐表示惊讶或贬斥〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’ve had an idea. Why don’t we walk into town?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有主意了﹐我们走着去城里怎样？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She got the idea from an article in a magazine.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从杂志上的一篇文章获得了灵感。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: What gave you the idea for the book?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是怎么想到写这本书的？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: think of an idea
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He’s always coming up with interesting ideas.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他老是会有一些新奇的念头。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: suddenly think of an idea
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Then we hit on the idea of renting a cottage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 于是我们突然想到租一间乡村小屋。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: think about using an idea, but not very seriously
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’m toying with the idea of going back to college.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在想要不要回去上大学﹐只是随便想想罢了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: get a group of people to all try and think of ideas
tell someone else your ideas, and learn their ideas
someone suddenly thinks of an idea
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人突然想到一个主意
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The idea came to me while I was having a bath.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在洗澡时想到了这个主意。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Keeping the drinks cold in the bath was a good idea.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 把冷饮放在浴缸里保温是个好主意。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: What a great idea!
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 多妙的主意！

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a very good idea – often used ironically
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Whose bright idea was it to leave the washing out in the rain?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 把洗好的衣服晾在雨中是谁的好主意？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It seemed like a clever idea at the time.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 当时这似乎是个聪明点子。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The idea sounded interesting, but I didn’t think it would work.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这主意听起来挺有意思﹐但我觉得不可行。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: no one has thought of it before
an idea that has not been carefully thought out
have a lot of ideas
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The children were enthusiastic and full of ideas.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些小孩子热情很高﹐思维活跃。

Exponent.DEF: something that you think of, especially something that you could do or suggest
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I think that’s an excellent idea.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得那个主意太妙了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Let me know if you have any good ideas.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有什么好主意的话就告诉我。

Exponent.DEF: something that comes into your mind
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The thought had entered my mind that he might be lying.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我心里产生了一个想法: 他可能在撒谎。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was a worrying thought.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个念头真让人心焦。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was lost in her thoughts.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她陷入沉思。

Exponent.DEF: the idea that you have in your mind about what someone or something is like
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What was your impression of him?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对他有什么印象？

Exponent.DEF: a good and original idea, which makes you think of doing or creating something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Where did you get your inspiration from for the book?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 写这本书的灵感你是哪里得来的？

Exponent.DEF: a sudden new and clever idea, especially one that solves a problem
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I thought I’d have to sell the house, but then I had a brainwave.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我原以为得把房子卖掉﹐不过后来我想到了一条妙计。

Exponent.DEF: an idea of how something is, or how something should be done
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Concepts of beauty are different in different cultures.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不同的文化中美的概念各不相同。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the traditional concept of marriage
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统的婚姻观

Exponent.DEF: an idea about life or society, especially one that is a little silly or old-fashioned
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指有点傻或过时的〕概念﹐观点
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There is no evidence to support the notion that poverty is caused by laziness.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有证据能证实穷困是懒惰造成的这一观点。

Sense.DEF: the best or most suitable that something could possibly be
Sense.TRAN: 理想的﹐最好的﹔最合适的
Sense.EXAMPLE: advice on how to reach your ideal weight
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如何达到理想体重的建议
Sense.EXAMPLE: The scheme offers an ideal opportunity for youngsters to get training.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该计划为年轻人提供了获得培训的极好机会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: With so much rain, conditions are far from ideal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨水这么多﹐天气情况很不理想。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: An elastic waist makes these jeans ideal for the larger woman.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 带松紧的腰身使这种牛仔裤很适合较丰满的女性。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: an ideal place for a walk
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 散步的理想去处

Sense.DEF: an ideal world, job, system etc is one that you imagine to be perfect, but that is not likely to really exist
Sense.TRAN: 〔世界﹑职业﹑制度等〕完美的﹔理想中的
Sense.EXAMPLE: In an ideal world there would be no need for a police force.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在理想的世界不需要警察。

Sense.DEF: a principle about what is morally right or a perfect standard that you hope to achieve

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the ideal of a free and democratic society
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 自由民主社会的理想
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the long-vanished ideals of the 1950s
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 早已破灭的20世纪50年代的理想

Sense.DEF: a perfect example of what something should be like

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are our ideals of beauty changing?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 是我们美的典范在改变吗？

Sense.DEF: a British spelling of idealize
the belief that you should live your life according to high standards and principles, even when they are very difficult to achieve
Sense.EXAMPLE: the idealism of the younger generation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻一代的理想主义
Sense.EXAMPLE: religious idealism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宗教的理想主义

Sense.DEF: a way of using art or literature to show the world as a perfect place, even though it is not
Sense.TRAN: 理想主义〔指通过艺术或文学将世界表现得完美﹐尽管事实并非如此〕

Sense.DEF: someone who tries to live according to high standards or principles, especially in a way that is not practical or possible
believing that you should live according to high standards and principles, even if they cannot really be achieved, or showing this belief
Sense.EXAMPLE: idealistic young doctors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充满理想主义的年轻医生
Sense.EXAMPLE: the idealistic values of the 1960s
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪60年代的理想主义价值观

Sense.DEF: to imagine or represent something or someone as being perfect or better than they really are
Sense.EXAMPLE: Society continues to idealize the two-parent family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会依然把双亲家庭视为理想家庭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an idealized view of marriage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理想化的婚姻观

Sense.DEF: used to describe the way you would like things to be, even though this may not be possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ideally, your car should have high-security locks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最理想的情况是﹐你的车应该配有高度安全的车锁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fruit and vegetables should ideally be organically grown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水果和蔬菜最理想的应该是有机种植。

Sense.DEF: having the best qualities, experience, knowledge etc for a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 非常适合的/位置理想的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was ideally suited for the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他做这工作非常合适。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel is ideally located for enjoying the beauty of Yorkshire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家宾馆位置非常理想﹐可以欣赏到约克郡的美景。

Sense.DEF: from the same book, writer etc as the one that has just been mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 出处同前〔指源自刚提及的同一本书﹑作者等〕

Sense.DEF: a short statement, often involving a piece of music, that tells you the name of a radio station or television channel, which is broadcast between programmes
Sense.TRAN: 频道标识〔通常包含一段音乐﹐在节目之间播放﹐告知正在播放节目的电台或电视频道的名称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: TV idents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视频道标识

Sense.DEF: exactly the same, or very similar
Sense.TRAN: 完全相同的﹔非常相似的
Sense.EXAMPLE: four identical houses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 四幢一模一样的房子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nutritionally, infant formulas are almost identical to breast milk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从营养方面来说﹐婴儿配方奶粉和母乳几乎一样。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ingredients are identical with those of competing products.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其成分和与之相竞争的产品相同。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sisters were identical in appearance and character.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对姐妹在相貌和性格上极其相似。

Sense.DEF: one of a pair of brothers or sisters born at the same time, who develop from the same egg and look almost exactly alike
Sense.TRAN: 同[单]卵双胞胎之一〔外貌相似〕

Sense.DEF: able to be recognized

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She looked young, and was immediately identifiable as a trainee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看上去很年轻﹐一眼就可以看出是实习生。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police were identifiable by their uniform.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察可以从其制服辨认出来。

Sense.DEF: official papers or cards, such as your passport, that prove who you are
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have any identification?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有什么身份证明文件吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bring some form of identification, preferably a passport.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 带上身份证明文件﹐最好是护照。

Sense.EXAMPLE: fingerprinting as a means of identification
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为一种身份证明方式的指纹提取

Sense.DEF: when someone says officially that they know who someone else is, especially a criminal or a dead person
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指对罪犯或死者的〕确认﹐识别﹐鉴定
Sense.EXAMPLE: His body was taken to Brighton mortuary for identification.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的尸体被送到布赖顿停尸所确认身份。

Sense.DEF: when you recognize something or discover exactly what it is

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the identification of customer needs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对顾客需求的确认
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the identification of children who need professional help
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于需要专业帮助的孩子的确认

Sense.DEF: the act of saying that two things are very closely related

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the identification of sexism with women’s oppression
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 性别歧视和妇女受压迫密切相关

Sense.DEF: a strong feeling of sympathy with someone that makes you able to share their feelings

GramExa.EXAMPLE: my identification with the heroine of the book
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我与书中女主角在情感上的共鸣

Sense.DEF: a process in which someone who has seen a crime take place looks at a group of people to see if they can recognize the criminal
Sense.TRAN: 列队辨认〔指让目击者从一群人中辨认罪犯的刑事侦查方法〕

Sense.DEF: to recognize and correctly name someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was too far away to be able to identify faces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他离得太远﹐没法看面孔认出谁是谁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police took fingerprints and identified the body.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方采集了指纹﹐对尸体作了身份确认。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Eyewitnesses identified the gunman as an army sergeant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 目击者确认枪手是一名陆军中士。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The aircraft were identified as American.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些飞机被认出是美国的。

Sense.DEF: to recognize something or discover exactly what it is, what its nature or origin is etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scientists have identified the gene that causes abnormal growth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家已发现造成畸形发育的基因。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They identified a number of problem areas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们发现了一些出现问题的区域。

Sense.DEF: if a particular thing identifies someone or something, it makes them easy to recognize

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His accent identified him as a Frenchman.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的口音表明他是法国人。

Sense.DEF: to feel sympathy with someone or be able to share their feelings
Sense.TRAN: 认同某人/某物﹐与某人/某物有同感
Sense.EXAMPLE: Humans can easily identify with the emotional expressions of chimpanzees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类很容易对黑猩猩的情感表达产生共鸣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He identified with our distress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他体谅我们的痛苦。

Sense.DEF: to think that someone is very closely related to or involved with something such as a political group
Sense.TRAN: 认为某人与某事物〔如政治派别等〕关系紧密
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has always been identified with the radical left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直被认为与左翼激进派别关系密切。

Sense.DEF: to think that something is the same as, or closely related to, something else
Sense.TRAN: 将某物等同于另一物﹔认为某物与某人/某物有密切关联
Sense.EXAMPLE: the attempt to identify crime with poverty and social problems
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把犯罪等同于贫穷和社会问题的做法

Sense.DEF: a method used by the police in which a picture of a criminal is produced from descriptions given by people who have seen the crime take place
Sense.TRAN: 容貌拼具〔指警方根据目击证人的描述拼制出嫌疑犯容貌的方法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an identikit picture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用容貌拼具拼出的画像

Sense.DEF: used to describe things that are all exactly the same, with no interesting or unusual features
Sense.EXAMPLE: new identikit cities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 千篇一律的新城市

Sense.DEF: someone’s identity is their name or who they are
Sense.EXAMPLE: The identity of the killer is still unknown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凶手的身份仍未查明。

Sense.DEF: the qualities and attitudes that a person or group of people have, that make them different from other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children need continuity, security, and a sense of identity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们需要稳定感﹑安全感以及自我认同感。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Travelling alone can lead to a loss of identity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 独自旅行会使人产生身份迷失。

GramExa.GLOSS: a strong feeling of belonging to a particular group, race etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our strong sense of national identity has been shaped by our history.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的历史使我们形成了强烈的民族认同感。

GramExa.GLOSS: a feeling of uncertainty about who you really are and what your purpose is
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My father experienced an identity crisis in middle age.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲在中年时经历了一次身份危机。

Sense.DEF: exact similarity between two things

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The true identity of the author was not revealed until 100 years later.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 作者的真实身份直到100年后才被揭晓。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He avoided arrest by adopting a new identity.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用新身份躲过了警方的拘捕。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when someone pretends to be another person

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The police have yet to discover the victim’s identity.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方尚未查明受害人的身份。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He wanted to know the identity of his real father.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想知道自己亲生父亲的身份。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She used a false name to conceal her identity.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她使用假名来隐瞒自己的身份。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: show or say who a person is
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company did not reveal the identity of the prospective buyer.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司未透露潜在买家的身份。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: accidentally reveal it
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 无意间透露某人的身份

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make sure no one finds out who someone is
give yourself a new identity
documents that show who you are
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Each member of staff is issued with an identity card.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 每名员工都发了一张身份卡。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when someone looks at a line of people to see if they recognize a criminal
the crime of stealing another person’s personal details in order to pretend to be that person
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 身份偷窃﹐盗用身份信息

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: something that proves you are who you say you are
Collocate.EXAMPLE: You’ll need proof of identity, such as a driving licence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要身份证明﹐比如驾驶执照。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when people think that someone is a different person, especially with the result that they are accused of something that they did not do
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 认错人的情况﹐认错人的案例

Sense.DEF: a card with your name, date of birth, and photograph on it, that proves who you are
an identification parade

any crime in which someone steals personal information about and belonging to another person, for example their bank account number or the number of their driving licence, and uses this information to deceive other people and get money or goods
Sense.TRAN: 身份偷窃﹐盗用身份信息〔指通过盗取他人的银行账号﹑驾驶执照号码等个人信息来行骗〕

Sense.DEF: a written sign, for example in Chinese, that represents an idea or thing rather than the sound of a word
Sense.TRAN: 表意文字〔如汉字〕﹔表意符号

Sense.DEF: based on strong beliefs or ideas, especially political or economic ideas
Sense.TRAN: 思想上的﹔思想体系的﹔意识形态的〔尤指政治或经济思想〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party is split by ideological differences.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意识形态上的差异造成该政党分裂。

Sense.DEF: someone whose actions are very much influenced by an ideology
Sense.TRAN: 思想体系的倡导者[拥护者]

Sense.DEF: a set of beliefs on which a political or economic system is based, or which strongly influence the way people behave
Sense.TRAN: 〔政治或经济上的〕思想体系﹔意识形态
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ideologies of fascism and terrorism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法西斯主义和恐怖主义的意识形态
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new ideology based on individualism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基于个人主义的新思想体系

Sense.DEF: March 15th, famous for being the day on which Julius Caesar was killed by a group of his former friends because they thought he had too much power. Caesar is supposed to have been warned by a fortune-teller to ‘beware the Ides of March’. People sometimes use this expression when giving a warning.
Sense.TRAN: 三月十五日〔尤利乌斯·恺撒遇刺的时间﹐据说有个算命先生曾提醒他“要当心三月十五日”。人们发出警告时有时会用这一短语〕

Sense.DEF: something that you think is extremely silly or stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: The idiocy of his behaviour appalled her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他极端愚蠢的行为吓坏了她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He smiled calmly at the idiocies of mankind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于人类的愚蠢他平静地一笑置之。

Sense.DEF: the way in which a particular person uses language
Sense.TRAN: 个人言语方式﹐个人语型

Sense.DEF: a group of words that has a special meaning that is different from the ordinary meaning of each separate word. For example, ‘under the weather’ is an idiom meaning ‘ill’.
a style of expression in writing, speech, or music that is typical of a particular group of people
Sense.TRAN: 〔某群体在写作﹑言语﹑音乐方面典型的〕风格﹐特色
Sense.EXAMPLE: the new musical idiom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的音乐风格

Sense.DEF: an idiom
typical of the natural way in which someone speaks or writes when they are using their own language
Sense.TRAN: 〔说话或书写时〕符合某一语言习惯的﹔地道的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had the ability to write fluent and idiomatic English.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他能够写出流利地道的英语。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the idiomatic richness of the Spanish language
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西班牙语习语的丰富多样

Sense.DEF: an unusual habit or way of behaving that someone has
Sense.EXAMPLE: my uncle’s idiosyncrasies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我叔叔的癖好

Sense.DEF: an unusual or unexpected feature that something has
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the many idiosyncrasies of English spelling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英语拼写的众多特点之一

Sense.DEF: a stupid person or someone who has done something stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was all your fault, you idiot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全是你的错﹐你这笨蛋。

Sense.DEF: someone who is mentally ill or has a very low level of intelligence

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要再问这些愚蠢的问题了。

Sense.DEF: something that is idiot-proof is so easy to use or do that even stupid people will not break it or make a mistake
Sense.TRAN: 简单易做的﹔容易操作的
Sense.EXAMPLE: idiot-proof instructions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简单易懂的说明书

Sense.DEF: not working or producing anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: I cannot afford to leave the land lying idle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能让土地闲置。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole team stood idle, waiting for the mechanic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整队人干站着等技工来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The workers have been idle for the last six months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近六个月工人们都很闲。

Sense.DEF: not serious, or not done with any definite intention
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was not a woman to make idle threats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不是只会空口威胁的人。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 无聊的唠叨/闲谈/闲话等

Sense.EXAMPLE: It was only from idle curiosity that she went into the barn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她进仓库只是出于无聊的好奇心。

Sense.DEF: lazy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go and wake up that idle brother of yours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去把你那懒哥哥叫起来。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Idle sounds rather old-fashioned and literary. In everyday English, people usually say lazy.
F2NBox.TRAN: idle 听起来相当过时﹐而且文学味很重。在日常英语中﹐人们一般说 lazy
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She's not stupid, just lazy .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不笨﹐就是懒。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it is idle to do sth
Sense.DEF: it is not worth doing something, because nothing will be achieved
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would be idle to deny that progress was made.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 否定所取得的进步毫无意义。

Sense.DEF: rich people who do not have to work

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I cannot stand idly by and let him take the blame.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能袖手旁观﹐让他承担责任。

Sense.DEF: if an engine idles, it runs slowly while the vehicle, machine etc is not moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: He flicked a switch and let the boat idle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他啪的一声按下开关﹐让船的发动机空转。

Sense.DEF: to spend time doing nothing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes he went for a walk; sometimes he just idled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时他去散散步﹐有时他纯粹是无所事事。

Sense.DEF: to stop using a factory or stop providing work for your workers, especially temporarily
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指暂时地〕使〔工厂〕闲置﹔使〔工人〕闲着
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has idled a number of its US plants indefinitely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司已经无限期地关闭了一些在美国的工厂。

Sense.DEF: to spend time in a relaxed way, doing nothing
Sense.EXAMPLE: They idled their time away in the pub.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在酒吧里消磨时光。

Sense.DEF: someone who is lazy and does not work
someone or something that you love or admire very much

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She is the idol of countless teenagers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是无数青少年的偶像。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had made an idol of her husband.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把丈夫当成了偶像。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a pop idol
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 流行乐偶像

Sense.DEF: a picture or statue that is worshipped as a god
the practice of worshipping idols
when you admire someone or something too much
to admire and love someone so much that you think they are perfect
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had one child, a girl whom they idolized.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们只有一个女儿﹐对这个孩子宠爱有加。

Sense.DEF: a place or experience in which everything is peaceful and everyone is perfectly happy
Sense.TRAN: 平静快乐的地方﹔安宁愉快的经历
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rural idyll
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恬静的乡村生活

Sense.DEF: an idyllic place or time is very beautiful, happy, and peaceful, with no problems or dangers
Sense.TRAN: 美丽宁静的﹔快乐祥和的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you want old-world tradition in an idyllic setting, this is the hotel for you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想找一处恬静宜人而又古色古香的环境﹐那么就是这家酒店了。

Sense.DEF: another form of the suffix -y
Sense.TRAN: 后缀 -y 的另一种形式
Sense.EXAMPLE: dearie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲爱的

Sense.DEF: written before a word or phrase that gives the exact meaning of something you have just written or said
Sense.TRAN: 即﹐也就是〔用于对刚刚写下或说过的内容作确切的说明〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film is only open to adults, i.e. people over 18.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该影片只限成年人观看﹐即18岁以上者。

Sense.DEF: a bomb that has been made using whatever materials are available. IEDs are used by terrorists or people who are opposed to their government rather than by official military forces.
Sense.TRAN: 〔恐怖分子或反政府者使用的〕简易爆炸装置﹐土炸弹

Sense.DEF: used when talking about something that might happen or be true, or might have happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll stay at home if it rains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果下雨﹐我们就待在家里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you need money, I can lend you some.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你需要钱﹐我能借给你一些。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I didn’t apologize, I’d feel guilty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我不道歉﹐我会感到内疚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you had worked harder, you would have passed your exams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你再努力一点﹐就通过考试了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What would happen to your family if you were to die in an accident?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你在意外事故中身亡﹐你的家人会怎么样呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: If Dad were here, he would know what to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果爸爸在这儿﹐他会知道怎么做的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Taste the soup and add salt and pepper if necessary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尝一下汤﹐需要的话加一点盐和胡椒粉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want to get back by five o’clock if possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果可能的话﹐我想5点之前回来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think I can fix it tomorrow. If not, you’ll have to wait till Friday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想明天我能修好它﹐如果不行﹐你只好等到周五了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is the book available, and if so, where?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有没有这本书？ 如果有的话﹐在哪儿？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The missiles can be fired only if the operator types in a six-digit code.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有在操作员输入一组六位数密码后﹐导弹才能发射。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll face that problem if and when it comes along if it happens or when it happens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果这一问题真的发生了﹐我们就要面对它。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If by any chance you can’t manage dinner tonight, perhaps we can at least have a drink together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 万一你今晚不能来吃饭﹐或许我们至少可以一起喝一杯。

Sense.DEF: used to mention a fact, situation, or event that someone asks about, or is not certain about
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stopped to ask me if I was all right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他停下来问我是否身体不适。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know if what I am saying makes any sense.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道我说的话是否有道理。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I doubt if anyone will remember me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怀疑是否会有人记得我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not sure if this is the right road or not.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不确定这条路对不对。

Sense.DEF: used to mention a type of event or situation when talking about what happens on occasions of that type
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I go to bed late, I feel dreadful in the morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要是睡晚了﹐早上起来就会感觉非常糟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Plastic will melt if it gets too hot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塑料太热会融化。

Sense.DEF: used when saying what someone’s feelings are about a possible situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于表示某人对某一可能情况的感受〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You don’t seem to care if I’m tired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你好像不在意我是不是累了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry if I upset you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抱歉让你不高兴了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would be nice if we could spend more time together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们能多些时间在一起有多好。

Sense.DEF: used when making a polite request
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wonder if you could help me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知道你能否帮我个忙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d be grateful if you would send me further details.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如能寄来详细资料﹐我将不胜感激。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you mind if I open a window?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开扇窗可以吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you would just wait for a moment, I’ll try to find your papers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请稍等﹐我会尽力找到你的文件。

Sense.DEF: used when you are adding that something may be even more, less, better, worse etc than you have just said
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brian rarely, if ever, goes to bed before 3 am.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布赖恩难得在凌晨3点钟之前睡觉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their policies have changed little, if at all, since the last election.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从上次选举以后﹐他们的政策纵使有改变也是微乎其微。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her needs are just as important as yours, if not more so.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的需求即使不比你的更重要﹐也至少和你的一样重要。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The snow was now two feet deep, making it difficult, if not impossible, to get the car out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在雪已有两英尺深﹐就算有可能﹐把车弄出来也是很困难的。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that, although something may happen or may be true, it will not change a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t tell you even if I knew.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使我知道也不会告诉你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even if she survives, she’ll never fully recover.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使她挺过来﹐也不可能完全康复。

Sense.DEF: used when adding a remark that changes what you have just said or makes it stronger
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s warm enough here in London. A little too warm, if anything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦这边够暖和﹐其实是有点太暖和了。

Sense.DEF: used during a conversation when you are trying to make a suggestion, change the subject, or interrupt someone else
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于谈话时想提出建议﹑变换话题或插话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I might just make a suggestion, I think that the matter could be easily settled with a little practical demonstration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能否提个建议﹐我认为做点实际示范就能轻松解决问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I could just take one example to illustrate this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能否举一个例子来说明这一点。

Sense.DEF: used when giving advice and telling someone what you think they should do
Sense.TRAN: 如果我是你〔用于给某人忠告〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t worry about it if I were you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要是你的话﹐就不会为此担心。

Subsense.DEF: used to express a strong wish, especially when you know that what you want cannot happen
Subsense.TRAN: 但愿﹐要是…就好了〔表示强烈愿望﹐尤用于知道所想的事不能发生时〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If only he had talked to her sooner!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他要是早点和她谈谈就好了！
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If only I weren’t so tired!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要是没这么累该多好！

Subsense.DEF: used to give a reason for something, although you think it is not a good one
Subsense.TRAN: 要是﹐只要〔用于为某事给出原因﹐即使不充分〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Media studies is regarded as a more exciting subject, if only because it’s new.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 媒体研究被视为一门更能激起人们兴趣的学科﹐仅仅因为它是个新兴学科。

Sense.DEF: used to say that, although something may be true, it is not important
Sense.TRAN: 如果〔用于承认某事可能属实﹐但不重要〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If he has a fault at all, it is that he is too generous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他有什么缺点的话﹐那就是他太慷慨了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her only problem, if you can call it a problem, is that she expects to be successful all the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她唯一的问题﹐如果称得上是问题的话﹐就是她总是渴望成功。

Sense.DEF: used when adding one criticism of a person or thing that you generally like
Sense.TRAN: 但﹐却﹐不过〔用于对大体上喜欢的人或事作批评〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The eldest son was highly intelligent, if somewhat lazy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大儿子很聪明﹐不过有点懒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lunch was a grand if rather noisy affair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 午餐场面盛大﹐只是有点嘈杂。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: When you are using if to talk about something that might happen in the future, use the present tense or the present perfect in the if-clause, not 'will' or 'shall'.
F2NBox.TRAN: 用 if 表述将来可能发生的事，在 if 从句中用现在时或现在完成时，不用 will 或 shall
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: If I see him (Not 不说 will see him), I'll tell him.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我看到他，我会告诉他的。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: If she hasn't come home by midnight, call the police.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果她到午夜还没回家，那就报警。
F2NBox.EXPL: You can use won't to talk about someone being unwilling to do something in the future.
F2NBox.TRAN: 要表述某人在将来不肯做某事，可以用 won't
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: If the bank won't listen, say that you are going to move your account.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果银行不肯听，就说你要转移账户。
F2NBox.EXPL: When you are using if to talk about something that is unlikely to happen or is impossible, use the past tense in the if-clause, not 'would'.
F2NBox.TRAN: 用 if 表述不太可能或不可能发生的事，在 if 从句中用过去时，不用would
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: If someone give me (Not 不说 would give me)the money, I'd buy a car tomorrow.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果有人给我钱，明天我就去买辆汽车。
F2NBox.EXPL: In formal English or in writing, use were, not 'was'.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在正式或书面英语中，即使从句的主语是单数，也要用 were，而不用 was
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: If I were in that position, I'd get legal advice.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是我面临那样的情形，我会去寻求法律咨询。
F2NBox.EXPL: In normal conversation, you can use was with a singular subject.
F2NBox.TRAN: 平常会话中，主语是单数时可用 was
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: If I was ten years younger, I'd go out with him.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 假如我年轻十岁，我会和他谈恋爱。
F2NBox.EXPL: When you are using if to talk about something that did not happen, use the past perfect tense in the if-clause.
F2NBox.TRAN: 用 if 表述为发生的事，在 if 从句中用过去完成时
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: If they had tried (Not 不说 would have tried)to stop the demonstration, there would have been a riot.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他们当时试图阻止游行示威的话，就会发生暴乱了。
F2NBox.HEADING: if, whether
F2NBox.EXPL: If and whether are both used to introduce clauses mentioning things that someone asks about or is uncertain about.
F2NBox.TRAN: if 和 whether 都可用于引导提及某人问到或不确定的事物的从句
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I'm not sure if i heard him correctly.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不确定是否对他的话听得真切。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I don't know whether he is guilty.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道他是否有罪。
F2NBox.EXPL: Whether can also be used after a preposition, before the phrase 'or not', and before a 'to' infinitive, but if cannot.
F2NBox.TRAN: whether 也可用在介词后，置于短语 or not 及带 to 的不定式之前，但 if 不可这样使用
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: the question of whether (Not 不说 if)the injuries had caused Mary's death
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 是否是这些伤造成玛丽死亡的问题
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Nobody knew whether or not the technique worked.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 没人知道这项技术是否有用。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He won’t decide whether to become a candidate until next year.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 要到下一年他才决定是否参选。

Exponent.DEF: used when talking about the possibility that something might happen or be true
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He faces a long prison sentence if the court finds him guilty.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果法庭裁定他有罪﹐他会面临很长的刑期。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If scientists’ predictions are correct, average global temperatures could rise by six degrees.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 假如科学家的预测正确﹐地球平均气温可能上升六度。

Exponent.DEF: if something does not happen, or if someone does not do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The star is difficult to see unless the sky is very clear.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 除非天空很清朗﹐否则很难看到星星。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Doctors said they could not treat the boy unless his parents gave their permission.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生说除非男孩的父母允许﹐不然的话他们无法为他治疗。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that it does not matter if something happens or not, or if something is true or not
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Most people will get better on their own, whether or not they receive medical treatment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数人不管是否接受治疗都会自己好起来。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m still going, whether she likes it or not.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管她是否喜欢﹐我还是要去的。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that there will be a bad result if someone does not do something, or if something does not happen
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Drink plenty of water – otherwise you will become dehydrated.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 要多喝水﹐不然会脱水的。

Exponent.DEF: in order to deal with something that might happen
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She did not think it would rain, but she took her umbrella just in case.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得不会下雨﹐但她还是带上雨伞以防万一。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It is best to keep a medical kit ready in case of emergency.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好准备一个医药箱以防出现紧急情况。

Exponent.DEF: only if something else happens or is true
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Visitors are welcome, as long as they bring their own tent.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 欢迎游客前来﹐但需自带帐篷。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Anyone can join the course, provided that there is space available.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要有空位﹐任何人都可参加此课程。

Exponent.DEF: used when you agree to do something only if someone first agrees to do something else
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was offered the job on condition that he went on a month-long training course.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他获得了这份工作﹐条件是参加为期一个月的培训。

Sense.TRAN: if you do not want any ifs and buts, you want someone to do something quickly without arguing 〔为故意拖延而给出的〕借口﹐托词
Sense.EXAMPLE: No ifs and buts – just make sure the job is done by tomorrow!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别找任何借口﹐一定要保证在明天把工作完成！

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is not likely to happen
Sense.TRAN: 这是一大疑问〔用于表示某事不大可能发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team will go racing next year if – and it’s a very big if – they can raise £6 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该队明年会参加比赛——如果他们能筹到600万英镑的话﹐但这是一大疑问。

Sense.DEF: something that may or may not happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are too many ifs in this plan of yours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的计划里有太多不确定因素。

Sense.DEF: not very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: That meat smells a bit iffy to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那肉我觉得闻起来不大新鲜了。

Sense.DEF: not certain to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The July date is still rather iffy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 七月份具体日期还不确定。

Sense.DEF: having a particular shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: cruciform cross-shaped
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十字形的

Sense.DEF: to make something be in a particular state or condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: to purify make or become pure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 净化
Sense.EXAMPLE: to clarify the situation make it clear
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 澄清情况

Sense.DEF: to fill someone with a particular feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: Spiders terrify me make me very afraid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我惧怕蜘蛛。

Sense.DEF: to do something in a silly or annoying way
Sense.TRAN: 愚蠢[令人讨厌]地做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: to speechify make speeches, using important sounding words
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高谈阔论﹔夸夸其谈

Sense.DEF: to make something or someone be like or typical of a person or group
Sense.EXAMPLE: Frenchified like the French
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国化的

Sense.DEF: a house made from blocks of hard snow or ice
igneous rocks are formed from lavahot liquid rock
to start burning, or to make something start burning
Sense.EXAMPLE: The petrol tank suddenly ignited.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油箱突然着火了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The candle ignited the plastic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜡烛烧着了塑料。

Sense.DEF: to start a dangerous situation, angry argument etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: events which ignited the war in Europe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 点燃欧洲战火的事件

Sense.DEF: the electrical part of a vehicle’s engine that makes it start working
the place in a car where you put in a key to start the engine
the act of starting to burn or of making something start to burn
ignoble thoughts, feelings, or actions are ones that you should feel ashamed or embarrassed about
Sense.TRAN: 卑鄙的﹐可耻的﹐不光彩的
Sense.EXAMPLE: ignoble feelings of intense jealousy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可耻的极度妒忌感

Sense.DEF: making you feel ashamed or embarrassed
Sense.TRAN: 蒙羞的﹐丢脸的; 可耻的

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 可耻的失利/失败/撤退等

Sense.EXAMPLE: an ignominious end to his career
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他职业生涯不光彩的终结

Sense.DEF: an event or situation that makes you feel ashamed or embarrassed, especially in public
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指公开的〕耻辱﹐丢脸﹐不体面﹐不光彩

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He feared the ignominy of being exposed as a spy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他害怕间谍身份被揭穿所带来的耻辱。

Sense.DEF: someone who does not know about things that most people know about
lack of knowledge or information about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Excuse my ignorance, but how does it actually work?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请原谅我的无知﹐它究竟是如何运作的？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: our ignorance of the true situation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对真实状况的不了解

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I would have remained in ignorance if Shaun hadn’t mentioned it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要不是肖恩提起这件事﹐我还蒙在鼓里呢。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: public fear and ignorance about AIDS
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众对于艾滋病的恐惧和无知

Sense.DEF: used to say that if you do not know about a problem, you cannot worry about it
not knowing facts or information that you ought to know
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ignorant and uneducated man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不学无术的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Political historians are often rather ignorant of economics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治历史学家往往对经济学一窍不通。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many people remain blissfully ignorant about the dangers of too much sun happy because they do not know about the dangers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人对日晒过度的危害一无所知。

Sense.DEF: caused by a lack of knowledge and understanding
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ignorant remark
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 愚蠢的言论
Sense.EXAMPLE: ignorant opinions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 愚蠢的看法

Sense.DEF: rude or impolite
Sense.EXAMPLE: ignorant behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粗鲁的行为

Sense.DEF: to deliberately pay no attention to something that you have been told or that you know about
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t ignore the fact that many criminals never go to prison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能无视很多罪犯从未获刑的事实。
Sense.EXAMPLE: problems which we can’t afford to ignore
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不能置之不理的问题

Sense.DEF: to behave as if you had not heard or seen someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The phone rang, but she ignored it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话铃响了﹐但她只当没听见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sam rudely ignored the question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆粗鲁地对这个问题不予理睬。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had completely ignored her remark, preferring his own theory.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他完全不理睬她的话﹐认为自己的说法更有道理。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday British English, people often say take no notice of something or not take any notice of something rather than ignore something.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英国英语中﹐人们常说take no notice of something 或 not take any notice of something﹐而不说 ignore something
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: There are signs telling you not to smoke, but people don’t take any notice of them.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 有标志告诫不要吸烟﹐但有人就是只当没看见。

Sense.DEF: a large tropical American lizard
Sense.TRAN: 鬣蜥〔一种大型热带美洲蜥蜴〕

Sense.DEF: another spelling of icon 3
the form used for in- before l
Sense.TRAN: 不﹐无﹐非〔用于 l 前代替 in-〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: illogical not logical
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不合逻辑的

Sense.DEF: a particular type

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Irving Berlin and composers of his ilk
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧文·柏林一类的作曲家

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mrs Taylor and her ilk talk absolute rubbish.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 泰勒夫人之流讲的是一派胡言。

Tail.TailContent: This graph shows how common the adjectives ill and sick are in British and American English. 本图表所示为形容词ill和sick在英国英语和美国英语中的使用频率。

In British English the word ill means not healthy. Americans usually use sick for this meaning. In British English sick can be used in this way, but is more commonly used in expressions such as be sick or feel sick meaning ‘to vomit or feel that you are going to vomit’. 英国英语中ill表示身体不健康﹐而美国英语一般用sick 表示这个意思。在英国英语里sick也可以这样用﹐但更常见的是用在be sick﹐feel sick 这样的短语中﹐表示“呕吐”或“恶心”的意思。

Sense.DEF: suffering from a disease or not feeling well
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bridget can’t come – she’s ill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布里奇特不能来了﹐她生病了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was feeling ill that day and decided to stay at home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我那天不太舒服﹐决定留在家里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her husband has been ill with bladder trouble.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她丈夫膀胱有毛病﹐身体一直不好。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a hospice for the terminally ill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚期病人的安养院

Sense.DEF: bad or harmful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people consumed the poisoned oil without ill effects.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人食用了这种有毒的油﹐但没有出现不良反应。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the neglect and ill treatment of children
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 忽视和虐待儿童
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was unable to join the army because of ill health.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因为身体不好没法参军。

Sense.DEF: nervous, uncomfortable, or embarrassed
Sense.EXAMPLE: He always felt shy and ill at ease at parties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他参加聚会总有害羞和不自在的感觉。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it’s an ill wind (that blows nobody any good)
Sense.DEF: used to say that every problem brings an advantage for someone
Sense.TRAN: 没有绝对的坏事〔指任何坏事都会使某些人获益〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: What’s wrong? Are you ill?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 怎么了？你不舒服？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’ve been feeling ill since I woke up this morning.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今天早晨醒来后就感觉不适。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He looked rather ill when I saw him.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到他时他好像身体很不舒服。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She became ill after eating oysters.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她食用牡蛎后就生病了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: become ill
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Louise fell ill while she was on holiday.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 路易丝度假时病了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: become ill suddenly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Henry was suddenly taken ill and had to go to the hospital.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利突然病了﹐只得去了医院。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I think it was the heat that made me ill.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想是高温使我不舒服。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very ill
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Any seriously ill patients are usually sent to a state hospital.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 重病患者一般都被送到州立医院。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: extremely ill
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She went to visit her grandfather, who was gravely ill.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她去看望病重的祖父。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: so ill that you might die
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He got news that his mother was critically ill in hospital.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他得到消息说母亲在医院病危。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: having a very serious illness that you will die from
having a long-term illness that cannot be cured and will not get better
having an illness of your mind

Exponent.DEF: suffering from a disease or not feeling well
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her mother is seriously ill in hospital.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她母亲病重住院。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I woke up feeling really ill.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我醒来后感到很不舒服。

Exponent.DEF: ill
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s been sick with the flu.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她患了流感。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a sick child
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 生病的小孩
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Dan got sick on vacation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹在度假时生病了。

Exponent.DEF: ill, but not seriously ill
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sarah’s not very well – she has a throat infection.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉身体有恙﹐她喉部感染。

Exponent.DEF: ill
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The singer had been unwell for some time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个歌手身体抱恙有一段时间了。

Exponent.DEF: ill
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Your grandmother’s been very poorly lately.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你祖母近来身体很不好。

Exponent.DEF: very ill because of a serious injury or disease
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You’d better call an ambulance – she looks like she’s in a bad way.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好打电话叫救护车﹐她看上去病得很重。

Exponent.DEF: to be not at work because of an illness
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Two teachers were off sick yesterday.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天有两名教师生病没来上课。

Section.SECHEADING: SLIGHTLY ILL 有点不舒服的﹐稍感不适的

Exponent.DEF: slightly ill
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sorry I haven’t called you – I’ve been a bit under the weather lately.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 抱歉我没给你打电话﹐最近我身体不太舒服。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You look a bit off colour – are you sure you’re OK?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看上去不大舒服﹐你肯定自己没事吗？

Exponent.DEF: feeling slightly ill and tired all the time, for example because you have been working too hard, or not eating well
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因工作太累﹑饮食不好等〕感到疲惫的﹐感到虚弱的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some people take extra vitamins if they are feeling run down.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人感到疲惫时就会补充些维生素。

Exponent.DEF: unhealthy and often ill
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Chopin was already in poor health when he arrived on the island.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 肖邦抵达岛上时健康状况已经很差了。

Exponent.DEF: weak and likely to become ill easily
Exponent.TRAN: 身体虚弱的﹐体弱多病的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was delicate and pale and frequently complained of headaches.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身体虚弱﹐脸色苍白﹐常常说自己头痛。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had a delicate constitution and throughout his adult life suffered from various illnesses.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他体质虚弱﹐成年后百病缠身。

Exponent.DEF: a sickly child is often ill
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was a sickly child and spent a lot of time at home on his own.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个体弱多病的孩子﹐很多时候都是独自一人在家度过。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb can ill afford (to do) sth
Sense.DEF: to be unable to do or have something without making the situation you are in very difficult
Sense.TRAN: 某人难以承担(做)某事的后果
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was losing weight which I could ill afford to lose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的体重在减轻﹐我已轻得不能再轻了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most gamblers can ill afford their habit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数赌徒都承担不起赌博这个恶习所带来的后果。

Sense.DEF: to think or say unpleasant things about someone
Sense.TRAN: 对某人抱有恶感/说某人坏话
Sense.EXAMPLE: She really believes you should never speak ill of the dead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的确认为绝不该说死者的坏话。

Sense.DEF: to give you a reason to think that something bad will happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The look on his face boded ill for somebody.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的脸色对某人来说是不好的兆头。

Sense.DEF: problems and difficulties
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wants to cure all the ills of the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想消除世上所有的弊病。

Sense.DEF: harm, evil, or bad luck
Sense.EXAMPLE: She did not like Matthew but she would never wish him ill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不喜欢马修﹐但也绝不希望他倒霉。

Sense.DEF: badly or not enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: ill-concealed boredom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不加掩饰的厌烦
Sense.EXAMPLE: ill-formed sentences
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结构不好的句子

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘I will’ or 或 ‘I shall’
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll see you tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们明天见。

Sense.DEF: not sensible or not wise, and likely to cause problems in the future
Sense.TRAN: 不理智的﹔不明智的〔日后可能惹麻烦〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You would be ill-advised to go out alone at night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你晚上独自出门很不明智。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ill-advised remarks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欠考虑的言论

Sense.DEF: an ill-assorted group of people or things do not seem to belong together in a group
Sense.TRAN: 〔一组人或事物〕不相配的﹐不相称的

Sense.DEF: rude or behaving badly, especially because your parents did not teach you to behave well
not planned well and not having an aim that is likely to be achieved
Sense.EXAMPLE: The policy was ill-conceived and wrong headed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项政策规划不周而且方向错误。

Sense.DEF: decisions, actions, ideas etc that are ill-considered have not been carefully thought about
Sense.TRAN: 〔决定﹑行动﹑想法等〕考虑不周的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tax reforms are ill-considered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 税务改革考虑不周。

Sense.DEF: not described clearly enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some jobs in the company are pretty ill-defined.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司里的一些工作职能很不明确。

Sense.DEF: not clearly marked, or not having a clear shape
Sense.TRAN: 不分明的﹔轮廓模糊不清的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The borders were vague and ill-defined.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 边界模糊﹐界定不明。

Sense.DEF: unfriendly or unsympathetic
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ill-disposed character
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不友好的个性

Sense.DEF: not allowed by the law
Sense.EXAMPLE: illegal drugs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 违禁药品
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were involved in illegal activities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们参与了非法活动。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is illegal to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is illegal to sell tobacco to someone under 16.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出售烟草给16岁以下者是违法的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The deal was completely illegal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔交易完全是非法的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: completely illegal
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It all sounds highly illegal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这听起来完全不合法。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: completely illegal – used for emphasis
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Phone tapping is strictly illegal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 窃听电话绝对违法。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: according to the exact details of a law

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It is illegal to sell tobacco products to anyone under the age of 16.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 向16岁以下者出售烟草产品是违法的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The drug did not become illegal until the 1970s.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 直到20世纪70年代这种药才被列为违禁药品。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was involved in the campaign to make hunting illegal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他参与了促使打猎非法化的运动。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The strike was declared illegal on July 7.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 此次罢工于7月7日被宣布为非法。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was charged with carrying an illegal weapon.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被指控携带非法武器。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was found guilty of possession of illegal drugs.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被判持有违禁药品罪名成立。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an illegal drug

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 违章停车/非法赌博/非法捕猎等

Sense.DEF: an illegal immigrant
Sense.EXAMPLE: Illegals are still slipping through in unacceptable numbers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非法移民仍在偷偷越境涌入﹐数量奇多。

Sense.DEF: someone who comes to live in another country without official permission
Sense.TRAN: 〔来自国外的〕非法居留者﹐非法移民

Sense.DEF: difficult or impossible to read
Sense.EXAMPLE: His handwriting is totally illegible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的字迹完全无法辨认。

Sense.DEF: born to parents who are not married
Sense.EXAMPLE: his illegitimate son
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的私生子

Sense.DEF: not allowed or acceptable according to rules or agreements
Sense.TRAN: 不合规则[协定]的﹐非法的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a distinction between legitimate and illegitimate trade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合法贸易和非法贸易的区别

Sense.DEF: not having the necessary equipment or skills for a particular situation or activity
Sense.TRAN: 装备不足的﹔能力欠缺的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rebels were ill-equipped to cope with Western weapons and forces.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛军装备不足﹐不能和西方国家的武器和兵力相抗衡。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their army is ill-equipped for modern warfare.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的军队装备很差﹐不符合现代化战争的要求。

Sense.DEF: unlucky and leading to serious problems or death
Sense.TRAN: 不幸的﹐倒霉的〔导致严重问题甚至死亡〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ill-fated venture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 注定失败的企业

Sense.DEF: angry feelings towards someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m sorry. No ill feeling?’ ‘None,’ she replied.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “对不起。你没生气吧？”“没有。”她回答道。

Sense.DEF: ill-fitting clothes do not fit the person who is wearing them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many children have problems with their feet, caused by ill-fitting shoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于穿的鞋不合适﹐很多儿童的脚都有问题。

Sense.DEF: based on something that is untrue
Sense.TRAN: 理由不充分的﹐没有根据的﹐站不住脚的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His fears proved ill-founded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的恐惧事实证明是杞人忧天。

Sense.DEF: money that was obtained in an unfair or dishonest way – used humorously
not supporting people’s rights to say or do what they want
Sense.TRAN: 不开明的﹐不容言论[行为]自由的
Sense.EXAMPLE: illiberal and undemocratic policies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专制﹑不民主的政策

Sense.DEF: not generous
not allowed by laws or rules, or strongly disapproved of by society
Sense.TRAN: 非法的﹐违禁的﹔社会不容许的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the illicit trade in stolen cattle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非法买卖偷来的牛

Sense.DEF: knowing less than you should about a particular subject
Sense.TRAN: 信息不足的﹔孤陋寡闻的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some employers are ill-informed about education.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些雇主对教育现状了解不够。

Sense.DEF: someone who is illiterate has not learned to read or write
badly written, in an uneducated way
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was an illiterate letter, full of mistakes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这封信文笔拙劣﹐错误连篇。

Sense.DEF: knowing very little about economics, politics etc
Sense.TRAN: 对经济/政治/科学知识等一窍不通的

Sense.DEF: someone who has not learned to read or write
an action that is ill-judged has not been thought about carefully enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ill-judged choice of words
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 措辞不当

Sense.DEF: not polite and behaving badly in social situations
Sense.TRAN: 〔在社交场合〕粗鲁的﹐不礼貌的

Sense.DEF: a disease of the body or mind, or the condition of being ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had all the normal childhood illnesses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童的常见病她小时候都得过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her mother was recovering from a serious illness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她母亲重病后正在逐渐康复。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never missed a day’s work through illness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从未因病耽误过一天工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ways to improve your health and reduce the risk of illness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 增进健康减少疾病的方法

Collocate.EXAMPLE: When did you first find out that you had the illness?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最早是什么时候发现自己有这个病？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She suffers from a rare illness.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她患上了一种罕见的病。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She developed the illness when she was in her 50s.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她五十多岁时得了这种病。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: get an illness by catching it from another person
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He contracted the illness while he was working abroad.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在国外工作时染上了这个病。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It took several months for him to recover from his illness.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的病几个月后才得以痊愈。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be found by doctors to have an illness
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 被诊断出患有某种疾病

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His illness is more severe than the doctors first thought.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的病比医生一开始估计的要严重。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not serious
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He suffered a succession of minor illnesses.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他接连生了几次小病。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: causing death quite quickly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She developed a fatal illness.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身患绝症。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: likely to cause death
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Doctors say that his illness isn’t life-threatening.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生说他的病不会危及生命。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: causing death eventually, and not possible to cure
Collocate.EXAMPLE: At that point the illness was thought to be terminal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了那个阶段这病被认为已无法治好了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not possible to cure
becoming serious very quickly
that lasts a long time, and cannot be cured

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She nursed him through his long illness.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他久病期间她一直照顾他。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that makes you very weak

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Symptoms of the illness include vomiting and severe headaches.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种病的症状包括呕吐和剧烈头痛。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘a heavy illness’. Say 而要说 a serious illness or 或 a severe illness.

Exponent.DEF: something wrong with your health which makes you feel ill
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her husband was in hospital for six months with a serious illness.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她丈夫因患重病在医院待了六个月。

Exponent.DEF: a particular illness, especially one that spreads to other people easily or that affects one part of your body
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指会传染或影响身体某部位的〕疾病
Exponent.EXAMPLE: childhood diseases such as measles and chickenpox
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 麻疹和水痘这类小儿疾病
Exponent.EXAMPLE: heart disease
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 心脏病

Exponent.DEF: an illness that is caused by bacteria or a virus
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His cough got worse and worse and became a chest infection.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他咳嗽得越来越厉害﹐最后演变为肺部感染。

Exponent.DEF: a health problem that affects you permanently or for a long time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a medical condition such as asthma
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 哮喘等疾病
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a heart condition
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 心脏病

Exponent.DEF: something that is wrong with a particular part of your body or your health in general
Exponent.TRAN: 〔身体某部位或整体健康状况方面的〕疾病
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a serious back problem
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 很严重的背部疾病
Exponent.EXAMPLE: health problems
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 健康问题

Exponent.DEF: illness or pain that affects a particular part of your body
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve had a bit of stomach trouble.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的胃有点毛病。

Exponent.DEF: an illness that prevents a particular organ of your body from working properly, or affects the way you behave
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a liver disorder
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 肝病
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a blood disorder
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 血液病
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Anorexia nervosa is an eating disorder.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 神经性厌食症是一种饮食失调病。

Section.SECHEADING: AN ILLNESS THAT IS NOT VERY SERIOUS 不很严重的病

Exponent.DEF: an illness that spreads to other people very easily but that is not very serious
Exponent.TRAN: 〔很容易传染但不严重的〕小病
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s a bug going round at school and a lot of the children are absent.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校里出现了一种传染病﹐很多小孩没来上学。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a flu bug
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 流感

Exponent.DEF: an illness that affects a particular part of your body, especially one that is not very serious – used by doctors
Exponent.TRAN: 疾病〔尤指不很严重的病﹐医生用语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a minor skin complaint
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻微的皮肤病
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Deakin suffers from a back complaint called arachnoiditis.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 迪金患上一种名为蛛网膜炎的背部疾病。

Exponent.DEF: an illness that affects a particular part of your body, especially one that is not serious
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People often go to their doctor about relatively minor ailments.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有小毛病的话人们一般都去看家庭医生。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The ointment is used to treat ailments such as small wounds and insect bites.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药膏用于治疗虫咬等小伤小病。

Section.SECHEADING: THE GENERAL STATE OF BEING ILL 一般性的生病情况

Exponent.DEF: the general state of being ill
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Stress is emerging today as a major cause of illness.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今压力已成为诱发疾病的主要因素。

Exponent.DEF: the state of being ill, especially when it stops you working
Exponent.EXAMPLE: absence from work due to sickness
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 因病缺勤

Exponent.DEF: the state of being ill, usually for a long period of time
Exponent.TRAN: 〔通常指长期的〕健康状况不佳
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Research shows that there is a link between air pollution and ill health.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究表明空气污染与健康状况不佳有关联。

Sense.DEF: not sensible or reasonable
Sense.EXAMPLE: illogical and unreasonable fear
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毫无道理的惧怕

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is illogical to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is illogical to assume you can do the work of three people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 认为你一个人能干三个人的活没有道理。

Sense.DEF: not ready for something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The country was ill-prepared for war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国没做好战争准备。

Sense.DEF: not helped by something or not represented well
Sense.TRAN: 供给不足的﹔没有得到充分体现的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The northeast of the country is ill-served by the rail network.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国的东北部铁路网络不完善。

Sense.DEF: unlucky and likely to cause or experience a lot of problems or unhappiness
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ill-starred love affair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苦命的爱情

Sense.DEF: not useful for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 不适合的﹐不相宜的﹐派不上用场的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a country ill-suited to wheat farming
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不适合种植小麦的国家

Sense.DEF: easily made angry or impatient
an ill-tempered meeting, argument etc is one in which people are angry and often rude to each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: Six players were sent off in an ill-tempered game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一场火药味十足的比赛中有六名球员被罚下场。

Sense.DEF: happening, done, or said at the wrong time
Sense.EXAMPLE: His remarks were ill-timed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话说得不是时候。
