Sense.DEF: to be cruel to someone, especially to a child or animal
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rescue centre for ill-treated horses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安置受虐马匹的援救中心

Sense.DEF: to make a light shine on something, or to fill a place with light
Sense.EXAMPLE: A single candle illuminated his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一支蜡烛照亮了他的脸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At night the canals are beautifully illuminated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚上运河灯火辉煌﹐美景毕现。

Sense.DEF: to make something much clearer and easier to understand
Sense.TRAN: 阐明﹐解释〔某事物〕﹔使易懂
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report illuminated the difficult issues at the heart of science policy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告阐明了科学方针核心部分的难点。

Sense.DEF: lit up by lights
Sense.EXAMPLE: An illuminated sign flashed on and off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发光的指示牌一闪一灭。

Sense.DEF: a book of a type produced by hand in the Middle Ages, whose pages are decorated with gold paint and bright colours
Sense.TRAN: 装饰华美的手稿/书籍〔指在中世纪手工制作的一种书籍﹐页面上有金漆及其他亮丽色彩装饰〕

Sense.DEF: making things much clearer and easier to understand
Sense.TRAN: 使清楚易懂的﹐富于启发性的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very illuminating book
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本极具启发性的书

Sense.DEF: lighting provided by a lamp, light etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: White candles, the only illumination, burned on the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白蜡烛作为唯一的照明在桌子上燃烧着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: soft illumination
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柔和的光亮

Sense.DEF: a picture or pattern painted on a page of a book, especially in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指旧时书籍中页面上的〕彩饰﹐图案装饰
Sense.EXAMPLE: the illuminations in a medieval manuscript
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中世纪手稿上的图案

Sense.DEF: a show of coloured lights used to make a town bright and colourful
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Blackpool illuminations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布莱克浦的灯饰

Sense.DEF: a clear explanation or understanding of a particular subject
another word for illuminate
an idea or opinion that is wrong, especially about yourself

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They suffer from the illusion that they cannot solve their problems.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们误以为解决不了自己的问题。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She was under no illusion that he loved her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不再幻想他爱她了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is an illusion that the Arctic is dark in winter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 认为北极冬天一片黑暗是错误的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had no illusions about her physical attractiveness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对自己外表的吸引力不抱幻想。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I hate to shatter your illusions,’ he said.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不愿意打破你的幻想。”他说。

Sense.DEF: something that seems to be different from the way it really is

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was unlikely to be satisfied with the illusion of power.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不可能满足于这种虚幻的权力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The mirrors in the room gave an illusion of greater space.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里的镜子给人一种空间增大的错觉。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Credit creates the illusion that you can own things without paying for them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 赊购会让人产生买东西不用付钱的错觉。

Sense.DEF: someone who does surprising tricks that make things seem to appear or happen
false but seeming to be real or true
Sense.EXAMPLE: First impressions can often prove illusory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一印象往往被证明是不真实的。

Sense.DEF: to make the meaning of something clearer by giving examples
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let me give an example to illustrate the point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我举个例子来说明这一点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She illustrated her discussion with diagrams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用图表来说明她的论述。

Sense.DEF: to be an example which shows that something is true or that a fact exists

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This dispute illustrates that the regime is deeply divided.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次争端说明该政权极度分裂。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The following examples illustrate how this operates in practice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下面几个例子说明这是如何实际操作的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This illustrates a fundamental weakness in the system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这表明该系统有一个根本性的缺点。

Sense.DEF: to put pictures in a book, article etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over a hundred diagrams, tables and pictures illustrate the book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书有一百多幅图解﹑表格和图片。

Sense.DEF: a picture in a book, article etc, especially one that helps you to understand it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book contains 62 pages of illustrations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书有62页插图。

Sense.DEF: a story, event, action etc that shows the truth or existence of something very clearly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a striking illustration of 19th-century attitudes to women
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 19世纪时对待女性态度的鲜明例证
GramExa.EXAMPLE: For the purposes of illustration, some of the more important symptoms are listed below.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下面列出一些更重要的症状作为例证。

Sense.DEF: the act or process of illustrating something
helping to explain the meaning of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The case is illustrative of a common pattern.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该事例是对常见模式的说明。

Sense.EXAMPLE: For illustrative purposes, only a simple example is given here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里只举个简单的例子来予以说明。

Sense.DEF: having pictures, especially to help you understand something
Sense.TRAN: 图解的﹐插图的〔尤为了帮助人理解某事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: graphics and other illustrative material
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 图表和其他图解材料

Sense.DEF: someone who draws pictures, especially for books
famous and admired because of what you have achieved
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has had an illustrious career.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已经有了辉煌的事业。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wagner was just one of many illustrious visitors to the town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瓦格纳只是到访过这座小镇的众多名人中的一位。

Sense.DEF: unfriendly or unkind feelings towards someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He said the accusation had been made from hatred and ill will.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说指控是出于仇恨和敌意。

Sense.DEF: the form used for in- before b, m, or p
Sense.EXAMPLE: immobilize
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使不能动
Sense.EXAMPLE: impossible
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可能的

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘I am’
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m a student.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是个学生。

Sense.DEF: a type of service available on the Internet that allows you to quickly exchange written messages with people that you know
a type of computer made by Apple Macintosh. iMacs are an unusual design and are produced in a range of bright colours.
the opinion people have of a person, organization, product etc, or the way a person, organization etc seems to be to the public
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人﹑组织﹑产品等的〕声誉﹔形象

GramExa.EXAMPLE: attempts to improve the image of the police
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 提升警察形象的努力

Sense.DEF: a picture that you have in your mind, especially about what someone or something is like or the way they look
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指对某人或某物的〕印象﹐形象

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had no visual image of her, only her name.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他记不得她的样子了﹐只记得她的名字。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He had the clearest image in his mind of his mother and father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脑海中对父母的印象极其清晰。

Subsense.DEF: a picture of an object in a mirror or in the lens of a camera
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She peered closely at her image in the mirror.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她仔细检视镜子中自己的映像。

Subsense.DEF: a picture on the screen of a television, cinema, or computer
Subsense.TRAN: 〔电视﹑电影或计算机屏幕上的〕图像﹐影像
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Jill Sharpe was little more than a name, a glossy image on a television screen.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉尔·夏普只是一个名字而已﹐一个电视荧屏上的浮华影像。

Subsense.DEF: a picture or shape of a person or thing that is copied onto paper or is cut in wood or stone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: carved images
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雕像

Sense.DEF: a word, phrase, or picture that describes an idea in a poem, book, film etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He paints a very romantic image of working-class communities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他描绘了工人阶级社区的浪漫景象。

Sense.DEF: to look exactly like someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s the spitting image of his mother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他酷似他的母亲。

Sense.DEF: in the same form or shape as someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: According to the Bible, man was made in the image of God.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《圣经》上说﹐人是照着上帝的样子创造的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We want to give people a positive image of the town.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要向别人展示这座城镇的正面形象。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult to explain why the industry has such a bad image.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难说清楚这一行业为何形象如此糟糕。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: morally good and never doing anything bad
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The recent scandal has damaged his clean-cut image.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的丑闻破坏了他道德高尚的形象。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: expensive and good quality
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company is trying to promote an upmarket image.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司在努力塑造一种高端品牌形象。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: cheap and not good quality
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The store has struggled to break away from its downmarket image.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该商店努力想摆脱其低端品牌形象。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They want to improve the traditional image of English food.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们要改善英国食品的传统形象。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The popular image of the spy as a glamorous figure of mystery is far from the reality.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家眼中间谍那富有魅力的神秘形象与实际情况相去甚远。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the image that many people have of someone or something
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人/某事物的公众形象

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: how someone seems in films or on TV

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The product has a rather downmarket image.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一产品的形象很低端。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company is trying to create an image of quality and reliability.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司力图打造优质﹑可靠的形象。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The casino industry was keen to improve its image.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 赌博行业急于改善形象。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Has this scandal damaged the company’s image?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一丑闻是否损害了公司的形象？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be like the image you have presented of yourself
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He has certainly lived up to his wild rock-star image.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的言行显然很符合其狂放不羁的摇滚乐明星形象。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: behave in a way that creates a particular image
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 表现/展现/提升某一形象
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He presented an image of himself as an energetic young leader.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他展示了一名精力充沛的年轻领袖的形象。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: try to encourage or develop an image
damage it slightly
get rid of it

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Politicians have an image problem as far as many young people are concerned.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多年轻人认为政治人物的形象有问题。

Sense.DEF: the use of words or pictures to describe ideas or actions in poems, books, films etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔诗﹑书﹑电影等中的〕意象﹐形象化描述﹔比喻

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the imagery of love
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱情意象

Sense.EXAMPLE: Their dreams commonly involved complex stories with visual imagery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的梦里常常有很多复杂的情节﹐充满了生动的画面。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is the best, worst etc that can be imagined
Sense.EXAMPLE: The travel brochure is full of the most wonderful resorts imaginable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本旅游小册子里全是人们梦寐以求的最好的旅游胜地。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something includes every possible example of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He seems to have been influenced by every imaginable musical style.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他似乎受到各种能想到的音乐风格的影响。

Sense.DEF: not real, but produced from pictures or ideas in your mind
Sense.EXAMPLE: As she listened, she played an imaginary piano on her knees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她边听边在膝盖上作弹钢琴状。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must protect older people from harm, whether it is real or imaginary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须保护老人免受伤害﹐无论这伤害是真实的还是假想的。

Sense.DEF: the ability to form pictures or ideas in your mind
Sense.EXAMPLE: a storyteller with an incredible imagination
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想象力极丰富的讲故事者
Sense.EXAMPLE: It does not take much imagination to understand their grief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不难想象他们是多么悲伤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: With a little imagination, you can find great inexpensive gifts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 稍微动点脑筋﹐你就会找到物美价廉的礼物。

Sense.DEF: to be something that someone imagines, not something that really exists or happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you hear that noise, or was it my imagination?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你听到那个声音了吗？ 还是那是我的幻觉？
Sense.EXAMPLE: These people do exist; they’re not figments of my imagination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些人确实存在﹐他们不是我凭空想象出来的。

Sense.DEF: only existing or happening in someone’s mind, not in real life
Sense.TRAN: 只存在[发生]于某人的想象之中
Sense.EXAMPLE: For the refugees, home exists only in their imagination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于这些难民来说﹐家只存在于他们的想象之中。

Sense.DEF: to make people feel very interested and excited
Sense.TRAN: 使某人出神﹐使某人入迷
Sense.EXAMPLE: American football really captured the imagination of the British public.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美式橄榄球确实使英国民众着迷。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately not describe something because you think someone can guess or imagine it
Sense.TRAN: 将某事留给某人自己去想象〔因认为某人能够猜出或想象到〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mercifully, the writer leaves most of the physical horrors to our imagination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸而作者把大部分有形的恐惧留给我们自己去想象。

Subsense.DEF: if someone’s clothes leave little or nothing to the imagination, the clothes are very thin or are worn in a way that shows the person’s body
Subsense.TRAN: 没有想象的余地〔指又薄又贴身的衣服令身材显露无遗〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Her black satin dress left nothing to the imagination.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的黑色缎子连衣裙令身段显露无遗。

Subsense.DEF: if something sexual or violent is described in a way that leaves nothing to the imagination, it is described in too much detail
Subsense.TRAN: 〔对性爱或暴力事件的描述〕很露骨

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that they can easily guess the answer to a question, so you should not need to tell them

Crossrefto.REFLEX: not by any stretch of the imagination

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She’s a lively child, with a good imagination.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个活泼的孩子﹐想象力很丰富。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His paintings show great imagination.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的画作展现出非凡的想象力。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an ability to think of a lot of ideas and things that could happen
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She had a fertile imagination and a great sense of humour.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想象力丰富并且很有幽默感。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a mind that imagines strange things that are not real
Collocate.EXAMPLE: These stories are the product of an overactive imagination.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些故事都是想象力过于丰富的结果。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The story captured the public imagination.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇报道引起了公众的兴趣。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I don't have the creative imagination to be a writer.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我缺乏富于创造性的想象力﹐成不了作家。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her poems show that she has a lot of imagination.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的诗作表明她有丰富的想象力。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Musicians need to use their imagination as well as their technical skills.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐家既要运用技巧又要发挥想象力。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His latest paintings display a vivid imagination.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最新的画作展现了生动的想象力。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make someone use their imagination

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her stories are full of imagination.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的故事充满了想象力。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Their policies show a lack of imagination.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的政策显露出想象力的匮乏。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: allow yourself to imagine many strange or wonderful things
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 让想象力尽情发挥[自由驰骋]

Sense.DEF: containing new and interesting ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: an imaginative use of computer technology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机技术的妙用
Sense.EXAMPLE: children’s imaginative play
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童富有想象力的游戏
Sense.EXAMPLE: an imaginative solution to the litter problem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 解决乱扔垃圾的问题的有创意的方法

Sense.DEF: good at thinking of new and interesting ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: an imaginative child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想象力丰富的孩子

Sense.DEF: to form a picture or idea in your mind about what something could be like

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Imagine that you have just won a million pounds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 设想你刚刚赢得一百万英镑。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Imagine life without hot water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想象一下没有热水的生活。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you imagine what it’s like when it’s really hot out here in Delhi?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能想象出德里这儿热起来是什么样子吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She could imagine dark-robed figures moving silently along the stone corridors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她可以想象出身穿黑袍的人悄无声息地在石廊里穿行的情景。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Imagine doing a horrible job like that!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想象一下做那种可怕的工作吧！
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just imagine going all that way for nothing!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想想看﹐白走了那么多的路！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He didn’t quite dare to imagine himself as a real artist.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不太敢把自己想象成一个真正的艺术家。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Somehow, I can’t imagine him without a beard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知为什么﹐我想象不出他没有胡子的样子。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is difficult/easy/possible/impossible etc to imagine sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: After such a dry summer, it’s difficult to imagine what rain looks like.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过如此干燥的夏季﹐很难想象下雨的样子。

Sense.DEF: to have a false or wrong idea about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps she’d never really been there at all – perhaps she’d just imagined it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能她从未到过那儿——也许这都是她的幻想。
Sense.EXAMPLE: imagined dangers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凭空臆想出来的危险

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had imagined that the doctor would be male.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她原本以为会是个男医生。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was surprised when I saw the farm. I had imagined it would be much bigger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看见农场时我很惊讶我原来想象它会大得多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s nobody here. You’re just imagining things.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这儿没人﹐你只是在胡思乱想。

Sense.DEF: to think that something is true or may happen, but without being sure or having proof
Sense.TRAN: 〔不确定或没有根据地〕猜想﹐猜测
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘A very complicated subject, I imagine,’ said Edwin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “一个非常复杂的问题﹐我猜想。”埃德温说。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You are obviously tired and I imagine that nothing would make you admit it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你明显是累了﹐但我想你是绝对不肯承认的。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how good, bad etc something is
Sense.TRAN: 你能想象到/你想象不到某事〔用于强调某物好﹑坏等的程度〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can imagine how angry I was!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能想象我当时有多生气!
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can’t imagine what a terrible week we had.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想象不到我们经历了多么可怕的一个星期。

Exponent.DEF: to form a picture or idea in your mind about what something might be like
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When I think of Honolulu, I imagine long white beaches and palm trees.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到檀香山我的脑海里就浮现出连绵的白色沙滩和棕榈树。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I can’t really imagine being a millionaire.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我无法想象百万富翁是个什么样子。

Exponent.DEF: to form a picture of someone or something in your mind, especially something that is definitely going to happen or exist in the future
Exponent.TRAN: 设想﹐想象〔尤指将会发生或出现的事〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Anna visualized meeting Greg again at the airport.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 安娜设想在机场和格雷格重逢的场面。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The finished house may be hard to visualize.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子完工后是什么样子也许很难想象。

Exponent.DEF: to form a clear picture of something or someone in your mind
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I can still picture my father, even though he died a long time ago.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我依旧能想象出父亲的样子﹐尽管他去世已久。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The town was just how she had pictured it from his description.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城镇和她根据他的描述想象的完全一样。

Exponent.DEF: to imagine something as possible or likely to happen in the future
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How do you envisage your career developing over the next ten years?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对自己未来十年的职业发展是如何设想的？

Exponent.DEF: to imagine a situation, especially one that is difficult to imagine
Exponent.TRAN: 想象[设想]某事物〔尤指难以想象的情形〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: For many people, music is so important that they cannot conceive of life without it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对许多人来说音乐太重要了﹐他们无法想象没有音乐的生活是什么样子。

Exponent.DEF: to imagine something exciting that you would like to happen, but that is very unlikely to happen
Exponent.TRAN: 幻想﹐想象〔发生的可能性很小的令人兴奋的事〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I used to fantasize about becoming a film star.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 以前我曾幻想过成为电影明星。

Exponent.DEF: to imagine pleasant things, so that you forget where you are and what you should be doing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Mark began to daydream, and didn’t even hear the teacher’s question.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克开始做起了白日梦﹐连老师的提问都没听见。

Exponent.DEF: to imagine that you are seeing things that are not really there, especially because you are ill or have taken drugs
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The drug can cause some people to hallucinate.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药会让一些人产生幻觉。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When I saw the walls moving, I thought I must be hallucinating.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到墙在动时﹐我想我一定是产生了幻觉。

Tail.TailContent: This graph shows how common the different grammar patterns of the verb imagine are. 本图表所示为动词imagine构成的不同语法模式的使用频率。

Sense.DEF: a technical process in which pictures of the inside of someone’s body are produced, especially for medical reasons
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指作医学用途的〕(体内器官)成像
Sense.EXAMPLE: New imaging technologies mean that doctors are better able to screen for breast cancer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的成像技术意味着医生能更容易检测出乳腺癌。

Sense.DEF: situations or ideas that you imagine, but which are not real or true
Sense.TRAN: 想象的情形[概念]〔实际上是虚妄的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: In my wildest imaginings, I could not have foreseen what a wonderful life lay before me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我再怎么也想象不到美好的生活在等着我。

Sense.DEF: a Muslim religious leader
Sense.TRAN: 伊玛目〔伊斯兰教的宗教领袖〕

Sense.DEF: a lack of a fair or correct balance between two things, which results in problems or unfairness

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government must redress the imbalance put it right in spending on black and white children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府必须纠正在黑人儿童和白人儿童方面开支的不平衡。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the current imbalance between farming and conservation interests
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 农业耕种和资源保护之间利益的不平衡现状

Sense.EXAMPLE: a hormonal imbalance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内分泌失调

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Many pupils follow an imbalanced curriculum.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多学生所学的课程结构不平衡。

Sense.DEF: someone who is very stupid or behaves very stupidly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked at me as if I was a total imbecile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看着我﹐好像我是个大笨蛋。

Sense.DEF: another spelling of embed
to drink something, especially alcohol – sometimes used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 喝﹐饮〔尤指酒﹐有时为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both men imbibed considerable quantities of gin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个男人都喝了大量的杜松子酒。

Sense.DEF: to accept and be influenced by qualities, ideas, values etc
Sense.TRAN: 吸收﹐接受〔品质﹑观点﹑价值观等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had imbibed the traditions of her family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她受到了自己家庭传统的影响。

Sense.DEF: a difficult, embarrassing, or confusing situation, especially in politics or public life
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指政治或公务中出现的〕错综复杂的局面﹐困局
Sense.EXAMPLE: a political imbroglio
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治上错综复杂的局面

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something have a quality, idea, or emotion very strongly
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某物〕拥有〔某种特性〕﹔使〔某人〕充满〔强烈情感﹑想法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: His philosophical writings are imbued with religious belief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的哲学著作里充满了宗教信仰方面的内容。

Sense.DEF: a number that each mobile phone has, which it sends whenever someone uses it to make a phone call
an international organization that tries to encourage trade between countries and to help poorer countries develop economically
used in emails or on the Internet when giving your opinion about something
Sense.TRAN: 以我的拙见〔用于电子邮件或因特网〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: IMHO you should call him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我个人的看法是你应该给他电话。

Sense.DEF: to copy the way someone behaves, speaks, moves etc, especially in order to make people laugh
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was a splendid mimic and loved to imitate Winston Churchill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个出色的模仿者﹐喜欢模仿温斯顿·丘吉尔。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not use imitate to mean ‘do the same thing as someone else’. Use copy. 表示和其他人做一样的事情时不要用imitate﹐而要用copy: She worries that Tom will copy his brother (NOT 不说 imitate his brother) and leave home. 她担心汤姆会学他的哥哥﹐离家出走。

Sense.DEF: to copy something because you think it is good
Sense.EXAMPLE: vegetarian products which imitate meat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 素肉
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Japanese have no wish to imitate Western social customs and attitudes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日本人无意仿效西方的社会习俗和处事态度。

Sense.DEF: when you copy someone else’s actions

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many people think that children learn language by imitation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人认为儿童通过模仿学习语言。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The remake of ‘Casablanca’ was a pale imitation something that is much less good than the thing it imitates of the original movie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重拍的《卡萨布兰卡》远不如原版。

Sense.DEF: when you copy the way someone speaks or behaves, especially in order to be funny
Sense.EXAMPLE: She acted, she danced, she did imitations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她演戏﹐跳舞﹐做滑稽模仿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his imitation of an American accent
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对美国口音的模仿

Sense.DEF: a copy of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She wore an imitation of a sailor’s hat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她戴着一顶仿制的水手帽。

GramExa.GLOSS: something that looks like an expensive material but is a copy of it
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 人造毛皮/珍珠/丝绸/皮革等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: an imitation fur coat
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人造毛皮大衣

Sense.DEF: copying someone or something, especially in a way that shows you do not have any ideas of your own
Sense.TRAN: 模仿的﹐仿效的〔尤指模仿者缺乏个人思想〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young people might be provoked into imitative crime by the exploits they see on TV.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人可能会从电视上看到的“英勇行为”中受到启发而仿效电视主人公实施犯罪。

Sense.DEF: very clean and tidy
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wore an immaculate dark blue suit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他穿着整洁的深蓝色西装。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an immaculate kitchen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常整洁的厨房

Sense.DEF: exactly correct or perfect in every detail
Sense.EXAMPLE: her immaculate stage performances
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她完美的舞台表演

Sense.DEF: a quality that is immanent seems to be present everywhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: Love is a force immanent in the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱是世界上一种无处不在的力量。

Sense.DEF: God or another spiritual power that is immanent is present everywhere
Sense.TRAN: 〔上帝或另一种精神力量〕无所不在的

Sense.DEF: not important in a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you sign a document, it is wholly immaterial whether you have read it carefully or not.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文件一经签署﹐是否仔细阅读过文件就完全无关紧要了。

Sense.DEF: not having a physical body or form
Sense.EXAMPLE: our immaterial soul
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们无形的灵魂

Sense.DEF: someone who is immature behaves or thinks in a way that is typical of someone much younger – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为﹑思想〕不成熟的﹐幼稚的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He forgave his son’s immature behaviour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他原谅了儿子的幼稚行为。

Sense.DEF: not fully formed or developed
Sense.EXAMPLE: measures to protect immature whales
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保护幼鲸的措施

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is too big or too extreme to be measured
Sense.EXAMPLE: The refugee problem has now reached immeasurable proportions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难民问题现在已经到了无法估量的程度。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的西班牙语进步极大。

Sense.DEF: when something is important or urgent because it relates to a situation or event that is happening now

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the immediacy of everyday experience
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 日常经验的直接性

Sense.EXAMPLE: Television brings a new immediacy to world events.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视把世界大事更迅捷地呈现在观众眼前。

Sense.DEF: happening or done at once and without delay
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our immediate response to the attack was sheer horror.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对攻击的第一反应就是非常惊恐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They promise immediate action to help the unemployed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们承诺立即采取行动帮助失业者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the eyes are affected, seek immediate medical attention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果眼睛感染了要立即就医。

Sense.DEF: existing now, and needing to be dealt with quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s try and solve the most immediate problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我们尽力解决最急迫的问题吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is an immediate danger of war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争迫在眉睫。

Sense.DEF: happening just before or just after someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The most immediate effect of retirement is a dramatic reduction in living standards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 退休的最直接影响是生活水准的大幅度下降。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He promised that there would be no tax increases in the immediate future.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他承诺短期内不会提高税收。

Sense.DEF: next to, or very near to, a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is a thriving shopping centre for the people who live in the immediate area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一家为附近居民服务的生意兴隆的购物中心。

Sense.DEF: people who are very closely related to you, such as your parents, children, brothers, and sisters
Sense.TRAN: 直系亲属〔如父母﹑子女﹑兄弟姐妹等〕

Sense.DEF: without delay
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mix in the remaining ingredients and serve immediately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拌入余下的食材﹐立即上桌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The telephone rang, and he answered it immediately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话铃响了﹐他马上去接。

Sense.DEF: very soon before or after something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He retired immediately after the end of the war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争一结束他就退休了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t remember what happened immediately before the crash.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我记不得撞车前一刹那发生的事了。

Sense.DEF: able to be seen or understood very easily
Sense.TRAN: 能轻易看见的﹔很容易理解的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The solution to this problem is not immediately obvious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题的解决办法不是显而易见的。

Sense.DEF: very near to something

GramExa.PROPFORM: immediately behind/above/below/in front of etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the seat immediately behind the driver
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 驾驶员正后方的那个座位

Sense.DEF: very closely involved etc in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 直接受〔某事〕影响的﹔〔与某事〕有直接牵连/关系等的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Those most immediately involved in the disaster will be given support.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灾害最直接受害者将获得援助。

Exponent.DEF: very soon after something else happens, and without any delay
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sam immediately offered to help.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆马上主动提供帮助。

Exponent.DEF: immediately – used especially for emphasis
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Remove the pie from the oven and serve at once.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 把馅饼从烤箱中取出后立即上桌。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He came home at once when he heard his wife was ill.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听到妻子生病的消息立刻就回家了。

Exponent.DEF: immediately, especially because something is urgent. Right away and straight away are less formal than immediately, and are very common in everyday spoken English.
Exponent.TRAN: 立刻﹐马上〔尤因情况紧急。right away和straight away不如immediately正式﹐在日常英语口语中很常用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If this happens, let us know right away.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果发生这一情况﹐马上告诉我们。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I apologized straightaway.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我立刻道了歉。

Exponent.DEF: if something happens instantly, it happens immediately after something else, with almost no time between
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The boy was killed instantly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名男孩当场死亡。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The message is sent instantly from your computer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条信息即刻从你的计算机发送出去。

Exponent.DEF: if someone orders you to do something right now, they want you to do it immediately, especially because they are annoyed with you
Exponent.TRAN: 马上﹐立刻〔尤用于因生某人的气而对其发号施令〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The head teacher wants to see you right now.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 校长现在就要见你。

Exponent.DEF: immediately, because it is important that you do something as soon as possible
Exponent.TRAN: 马上﹐立刻〔因为重要而需尽快做〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If you lose your passport, you should contact the embassy without delay.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果遗失护照应该立刻与大使馆联系。

Sense.DEF: as soon as
Sense.EXAMPLE: Immediately you begin to speak, he gives you his full attention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你只要一开始说话﹐他就会全神贯注地听。

Sense.DEF: starting longer ago than people can remember, or than written history shows
Sense.TRAN: 年代久远的﹐远古的﹔史前的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Markets have been held here since time immemorial.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里自古以来就举办集市贸易。

Sense.DEF: extremely large
Sense.EXAMPLE: People who travel by rail still read an immense amount.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们坐火车旅行时仍然会读很多书。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Regular visits from a social worker can be of immense value to old people living alone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于独居老人来说社工的经常探望很重要。

Sense.DEF: very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: Champagne wines became immensely popular in the 18th century.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香槟酒在18世纪十分流行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nationalism is an immensely powerful force.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 民族主义是十分强大的力量。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We enjoyed the play immensely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们很喜欢这出戏。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize the great size of something, especially something that cannot be measured

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the immensity of outer space
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 外太空的浩瀚无垠

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize the great size and seriousness of something such as a problem you have to deal with or a job you have to do
Sense.TRAN: 巨大〔用于强调规模或严重程度〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the immensity of the problem
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 问题之严重

Sense.DEF: to put someone or something deep into a liquid so that they are completely covered

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Immerse your foot in ice cold water to reduce the swelling.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的脚泡在冰凉的水中消肿。

Sense.DEF: to become completely involved in an activity
Sense.TRAN: 潜心于某事﹐专注于某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: He left school at 16 and immersed himself in the Labour Party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他16岁离开学校投身工党。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She was far too immersed in her studies.

Sense.DEF: the action of immersing something in liquid, or the state of being immersed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his near-fatal immersion in the icy Atlantic Ocean
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他泡在冰冷的大西洋中几乎送命

Sense.DEF: the fact of being completely involved in something you are doing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: my immersion in black music and culture
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对黑人音乐和文化的全身心投入

Sense.DEF: the language teaching method in which people are put in situations where they have to use the new language
Sense.TRAN: 〔将学生置于必须使用外语的环境的〕沉浸式语言教学法

Sense.DEF: an immersion heater
an electric water heater that provides hot water for a house
Sense.TRAN: 浸入式热水器〔一种家用电热水器〕

Sense.DEF: someone who enters another country to live there permanently
Sense.EXAMPLE: an illegal immigrant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非法移民
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new wave of immigrants from the Middle East
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自中东的一股新兴的移民浪潮

Sense.DEF: to come into a country in order to live there permanently
Sense.EXAMPLE: His father and mother immigrated when he was two.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的父母在他两岁时移民到这里。

Sense.DEF: the process of entering another country in order to live there permanently
Sense.EXAMPLE: He called for a common European policy on immigration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他要求欧洲国家实施共同的移民政策。

Sense.DEF: the total number of people who immigrate
Sense.EXAMPLE: Immigration fell in the 1980s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪80年代移民人数下降。

Sense.DEF: the place at an airport, sea port etc where officials check the documents of everyone entering the country
an event that is imminent, especially an unpleasant one, will happen very soon
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指令人不快的事〕即将发生的﹐逼近的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was in imminent danger of dying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他奄奄一息。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A new trade agreement is imminent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项新的贸易协定即将签署。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the imminence of the General Election

Sense.DEF: not moving at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: She could see a figure sitting immobile, facing the sea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看到一个人影面朝大海坐着﹐一动不动。

Sense.DEF: unable to move or walk normally
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kim’s illness had rendered her completely immobile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金的病使她完全丧失了活动能力。

Sense.DEF: to prevent someone or something from moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: The broken limb must be immobilized immediately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 断肢必须立即加以固定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was immobilized with a broken leg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的腿断了﹐不能行走。

Sense.DEF: to stop something from working
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car’s security device will immobilize the ignition system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车的安全装置能使点火系统停止工作。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that is fitted to a car to stop it moving if someone tries to steal it
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车的〕发动机防盗锁止系统

Sense.DEF: not within reasonable and sensible limits
Sense.EXAMPLE: immoderate drinking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酗酒

Sense.DEF: having a very high opinion of yourself and your abilities, and not embarrassed about telling people how clever you are
Sense.EXAMPLE: Webb was an immodest publicist of his own achievements.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 韦布宣扬起自己的成绩来毫不谦虚。

Sense.DEF: clothes that are immodest show too much of someone’s body
behaviour that is immodest shocks or embarrasses people
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为〕使人震惊的﹔令人尴尬的﹔不合礼仪的﹐下流的
Sense.EXAMPLE: They thought it was immodest for both sexes to swim together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们认为男女共泳有伤风化。

Sense.DEF: to kill someone or destroy something by burning them
morally wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: Deliberately making people suffer is immoral.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 故意使人吃苦头是不道德的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s immoral to be rich while people are starving and homeless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管别人忍饥挨饿﹑居无定所而自己发家致富是不道德的。

Sense.DEF: not following accepted standards of sexual behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 放荡的﹐淫荡的﹔伤风败俗的

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 轰炸平民的不道德行为

Sense.DEF: living or continuing for ever
Sense.EXAMPLE: Plato believed that the soul is immortal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柏拉图认为灵魂不灭。

Sense.DEF: an immortal line, play, song etc is so famous that it will never be forgotten
Sense.TRAN: 〔诗句﹑戏剧﹑歌曲等〕不朽的﹐流传百世的
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the immortal words of Henry Ford, ‘If it ain’t broke, don’t fix it.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利·福特的不朽名言说道:“如果东西还没坏﹐就别去修它。”

Sense.DEF: the state of living for ever or being remembered for ever
Sense.TRAN: 永生﹐长存﹐永恒﹐永垂不朽
Sense.EXAMPLE: the immortality of the soul
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灵魂的不朽

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something famous for a long time, especially by writing about them, painting a picture of them etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过著书﹑画像等〕使不朽﹐使名垂千古
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dickens’ father was immortalized as Mr Micawber in ‘David Copperfield’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狄更斯的父亲作为《大卫 · 科波菲尔》中米考伯先生的原型而被后人铭记。

Sense.DEF: impossible to move
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lock your bike to something immovable like a railing or lamp-post.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把自行车锁到栏杆或路灯柱之类固定的物体上。

Sense.DEF: impossible to change or persuade
Sense.TRAN: 坚定不移的﹐不为所动的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president is immovable on this issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个问题上﹐总统的立场坚定不移。

Sense.DEF: someone who is immune to a particular disease cannot catch it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once we’ve had the disease, we’re immune for life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一旦得过这种病﹐就获得了终身免疫力。

Sense.DEF: the reaction of the body’s immune system to something that is harmful
Sense.EXAMPLE: HIV is a progressive disease which the immune response ultimately fails to control.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类免疫缺陷病毒是一种进行性疾病﹐最终免疫反应无法将其控制。

Sense.DEF: not affected by something that happens or is done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Labour Party is not immune to new ideas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党也受到新思潮的影响。

Sense.DEF: specially protected from something unpleasant

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The senior members of the group appeared to be immune from arrest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该团体的资深成员似乎可免遭逮捕。

Sense.DEF: the system by which your body protects itself against disease
Sense.EXAMPLE: My immune system is not as strong as it ought to be.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的免疫力比较差。

Sense.DEF: a British spelling of immunize
the state or right of being protected from particular laws or from unpleasant things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were granted immunity from prosecution.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们获准免受起诉。

Sense.DEF: the state of being immune to a disease

GramExa.EXAMPLE: immunity to infection
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对传染病的免疫力

GramExa.EXAMPLE: immunity from smallpox
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对天花的免疫力

Sense.DEF: to protect someone from a particular illness by giving them a vaccine

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is still no vaccine to immunize people against the virus.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在还没有针对这种病毒的疫苗。

Sense.DEF: the scientific study of the prevention of disease and how the body reacts to disease
to shut someone in a place so that they cannot get out
never changing or impossible to change
Sense.EXAMPLE: This decision should not be seen as immutable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不该把这个决定看成是不可改变的。

Sense.DEF: a mobile phone that has a small screen which you can use for Internet and email services
Sense.TRAN: I-mode手机〔可通过I-mode服务访问因特网和收发邮件〕

Sense.DEF: a child who behaves badly, but in a way that is funny
Sense.TRAN: 调皮的孩子﹐顽童﹐小淘气

Sense.DEF: a small creature in stories who has magic powers and behaves very badly
Sense.TRAN: 〔故事中有魔法爱捉弄人的〕小魔鬼﹐小妖精

Sense.DEF: the effect or influence that an event, situation etc has on someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We need to assess the impact on climate change.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要评估对气候变化的影响。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Higher mortgage rates have already had a major impact on spending.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 提高的抵押借款利率已经对消费产生了重大影响。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an international meeting to consider the environmental impacts of global warming
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究全球变暖所造成环境影响的国际会议

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘cause an impact’ on something. Say 而要说 have an impact on something.

Sense.DEF: the force of one object hitting another
Sense.EXAMPLE: The force of the impact knocked the breath out of her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 撞击力使她喘不过气来。

Sense.DEF: at the moment when one thing hits another
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane’s wing was damaged on impact.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机机翼因碰撞而受损。

Sense.DEF: to have an important or noticeable effect on someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Food Safety Act will progressively impact on the way food businesses operate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 《食品安全法》将逐渐对食品业的经营方式产生影响。

Sense.DEF: a tooth that is impacted is growing under another tooth so that it cannot develop properly
to damage something or make it not as good as it should be
Sense.EXAMPLE: The illness had impaired his ability to think and concentrate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种疾病损害了他的思维能力和注意力。

Sense.DEF: damaged, less strong, or not as good as before
Sense.EXAMPLE: impaired vision
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受损的视力

GramExa.GLOSS: used to describe someone who cannot see, hear etc well
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 视力/听力/智力等受损的

Sense.DEF: a condition in which a part of a person’s mind or body is damaged or does not work well
Sense.TRAN: 智力/视力/认知能力/听力等受损

Sense.DEF: a large African antelope
if someone or something is impaled, a sharp pointed object goes through them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their heads were impaled on Charles Bridge as a warning to others.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的头颅被钉在查尔斯桥上﹐作为对其他人的警告。

Sense.DEF: impossible to touch or feel physically
Sense.TRAN: 触摸不着的﹔感觉不到的

Sense.DEF: very difficult to understand
another spelling of empanel
to give a particular quality to something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Use a piece of fresh ginger to impart a East Asian flavour to simple ingredients.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用一片鲜姜给简单的原料添上东亚的风味。

Sense.DEF: to give information, knowledge, wisdom etc to someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔向某人〕传授〔知识﹑智慧〕﹐透露〔信息〕﹔告知
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had information that she couldn’t wait to impart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她得到了消息﹐迫不及待地想告诉别人。

Sense.DEF: not involved in a particular situation, and therefore able to give a fair opinion or piece of advice
Sense.EXAMPLE: We offer impartial advice on tax and insurance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们就税收和保险问题提供公充的建议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an impartial inquiry into the deaths
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对死亡事件的公正调查
Sense.EXAMPLE: an impartial observer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公正的观察员

Sense.DEF: a road, path, or area that is impassable is impossible to travel along or through
Sense.TRAN: 不能通行的﹐无法通过的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mountains are impassable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 连绵的群山无法翻越。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which it is impossible to continue with a discussion or plan because the people involved cannot agree

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The political process is at an impasse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治进程出现僵局。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Negotiations seemed to have reached an impasse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈判似乎陷入了僵局。

Sense.DEF: full of strong feeling and emotion
Sense.EXAMPLE: She appeared on television to make an impassioned plea for help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在电视上恳切地请求人们帮助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an impassioned speech
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激昂的演讲

Sense.DEF: not showing any emotion
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her impassive face showed no reaction at all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她表情冷淡﹐毫无反应。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们神情冷漠地审视着他。

Sense.DEF: annoyance at having to accept delays, other people’s weaknesses etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his impatience with the slowness of bureaucratic procedures
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对拖沓的官僚程序的不耐烦

Sense.EXAMPLE: A note of impatience had entered his voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的语气开始透出一丝不耐烦。

Sense.DEF: great eagerness for something to happen, especially something that is going to happen soon
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指对即将发生的事的〕渴望﹐企盼

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was bursting with impatience to tell Natalia what had happened.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她急不可待地想要告诉纳塔利娅所发生的事情。

Sense.DEF: annoyed because of delays, someone else’s mistakes etc
Sense.TRAN: 不耐烦的﹐无耐心的﹐急躁的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We are growing impatient with the lack of results.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们因为没有取得成效而急躁起来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He turned away with an impatient gesture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他做了个不耐烦的手势转过身去。

Sense.DEF: very eager for something to happen and not wanting to wait

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Alec strode down the street, impatient to be home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚历克在街上大步走着﹐急着想赶回家。

GramExa.PROPFORM: impatient for sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was eager to talk to Shildon and impatient for him to return from lunch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他急着想和希尔登谈谈﹐盼着他快点吃完午饭回来。

Sense.DEF: if a government official is impeached, they are formally charged with a serious crime in a special government court
Sense.EXAMPLE: The governor was impeached for using state funds improperly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 州长因违规使用州政府资金而受到弹劾。

Sense.DEF: without any faults and impossible to criticize
Sense.TRAN: 完美的﹔无缺点的﹔无可指摘的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has taught her children impeccable manners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把她的孩子教育得举止十分得体。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bar with impeccable service
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 服务无可挑剔的酒吧

Sense.DEF: having very little money, especially over a long period – sometimes used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指长期〕没钱的﹐贫穷的〔有时为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He came from a respectable if impecunious family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他来自一个没钱但受人尊重的家庭。

Sense.DEF: a measure of the power of a piece of electrical equipment to stop the flow of an alternating current
to make it difficult for someone or something to move forward or make progress
Sense.EXAMPLE: Storms at sea impeded our progress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海上风暴阻碍了我们的航程。

Sense.DEF: a physical problem that makes speaking, hearing, or moving difficult
Sense.TRAN: 〔生理问题导致的〕言语[听觉﹐行动]障碍
Sense.EXAMPLE: a speech impediment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 言语障碍

Sense.DEF: a situation or event that makes it difficult or impossible for someone or something to succeed or make progress

GramExa.EXAMPLE: War is one of the greatest impediments to human progress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争是人类进步的一大绊脚石。

Sense.DEF: things that you think you need to have or do, but which can slow your progress – often used humourously
Sense.TRAN: 〔妨碍行进的〕重负〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: if something impels you to do something, it makes you feel very strongly that you must do it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The lack of democracy and equality impelled the oppressed to fight for independence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有民主和平等的境况促使受压迫者为独立而战。

Sense.DEF: an impending event or situation, especially an unpleasant one, is going to happen very soon
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指不愉快的事情〕逼近的﹐即将发生的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had a sense of impending disaster.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有种大祸即将临头的感觉。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: impending changes in government legislation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府法规即将发生的改变

Sense.DEF: impossible to get through, see through, or get into
Sense.TRAN: 不能通过的﹔不能看透的﹔无法进入的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trees formed a dark and impenetrable barrier.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些树形成了一道无法通过的黑暗屏障。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the impenetrable blackness of the night
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜晚伸手不见五指的黑

Sense.DEF: very difficult or impossible to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: impenetrable legal jargon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 费解的法律术语

Sense.DEF: extremely important and needing to be done or dealt with immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is imperative that politicians should be good communicators.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治家应该是很好的沟通者﹐这很重要。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is imperative (for sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is imperative to meet face to face with the client.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 必须面对面接触客户。

Sense.DEF: an imperative verb is one that expresses an order, such as ‘stand up’
something that must be done urgently
Sense.EXAMPLE: A broad and balanced education is an imperative for raising standards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为提高教育水准﹐推行广泛和均衡的教育是当务之急。

Sense.DEF: an idea or belief that has a strong influence on people, making them behave in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 〔对人的行为具有很大影响的〕观念﹐信念
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sharing food is the most important moral imperative in Semai society.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 分享食物在塞迈社会中是最重要的道德观念。

Sense.DEF: the form of a verb that expresses an order. For example, in the order ‘Come here’, ‘come’ is in the imperative.
almost impossible to see or notice
Sense.EXAMPLE: Such changes are imperceptible to even the best-trained eye.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样的变化即使是对最训练有素的人来说也不易察觉。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The daylight faded almost imperceptibly into night.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 天色不知不觉暗了下来。

Sense.DEF: not completely correct or perfect
Sense.EXAMPLE: the imperfect world we live in
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们生活于其中的不完美的世界

Sense.DEF: the form of a verb which is used when talking about an action in the past that is not complete. For example, ‘I was eating’.
relating to an empire or to the person who rules it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain’s imperial expansion in the 19th century
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 19世纪英帝国的扩张

Sense.DEF: relating to the system of weights and measurements based on pounds, inches, miles etc
Sense.TRAN: 英制的〔以磅﹑英寸﹑英里等为基本度量衡单位的制度〕

Sense.DEF: a political system in which one country rules a lot of other countries
Sense.EXAMPLE: a book on the history of British imperialism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本关于英国帝国主义历史的书

Sense.DEF: the way in which a rich or powerful country’s way of life, culture, businesses etc influence and change a poorer country’s way of life etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Small nations resent Western cultural imperialism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小国家痛恨西方的文化扩张。

Sense.DEF: to put something or someone in danger
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tax increases now might imperil economic recovery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前提高税收可能会危及经济的复苏。

Sense.DEF: giving orders and expecting to be obeyed, in a way that seems too proud
Sense.TRAN: 专横的﹔飞扬跋扈的﹔傲慢的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She raised her hand in an imperious gesture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她傲慢地扬起手。

Sense.DEF: existing or continuing for a long time or for ever
Sense.EXAMPLE: a set of imperishable truths
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套不朽的真理

Sense.DEF: not staying the same forever
Sense.EXAMPLE: single-storey structures, built from cheap and impermanent materials
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用廉价而不耐久的材料建成的单层建筑

RunOn.EXAMPLE: His philosophy stressed the impermanence of the world.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的哲学观点强调世界的无常。

Sense.DEF: not allowing liquids or gases to pass through
Sense.TRAN: 不容〔液体或气体〕透过的﹐不可渗透的
Sense.EXAMPLE: No paint is impermeable to water vapour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有哪种涂料是不透水汽的。

Sense.DEF: something that is impermissible cannot be allowed
not showing any feelings of sympathy, friendliness etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Business letters do not have to be impersonal and formal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 商业信函并非一定要刻板而缺乏人情味。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes she seems a very impersonal, even unkind, mother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时她看起来是一个非常冷漠的母亲﹐甚至有些刻薄。

Sense.DEF: a place or situation that is impersonal does not make people feel that they are important
Sense.TRAN: 〔地方或情况〕没有人情味的﹔冷淡的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate staying in hotels; they’re so impersonal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢住酒店﹐那里缺乏人情味。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a formal and impersonal style of management
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种刻板的﹑缺乏人情味的管理风格

Sense.DEF: in grammar, an impersonal sentence or verb is one where the subject is represented by ‘it’ or ‘there’, as in the sentence ‘It rained all day’
Sense.TRAN: 〔语法中〕非人称的﹐无人称的〔指句子或动词的主语是it或there﹐如 It rained all day〕

Sense.DEF: to pretend to be someone else by copying their appearance, voice, and behaviour, especially in order to deceive people
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为行骗而〕假扮﹐假冒〔他人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you know it is a very serious offence to impersonate a police officer?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道假冒警察是很严重的违法行为吗？

Sense.DEF: to copy someone’s voice and behaviour, especially in order to make people laugh
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为逗人发笑而〕模仿〔某人的言语﹑动作〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the film he amusingly impersonates a woman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影片中他模仿一个女人﹐非常好笑。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He’s renowned for his Elvis impersonation.

Sense.DEF: someone who copies the way that other people look, speak, and behave, as part of a performance
Sense.TRAN: 〔在表演中模仿他人的〕模仿者
Sense.EXAMPLE: a female impersonator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男扮女装的表演者

Sense.DEF: rude and not respectful, especially to someone who is older or more important
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指对尊长〕不敬的﹐莽撞无礼的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was always asking impertinent questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他老是问一些唐突的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You are an impertinent young woman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这姑娘真没礼貌。

Sense.DEF: remaining calm and unworried in spite of problems or difficulties
Sense.TRAN: 从容镇定的﹐沉着的﹐冷静的

Sense.DEF: not affected or influenced by something and seeming not to notice it
Sense.TRAN: 不受影响的﹔无动于衷的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His ego was impervious to self-doubt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从不自我怀疑。

Sense.DEF: not allowing anything to enter or pass through
Sense.TRAN: 不能进入的﹐不能穿过的
Sense.EXAMPLE: impervious volcanic rock
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不透水的火山岩

GramExa.EXAMPLE: materials that are impervious to water
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不透水的物质

Sense.DEF: an infectious skin disease
Sense.TRAN: 脓疱病〔一种传染性皮肤病〕

Sense.DEF: tending to do things very quickly, without thinking carefully first, or showing this quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was high-spirited and impetuous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他情绪高昂﹐行事鲁莽。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She might live to regret this impetuous decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她可能会一辈子为这个鲁莽的决定感到后悔。

Sense.DEF: an influence that makes something happen or makes it happen more quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The report may provide further impetus for reform.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份报告可能会进一步推动改革。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The discovery gave fresh impetus to the research.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个发现为研究带来新动力。

Sense.DEF: the force that makes an object start moving, or keeps it moving
lack of respect for religion or God, or an action that shows this
Sense.TRAN: 〔对宗教或上帝的〕不虔诚﹐亵渎﹔不敬的行为

Sense.DEF: to have a harmful effect on someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Personal problems experienced by students may impinge on their work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生遇到的个人问题可能会影响到他们的学业。

Sense.DEF: lacking respect for religion or God
Sense.TRAN: 〔对宗教或上帝〕不恭敬的﹐不虔诚的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an impious crime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大不敬之罪

Sense.DEF: showing a lack of respect or seriousness in a way that is amusing rather than bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: a little girl with dark hair and an impish grin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脸上带着顽皮的笑容的黑发小女孩

Sense.DEF: very determined to continue opposing someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 决意〔与…〕作对的﹔〔对…〕毫不宽容的
Sense.EXAMPLE: implacable enemies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 死敌
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government faces implacable opposition on the issue of nuclear waste.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在核废物问题上政府遭到了坚决的反对。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He remained implacably opposed to the regime.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他依然坚决反对该政权。

Sense.DEF: to strongly fix an idea, feeling, attitude etc in someone’s mind or character

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A deep sense of patriotism had been implanted in him by his father.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他父亲向他灌输了强烈的爱国主义思想。

Sense.DEF: to put something into someone’s body by performing a medical operation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Surgeons successfully implanted an artificial hip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外科医生成功地植入了一个人工髋关节。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A donor egg fertilised by her husband’s sperm will be implanted in her womb.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个由她丈夫的精子授精的供卵将植入到她的子宫内。

Sense.DEF: if an egg or embryo implants, it begins to develop normally
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fertilized egg implants and becomes a foetus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受精卵着床后发育成胎儿。

Sense.DEF: something artificial that is put into someone’s body in a medical operation
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过手术被移植进人体的〕植入物
Sense.EXAMPLE: silicone breast implants
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 硅酮隆胸植入物

Sense.DEF: difficult to believe and therefore unlikely to be true
Sense.TRAN: 难以置信的﹔不可能真实的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Margaret found his excuse somewhat implausible.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛格丽特认为他的借口有些站不住脚。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not entirely implausible that a galaxy could be identical to our own.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 某个星系和我们这个星系完全相同并非完全不可能。

Sense.DEF: to take action or make changes that you have officially decided should happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have decided to implement the committee’s recommendations in full.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已决定全面实施委员会提出的建议。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the implementation of the peace plan

Sense.DEF: a tool, especially one used for outdoor physical work
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指用于户外体力活的〕工具﹐用具﹐器具

Sense.DEF: to show or suggest that someone is involved in a crime or dishonest act
Sense.TRAN: 表明[暗示]〔某人〕与〔犯罪或不诚实行为〕有牵连
Sense.EXAMPLE: The allegations implicated Abe to such an extent he was forced to resign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安倍深受指控牵连﹐不得不辞职。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Three police officers are implicated in the cover-up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 三名警察涉嫌隐瞒事实。

Sense.DEF: if something is implicated in something bad or harmful, it is shown to be its cause
Sense.TRAN: 说明〔某物〕导致〔不好或有害的事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Viruses are known to be implicated in the development of some cancers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 已知病毒是诱发一些癌症的原因。

Sense.DEF: a possible future effect or result of an action, event, decision etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔行动﹑事件﹑决定等的〕可能的影响[后果]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What are the implications of these proposals?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些提议会有什么后果？

Sense.EXAMPLE: This election has profound implications for the future of U.S. democracy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于美国民主的未来而言﹐这次选举影响深远。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His talk will examine the wider implications of the Internet revolution.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的讲话将探讨因特网革命更为广泛的影响力。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which it is shown or suggested that someone or something is involved in a crime or a dishonest act
Sense.TRAN: 〔与罪行或欺诈行为的〕牵涉﹐牵连

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the implication of the former Chief of Staff in a major scandal
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 前任总参谋长卷入一宗重大丑闻

Sense.DEF: a suggestion that is not made directly but that people are expected to understand or accept
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are called ‘Supertrams’, the implication being that which is meant to suggest that they are more advanced than earlier models.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它们被称作“超级电车”﹐这是暗指它们比先前的型号更先进。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The law bans organized protests and, by implication, any form of opposition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一法令禁止有组织的抗议﹐言下之意就是禁止任何形式的反对活动。

Sense.DEF: suggested or understood without being stated directly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her words contained an implicit threat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她话里暗含威胁。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The minister’s statement is being seen as implicit criticism of the work of research laboratories.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长的话被认为是对研究实验室工作的含蓄批评。

Sense.DEF: forming a central part of something, but without being openly stated

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Confidentiality is implicit in your relationship with a counselor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在你与顾问的关系中﹐保守秘密是不言而喻的。

Sense.DEF: complete and containing no doubts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They had implicit faith in his powers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们绝对相信他的能力。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: They believed implicitly in their own superiority.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们绝对相信自己的优越性。

Sense.DEF: to explode inwards
Sense.EXAMPLE: The windows on both sides of the room had imploded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间两边的窗户都向内爆碎了。

Sense.DEF: if an organization or system implodes, it fails suddenly, often because of faults that it has
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most nations learned their lesson during the 1930s, when trade imploded and incomes plunged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪30年代贸易大崩溃﹐人们的收入骤然下降﹐大多数国家从中吸取了教训。

Sense.DEF: to ask for something in an emotional way
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Don’t go,’ I implored her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “不要走。”我哀求她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She implored the soldiers to save her child.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她恳求那些士兵救救她的孩子。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a ragged child with imploring eyes
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼神中充满乞求的衣衫褴褛的孩子

Sense.DEF: to suggest that something is true, without saying this directly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cleo blushed. She had not meant to imply that he was lying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克利奥脸红了。她不是故意暗指他在撒谎的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an implied threat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 隐含的威胁

Sense.DEF: if a fact, event etc implies something, it shows that it is likely to be true
Sense.TRAN: 意味着〔某事可能是真的〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The high level of radiation in the rocks implies that they are volcanic in origin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些岩石内的高辐射水平显示它们是由火山作用形成的。

Sense.DEF: if one thing implies another, it proves that the second thing exists
Sense.EXAMPLE: Democracy implies a respect for individual liberties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主必然包含对个人自由的尊重。
Sense.EXAMPLE: High profits do not necessarily imply efficiency.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高利润并不一定意味着高效率。

Sense.DEF: not polite
Sense.EXAMPLE: an impolite remark
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无礼的话

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is impolite (of sb) (to do sth)
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would it be impolite of me to ask exactly where you’ve been?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是我问你们到底去了哪儿会不会很唐突？

Sense.DEF: behaving in a way that is not careful and that could make people think you are not sensible
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was considered impolitic of him to spend too much time with the party radicals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他花太多时间与党内的激进分子在一起﹐这被认为是不明智的。

Sense.DEF: something that cannot be exactly measured, judged, or calculated
Sense.TRAN: 无法精确估量的事物﹔难以判断的事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are too many imponderables to make an accurate prediction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有太多无法判断的因素﹐因此很难作出准确的预测。

Sense.DEF: a product that is brought from one country into another so that it can be sold there, or the business of doing this
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ban on beef imports
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁止进口牛肉
Sense.EXAMPLE: the abolition of import duties taxes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 进口关税的废止

GramExa.EXAMPLE: cheap imports from Asia
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自亚洲的廉价进口产品

Sense.EXAMPLE: American demand for Japanese imports goods from Japan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国人对日本进口产品的需求
Sense.EXAMPLE: the import of electrical goods
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电气产品的进口

Sense.DEF: something new or different that is brought to a place where it did not previously exist
Sense.TRAN: 〔之前不曾在某地存在的〕输入物﹐引进物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The beetle is thought to be a European import.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种甲虫被认为是从欧洲传入的。

Sense.DEF: importance or meaning
Sense.EXAMPLE: a matter of no great import
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无关紧要的事

Sense.DEF: to bring a product from one country into another so that it can be sold there
Sense.EXAMPLE: In 2001, Britain exported more cars than it imported.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 2001年英国的汽车出口量大于进口。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All the meat is imported from France.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的肉都从法国进口。

Sense.DEF: to introduce something new or different in a place where it did not previously exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: The unusual designs were probably imported from Iran.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些新奇设计可能是从伊朗传入的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The US comedy format was gradually imported to UK screens.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种美国喜剧模式渐渐被搬上英国银幕。

Sense.DEF: to move information from one computer to another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can now import graphics from other applications.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你现在可以导入其他应用软件的图表。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being important

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the importance of regular exercise
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经常锻炼的重要性
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I agree about the importance of these proposals the reasons why they are important.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我同意﹐这些建议十分重要。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They make decisions about various matters of importance important matters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对各种各样的重要事情作出决定。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was full of his own importance he behaved in an annoying way which showed that he thought he was very important.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他自以为很了不起。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: This is an issue that has importance for all of us.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个议题对我们所有人都很重要。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: think it is important
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She attached great importance to loyalty.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她认为忠诚很重要。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 意识到某事物的重要性
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We all recognize the importance of his work.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都意识到他工作的重要性。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I'd like to emphasize the importance of reading exam questions carefully.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想强调仔细阅读考题的重要性。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The island lost its importance when trade routes changed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 贸易路线发生了改变﹐这座岛屿便失去了重要性。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be more important than something else

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Crime rates have great importance for the government.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 对该政府来说犯罪率事关重大。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very great
Collocate.EXAMPLE: This research is of vital importance.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一研究极其重要。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The central importance of interest rates is widely recognized.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都承认利率的重要性是第一位的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Tourism has particular importance in some regions.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游业在一些地区格外重要。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: When applying for a job, qualifications and experience are often of equal importance.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 申请工作时﹐资历和工作经验往往同等重要。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We discussed the relative importance of these different sources of revenue.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们讨论了这些不同收益来源的相对重要性。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: the growing importance of the Internet as a source of information
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为消息来源的因特网不断增强的重要性

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 经济上/政治上的重要性

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: related to things that happen, rather than just ideas
a feeling that you are an important person
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Sitting behind the big desk gave her a feeling of importance.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐在那张大办公桌后面使她感觉自己很重要。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Where the money came from is of no importance.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔钱从哪里来的并不重要。

Collocate.COLLOC: be of the utmost importance/be of paramount importance
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be extremely important
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It is of the utmost importance that this matter is kept confidential.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 对此事保密至为重要。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be the most important thing
be less important than another thing

Sense.DEF: an important event, decision, problem etc has a big effect or influence on people’s lives or on events in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very important meeting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很重要的会议
Sense.EXAMPLE: The accident taught him an important lesson.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次事故给了他很大的教训。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Happiness is more important than money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快乐比金钱更重要。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What did you say?’ ‘Oh, nothing important.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你说什么？”“噢﹐没什么大事。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s important to explain the procedure to the patient.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 向病人解释治疗程序十分重要。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s vitally important that you understand the danger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 了解危险所在是极为重要的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was important for the president to continue his schedule, regardless of the bomb threat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统不顾炸弹的威胁仍继续他的行程﹐这十分重要。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nothing could be more important to me than my family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对我来说﹐没有什么比家庭更重要。

Sense.HINTTRAN: When you mean that you care or think about something a lot, say that it is important to you, not that it is ‘important for’ you.表示你对某事很在意时﹐要说it is important to you﹐不要说it is important for you。

Sense.DEF: people who are important have a lot of power or influence
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very important customer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位大客户
Sense.EXAMPLE: They carry guns because it makes them feel important.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们带着枪﹐因为这使他们感觉自己有势力。

Exponent.DEF: having a big effect on people’s lives or on events in the future
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an important decision
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 重要决定
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Good qualifications are increasingly important.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 好学历越来越重要。

Exponent.DEF: important or serious
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s a big decision.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个重大的决定。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a big problem
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 严重的问题

Exponent.DEF: important enough to be noticeable or have a big effect
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There is no significant difference between the performance of male and female students.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 男女学生在学习表现上没有很大的差异。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Internet has brought about significant changes in people’s lives.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 因特网给人们的生活带来了重大的变化。

Exponent.DEF: important or interesting enough to deserve your attention
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The castle is the island’s most noteworthy feature.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城堡是该岛最大的特色。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The jury’s verdict was noteworthy for a number of reasons.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 出于一些原因﹐陪审团的这一裁决很值得关注。

Exponent.DEF: very important, especially for the success, health, or safety of someone or something
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指对成功﹑健康或安全〕极重要的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It is essential to speak the local language.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 很重要的一点是说当地话。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: essential supplies of food and clothing
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 食物和衣服这样的必需品

Exponent.DEF: extremely important, because without it there could be serious problems
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His evidence was vital to the case.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的证词对此案至关重要。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The US plays a crucial role in the region.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国在这一地区扮演着极其重要的角色。

Exponent.DEF: extremely important and having a big effect
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Wheeler had a key role in the development of the atom bomb.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 惠勒在原子弹的研发中起了关键的作用。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Timing is key.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 把握时机至关重要。

Exponent.DEF: very important
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In the construction industry, health and safety are of considerable importance.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在建筑行业﹐健康和安全相当重要。

Exponent.DEF: very important because it has a very great effect on the future
Exponent.TRAN: 〔对未来的影响〕重大的﹐重要的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Momentous events were taking place in Russia.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 俄罗斯正在发生重大的事件。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a momentous decision
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 重大决定

Exponent.DEF: most important
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What was your main aim?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的主要目的是什么？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the principal reason for their decision
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们作出决定的主要原因

Exponent.DEF: one of the most important or serious things
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Smoking is a major cause of heart disease.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟是引发心脏病的主要原因。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Street crime is a major problem.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 街头犯罪是主要问题。

Exponent.DEF: most important – used especially when talking about the main thing that people are discussing, worried about, or trying to do
Exponent.TRAN: 主要的﹐首要的〔尤用于谈论正在讨论﹑担心或设法做的事〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Education will be the central issue in the election.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育将是此次选举的主要议题。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Our primary concern is passenger safety.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最关心的是乘客的安全。

Exponent.DEF: more important than anything else, so that you must consider it when deciding what to do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Airport security is of paramount importance.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 机场安保工作至关重要。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The needs of the students are paramount.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生的需求高于一切。

Sense.DEF: used to show that your next statement or question is more, equally etc important than what you said before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most importantly, you must keep a record of everything you do.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最重要的是﹐你必须把你所做的事一一记录下来。

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows you think that what you are saying or doing is important
Sense.TRAN: 煞有介事地﹔自以为了不起地
Sense.EXAMPLE: He strode importantly into the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他煞有介事地阔步走进房间。

Sense.DEF: the act of bringing something new or different to a place where it did not previously exist, or something that arrives in this way
Sense.TRAN: 〔对新鲜事物的〕引进﹐进口﹔舶来品﹐从外国引进的事物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: restrictions on the importation of American movies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对引进美国电影的限制

Sense.DEF: the business of bringing things into a country from other countries in order to sell them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a law prohibiting the importation of tuna
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁止进口金枪鱼的法令

Sense.DEF: a person, company, or country that buys goods from other countries so they can be sold in their own country
Sense.TRAN: 进口者﹔进口商﹔进口国﹐输入国

Sense.DEF: continuously asking for things in an annoying or unreasonable way
Sense.EXAMPLE: importunate demands
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无理的要求

Sense.DEF: to ask someone for something continuously in an annoying or unreasonable way
Sense.TRAN: 向〔某人〕再三要求〔指纠缠不休或不讲道理〕

Sense.DEF: if someone in authority imposes a rule, punishment, tax etc, they force people to accept it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The court can impose a fine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭可以强制执行罚款。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government imposed a ban on the sale of ivory.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府禁止出售象牙。

Sense.DEF: to force someone to have the same ideas, beliefs etc as you
Sense.TRAN: 将〔想法﹑信仰等〕强加于〔某人〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: parents who impose their own moral values on their children
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把自己的道德观强加给孩子的父母

Sense.DEF: to expect or ask someone to do something for you when this is not convenient for them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We could ask to stay the night, but I don’t want to impose on them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以要求留下来过夜﹐但我不想给他们添麻烦。

Sense.DEF: to have a bad effect on something or someone and to cause problems for them
Sense.TRAN: 对…造成不利影响﹔给…造成困难

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Military spending imposes a huge strain on the economy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 军费开支给经济带来了沉重的负担。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say put a ban/tax/burden/strain on something rather than impose a ban/tax/burden/strain on something.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说put a ban/tax/burden/strain on something﹐而不说impose a ban/tax/burden/strain on something
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The government put a higher tax on cigarettes.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府提高了香烟税。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: This puts a lot of strain on families.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这给家庭带来了巨大的压力。

Sense.DEF: large, impressive, and appearing important
Sense.TRAN: 壮观的﹐宏伟的﹐气势雄伟的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an imposing building
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宏伟的建筑
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a tall, quietly spoken, but imposing figure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他高高的个子﹐说话轻声细语﹐但气宇轩昂。

Sense.DEF: the introduction of something such as a rule, punishment, tax etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the imposition of martial law
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戒严的实施

Sense.DEF: something that someone expects or asks you to do for them, which is not convenient for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know it’s an imposition, but could I use your bathroom?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实在不好意思﹐我可以借用你的浴室吗？

Sense.DEF: something that is impossible cannot happen or be done
Sense.TRAN: 不可能发生的﹔办不到的
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I want to speak to Mr Franks.’ ‘I’m afraid that’s impossible.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我想和弗兰克斯先生谈谈。”“恐怕不行。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s impossible to be accurate about these things.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些事情不可能准确无误。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The noise made sleep impossible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噪音吵得人无法睡觉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Members with young children often found it impossible to attend evening meetings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有小孩的会员常觉得没法参加晚上的聚会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is difficult to find work these days, but for blind people it is virtually impossible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在找工作很难﹐对于盲人来说几乎是不可能。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was faced with a seemingly impossible task.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他面临着似乎不可能完成的任务。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was physically impossible to get the fridge through the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根本不可能把冰箱从这扇门搬过去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Six months ago, peace seemed an impossible dream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 六个月前和平还似乎是个无法实现的梦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Such mental attitudes are difficult, if not impossible, to change.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使有可能﹐要改变这样的心态也是很难的。

Sense.DEF: a situation that is impossible is one that you cannot deal with
Sense.TRAN: 无法处理的﹐极难对付的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were in an impossible situation. Whatever we decided to do would upset someone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们处于两难的境地。 无论我们决定做什么都会有人不开心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Helen’s refusal to cooperate put me in an impossible position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海伦拒绝合作﹐使我进退维谷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His attitude is making life impossible for the rest of the team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的态度使队里其他人的日子很难过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was facing impossible odds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他面临的情况极为不利。

Sense.DEF: behaving in a very unreasonable and annoying way
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为〕不讲道理的﹐令人讨厌的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, you’re just impossible!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐你真不讲道理！

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Some sales managers think selling abroad is impossibly difficult.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些销售经理认为做外销极其困难。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: One hundred percent airline security is a practical impossibility.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 百分之百的航空安全是几乎不可能的。

Exponent.DEF: something that is impossible cannot happen or be done
Exponent.TRAN: 不可能发生的﹔办不到的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s impossible to get a taxi around here.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里是叫不到出租车的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: At times, finding a job felt like an impossible task.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时找份工作就像是不可能完成的任务。

Exponent.DEF: something that is impractical is too expensive, takes too much time, is too difficult etc and therefore it is not sensible to try to do it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s a nice idea, but it’s totally impractical.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 主意是不错﹐但是完全不切实际。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We cannot all just stop using our cars – that would be completely impractical.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不可能全都不使用汽车﹐这完全不现实。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that something is completely impossible, especially because it is not allowed
Exponent.TRAN: 完全不可能的〔尤因为不被允许〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s out of the question for you to go alone.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 让你独自一人去是不可能的。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that you think something is completely impossible
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s no way we can get to the airport in less than an hour.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不可能在一小时内赶到机场。

Exponent.DEF: impossible to imagine or believe
Exponent.TRAN: 不可思议的﹐难以置信的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It seemed inconceivable that there could be an end to the fighting in Northern Ireland.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 北爱尔兰的战斗能够停火似乎让人难以置信。

Exponent.DEF: impossible to imagine or believe e_SEnD used especially about something that seems very shocking to people
Exponent.TRAN: 难以置信的﹐难以想象的〔尤指令人震惊的事〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In those days it was unthinkable for a lady to work outside the home.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时候女子走出家门去工作是无法想象的事情。

Exponent.DEF: impossible to achieve
Exponent.TRAN: 不能达到的﹐无法实现的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an unattainable goal
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 无法达到的目标
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Victory seemed unattainable.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 胜利似乎无法实现。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying very definitely that something is impossible
Exponent.TRAN: 那是做不到的﹐那是不可能的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid it can’t be done.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想那恐怕是不可能的。

Sense.DEF: something that cannot be done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I just want to be able to buy healthy food at a reasonable price. Is that asking the impossible?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是希望能以合理的价格买到健康食品。难道这是在要求不可能的事吗？

Sense.DEF: someone who pretends to be someone else in order to trick people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The nurse was soon discovered to be an impostor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个护士很快被发现是个冒牌货。

Sense.DEF: unable to take effective action because you do not have enough power, strength, or control
Sense.TRAN: 无影响力的﹐无能为力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Emergency services seem impotent in the face of such a disaster.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面对这种灾难﹐应急服务机构似乎无能为力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: impotent rage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 于事无补的狂怒

Sense.DEF: a man who is impotent is unable to have sex because he cannot get an erection
if the police or law courts impound something you have or own, they keep it until it has been decided that you can have it back
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sued the police after they impounded his car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察扣押他的车后他提起诉讼。

Sense.DEF: to make someone very poor
Sense.EXAMPLE: Falling coffee prices have impoverished many developing economies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咖啡价格下跌使很多发展中的经济面临困境。
Sense.EXAMPLE: families impoverished by debt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因负债而贫穷的家庭

Sense.DEF: to make something worse in quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fast-growing trees remove nutrients and impoverish the soil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 速生树木吸收了土壤中的营养﹐使土地变得贫瘠。

Sense.DEF: impossible or very difficult to do for practical reasons
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was an appealing plan but quite impracticable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个计划有吸引力﹐但完全行不通。

Sense.DEF: not sensible or possible for practical reasons
Sense.EXAMPLE: The road toll scheme was dismissed as impractical.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公路收费计划由于不切实际而遭到否定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: James was a foolish man, full of impractical plans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯是个愚蠢的人﹐满脑子都是不切实际的计划。

Sense.DEF: not good at dealing with ordinary practical matters, such as making or repairing things
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕无实践能力的〔如制作或维修物件〕﹔动手能力差的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sandra was hopelessly impractical around the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑德拉在家务事方面一窍不通。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the sheer impracticality of collecting DNA from such a large population
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 从这么多人身上收集DNA完全不切实际

Sense.DEF: an offensive word or phrase, used when someone is very angry
not clear or exact
Sense.EXAMPLE: vague imprecise estimates
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粗略的﹑不精确的估计
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alcohol affects the brain, making speech slurred and imprecise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒精影响大脑﹐使言语含糊不清。
