Sense.DEF: a building that is impregnable is so strong that it cannot be entered by force
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物〕攻不破的﹐固若金汤的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an impregnable fortress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坚不可摧的堡垒

Sense.DEF: strong and impossible to change or influence
Sense.TRAN: 无法改变的﹐无法动摇的
Sense.EXAMPLE: her impregnable obstinacy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的顽固不化

Sense.DEF: to make a substance spread completely through something, or to spread completely through something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The mats have to be impregnated with disinfectant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 垫子得用消毒剂浸透。

Sense.DEF: to make a woman or female animal pregnant
someone who organizes performances in theatres, concert halls etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔剧院﹑音乐厅等的〕演出主办人﹐演出经理

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel admiration and respect
Sense.TRAN: 使钦佩﹔使留下深刻印象
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steve borrowed his dad’s sports car to impress his girlfriend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫借来他爸爸的跑车向女友炫耀。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were very impressed by the standard of work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作水准之高给我们留下了深刻的印象。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: One candidate in particular impressed us with her knowledge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尤其是有一位候选人﹐她的学识给我们留下了深刻的印象。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think the chief exec was favourably impressed by your presentation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为总经理对你作的介绍相当满意。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘He’s a lawyer?’ Mum looked suitably impressed as impressed as you would expect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他是个律师？”妈妈看上去果然对他印象颇好。

Sense.DEF: to make the importance of something clear to someone
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕了解〔某事的重要性〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Father impressed on me the value of hard work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲向我强调努力工作的重要意义。

Sense.DEF: to press something into a soft surface so that a mark or pattern appears on it
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某物〕压入〔柔软的平面〕﹔压印﹔盖〔印〕于
Sense.EXAMPLE: patterns impressed in the clay
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 压印在黏土上的图案

Sense.DEF: the opinion or feeling you have about someone or something because of the way they seem
Sense.EXAMPLE: When we looked around the school we got a very good impression.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们参观了学校﹐对它的印象很好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got the impression that she wasn’t very happy with her job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有这样的印象﹐她的工作干得并不愉快。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What was your impression of Roger?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对罗杰印象如何？

Sense.DEF: to believe that something is true when it is not
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, I was under the impression that you were the manager.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我以为你是经理呢。

Sense.DEF: if you do an impression of a famous person, you copy their speech or behaviour in order to make people laugh
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jean does a great impression of Madonna.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼模仿麦当娜真是惟妙惟肖。

Sense.DEF: a picture or drawing of what someone or something might look like, or what something will look like in the future

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an artist’s impression of the new building
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位美术家给新大楼画的印象画

Sense.DEF: a mark left by pressing something into a soft surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the fallen trees had left a clear impression in the hardened mud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一些倒下的树木在坚硬的泥地上留下了清晰的压痕。

Sense.DEF: all the copies of a book printed at one time
Sense.TRAN: 印数〔一本书一次印刷的总册数〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Think about what sort of impression you want to make.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 想一想你想给人留下什么印象。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her speech definitely gave the impression that she was enthusiastic about the project.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的发言给人的印象显然是她对该项目很热心。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Arriving late won’t create a very good impression.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 迟到不会给人留下很好的印象。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: What sort of impression did you get of the city?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对这座城市有什么印象？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make someone remember a person, place, or thing
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 给某人留下印象〔使某人记得〕
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Janet certainly left an impression on him.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮特肯定给他留下了印象。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was keen to make a good impression on his boss.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很想给老板留下好印象。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Arriving late for an interview gives a very negative impression.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 面试迟到会给人留下很坏的印象。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: My first impression was that Terry’s version of the events was untrue.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的第一印象是特里对事件的描述不真实。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He had the clear impression that most people were in favour of the idea.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他明显感到大多数人赞成这个主意。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not very clear
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Dave only had a vague impression of the man who had attacked him.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫对袭击他的那个人只有很模糊的印象。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that someone feels very strongly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She made a strong impression on me the first time I met her.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我第一次遇到她时﹐她给我留下了很深的印象。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that someone remembers for a long time
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Sam’s performance had clearly made a lasting impression on the audience.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆的表演显然给观众留下了难忘的印象。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The advertisement gave a misleading impression of the product.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这则广告误导了人们对该产品的印象。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He had the mistaken impression that Julia was married.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他误以为朱莉娅结婚了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The general impression was of a very efficiently run company.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 给人的总体印象是这家公司的运营很有效率。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used when something seems very clear to you
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We were left with the distinct impression that the contract was ours if we wanted it.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我们的明显感觉是﹐如果我们要的话﹐这份合同就是我们的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the impression you make when you first meet someone is important

Sense.DEF: someone who is impressionable is easily influenced, especially because they are young
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids are at an impressionable age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些儿童正处于易受影响的年龄。

Sense.DEF: a style of painting used especially in France in the 19th century which uses colour instead of details of form to produce effects of light or feeling
Sense.TRAN: 印象主义﹐印象派〔不拘泥于细节﹐而以色彩来营造光线或感觉效果的绘画风格﹐尤盛行于19世纪的法国〕

Sense.DEF: a style of music from the late 19th and early 20th centuries that produces feelings and images by the quality of sounds rather than by a pattern of notes
Sense.TRAN: 印象主义﹐印象派〔以音色而不是旋律来产生感觉和意象的音乐风格﹐盛行于19世纪末及20世纪初〕

Sense.DEF: someone who copies the speech or behaviour of famous people in order to entertain other people
someone who uses impressionism in the paintings or music that they produce
Sense.TRAN: 印象派画家﹔印象派作曲家
Sense.EXAMPLE: impressionist painters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印象派画家

Sense.DEF: based on a general feeling of what something is like, rather than on specific facts or details
Sense.EXAMPLE: The officers seemed to make only an impressionistic assessment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 官员们好像是仅凭印象便作出了评估。

Sense.DEF: something that is impressive makes you admire it because it is very good, large, important etc
Sense.TRAN: 令人钦佩的﹐给人深刻印象的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The figures certainly look impressive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些数字看上去确实很可观。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Among the guests was an impressive array of authors and critics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来宾中有不少出色的作家和评论家。

Sense.DEF: approval of something, especially from an important person
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指来自重要人物的〕批准﹐认可﹐同意
Sense.EXAMPLE: His actions have the imprimatur of the Secretary of State.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的行动得到国务卿的认可。

Sense.DEF: official permission to print a book, given by the Roman Catholic Church
Sense.TRAN: 〔罗马天主教会对书刊的〕印刷出版许可

Sense.DEF: the mark left by an object being pressed into or onto something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the imprint of her hand on the soft sand
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她留在细沙上的手印

Sense.DEF: the name of a publisher as it appears on a book
to print or press the mark of an object on something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One snowy morning, footprints and tyre marks were imprinted in the snow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个下雪的早上﹐雪地上留下了脚印和轮胎印。

Sense.DEF: to become fixed in your mind or memory so that you never forget

GramExa.PROPFORM: imprint sth on your mind/memory/brain etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sight of Joe’s dead body was imprinted on his mind forever.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到乔尸体的景象一直留在他的脑海里。

Sense.DEF: to put someone in prison or to keep them somewhere and prevent them from leaving
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government imprisoned all opposition leaders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府把反对派领导人全部监禁起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was imprisoned within his strong arms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被他强壮的手臂搂着。

Sense.DEF: if a situation or feeling imprisons people, it restricts what they can do
Sense.TRAN: 〔状况或情感〕束缚﹐限制〔人们的行为〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many elderly people feel imprisoned in their own homes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多老年人感到待在自己家里跟坐牢一样。

Sense.DEF: the state of being in prison, or the time someone spends there
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were sentenced to 6 years’ imprisonment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们被判处六年监禁。

Sense.DEF: not likely to happen or to be true
Sense.TRAN: 不大可能发生的﹔未必确实的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a film with an improbable plot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情节离奇的电影
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seems highly improbable that he had no knowledge of the affair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不知道这件事的可能性似乎极小。

Sense.DEF: surprising and slightly strange
Sense.EXAMPLE: improbable combinations of colours
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奇异的颜色组合

Sense.DEF: done or said without any preparation or planning
Sense.TRAN: 无准备的﹔即兴的﹔即席的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The band gave an impromptu concert.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队开了一场即兴音乐会。

Sense.DEF: dishonest, illegal, or morally wrong
Sense.TRAN: 不诚实的﹔不合法的﹔不道德的

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is improper (for sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He realised that it was improper for a police officer to accept gifts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他意识到作为警察收受礼物是不合法的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: allegations of improper banking practices
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对银行业务操作不当的指控
GramExa.EXAMPLE: improper sexual conduct
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不当的性行为

Sense.DEF: not sensible, right, or fair in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 不理智的﹔不合适的﹔不公平的

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is improper to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It would be improper of me to comment before the election outcome is known.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在选举结果未知的情况下我作出评论是不恰当的。

Sense.DEF: wrong or not correct

RunOn.EXAMPLE: If you are improperly dressed, you will not be admitted.

Sense.DEF: a fraction such as 107/8 in which the top number is larger than the bottom number
Sense.TRAN: 假分数〔分子大于分母的分数﹐如107/8〕

Sense.DEF: behaviour or an action that is wrong or unacceptable according to moral, social, or professional standards
Sense.TRAN: 不正当的行为[行动]﹔不得体的举止
Sense.EXAMPLE: Accusations of impropriety were made against the company’s directors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对公司董事不正当的行为提出了指控。

Sense.DEF: acting, singing, performing etc without preparing what you will say first
Sense.TRAN: 即兴创作﹔即兴表演﹔即兴演说
Sense.EXAMPLE: comedy improv
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即兴喜剧

Sense.DEF: to make something better, or to become better
Sense.EXAMPLE: a course for students wishing to improve their English
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为想提高英语水平的学生开设的一门课
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctors say she is improving after being ill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生说她正在康复。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You could use the money for improving your home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以用这笔钱改善家居。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many wines improve with age get better as they get older.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多葡萄酒年代越久越香醇。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say something gets better rather than improves .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们常说get better﹐而不说improve
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Her English is definitely getting better .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的英语的确是越来越好了。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I hope things get better soon.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望情况很快好转。

Sense.DEF: to do something better than before or make something better than before
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bertorelli has scored 165 points, and I don’t think anyone will improve on that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯托雷利得了165分﹐我看没人能超越这个分数。

Sense.DEF: better than before
Sense.EXAMPLE: improved performance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 更好的性能
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our washing powder now has a new improved formula.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的洗衣粉现已有改良的新配方。

Sense.DEF: the act of improving something or the state of being improved

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s been a big improvement in the children’s behaviour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们的行为举止有了很大的进步。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: an improvement on earlier models
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对较早一批型号的改进
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We need to carry out some improvements to the system.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要对系统进行一些改进。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Our results have shown some improvement this month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的成绩这个月有所提高。

Sense.DEF: a change or addition that improves something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you making some improvements to your home?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在改善家里的居住条件吗？

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配– MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: This version of the software is a clear improvement on its predecessor.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该软件的这个版本比原先的版本有了明显的 改进。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: After taking the tablets, he noticed some improvement in his energy levels.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 服药后他感觉体力有些恢复。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The sales figures show a major improvement.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售数据呈现大幅增长。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be an improvement
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A pre-tax profit of 4.3 million pounds represents a 5% improvement on last year.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 430万英镑的税前利润意味着比去年增加5%。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The situation today is a big improvement on the 1980s.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今的情况比起20世纪80年代有了很大的改善。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very big
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The new computer system was a vast improvement.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这套新的计算机系统有了重大改进。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very big and quick
Collocate.EXAMPLE: With the new treatment we saw a dramatic improvement in his condition.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 采用新的治疗方法之后﹐我们看到他的病情在短时间内有了极大的好转。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: quite big
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There has been a considerable improvement in trading conditions.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 贸易状况有了相当大的改善。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that people can notice
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Joanna's work showed a marked improvement.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔安娜的工作有了显著的改进。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Sales figures have shown a slight improvement this month.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售数据本月有些微增长。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: happening slowly and gradually
more improvement

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The patient is showing signs of improvement.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 病人出现康复的迹象。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the possibility that something could be done better
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There's room for improvement in the way the tickets are sold.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 售票方式尚有改进的余地。

Sense.DEF: too careless to save any money or to plan for the future
to do something without any preparation, because you are forced to do this by unexpected events
Sense.TRAN: 〔事先无准备﹐但因意外之事而被迫〕临时做(事)﹐即兴作出
Sense.EXAMPLE: I forgot to bring my notes, so I had to improvise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我忘了带笔记﹐只好临时发挥。

Sense.DEF: to make something by using whatever you can find because you do not have the equipment or materials that you need
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were no nappies, so we had to improvise with what we could find.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有尿布﹐我们只好找到什么就凑合着用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Annie improvised a sandpit for the children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮临时为孩子们造了个沙池。

Sense.DEF: to invent music, words, a statement etc from your imagination, rather than planning or preparing it first
Sense.TRAN: 即兴创作〔音乐等〕﹔即兴发表〔讲话﹑声明等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just started playing, and the other guys started improvising around me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚开始演奏﹐其他人就在我周围即兴表演了起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an improvised sketch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即兴素描

Sense.DEF: not sensible or wise
Sense.TRAN: 不明智的﹐轻率的﹐鲁莽的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The banks made hundreds of imprudent loans in the 1970s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪70年代那几家银行轻率地发放了几百笔贷款。

Sense.DEF: rude and showing no respect to other people

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He stared at me with a mixture of impudence and hostility.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他无理又充满敌意地瞪着我。

Sense.DEF: to express doubts about someone’s honesty, courage, ability etc
Sense.TRAN: 对〔某人的诚实﹑勇气﹑能力等〕表示怀疑
Sense.EXAMPLE: I did not mean to impugn her professional abilities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我并不是怀疑她的专业能力。

Sense.DEF: a sudden strong desire to do something without thinking about whether it is a sensible thing to do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sudden impulse to laugh
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然想笑的冲动
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Marge’s first impulse was to run.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛吉的第一个念头就是跑。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gerry couldn’t resist the impulse to kiss her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格里抑制不住想亲吻她的冲动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: On impulse, I picked up the phone and rang her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一时心血来潮﹐我拿起电话打给她。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most beginners buy plants on impulse and then hope for the best.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数新手都是一时兴起把植物买回来﹐然后就抱着最大的希望。

GramExa.GLOSS: when you buy things that you had not planned to buy

Sense.DEF: a short electrical signal that travels in one direction along a nerve or wire
Sense.EXAMPLE: The eye converts light signals to nerve impulses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼睛把光信号转变成神经冲动。

Sense.DEF: a reason or aim that causes a particular kind of activity or behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is the passions which provide the main impulse of music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激情是音乐创作的主要动力。

Sense.DEF: a strong force or desire that causes something to happen or exist
someone who is impulsive does things without considering the possible dangers or problems first
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rosa was impulsive and sometimes regretted things she’d done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗莎性情鲁莽﹐有时会为做过的事感到后悔。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In a burst of impulsive generosity, I offered to pay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因一时慷慨﹐我主动提出付款。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: ‘Oh, Anne, I do love you!’ he said impulsively.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: “噢﹐安妮﹐我真的爱你！”他冲动地说。

Sense.DEF: if someone does something bad with impunity, there is no risk that they will be punished for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s astonishing that these criminals are free to walk the streets with impunity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人惊讶的是﹐这些罪犯可以招摇过市却依然逍遥法外。

Sense.DEF: not pure or clean, and often consisting of a mixture of things instead of just one
Sense.EXAMPLE: drug dealers selling impure heroin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贩卖不纯海洛因的毒贩

Sense.DEF: impure thoughts, feelings etc are morally bad because they are about sex – sometimes used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 不道德的﹐淫秽的﹐下流的〔有时为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tried, without success, to rid his mind of any impure thoughts about Julia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他努力想驱除脑海中对朱莉娅的种种邪念﹐可是做不到。

Sense.DEF: a substance of a low quality that is contained in or mixed with something else, making it less pure
Sense.EXAMPLE: All natural minerals contain impurities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凡天然矿物都含有杂质。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our oatmeal face mask absorbs impurities from your skin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的燕麦面膜能够吸收皮肤上的杂质。

Sense.DEF: the state of being impure
to say often unfairly, that someone is responsible for something bad or has bad intentions
Sense.TRAN: 〔常指不公正地〕把〔坏事〕归咎于〔某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police were not guilty of the violence imputed to them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方并未犯过强加于他们头上的暴力罪行。

Sense.DEF: used with the name of a container, place, or area to say where someone or something is
Sense.TRAN: 在〔容器﹑地点或地区〕里﹐在…内
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s some sugar in the cupboard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 碗橱里有一些糖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mother was in the kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲在厨房里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took us for a drive in his new car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开着他的新车载我们去兜风。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I found her sitting up in bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现她直直地坐在床上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Manson spent fifteen years in prison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼森在监狱里待了15年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hole in the ground
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地上的一个洞
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Fisher is in Boston this week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 费希尔先生本周在波士顿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My parents live in New Zealand now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母现住在新西兰。

Sense.DEF: into a container, place etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never went in pubs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从不进酒吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He almost drowned when he fell in the river.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他掉入河里差一点淹死。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can put your pyjamas in the bottom drawer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以把你的睡衣放在底层抽屉里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Get in the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上车吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked in her handbag, but her keys were not there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她朝她的手提包里看了看﹐但钥匙不在里面。

Sense.DEF: used to say how something is done or happens
Sense.TRAN: 〔表示某事完成或发生的方式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a room furnished in the modern style
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一间以现代风格装饰的房间
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her parents always talk to her in German.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的父母总是用德语和她交谈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She shouted my name in a harsh voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用刺耳的声音叫我的名字。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a short note scribbled in pencil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用铅笔草草写下的一小段笔记
Sense.EXAMPLE: The title was printed in capital letters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 标题是用大写字母印刷的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We waited in silence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们静静地等候着。

Sense.DEF: used with the names of months, years, seasons etc to say when something happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shaw was born in 1856.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萧生于1856年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bright yellow flowers appear in late summer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏末时开出颜色鲜艳的黄色花朵。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He retired in October.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他10月份退休了。

Sense.DEF: during a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was amazing how much we managed to do in a day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真想不到我们在一天之内做了这么多事情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the hardest decision I ever made in my life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一生中作出的最困难的决定

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use in before 'this', 'last', and 'next' when saying when something happens.
F2NBox.TRAN: 说到某事什么时候发生时﹐在this﹐last和next前面不要用in
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I got a letter from my sister this morning (NOT 不说 in this morning).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天早晨我收到妹妹的一封来信。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I hope to go to Europe next summer (NOT 不说 in next summer).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 明年夏天我希望能去欧洲。
F2NBox.EXPL: You do not normally use in when saying how often something happens during a particular period of time.
F2NBox.TRAN: 说到一段特定时间内某事发生的频率时﹐一般不用in
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The group meets four times a week (NOT 不说 four times in a week).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个团体一周聚会四次。
F2NBox.EXPL: But when you are emphasizing how often something happens, you can use in in front of one.
F2NBox.TRAN: 但要强调某事发生的频率时﹐可以在one前面用in
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She was late for school four times in one week.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一周内上学迟到了四次。

Sense.DEF: at the end of a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be with you in a minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我马上就到你那儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The results will be announced in two weeks’ time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结果将于两周后宣布。

Sense.DEF: used with negatives or with ‘first’ to say how much time has passed since the last time something happened
Sense.TRAN: 在〔某段时间〕内〔用于否定句或与first连用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t enjoyed myself so much in years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已多年没有玩得这么开心了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was the team’s first win in eighteen months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是该队18个月以来的首次胜利。

Sense.DEF: used to name the book, document, film etc where something or someone appears
Sense.TRAN: 〔指某事或某人出现在书﹑文件﹑电影里等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t believe everything you read in the newspapers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸上看到的东西不可全信。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Which actress starred in the film ‘Cleopatra’?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪位女演员在电影《埃及艳后》里担任主角？
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are a few mistakes in your essay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的文章里有一些错误。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In his speech Professor Leary praised the work of the volunteers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利里教授在演讲中赞扬了志愿者所做的工作。

Sense.DEF: making up the whole of something or included as part of something
Sense.TRAN: 构成…的整体﹔包含在…之内
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are twelve programmes in the series.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一系列有12集节目。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How many minutes are there in an hour?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一小时有多少分钟？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Think of a word with eight letters in it meaning ‘cold’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想出一个由八个字母组成的意为“寒冷”的单词。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Owen will be playing in the England team tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧文明天将代表英格兰队出战。

Sense.DEF: doing or affecting a particular kind of job
Sense.EXAMPLE: a career in industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工厂里的工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been in politics for fifteen years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从政有15年了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: reforms in education
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育改革

Sense.DEF: wearing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked very handsome in his uniform.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他穿着制服显得很英俊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was dressed in a blue linen suit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿着蓝色亚麻套装。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about the state or situation of something or someone
Sense.TRAN: 处于…中〔表示某事物或某人的状态﹑情况〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hear that their marriage is in trouble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听说他们的婚姻出问题了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The engine appears to be in good condition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引擎状态似乎很好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His life was in danger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有生命危险。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The castle now lies in ruins.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城堡现在已是一片废墟。

Sense.DEF: used to say what activity a group of people do
Sense.EXAMPLE: About 4,000 students took part in the protest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约有4,000名学生参加了抗议活动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: his role in the negotiations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在谈判中的角色

Sense.DEF: used to talk about the shape, arrangement, or course of something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want you all to stand in a circle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要你们所有人站成一圈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She slept curled up in a ball.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她蜷成一团睡着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you walk in a straight line?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能走直线吗？

Sense.DEF: used between a smaller number and a larger number to say how common or how likely something is
Sense.TRAN: 在…中〔用于较小和较大的数字之间﹐指某事的普遍性或可能性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: One in ten homes now has cable TV.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在十个家庭中有一家拥有有线电视。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smokers have a one in three chance of dying from their habit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟者死于吸烟这一习惯的概率是三分之一。

Sense.DEF: used before a plural number or amount to say how many people or things are involved, or how many there are in each group
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于复数或数量前﹐表示涉及多少人或物﹐或每组有多少人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eggs are still sold in half dozens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸡蛋仍然半打半打地卖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children work in pairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们两人一组地活动。

GramExa.GLOSS: in very large numbers
GramExa.EXAMPLE: People flocked in their thousands to greet their new princess.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 成千上万的人蜂拥而来迎接他们的新王妃。

Sense.DEF: used between a smaller number or amount and a larger one to say what a rate is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Income tax stands at 23 pence in the pound.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每英镑所得税为23便士。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hill with a gradient of one in six
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坡度为1比6的小山

Sense.DEF: used to say what colour something is or what it is made of
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have the same pattern in blue?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相同款式你有蓝色的吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sculpture in white marble
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白色大理石雕塑

Sense.DEF: used to say what specific thing your statement is related to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Milk is very rich in calcium.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛奶中含有丰富的钙质。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clark had become more extreme in his opinions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克拉克的观点变得更为极端。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an increase in fuel prices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 燃料价格的上涨
Sense.EXAMPLE: The street is about a mile in length.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条街长约一英里。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to the weather or the physical conditions somewhere
Sense.TRAN: 〔用以描述某地的天气或具体环境〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been standing in the rain for over an hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在雨中已站了一个多小时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you prefer to sit in the shade?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你喜欢坐在背阴处吗？

Sense.DEF: used to say what feeling you have when you do something
Sense.TRAN: 处于…中〔表示做某事时的情感〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked at me in horror.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她惊恐地望着我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was all done purely in fun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么做纯粹是闹着玩的。

Sense.DEF: used before the name of someone or something when you are saying how they are regarded
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于某人或某物的名字前﹐表示对其的看法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have a very good friend in Pat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的朋友帕特真不错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In Dwight D. Eisenhower the Republicans had found the ideal candidate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 共和党人认为德怀特·D.艾森豪威尔是理想的候选人。

Sense.DEF: used to say what person or thing has the quality you are mentioning
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a hint of spring in the air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空气中弥漫着一丝春天的气息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think Freddy had it in him to be a killer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为弗雷迪成不了杀手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s everything I’d want in a wife she has every quality I would want a wife to have.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她就是我心目中完美的妻子形象。

Sense.DEF: used to name the substance, food, drink etc that contains something
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于说出包含某物的物质﹑食品﹑饮料等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vitamin D is found in butter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黄油里含有维生素D。

Sense.DEF: used to say how many parts something is divided into
Sense.EXAMPLE: a radio serial in four parts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 共有四集的广播连续剧

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I tore the letter in two and threw the pieces in the fire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把信撕成两半扔进火中。

Sense.DEF: while doing something or while something is happening, and as a result of this
Sense.EXAMPLE: In all the confusion, it is quite possible that some people got tickets without paying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在混乱中极有可能有人没付钱就得到票了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In my excitement, I forgot all about the message.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一激动就把口信忘得一干二净。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In trying to protect the queen, Howard had put his own life in danger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍华德冒着生命危险保护女王。

Sense.DEF: used after a statement to begin to explain in what way it is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been lucky in that I have never had to worry about money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很幸运﹐从来不必为钱发愁。

Sense.DEF: to be between the ages of 20 and 29, 30 and 39 etc
Sense.TRAN: 二十多岁/三十多岁/四十多岁等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Matthews was already in his mid-40s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马修斯已经四十五岁左右。

Sense.DEF: into or inside a container, place, vehicle etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eric held the boat steady while the children got in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们上船时﹐埃里克把船扶稳。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He went to the ticket machine and put a coin in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走向售票机﹐投入一枚硬币。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She dived in and swam out to the yacht.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她跳进水里﹐游向游艇。

Sense.DEF: inside or into a building, especially your home or the place where you work
Sense.TRAN: 在建筑物里﹐进入建筑物里〔尤指居住或工作的地方〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come in and sit down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 进来坐下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid Mr Stewart won’t be in until tomorrow morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕斯图尔特先生明天上午才会回来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re staying in this evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们今晚不外出。

Sense.DEF: if a train, boat, or plane is in, it has arrived at a station, airport etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our train’s not in yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的火车还没进站。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When’s her flight due in?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她乘坐的航班什么时候到？

Sense.DEF: given or sent to a person or organization to be dealt with by them
Sense.EXAMPLE: All entries must be in by next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有参赛作品必须在下周之前提交。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Letters have been pouring in from all over the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 信件从全国各地纷至沓来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you handed your essay in yet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你交论文了吗？

Sense.DEF: if you write, paint, or draw something in, you add it in the correct place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fill in your name and address on the form provided.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在所提供的表格上填上你的姓名和地址。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The information is typed in by trained keyboarders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 资料由训练有素的输入人员输入计算机。

Sense.DEF: if a player or team is in during a game of cricket1, they are batting
if a ball is in during a game, it is inside the area where the game is being played
Sense.EXAMPLE: Agassi’s second serve was just in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿加西的第二次发球刚好落在界内。

Sense.DEF: if a politician or a political party is in, they have been elected
Sense.EXAMPLE: Labour recorded its highest vote ever, but the Tories got in again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党的得票率是有史以来最高的﹐但保守党再一次当选。

Sense.DEF: towards the centre
Sense.EXAMPLE: The map had started to curl in at the edges.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地图边上已经开始卷起。

Sense.DEF: when the tide is in, the sea by the shore is at its highest level
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tide was in, and the sea lapped against the harbour wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 涨潮了﹐海水拍打着港口岸堤。

Sense.DEF: if someone is in for something unpleasant, it is going to happen to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid he’s in for a bit of a disappointment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕他要有点失望了。

Sense.DEF: if someone is in for it, they are going to be punished
Sense.EXAMPLE: If they find out what I’ve done, I’ll be in for it, won’t I?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他们发现我做的事﹐我会受到惩罚的﹐是不是？

Sense.DEF: to be or become involved in something that is happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think you ought to be in on this discussion, Ted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看你应该加入这场讨论﹐特德。

Sense.DEF: to have a friendly relationship with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s in with the theatrical crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她与戏剧界的关系不错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to be well in with the directors be very friendly with them if you want to get promotion here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想在这里得到提升﹐就必须和主管们搞好关系。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in at the beginning/start (of sth)
Sense.DEF: to be present or involved when something starts
Sense.TRAN: (某事)一开始时就已在场[参与]

Sense.DEF: fashionable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Red is definitely the in colour this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红色无疑是今年的流行色。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Long skirts are in at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时下流行穿长裙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I joined the club because it seemed the in thing to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我加入了这家俱乐部﹐因为这似乎是很时髦的事。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the ins and outs of sth
Sense.DEF: all the facts and details of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book guides you through the ins and outs of choosing and growing garden flowers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书详细介绍了如何选择和培育园艺花卉。

Sense.DEF: a way of getting the opportunity to do something or influence someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔得到某机会或影响某人的〕途径﹐方式
Sense.EXAMPLE: The job is pretty boring, but it’s an in to a career in publishing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这工作很乏味﹐但却是进入出版业谋发展的途径。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= inch or 或 inches 英寸

Sense.DEF: the opposite or lack of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: insensitive not sensitive
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不敏感的
Sense.EXAMPLE: incautious not cautious
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不谨慎的
Sense.EXAMPLE: inattention lack of attention
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漫不经心

Sense.DEF: the fact of being unable to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Alcoholism can result in an inability to cope.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒精中毒会导致行为能力丧失。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the government’s inability to enforce the ceasefire
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府无力强制实施停火协议

Sense.DEF: without being present
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was tried in absentia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被缺席审判。

Sense.DEF: difficult or impossible to reach
Sense.EXAMPLE: In winter, the villages are inaccessible by road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冬天时﹐进入这些村子的路很难走。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A long flight of stairs made the center inaccessible to disabled visitors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一段长长的楼梯使残疾的参观者难以到达中心。

Sense.DEF: difficult or impossible to understand or afford
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stockhausen’s music is thought to be difficult and inaccessible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 施托克豪森的音乐被认为费解难懂。

Sense.DEF: a statement that is not completely correct
Sense.TRAN: 不准确的说法﹔错误﹐差错
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jansen’s review contained several inaccuracies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹森的评论有几处不准确。

Sense.DEF: a lack of correctness
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a journalist, you simply cannot tolerate inaccuracy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身为一名记者是决不能容忍报道失实的。

Sense.DEF: not completely correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of what has been written about him is inaccurate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于他的文字描述有大量失实之处。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was fined $300,000 for making inaccurate statements to Congress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对国会发表失实的陈述﹐被罚款30万美元。

Sense.DEF: the fact that someone is not doing anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several newspapers have criticized the president for inaction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多家报纸批评总统不作为。

Sense.DEF: not doing anything, not working, or not moving
Sense.TRAN: 不活动的﹔不工作的﹔懒散的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The brain cells are inactive during sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在睡觉时脑细胞不活跃。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young people are becoming politically inactive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人变得不热衷政治了。

Sense.DEF: not taking part in something that normally you would take part in
Sense.EXAMPLE: Graham’s knee injury means he will be inactive for Sunday’s game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷厄姆膝盖受伤﹐这意味着他不能参加周日的比赛了。

Sense.DEF: an inactive substance does not react chemically with other substances
Sense.TRAN: 不活跃的﹔非活性的﹔惰性的

Sense.DEF: the state of not doing anything, not moving, or not working
Sense.TRAN: 不做任何事﹔不活动﹔不工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t suddenly take up violent exercise after years of inactivity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多年没锻炼不要突然进行剧烈运动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The time spent between jobs should not be a period of inactivity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作之余不应无所事事。

Sense.DEF: a feeling that you are not as good, clever, skilled etc as other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unemployment can cause feelings of inadequacy and low self-esteem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业会使人缺乏自信﹐产生自卑感。

Sense.DEF: the fact of not being good enough in quality, ability, size etc for a particular purpose

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the inadequacy of local health care
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地医疗保健服务的不足

Sense.DEF: a fault or weakness
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m quite aware of my own inadequacies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很清楚自身的不足之处。

Sense.DEF: not good enough, big enough, skilled enough etc for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某一特定目的而言〕不够好的﹐不足的﹐不强的
Sense.EXAMPLE: inadequate resources
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 资源缺乏

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The parking facilities are inadequate for a busy shopping centre.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些停车设施对于一个繁忙的购物中心来说是不够的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The building’s electrical system was completely inadequate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大楼的电力供应系统有严重缺陷。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The new air conditioning system proved inadequate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的空调系统不够好。

Sense.DEF: someone who feels inadequate thinks other people are better, more skilful, more intelligent etc than they are
Sense.TRAN: 〔人自以为〕不胜任的﹐不够好的﹐能力不足的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The teacher made us feel inadequate and stupid if we made mistakes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们犯了错﹐老师就会让我们觉得自己能力差﹐脑子笨。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Colleges have been inadequately funded for years.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 多年来大学资金一直不足。

Sense.DEF: inadmissible information is not allowed to be used in a court of law
Sense.EXAMPLE: The evidence was ruled inadmissible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此项证据被裁定不可采纳。

Sense.DEF: without realizing what you are doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Viruses can be spread inadvertently by email users.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 病毒会被电子邮件用户无意中传播开来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Robinson’s name was inadvertently omitted from the list.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲁宾逊的名字被人无意之中从名单上漏掉了。

Sense.DEF: an action that is inadvisable is not sensible
Sense.TRAN: 〔行动〕不可取的﹐不明智的﹐失策的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Changes in the patient’s condition may make surgery inadvisable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 病人病情的变化可能会使其不宜做手术。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is inadvisable to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is inadvisable to involve more than one contractor on a project.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个项目有多个承包商参与是不明智的。

Sense.DEF: an inalienable right, power etc cannot be taken from you
Sense.EXAMPLE: inalienable human rights
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可剥夺的人权

Sense.DEF: the woman that a man loves – sometimes used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 情人﹐情妇〔有时为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: very stupid or without much meaning
Sense.TRAN: 愚蠢至极的﹔无意义的﹐空洞的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most pop lyrics are pretty inane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分流行歌曲的歌词都相当空洞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an inane remark
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空话

Sense.DEF: not living
Sense.EXAMPLE: an inanimate object
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无生命的物体

Sense.DEF: rules, statements, questions etc that are inapplicable are not suitable, correct, or able to be used in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔规则﹑声明﹑问题等对某一特定情况〕不适用的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most of the new regulations are inapplicable to us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些新规定大部分对我们都不适用。

Sense.DEF: not suitable or right for a particular purpose or in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔对特定目的或情况〕不合适的﹐不恰当的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His comments were wholly inappropriate on such a solemn occasion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在这么严肃的场合中说这样的话完全不恰当。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is inappropriate (for sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It would be inappropriate for me to comment until we know more of the facts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我们了解更多的情况之前我不宜发表意见。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an inappropriate gift for a child
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不适合送给孩子的礼物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: marketing techniques that are totally inappropriate to education
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对教育完全不适用的营销方法

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 不恰当的行为/反应/语言等

Sense.DEF: an inapt phrase, statement etc is not right for a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔措辞﹑陈述等〕不恰当的﹐不适宜的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very inapt comment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很不恰当的评论

Sense.DEF: not able to express your feelings clearly or easily
Sense.TRAN: 词不达意的﹔不善言辞的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He left me inarticulate with rage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把我气得说不出话来。

Sense.DEF: speech that is inarticulate is not clearly expressed or pronounced
Sense.TRAN: 〔话语〕表达不清楚的﹐发音不清的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Making an inarticulate sound, he turned away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他含糊不清地咕哝了一声后转身走了。

Sense.DEF: used to explain the way in which what you are saying is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ann is guilty, inasmuch as she knew what the others were planning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鉴于安对其他人的计划知情﹐所以她是有罪的。

Sense.DEF: lack of attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: a moment of inattention
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 片刻的失神

GramExa.EXAMPLE: inattention to detail
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对细节的疏忽

Sense.DEF: not giving enough attention to someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: accidents caused by inattentive or reckless drivers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于驾驶员疏忽或鲁莽而造成的事故

Sense.DEF: too quiet to be heard
Sense.EXAMPLE: The noise of the wind made her cries inaudible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风声盖过了她的叫喊声。

Sense.DEF: an inaugural speech is the first given by someone who is starting an important job
Sense.EXAMPLE: the president’s inaugural address
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统的就职演说
Sense.EXAMPLE: the inaugural lecture of the new Professor of American Literature
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新来的美国文学教授讲的第一堂课

Sense.DEF: an inaugural event is the first in a planned series of similar events
Sense.EXAMPLE: the plane’s inaugural flight
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这架飞机的首次飞行
Sense.EXAMPLE: the inaugural match of Major League Soccer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 职业足球大联盟的第一场比赛

RunOn.EXAMPLE: More than 200,000 people attended Carter’s inaugural.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 二十多万人参加了卡特的就职典礼。

Sense.DEF: to hold an official ceremony when someone starts doing an important job in government
Sense.TRAN: 为〔重要官员〕举行就职典礼

GramExa.EXAMPLE: On 8 January 1959 de Gaulle was inaugurated as First President of the Fifth Republic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1959年1月8日戴高乐就任法兰西第五共和国第一任总统。

Sense.DEF: to open a building or start an organisation, event etc for the first time
Sense.TRAN: 举行〔新建筑物〕落成典礼﹔举行〔组织〕创建仪式﹔为〔公共活动〕举行开幕式
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Turner Prize was inaugurated in 1984.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特纳奖于1984年正式设立。

Sense.DEF: if an event inaugurates an important change or period of time, it comes at the beginning of it
Sense.TRAN: 开始〔一个重要变化〕﹔开创
Sense.EXAMPLE: The International Trade Agreement inaugurated a period of high economic growth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《国际贸易协定》开创了一个经济高速发展的时代。

Sense.DEF: seeming to show that success in the future is unlikely
Sense.EXAMPLE: an inauspicious start
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不祥的开端

Sense.DEF: in the middle between two points, sizes, periods of time etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was at that in-between age, neither a girl nor a woman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的年龄介于女孩与妇女之间。

Sense.DEF: inside a boat
an inborn quality or ability is one you have had naturally since birth
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mammals have an inborn fear of snakes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哺乳动物天生害怕蛇。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good taste is inborn and cannot be learned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好的鉴赏力是与生俱来的﹐无法通过后天习得。

Sense.DEF: an inbound flight or train is arriving at a place
if the ball is in-bounds in a sport, it is in the playing area
the place in a computer email program where new messages arrive
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had 130 emails in my inbox this morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天早上我的收件箱里有130封邮件。

Sense.DEF: a container on an office desk that is used to hold letters, documents etc that you must deal with
Sense.TRAN: 〔办公室中存放待处理信件﹑文件等的〕收件盘﹐收文匣

Sense.DEF: produced by inbreeding
having developed as a natural part of your character
Sense.EXAMPLE: inbred ambition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自小就有的远大抱负

Sense.DEF: when children, animals, or plants are produced from closely related members of the same family
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was born with a rare bone disease, probably the result of aristocratic inbreeding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他天生就有罕见的骨病﹐可能是贵族近亲结婚的结果。

Sense.DEF: an inbuilt quality, feature etc is part of the nature of someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: plants with inbuilt resistance to disease
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天生能抵抗病害的植物
Sense.EXAMPLE: History has an inbuilt tendency to repeat itself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 历史本身往往会重演。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= incorporated 股份有限的
Sense.EXAMPLE: General Motors Inc.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通用汽车股份有限公司

Sense.DEF: too great to be calculated
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her contribution to our work is incalculable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对我们工作的贡献极大。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: treasures of incalculable value
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 无价的珍宝

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The outbreak of hostilities will cause incalculable misery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 敌对行为的爆发将会导致无穷苦难。

Sense.DEF: very angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Prince was said to be incandescent with rage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说王子怒不可遏。

Sense.DEF: producing a bright light when heated
Sense.EXAMPLE: the invention of the incandescent lamp
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白炽灯的发明

Sense.DEF: very bright
Sense.EXAMPLE: incandescent flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灿烂的花朵

Sense.DEF: special words that someone uses in magic, or the act of saying these words
Sense.EXAMPLE: a book of spells and incantations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 符咒书

Sense.DEF: not able to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He seemed incapable of understanding how she felt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他似乎不能理解她的感受。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Seventy-five percent of the electorate believe his party is incapable of government.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 75%的选民都认为他领导的政党无能力执政。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The stroke rendered her incapable of speech.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 中风令她丧失了语言能力。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘incapable to do something’. Say 而要说 incapable of doing something.

Sense.DEF: to make you too ill or weak to live and work normally
Sense.TRAN: 使无能力〔正常生活和工作〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her mother has been incapacitated by a fall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她母亲摔了一跤后﹐失去了正常生活能力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an incapacitating injury
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使人失去活动能力的伤

Sense.DEF: to stop a system, piece of equipment etc from working properly
Sense.TRAN: 使〔系统﹑设备等〕停止正常工作﹐使瘫痪
Sense.EXAMPLE: A successful attack would incapacitate military training camps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次成功的攻击能使军事训练营陷入瘫痪。

Sense.DEF: lack of the ability to do things or to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: temporary incapacity through illness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因病暂时不能正常生活和工作

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Evidence of his mental incapacity was never produced in court.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他精神失常的证据从未在法庭上出示过。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The main problem is the author’s incapacity to convey his ideas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 主要问题在于作者缺乏表达自己想法的能力。

Sense.DEF: to put or keep someone in prison
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spent 10 years incarcerated in prison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在监狱里关了十年。

Sense.DEF: to have an extreme amount of a particular quality
Sense.TRAN: 是邪恶/美/贪婪等的化身
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is now respectability incarnate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在他成了正派的化身。

Sense.DEF: having taken human form
Sense.TRAN: 人体化的﹔化身的﹔拟人化的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jesus, the incarnate Son of God
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 耶稣﹐上帝之子的化身
Sense.EXAMPLE: The media cast him as the devil incarnate someone very evil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 媒体把他描述成魔鬼的化身。

Sense.DEF: to represent a particular quality in a physical or human form
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crown incarnates national power.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 王冠是国家权力的象征。

Sense.DEF: to make something appear in a human form
the state of living in the form of a particular person or animal. According to some religions, people have several different incarnations.
Sense.TRAN: 〔某些宗教中的〕前世﹐今世﹐来世
Sense.EXAMPLE: She believes she was an Egyptian queen in a previous incarnation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她认为她的前世是埃及女王。

Sense.DEF: a period of time when someone or something has a particular job, use etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人做某项工作﹐某物作某项用途等的〕阶段
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building has gone through several incarnations: as a station, a cafe, and most recently, a club.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座建筑变过几次身﹐曾作过车站﹑咖啡馆﹐最近变成了俱乐部。

Sense.DEF: someone who has a lot of a particular quality, or represents it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was the incarnation of wisdom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是智慧的化身。

Sense.DEF: the act of God coming to Earth in the human form of Christ, according to the Christian religion
Sense.TRAN: 〔基督教的〕道成肉身〔指上帝化身成基督来到人间〕

Sense.DEF: if you are incautious, you do not think about the possible bad results of your actions
Sense.EXAMPLE: incautious remarks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻率的言论
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wine had made her incautious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒后她变得口无遮拦。

Sense.DEF: designed to cause a fire

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The explosion seems to have been caused by an incendiary device.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爆炸似乎是由一种燃烧装置引发的。

Sense.DEF: an incendiary speech, piece of writing etc is intended to make people angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hip-hop album with incendiary lyrics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充满煽动性歌词的嘻哈乐专辑

Sense.DEF: a bomb designed to cause a fire
a substance that has a pleasant smell when you burn it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a church filled with the smell of incense
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充满焚香气味的教堂
Sense.EXAMPLE: lighted incense sticks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 点燃的棒香

Sense.DEF: to make someone very angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: Spectators were incensed by the referee’s decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众对裁判的判罚极为愤怒。

Sense.DEF: very angry

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fans were incensed at the decision to ban the song.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 歌迷们对禁播这首歌的决定极为愤怒。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Passengers are incensed that rail companies make huge profits while service remains poor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁路公司获利丰厚﹐但服务依然低劣﹐乘客对此极为愤怒。

Sense.DEF: something that encourages you to work harder, start a new activity etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: As an added incentive, there’s a bottle of champagne for the best team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给最优秀的队发一瓶香槟作为额外的鼓励。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Awards provide an incentive for young people to improve their skills.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奖励是一种激励手段﹐鼓励年轻人努力提高自己的技能。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Farmers lack any incentive to manage their land organically.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 农场主没有任何动力去采用有机耕作法。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a recycling drive backed with financial incentives
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 由财政奖励作支持的回收利用运动

Sense.DEF: to give someone a reason to do something, especially by offering them a reward
Sense.TRAN: 激励﹐鼓励〔尤指给予奖赏〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How should a company incentivize its employees?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司该如何来激励员工呢？

Sense.DEF: the start of an organization or institution
Sense.EXAMPLE: a CD collection covering the band from its inception in 1994
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套包括该乐队自1994年成立以来所有曲目在内的激光唱片

Sense.DEF: continuing without stopping
Sense.TRAN: 持续不断的﹐没完没了的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The child’s incessant talking started to irritate her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这孩子喋喋不休﹐她开始烦躁起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: incessant rain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 连绵的雨

Sense.DEF: sex between people who are closely related in a family
Sense.EXAMPLE: Abortions would only be allowed in cases of rape or incest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有被强奸或乱伦受孕才允许堕胎。

Sense.DEF: involving sexual activity between people who are closely related in a family
Sense.EXAMPLE: an incestuous relationship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乱伦的关系

Sense.DEF: involving a small group of people who only spend time with or help each other, not people outside the group – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 排外的﹔小圈子内的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an incestuous political community
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个排外的政治团体

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring length, equal to 2.54 centimetres. There are 12 inches in a foot.
Sense.TRAN: 英寸〔长度单位﹐等于2.54 厘米。1英尺为12英寸〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The curtains were an inch too short.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗帘短了一英寸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rainfall here is under 15 inches a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本地的年降雨量不到15英寸。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a six-inch nail
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 六英寸长的钉子

Sense.DEF: a very small distance
Sense.EXAMPLE: Derek leaned closer, his face only inches from hers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德里克靠得更近了﹐他的脸几乎贴到她的脸上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bus missed us by inches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车差一点就撞着我们了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: On several occasions, they came within inches of death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几次他们都险些丧命。

Subsense.DEF: completely or in every way
Subsense.EXAMPLE: With her designer clothes and elegant hair, she looks every inch the celebrity.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿着著名设计师设计的服装﹐发型优雅﹐看起来完全像个名人。

Subsense.DEF: the whole of an area or distance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Every inch of space in the tiny shop was crammed with goods.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家小商店的每一寸地方都塞满了商品。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Italy deserved to win, though Greece made them fight every inch of the way.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 意大利队应该获胜﹐虽然在希腊队的逼迫下﹐他们全局打得都很艰苦。

Sense.LEXUNIT: give sb an inch and they’ll take a yard/mile
Sense.DEF: used to say that, if you allow someone a little freedom or power, they will try to take more
moving very gradually and slowly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Inch by inch, he lowered himself from the roof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他慢慢地从屋顶下来。

Sense.DEF: to refuse to change your decision or opinion, even though people are trying to persuade you to do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Neither side is prepared to give an inch in the negotiations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方都无意在谈判中作丝毫让步。

Sense.LEXUNIT: beat/thrash etc sb to within an inch of their life
Sense.DEF: to beat someone very hard and thoroughly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Another word out of you and I’ll beat you to within an inch of your life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再说一句﹐我就揍死你。

Sense.DEF: to move very slowly in a particular direction, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: I inched forward along the ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我贴着地面缓慢向前挪动。

Sense.DEF: inchoate ideas, plans, attitudes etc are only just starting to develop
Sense.TRAN: 〔想法﹑计划﹑态度等〕刚开始形成的

Sense.DEF: the number of times something happens, especially crime, disease etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why did the incidence of heroin use continue to climb?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么吸食海洛因的人数持续攀升？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Smokers had the highest incidence of colds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟者中感冒的发病率最高。

Sense.DEF: an event, especially one that is unusual, important, or violent
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指不平常的﹑重要的或暴力的〕事件
Sense.EXAMPLE: Am I at risk because of some incident in my sexual past?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我过去性生活中的某件事会使我处于危险境地吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Roads were sealed off because of a major incident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为发生重大事故﹐道路被封锁了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The plane landed without incident.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机安全着陆。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Incident is used mainly in journalism or in formal contexts. In everyday English, people usually say something happened rather than talking about an incident.
F2NBox.TRAN: incident 主要用在新闻或正式的文体中。在日常英语中﹐人们一般说something happened﹐而不说an incident
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Am I at risk because of something that happened in my past?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是否因为我过去的什么事而面临危险？

Sense.DEF: a serious disagreement between two countries
Sense.EXAMPLE: You could have caused a major diplomatic incident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可能引起了严重外交冲突。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The road is closed following a serious incident earlier today.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于今天早些时候发生的一起严重事故﹐这条路现已封闭。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very serious
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The most recent major incident was an explosion at an oil refinery.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的一起重大事故是一家炼油厂发生爆炸。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: An apparently minor incident sparked off rioting.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件看似很小的事引发了暴乱。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The whole incident was caught on CCTV.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个事件被闭路电视拍摄下来。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Young men were killed in two separate incidents on the same day.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 同一天有年轻人在两起不同的事件中被杀。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: connected to another incident
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The report describes a number of related incidents.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这则报道描述了一些相关事件。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that happens on its own, not together with others
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Luckily the attack turned out to be an isolated incident.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸运的是此次袭击最终证明是一起个别事件。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the most recent one
unexpected and exciting
one that involves someone’s death
involving an accident or argument
when someone is shot or stabbed

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The incident happened as Mrs Edwards was walking her dog.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 事发时爱德华兹太太正在遛狗。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The tragic incident occurred just after midnight.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 悲剧事件发生时刚过午夜。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His carelessness caused a major incident.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的粗心大意造成了一起严重事故。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: cause it to happen suddenly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It is claimed that the police provoked the incident.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 据称是警察挑起这一事件的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: All those involved in the incident were sacked.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有参与此事的人都被解雇了。

Sense.DEF: happening or existing in connection with something else that is more important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Increased motivation is more than an incidental benefit of reward schemes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 积极性提高不仅仅是奖励计划附带的益处。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: companies that carry out investment business that is incidental to their main activity
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 主营业务之外还进行其他相关投资的公司

Sense.DEF: naturally happening as a result of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Drinking too much is almost incidental to bartending.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当酒吧侍者几乎免不了饮酒过度。

Sense.DEF: something that you have to do, buy etc which you had not planned to
Sense.TRAN: 原本不打算做的事[买的东西等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carry extra cash for taxis, tips and other incidentals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 另外再带些现金用来付出租车费﹑小费和其他杂项开销。

Sense.DEF: used to add more information to what you have just said, or to introduce a new subject that you have just thought of
Sense.TRAN: 顺便提一下〔用来补充说过的事情﹐或提及刚想到的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Incidentally, where were you born?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顺便问一下﹐你在哪儿出生的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wine, incidentally, goes very well with a mature cheese.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顺便说一下﹐这种葡萄酒配熟干酪味道很好。

Sense.DEF: in a way that was not planned, but as a result of something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quite incidentally, I got some useful information at the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在聚会上无意中得到了一些有用信息。

Sense.DEF: music played during a play, film etc that helps produce a particular feeling
a room in a police station or other place, where police work on solving a particular serious crime
Sense.TRAN: 〔警察局等地方研究﹑侦破重罪案件的〕案件调查室

Sense.DEF: to burn something completely in order to destroy it
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the infected clothing was incinerated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有沾染了细菌的衣服都被焚化了。

Sense.DEF: a machine designed to burn things in order to destroy them
starting to happen or exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sign of incipient madness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神失常的早期征兆

Sense.DEF: to cut a pattern, word etc into something, using a sharp instrument
Sense.EXAMPLE: an inscription incised in stone
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刻在石头上的碑文

Sense.DEF: a neat cut made into something, especially during a medical operation
Sense.TRAN: 割口﹔〔尤指手术的〕切口﹐切痕

Sense.DEF: showing intelligence and a clear understanding of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her questions were well-formulated and incisive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的问题明晰而尖锐。

Sense.DEF: one of the eight flat teeth at the front of your mouth
to deliberately encourage people to fight, argue etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were charged with inciting racial hatred.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们被指控煽动种族仇恨。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a person who incites others to commit an offence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教唆他人犯罪的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was no evidence that he had incited members of the group to violence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有证据证明他唆使该团体成员使用暴力。

Sense.DEF: impolite behaviour, remarks etc
Sense.TRAN: 不文明行为﹔无礼举动[言辞等]

Sense.DEF: inclement weather is unpleasantly cold, wet etc
a feeling that makes you want to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: My natural inclination was to say no.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我生性爱说“不”。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Neither of my children showed the slightest inclination to follow me into journalism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的两个孩子一点都没表现出要随我从事新闻业的意愿。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Teachers simply do not have the time or the inclination to investigate these matters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师们根本没有时间﹑也无意调查这些事。

Sense.DEF: a tendency to think or behave in a particular way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an inclination to see everything in political terms
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从政治角度看待一切事物的倾向

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s troubled by her son’s inclination toward atheism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因为儿子的无神论倾向而感到困扰。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bart was a romantic by inclination.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴特生性浪漫。

Sense.DEF: a movement made down towards the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: She greeted Maggie with an inclination of the head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她向玛吉点头打招呼。

Sense.DEF: a slope, or the angle at which something slopes
if a situation, fact etc inclines you to do or think something, it influences you towards a particular action or opinion
Sense.TRAN: 使倾向于〔某种行动或观点〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The accident inclined him to reconsider his career.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次意外使他重新考虑他的职业。

Sense.DEF: to think that a particular belief or opinion is most likely to be correct
Sense.TRAN: 倾向于〔认为某个信念或观点是正确的〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I incline to accept the official version of events.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我倾向于接受官方对这些事件的说法。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I incline to the opinion that this principle extends to cases of religious discrimination.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我倾向于认为这一原则也适用于宗教歧视的情况。

Sense.DEF: to slope at a particular angle, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The telescope is inclined at an angle of 43 degrees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这架望远镜以43度角倾斜。

Sense.DEF: to bend your neck so that your head is lowered
a slope
Sense.EXAMPLE: a steep incline
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陡坡

Sense.DEF: to hold a particular opinion, but not very strongly
Sense.TRAN: 倾向于赞同/认为/相信等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Arthur has some strange ideas, but on this occasion I’m inclined to agree with him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿瑟是有一些奇怪的想法﹐但这次我倒是倾向于同意他的观点。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be inclined to do sth/inclined to sth
Sense.DEF: to be likely to do something or behave in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 有做某事的意向﹐倾向于做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Commandos are inclined to shoot first and ask questions later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突击队员往往会先开枪﹐然后再问话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was inclined to self-pity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他爱自怜。

Sense.DEF: to want to do something, but without having a strong desire
Sense.TRAN: 想(做某事)〔但愿望不强烈〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was Sunday morning, and she was not inclined to get up yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是星期天早上﹐她还不想起床。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can visit our chatrooms, if you feel so inclined.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有兴趣的话可以登录我们的聊天室。

Sense.DEF: naturally interested in or good at art, music etc
Sense.TRAN: 有艺术/音乐/数学等天赋的
Sense.EXAMPLE: For the artistically inclined, the markets are full of interest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对有艺术天赋的人来说﹐这些市场相当有趣味。

Sense.DEF: sloping or leaning in a particular direction
another spelling of enclose
another spelling of enclosure
if one thing includes another, the second thing is part of the first
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does the price include postage?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个价格包含邮费吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: His job includes looking after under-21 teams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的职责包括照管21岁以下球队。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The curriculum includes courses in computing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 课程内容包括计算机技术。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something part of a larger group or set
Sense.TRAN: 将…列为…的一部分﹔把…算入
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team is stronger now they’ve included Roscoe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗斯科加入后﹐现在队伍的实力更强了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Service is included in the bill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 账单包括服务费。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you include a Walkman on your list of essentials?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的基本用品清单上包括随身听吗？

Sense.DEF: including someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone has to go to the dentist, you included.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都得去看牙医﹐包括你在内。

Sense.DEF: used to introduce something or someone that is part of a larger group or amount you have just mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: The price is £25.50, including postage and packing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 价钱是25.5英镑﹐含邮费和包装费。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll need a variety of skills, including leadership and negotiating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你将需要各种技巧﹐包括领导能力和协商能力。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written or business English, people often prefer to use excluding rather than not including , as it sounds more formal.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面或商务英语中﹐人们一般更喜欢用excluding﹐而不用not including﹐因前者听上去更为正式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The cost is $49.95 excluding tax.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 不含税的费用为49.95美元。

Sense.DEF: the act of including someone or something in a larger group or set, or the fact of being included in one

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His inclusion in the team has caused controversy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他入选球队引起了争议。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: photos chosen for inclusion in the magazine
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被选中登在杂志上的照片

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the inclusion of early recordings on the CD
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 激光唱片中收入的早期录音

Sense.DEF: someone or something that has been included in a larger group
Sense.TRAN: 包括在整体中的某人[某物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: With the recent inclusions, there will be 28 delegates in all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 连同新近加入的成员﹐总共将有28位代表。

Sense.DEF: an inclusive price or cost includes everything

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fully inclusive fare for the trip is £22.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次出行的全部费用为22英镑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rent is £120 a week, inclusive of heating.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房租连暖气费在内是每星期120英镑。

Sense.DEF: including a wide variety of people, things etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not everyone shares his vision of an inclusive America.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不是所有人都同意他的观点﹐认为美国是个包容性很强的国家。

Sense.LEXUNIT: (from) April to June inclusive/15 to 20 inclusive etc
Sense.DEF: used to refer to a range of months, numbers etc, including the ones that start and end the range
Sense.TRAN: 从4月到6月〔包括4月和6月〕/从15到20〔包括15和 20〕

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday American English, people usually use through rather than inclusive.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常美国英语中﹐人们一般用through﹐而不用inclusive
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They are open Monday through Friday.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们周一到周五开门。

Sense.DEF: if a famous person does something incognito, they do it without letting people know who they are
Sense.TRAN: 〔名人行事〕隐瞒身份地﹐微服地
Sense.EXAMPLE: That night, Lenin travelled incognito to the party headquarters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天晚上﹐列宁微服出行﹐去了党总部。

Sense.DEF: not expressed or organized clearly, and therefore difficult to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: an incoherent over-long action movie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情节混乱﹑冗长拖沓的动作片
Sense.EXAMPLE: He called the policy ‘incoherent and ill thought-out’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他称该政策“条理不清﹑考虑不周”。

Sense.DEF: speaking in a way that cannot be understood, because you are drunk, feeling a strong emotion etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben, drunk and incoherent, slumped in a chair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本醉得语无伦次﹐一屁股跌坐在一把椅子上。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开始含混不清地嘀咕起来。

Sense.DEF: the money that you earn from your work or that you receive from investments, the government etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People on higher incomes should pay more tax.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高收入者应该多缴税。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: income from savings and pensions
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自储蓄和养老金的收入

Sense.EXAMPLE: low-income families
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低收入家庭

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We have an income of over $100,000 a year.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每年有10万美元以上的收入。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The properties he rented out provided him with an income.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他出租的房产给他提供了一份收入。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: provide one
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He decided to invest the money to generate an income for the future.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他决定投资这笔钱﹐以便将来产生收益。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She took on extra work to increase her income.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她另打一份工来增加收入。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: increase your income, for example by doing an extra job
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Ted supplemented his income by doing part-time work in the evenings.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 特德晚上打零工来增加收入。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They saw their income rise considerably over the next few years.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在接下来的几年里﹐他们看到自己的收入大幅增加。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He has a relatively high income.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他收入较高。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Rent takes a large chunk of their small income.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 租金占了他们微薄收入中的大部分。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Brian’s annual income is around £43,000.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 布赖恩的年收入约 43,000 英镑。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The report compares average incomes across different European countries.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告比较了欧洲不同国家的平均收入。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the income of a country
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A large proportion of the national income comes from food exports.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 国民收入的很大一部分来自食品出口。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She works in a shop to supplement the family income.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在一家商店工作以补贴家用。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: your income after tax and necessary bills have been paid
Collocate.EXAMPLE: People spend a high proportion of their disposable income running a car.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们把可支配收入中的很大一部分用于养车。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: income before you have paid tax
income after you have paid tax
the part of your income on which you pay tax
that two or more people have

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The tax rate rises with the individual’s income level.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 税率随个人收入水平提高。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: income level
Collocate.EXAMPLE: In general, people in higher income brackets live longer.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一般来说收入等级越高的人寿命越长。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: tax that you pay on your income
government controls on wages

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His pension was his only source of income.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 养老金是他唯一的收入来源。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: You can buy insurance to protect you against loss of income if you are ill.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可购买保险以防生病时的收入损失。

Sense.DEF: someone who comes to live in a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve lived here for 17 years, but they still see us as incomers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经在这儿住了17年﹐但他们仍把我们看作新来的。

Sense.DEF: money that is given by the government in Britain to people who have no income or a very low income
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国政府发给无收入或低收入者的〕收入补贴

Sense.DEF: tax paid on the money that you earn
arriving at or coming to a place
Sense.TRAN: 正到达的﹔正来临的﹔进来的
Sense.EXAMPLE: incoming flights
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 进港航班
Sense.EXAMPLE: Incoming calls were monitored.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来电受到监听。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the incoming tide
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 涨潮

Sense.DEF: an incoming president, government etc has just been elected or chosen
Sense.EXAMPLE: the incoming administration
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新当选的政府

Sense.DEF: if you are incommunicado, you are in a place where other people cannot speak to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is reportedly being held incommunicado at a military prison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说他现在被单独囚禁在军事监狱。

Sense.DEF: extremely good, beautiful etc, and much better than others
Sense.TRAN: 无可比拟的﹐举世无双的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an incomparable view of San Marco
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣马科美妙绝伦的景色
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wine of incomparable flavour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香醇无比的葡萄酒

Sense.DEF: two people who are incompatible have such diffe-rent characters, beliefs etc that they cannot have a friendly relationship
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个人〕不能和睦相处的﹐合不来的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know why they ever got married. They’re totally incompatible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道他们为什么结婚﹐他们根本合不来。

Sense.DEF: two things that are incompatible cannot exist or be accepted together
Sense.TRAN: 〔两种事物〕不相容的﹐不能共存的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Business interests are incompatible with public office.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 商业利益与公职不可兼得。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Politeness and truth are often mutually incompatible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 礼貌和实话往往互不相容。

Sense.DEF: two things that are incompatible are of different types and so cannot be used together
Sense.TRAN: 〔两种不同类的东西〕不相配的﹐相互排斥的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The laser printer is incompatible with the new computer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这台激光打印机和新计算机不兼容。

Sense.EXAMPLE: patients with incompatible blood groups
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 血型不相容的病人

Sense.DEF: lack of the ability or skill to do a job properly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: allegations of professional incompetence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对专业方面不称职的指责

Sense.EXAMPLE: The report blamed police incompetence for the tragedy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报道指责警方的无能导致了这场悲剧。

Sense.DEF: not having the ability or skill to do a job properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: an incompetent manager
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不称职的经理
Sense.EXAMPLE: weak incompetent leadership
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 软弱不称职的领导

Sense.DEF: not having everything that should be there, or not completely finished
Sense.TRAN: 不完全的﹐不完整的﹔未完成的﹐未结束的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unfortunately, I do not have the information because our records are incomplete.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很遗憾﹐由于我们的记录不完整﹐我无法提供有关资料。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an incomplete process
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未完成的工序
Sense.EXAMPLE: TV ads implied that a woman was incomplete without a man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视广告暗示女人没有男人就不完整。

Sense.DEF: a grade given to school or college students when they have not completed all the work for a course
Sense.TRAN: 〔学业成绩评分〕未修毕﹐未完成

Sense.DEF: difficult or impossible to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: legal documents full of incomprehensible jargon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 满是难懂术语的法律文件
Sense.EXAMPLE: I find your attitude quite incomprehensible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得你的态度很难理解。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His accent made his speech incomprehensible to many listeners.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的口音使得很多听众听不懂他说的话。

Sense.DEF: the state of not being able to understand something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spread his hands in a gesture of incomprehension.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他两手一摊表示不理解。

Sense.DEF: too strange or unusual to be thought real or possible
Sense.TRAN: 难以置信的﹐不可思议的
Sense.EXAMPLE: A few years ago a car fuelled by solar energy would have been inconceivable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几年前太阳能汽车还是不可思议的事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is inconceivable that a man in such a powerful position could act so unwisely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真是难以置信﹐这么大权在握的人行事竟如此愚蠢。

Sense.DEF: not leading to a clear decision or result
Sense.TRAN: 非结论性的﹐无确定结果的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The evidence against the two men was inconclusive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对这两个人的不利证据并不令人信服。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A coalition government was formed after inconclusive elections.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选举没有结果﹐于是成立了一个联合政府。

Sense.DEF: the fact that something is strange, unusual, or unsuitable in a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The incongruity of her situation struck Gina with unpleasant force.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉娜猛然意识到自己处境尴尬﹐心里很不舒服。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He didn’t see the slightest incongruity between the idealism of his plays and his own morals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没看出他戏剧中的理想主义和他自己的道德观有丝毫不相称。

Sense.DEF: strange, unexpected, or unsuitable in a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new theatre looks utterly incongruous in its setting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座新剧院和周围的环境格格不入。

Sense.DEF: not important
Sense.EXAMPLE: inconsequential but amusing chatter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无谓但有趣的闲扯

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is large or important
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has built up a not inconsiderable business empire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已建立起一个有相当规模的商业帝国。

Sense.DEF: not caring about the feelings, needs, or comfort of other people
Sense.TRAN: 不考虑他人的﹐不为别人着想的
Sense.EXAMPLE: inconsiderate motorists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不为别人着想的驾车者

GramExa.PROPFORM: it was inconsiderate (of sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was very inconsiderate of you to keep us waiting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你让我们一直等着﹐真是太不体谅人了。

Sense.DEF: when someone keeps changing their behaviour, reactions etc so that other people become confused
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为﹑反应等的〕反复无常﹐变化不定

Sense.DEF: a situation in which two statements are different and cannot both be true
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个说法的〕不一致﹐互相矛盾
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were several glaring inconsistencies very noticeable differences in his report.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的报告中有几个明显的前后矛盾之处。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Defence counsel looks for inconsistency between witness statements.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被告律师在证人的证词中寻找有矛盾的地方。

Sense.DEF: two statements that are inconsistent cannot both be true
Sense.TRAN: 〔两种说法〕不一致的﹐互相矛盾的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The accounts of the witnesses are inconsistent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几位目击者的说法不一致。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His results are inconsistent with our data.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他得到的结果和我们的数据不一致。

Sense.DEF: not right according to a particular set of principles or standards

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His conduct was inconsistent with what is expected of a Congressman.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的行为和国会议员应有的操守相悖。

Sense.DEF: inconsistent behaviour, work etc changes too often from good to bad
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为﹑工作等〕时好时坏的﹐变化无常的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team’s performance has been highly inconsistent this season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该队本赛季发挥极不稳定。

Sense.DEF: so sad that it is impossible for anyone to comfort you
Sense.TRAN: 〔悲痛至极而〕无法安慰的﹐伤心欲绝的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boy was inconsolable after the death of his dog.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩因为自己的狗死了而伤心不已。

Sense.DEF: not easily seen or noticed
Sense.TRAN: 不显眼的﹐不引人注意的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an inconspicuous little restaurant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家不起眼的小饭店
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stood by the wall, trying to look inconspicuous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她贴墙站着﹐尽量不引人注目。

Sense.DEF: unfaithful in love or friendship
Sense.TRAN: 〔对爱情或友谊〕不忠的﹐不专一的

Sense.DEF: clearly true and impossible to disagree with
Sense.TRAN: 无可否认的﹔不可争辩的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had incontestable proof of her innocence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有她无罪的铁证。

Sense.DEF: unable to control the passing of liquid or solid waste from your body
definitely true and impossible to be proved false
Sense.TRAN: 不容置疑的﹔无可辩驳的
Sense.EXAMPLE: CCTV provided incontrovertible evidence that he was at the scene of the crime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闭路电视提供了案发时他在犯罪现场的确凿证据。

Sense.DEF: problems caused by something which annoy or affect you
Sense.EXAMPLE: We apologise for the delay and any inconvenience caused.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对延误和由此造成的不便深感抱歉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the inconvenience of having to find another buyer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 另寻买主的不便

Sense.DEF: someone or something that causes problems for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: a minor inconvenience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小麻烦

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His early arrival was clearly an inconvenience to his host.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他早到显然给主人带来了不便。

Sense.DEF: to cause problems for someone
Sense.TRAN: 给〔某人〕带来不便﹐添麻烦﹔打扰
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to inconvenience you any further.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想再打扰你了。

Sense.DEF: causing problems, often in a way that is annoying
Sense.EXAMPLE: Monday’s a bit inconvenient for me. How about Wednesday?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 周一我不太方便﹐周三如何？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Am I calling at an inconvenient time?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我电话打得不是时候吧？

Sense.DEF: to include something as part of a group, system, plan etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve incorporated many environmentally friendly features into the design of the building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在这座建筑的设计中加进了许多环保元素。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our original proposals were not incorporated in the new legislation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最初的提案没有写进新的法规。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the incorporation of the college into the university

Sense.DEF: used after the name of a company in the US to show that it has become a corporation
Sense.TRAN: 股份有限的〔在美国用于公司名称后﹐表示成为法人组织〕

Sense.DEF: not existing in any physical form
Sense.TRAN: 无形体的﹔非实体的﹐精神的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Plato demonstrated the incorporeal nature of the soul.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柏拉图阐明灵魂是无形的。

Sense.DEF: not correct or true
Sense.EXAMPLE: The information you gave us was incorrect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你给我们的信息不准确。

Sense.DEF: not following the rules of polite or fair behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would be incorrect of me to comment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发表意见不合规矩。

Sense.DEF: someone who is incorrigible is bad in a way that cannot be changed or improved – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 屡教不改的﹐不可救药的〔常为幽默用法〕

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 撒谎成性﹑屡教不改的人/不可救药的捣蛋鬼等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Peter, you are an incorrigible flirt!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得﹐你总喜欢跟女人调情﹐真是不可救药！

Sense.DEF: someone who is incorruptible cannot be persuaded to do wrong or illegal things
Sense.TRAN: 诚实正直的﹐刚正不阿的﹐廉洁的
Sense.EXAMPLE: A good judge must be incorruptible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好法官必须廉洁。

Sense.DEF: material that is incorruptible will never decay and cannot be destroyed
Sense.TRAN: 〔物质〕不会腐蚀的﹐不会毁坏的

Sense.DEF: if you increase something, or if it increases, it becomes bigger in amount, number, or degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: The population increased dramatically in the first half of the century.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该世纪上半叶﹐人口大幅度增加。
Sense.EXAMPLE: political tensions that might increase the likelihood of war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 或许会增加战争爆发可能性的紧张政治局面
Sense.EXAMPLE: Visits to the site have increased threefold since May.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来这里的参观者自5月起已增至原来的三倍。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Investments are certain to increase in value.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 投资一定会升值。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Food prices increased by 10% in less than a year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不到一年﹐食品价格就上涨了10%。
