Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在下面的方程式中﹐E趋向于零时﹐n接近无穷大。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is an infinity of possible solutions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有无数可行的解决方法。

Sense.DEF: a swimming pool that has been built in a special position so that someone swimming in the pool can see as far as the horizonthe line far away where the land or sea seems to meet the sky
Sense.TRAN: 〔可看到地平线的〕无边际游泳池

Sense.DEF: weak or ill for a long time, especially because you are old
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her grandmother is elderly and infirm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的祖母年迈体弱。

Sense.DEF: people who are weak or ill for a long time, especially because they are old
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel is on a hill, which is not ideal for the infirm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅店在山上﹐不适合体弱多病者。

Sense.DEF: a hospital – often used in the names of hospitals in Britain
Sense.TRAN: 医院〔常用于英国的医院名称〕

Sense.DEF: a room in a school or other institution where people can get medical treatment
Sense.TRAN: 〔学校及其他机构中的〕医务室

Sense.DEF: bad health or a particular illness
during the act of having sex, especially with someone else’s husband or wife – sometimes used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指与别人的丈夫或妻子〕做爱时〔有时为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were caught in flagrante by Donna’s husband.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他俩被唐娜的丈夫捉奸在床。

Sense.DEF: to make someone’s feelings of anger, excitement etc much stronger
Sense.TRAN: 加剧〔愤怒﹑兴奋等情感〕﹐使火上浇油
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shooting inflamed ethnic tensions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 枪击事件加剧了种族间的紧张局势。

Sense.DEF: a part of your body that is inflamed is red and swollen, because it is injured or infected
Sense.EXAMPLE: an inflamed eye
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发炎红肿的眼睛

Sense.DEF: inflammable materials or substances will start to burn very easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Petrol is highly inflammable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽油高度易燃。

Sense.DEF: easily becoming angry or violent, or making people angry or violent
Sense.TRAN: 易发怒的﹔易激动的﹔让人生气的
Sense.EXAMPLE: inflammable language
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 惹人发怒的言语

Sense.DEF: swelling and pain in part of your body, which is often red and feels hot

GramExa.EXAMPLE: inflammation of the colon
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 结肠炎

Sense.DEF: an inflammatory speech, piece of writing etc is likely to make people feel angry
Sense.TRAN: 〔讲话﹑文章等〕使人激愤的﹐煽动性的
Sense.EXAMPLE: inflammatory remarks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煽动性言论

Sense.DEF: an inflammatory disease or medical condition causes inflammation
Sense.EXAMPLE: inflammatory bowel disease
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炎症性肠病

Sense.DEF: an inflatable object has to be filled with air before you can use it
Sense.EXAMPLE: an inflatable mattress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充气垫子

Sense.DEF: an object that has to be filled with air before you can use it, especially a boat or toy
Sense.TRAN: 充气物〔尤指小艇或玩具〕

Sense.DEF: to fill something with air or gas so it becomes larger, or to become filled with air or gas
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took us half an hour to inflate the dinghy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们用了半小时给橡皮筏充好气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her life jacket failed to inflate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的救生衣未能充进去气。

Sense.DEF: to make something seem more important or impressive than it really is
Sense.EXAMPLE: The success further inflated his self-confidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次成功使他进一步自我膨胀。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The numbers of people involved have been grossly inflated by the media.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 涉及的人数被媒体严重夸大了。

Sense.DEF: to increase in price, or make something increase in price
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hotels often inflate prices at particular times of the year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店经常在一年中的某些时候抬高价格。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Costs were inflating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成本在上涨。

Sense.DEF: inflated prices, amounts etc are high and unreasonable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: company directors on grossly inflated salaries
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 薪水过高的公司董事

Sense.DEF: inflated ideas, opinions etc about someone or something make them seem better, more important etc than they real-ly are
Sense.TRAN: 〔想法﹑意见等〕夸张的﹐言过其实的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has a very inflated opinion of himself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他自视甚高。

Sense.DEF: filled with air or gas
a continuing increase in prices, or the rate at which prices increase
Sense.TRAN: 物价上涨(率)﹐通货膨胀(率)
Sense.EXAMPLE: Inflation is now at over 16%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通货膨胀率现已超过16%。

Sense.DEF: the process of filling something with air

Collocate.EXAMPLE: France had achieved low inflation and steady growth.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国实现了低通胀率和经济稳定增长。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Inflation remained high throughout this period.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一时期内通胀率仍居高不下。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Annual inflation in 1990 was 8.1%.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 1990年的年度通胀率为8.1﹪。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The country was hit by rising inflation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国遭到不断升高的通货膨胀率的打击。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: inflation that is increasing quickly and out of control
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 呈螺旋形上升的/急剧上升的通货膨胀率

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: increasing prices/wages

Collocate.COLLOC: the inflation rate/the rate of inflation
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The current inflation rate stands at 4.1%.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前通胀率为4.1%。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: April's inflation figures are likely to show a further fall.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 4月的通胀数据可能呈进一步下降的趋势。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Too much government borrowing can lead to inflation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府过度借贷可导致通货膨胀。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make inflation worse
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The increase in food prices is fuelling inflation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 食品价格上涨加剧了通货膨胀。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: prevent it from increasing more
Collocate.EXAMPLE: These measures are designed to curb inflation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些措施的目的是抑制通货膨胀。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: An economic plan to combat inflation was drawn up.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 起草了一项抑制通货膨胀的经济计划。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government has promised to reduce inflation to 3%.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府已承诺要把通货膨胀率降至3%。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Inflation rose steadily from the mid-1960s.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪60年代中期起通货膨胀率持续升高。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Inflation fell by 0.5% last month.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 上个月通货膨胀率下降0.5%。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used to talk about the present rate of inflation
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Inflation currently stands at 3.2%.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前通货膨胀率为3.2%。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be at the same level as inflation
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 与通货膨胀率保持同步
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Salaries have not kept pace with inflation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 工资水平未能与通货膨胀率保持同步。

Sense.DEF: relating to or causing price increases
Sense.TRAN: 价格上涨的﹔引起通货膨胀的
Sense.EXAMPLE: inflationary pressures in the economy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济上的通货膨胀压力
Sense.EXAMPLE: A new round of wage increases could trigger an inflationary spiral a continuing rise in both wages and prices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新一轮的加薪会引发工资与物价的交互上涨。

Sense.DEF: if a word inflects, its form changes according to its meaning or use
an inflected language contains many words which change their form according to their meaning or use
the way in which a word changes its form to show a difference in its meaning or use
one of the forms of a word that changes in this way, or one of the parts that is added to it
the way the sound of your voice goes up and down when you are speaking
unwilling to make even the slightest change in your attitudes, plans etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔态度﹑计划等〕顽固的﹐僵化的﹐缺乏弹性的
Sense.EXAMPLE: inflexible attitudes towards change
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对变革的顽固态度

Sense.DEF: inflexible rules, arrangements etc are impossible to change
Sense.TRAN: 〔规则﹑安排等〕不可改变的﹐不容变更的
Sense.EXAMPLE: This approach is too inflexible and too costly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个方法太死板﹐而且花费也太高。

Sense.DEF: inflexible material is stiff and will not bend
another spelling of inflection
to make someone suffer something unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕遭受〔不愉快的事〕﹐使承受

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The strikes inflicted serious damage on the economy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罢工给经济造成了巨大损失。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Detectives warned that the men could inflict serious injury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警探提醒说这些人可能会造成严重伤害。

Sense.DEF: to visit or be with someone when they do not want you – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 不请自来/把某人硬塞给某人〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Was it really fair to her friends to inflict her nephew on them?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把她外甥硬塞给她的朋友﹐这对她们真的公平吗？

Sense.DEF: provided during a plane journey
Sense.EXAMPLE: in-flight entertainment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞行途中提供的娱乐活动

Sense.DEF: the movement of people, money, goods etc into a place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an inflow of funds from abroad
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国外资金的流入

Sense.DEF: the flow of water into a place
the power to affect the way someone or something develops, behaves, or thinks, without using direct force or orders
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a scientist, his influence was immense.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身为一名科学家﹐他的影响力极大。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the unions’ influence over local politics
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会对当地政治的影响

Sense.DEF: someone or something that has an influence on other people or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gayle’s mother said I was a bad influence on her daughter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 盖尔的母亲说我对她女儿产生了坏影响。

Sense.EXAMPLE: For centuries the country remained untouched by outside influences.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多世纪以来﹐该国一直未受到外界影响。

Sense.DEF: drunk or feeling the effects of a drug

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His works have had an influence on many modern writers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的作品对许多现代作家产生了影响。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: have an influence
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Technology exerts a powerful influence over our lives.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 科技对我们的生活产生强大的影响。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She wasn’t afraid to use her influence to get what she wanted.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她并不怕利用自己的影响力来得到想要的东西。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: use it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The Federal Reserve exercises influence on the economy by setting short-term interest rates.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 美联储通过规定短期利率来对经济施加影响。

Collocate.COLLOC: come/fall under the influence of sb/sth
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be influenced by someone or something
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 受到某人/某事物的影响
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They had come under the influence of a religious sect.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们受到一个教派的影响。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Television can have a positive influence on young people.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视能对青年人产生积极的影响。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He thought her friends were a bad influence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他认为她的那些朋友对她构成了不良影响。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The goalkeeper’s injury had a big influence on the match.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 守门员的受伤对这场比赛产生了很大的影响。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Parents have an important influence on children&apos;s development.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长对子女的成长具有重要的影响。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Well-organized pressure groups can exert considerable influence on the government.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 组织良好的压力集团能够对政府施加相当大的影响。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The press can have a powerful influence on the way people vote.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻界能够对选民的选举方式产生强大的影响。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His writings had a profound influence on the Romantic poets.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的作品对浪漫派诗人具有深远的影响。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Many people are worried about the growing influence of these websites.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人对这些网站日益增加的影响力有所担心。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: continuing for a long time
Collocate.EXAMPLE: His travels in Africa had a lasting influence on his work.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 数次非洲之行对他的作品产生了持久的影响。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The Cubist painters had a direct influence on his work.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 立体派画家对他的作品有着直接的影响。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The music seemed to have a calming influence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这音乐似乎有稳定情绪的作用。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Frank used his personal influence to get his son a job at the newspaper.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗兰克利用其个人影响力为儿子在报社谋到了职位。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: French political influence began to dominate the country.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国的政治影响开始左右起这个国家来。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: happening from outside a country or a situation
too much influence

Sense.DEF: to affect the way someone or something develops, behaves, thinks etc without directly forcing or ordering them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marx was strongly influenced by the historian Niebuhr.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克思深受历史学家尼布尔的影响。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several factors are likely to influence this decision.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个因素可能会影响这个决定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What influenced you to take up nursing?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 是什么因素影响你去从事护理工作的？

Sense.DEF: having a lot of influence and therefore changing the way people think and behave
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had influential friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有一些有影响力的朋友。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dewey was influential in shaping economic policy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杜威对制定经济政策有影响力。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly influential art magazine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本极有影响力的艺术杂志

Sense.DEF: an infectious disease that is like a very bad cold
the arrival of large numbers of people or large amounts of money, goods etc, especially suddenly
Sense.TRAN: 〔人﹑钱﹑货物等突然的〕大量涌入

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sudden influx of cash
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现金的突然大量流入

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a large influx of tourists in the summer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏季旅游者的大批涌进

Sense.DEF: information
a company whose business is to provide information or communication technology, for example a telephone company or a company that provides connections to the Internet

a company that collects information from people about the type of products they buy, how often they buy a product etc, and pays them for this information. It then sells the information to other companies, but does not pass on private details such as someone’s name or address etc.
Sense.TRAN: 信息中介公司〔付钱向消费者收集有关他们购买的产品种类﹑购买次数等资料﹐然后把这些资料卖给其他公司〕

Sense.DEF: a long television advertisement that provides a lot of information and seems like a normal programme
Sense.TRAN: 商品信息电视片﹐专题广告片〔这类广告提供大量信息﹐看似普通的电视节目〕

Sense.DEF: to officially tell someone about something or give them information
Sense.EXAMPLE: They decided to inform the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们决定通知警察。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Please inform us of any change of address as soon as possible.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地址如有变更﹐请尽早通知我们。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We regret to inform you that your application has been rejected.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们很遗憾地通知你﹐你的申请未被接受。

Sense.DEF: to influence someone’s attitude or opinion
Sense.TRAN: 影响〔某人的态度或观点〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her experience as a refugee informs the content of her latest novel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的难民经历影响了她最新小说的内容。

Sense.DEF: to tell the police or an enemy information about someone that will harm them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He denied that he had ever informed on his neighbours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他否认曾告发他的邻居。

Sense.DEF: relaxed and friendly without being restricted by rules of correct behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 轻松友好的﹐不拘礼节的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The atmosphere at work is fairly informal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作气氛相当轻松。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two groups met for informal talks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个团体会面举行非正式会谈。

Sense.DEF: an informal style of writing or speaking is suitable for ordinary conversations or letters to friends
Sense.TRAN: 〔书写或言谈〕非正式的﹐日常使用的﹐适用于朋友间的

Sense.DEF: informal clothes are suitable for wearing at home or in ordinary situations
someone who secretly gives the police, the army etc information about someone else
Sense.TRAN: 〔向警方﹑军队等〕提供秘密消息者﹐线人﹐告密者
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of the witnesses was a paid informant for the FBI.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目击者之一是联邦调查局出钱雇用的线人。

Sense.DEF: someone who gives information about their language, social customs etc to someone who is studying them
Sense.TRAN: 〔为研究者提供语言﹑风俗等资料的〕资料提供人

Sense.DEF: facts or details that tell you something about a situation, person, event etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need more information.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要更多信息。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have received information that Grant may have left the country.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得到消息﹐格兰特可能已经离开了这个国家。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say what you know about a situation
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 我/我们等得到的消息是〔用于说明对某情况的了解〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My information is that Gary wants to stay with the club.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得到的消息说﹐加里想留在该俱乐部。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Information is an uncountable noun and has no plural form. Use a singular verb after it.
F2NBox.TRAN: information 是不可数名词﹐没有复数形式﹐其后要使用单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The information was not passed on to the hospital.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一信息未传到医院。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, in informal contexts, people often use the expression tell someone something rather than using the noun information.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐非正式语境下常用tell someone something﹐而不用名词information
F2NBox.BADEXA: I wonder if you could give me some information about your childhood.
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔I wonder if you could tell me something about your childhood.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能否和我讲讲你的童年。

Sense.DEF: the telephone service which provides telephone numbers to people who ask for them
used when you are telling someone that they are wrong about a particular fact
Sense.TRAN: 不妨告诉你一下〔用来纠正别人的错误〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: For your information, I’ve worked as a journalist for six years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不妨告诉你一下﹐我做记者已有六年了。

Sense.DEF: written on copies of letters and documents that are sent to someone who needs to know about them but does not have to deal with them
Sense.TRAN: 仅供参考〔写在信件和文件副本上﹐发给需要知道但无需对其进行处理的人〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The information he gave me was very useful.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给我的信息很有用。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Are you sure this information is correct?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你肯定这一消息正确无误吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was jailed for providing false information to the police.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因为向警方提供虚假信息而入狱。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: about the subject you are interested in
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Some of the information in the article is not particularly relevant.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇文章中的有些信息不太相关。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: That information was confidential and should not have been passed on.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那信息是保密的﹐本不应该被泄露出去。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: For more information, visit our website.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 欲知详情请访问我们的网站。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The police have received new information about the case.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方得到了有关此案的新消息。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: information that has been discovered very recently
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We have access to all the latest information.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们能获悉所有最新的情报。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: This leaflet should provide you with all the necessary information.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份传单可为你提供所有必需的信息。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: information explaining what happened before the present situation

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Do you have any information about coach trips to Oxford?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们有去牛津的长途车旅游资料吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The documents contained top secret information.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些文件含有最高机密的情报。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It is vital that people receive the information they need.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 民众能得到自己所需的信息是至关重要的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: a booklet giving information about local education services
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本提供当地教育服务信息的小册子

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The job consisted of gathering information about consumer needs.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作内容包括收集有关消费者需求的信息。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Journalists going to the building to seek information were denied entry.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 前往大楼去打听消息的新闻记者被拒之门外。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: give information to each other
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The meetings provided an opportunity to exchange information.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些会议提供了交流信息的机会。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: give it to a lot of people
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The internet plays a key role in disseminating information.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 因特网在信息传播方面起了关键的作用。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He provided me with several useful pieces of information.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向我提供了好几条有用的信息。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone or something that can provide information
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Newspapers are valuable sources of information.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸是很有价值的信息源。

Tail.TailContent: This graph shows some of the words most commonly used with the noun information. 本图表所示为含有名词information的一些最常用词组。

Sense.DEF: a place where you can get information about an area, event etc
when someone gets too much information at one time, for example on the Internet, and becomes tired and unable to think very carefully about any of it
Sense.TRAN: 信息超载〔指一次获得过多信息﹐从而出现应接不暇的状况〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The greater the amount of data, the greater the risk of information overload.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数据量越大﹐出现信息超载的风险也越大。

Sense.DEF: the process of finding stored information, especially on a computer
Sense.TRAN: 信息检索〔尤指从计算机存储的资料中进行查找的过程〕

Sense.DEF: the science of collecting, arranging, storing, and sending out information
Sense.TRAN: 信息(科)学〔收集﹑整理﹑储存和发送信息的科学〕

Sense.DEF: the Internet
Sense.TRAN: 信息高速公路〔即因特网〕

Sense.DEF: the study or use of electronic processes for gathering and storing information and making it available using computers
Sense.TRAN: 信息技术〔以电子方法收集﹑储存和使用信息的科学或其应用〕

Sense.DEF: the mathematical principles related to sending and storing information
providing many useful facts or ideas
Sense.TRAN: 资料丰富的﹔增进知识的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an informative and entertaining book
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本资料丰富且饶有趣味的书

Sense.DEF: having a lot of knowledge or information about a particular subject or situation
Sense.TRAN: 见多识广的﹔消息灵通的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Informed sources said it was likely that the president would make a televised statement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据消息灵通人士说﹐总统可能会发表电视声明。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I became reasonably well-informed about the subject.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对这个话题有了还算比较多的了解。

Sense.DEF: a decision etc that is based on knowledge of a subject or situation
Sense.TRAN: 有根据的决定/选择/判断等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good information is essential if people are to make informed choices about services.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们若要明智地选择服务﹐就必须有准确的信息。

Sense.DEF: to give someone the latest news and details about a situation
Sense.TRAN: 不断给某人提供最新消息
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please keep me fully informed of any developments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事态如有进展﹐请随时通知我。

Sense.DEF: someone who secretly tells the police, the army etc about criminal activities, especially for money
Sense.TRAN: 告发者﹐告密者〔尤指为了金钱〕

Sense.DEF: television programmes that deal with important subjects in a way that people can enjoy
Sense.TRAN: 〔在电视中用轻松的方式谈论重要问题的〕信息娱乐节目

Sense.DEF: attacks on computer systems, for example with viruses that are intended as acts of war against an enemy
Sense.TRAN: 信息战〔如利用病毒攻击敌方计算机系统的行为〕

Sense.DEF: below something in a range
Sense.EXAMPLE: the infra-red end of the spectrum
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 光谱的红外线区

Sense.DEF: an act of breaking a rule or law

GramExa.EXAMPLE: minor infractions of the rules
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻微的违规行为

Sense.DEF: infra-red light gives out heat but cannot be seen
the basic systems and structures that a country or organization needs in order to work properly, for example roads, railways, banks etc
Sense.TRAN: 基础设施[建设]〔如公路﹑铁路﹑银行等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some countries lack a suitable economic infrastructure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些国家缺乏适当的经济基础设施。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a $65 billion investment package in education, health care and infrastructure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用于教育﹑医疗和基础设施的650亿美元一揽子投资计划

Sense.DEF: not happening often
Sense.EXAMPLE: They would make infrequent visits to the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们偶尔去看一看那所房子。

Sense.DEF: not often
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jeremy does play cricket, but very infrequently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰里米确实玩板球﹐但次数很少。

Sense.DEF: fairly often
Sense.EXAMPLE: The censors changed some names and dialogue and, not infrequently, banned controversial films.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 审查官对电影里的一些名字和对话进行修改﹐并常常禁止有争议的电影发行。

Sense.DEF: to do something that is against a law or someone’s legal rights
Sense.TRAN: 违反〔法律〕﹔侵犯〔他人权利〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A backup copy of a computer program does not infringe copyright.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机程序的备份不侵犯版权。

Sense.DEF: to limit someone’s freedom in some way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some students argued that the rule infringed on their right to free speech.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些学生争辩说﹐这一规定侵犯了他们言论自由的权利。

Sense.DEF: to make someone extremely angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her actions infuriated her mother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的举动使她母亲极为生气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It infuriated him that Beth was with another man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝丝和另一个男人在一起﹐这使他极为愤怒。

Sense.DEF: very annoying
Sense.EXAMPLE: The infuriating thing is that he is always right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人恼火的是他总是正确的。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 难度高得令人恼火的纵横填字游戏

Sense.DEF: to fill something or someone with a particular feeling or quality
Sense.TRAN: 使充满〔某种感觉〕﹔向…灌输〔某一品质〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her books are infused with humour and wisdom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的书充满了幽默和智慧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These new designers are infusing fresh interest into the New York fashion scene.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些新设计师把有创意的元素带入了纽约时装界。

Sense.DEF: if you infuse tea or herbs or if they infuse, you leave them in very hot water while their taste passes into the water
the act of putting a new feeling or quality into something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Further education badly needs the infusion of more resources.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 进修教育非常需要更多资源的注入。

Sense.DEF: the act of putting medicine slowly into someone’s body, or the medicine itself
Sense.EXAMPLE: intravenous infusions of cardiac drugs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 心脏病药物的静脉注射

Sense.DEF: a drink made with herbs in hot water that is usually taken as a medicine
Sense.TRAN: 草药泡剂﹔用香草泡的茶

Sense.DEF: forms the present participle of verbs
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re dancing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在跳舞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: to go dancing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去跳舞
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dancing bear
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一头跳舞的熊

Sense.DEF: the action or process of doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hates swimming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不喜欢游泳。
Sense.EXAMPLE: No parking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁止停车。

Subsense.DEF: an example of doing something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: to hold a meeting
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 举行会议

Subsense.DEF: a product or result of doing something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a beautiful painting
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幅漂亮的画

Sense.DEF: something used to do something or used for making something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a silk lining
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丝质衬里
Sense.EXAMPLE: ten metres of curtaining cloth for curtains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十米窗帘布

Sense.DEF: an ingenious plan, idea, or object works well and is the result of clever thinking and new ideas
Sense.TRAN: 〔计划﹑主意或物体〕精巧的﹐巧妙的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many fish have ingenious ways of protecting their eggs from predators.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多鱼都有绝妙的方法来保护它们产的卵不被捕食者吃掉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ingenious device
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精巧的装置

Sense.DEF: someone who is ingenious is very good at inventing things or at thinking of new ideas
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕善于创造发明的﹐足智多谋的﹐心灵手巧的

Sense.DEF: skill at inventing things and thinking of new ideas
Sense.TRAN: 心灵手巧﹐善于创造发明﹔足智多谋

Sense.DEF: a young girl, especially in a film or play, who has not had much experience of life
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指电影或戏剧中〕涉世不深的少女

Sense.DEF: an ingenuous person is simple, trusting, and honest, especially because they have not had much experience of life
Sense.TRAN: 阅历浅的﹐纯朴的﹐坦诚率直的

Sense.DEF: to take food or other substances into your body
a seat by the side of a large open fireplace, or the space that it is in
causing shame and dishonour
Sense.TRAN: 不光彩的﹐可耻的﹐不名誉的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an inglorious defeat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可耻的失败

Sense.DEF: a piece of pure metal, especially gold, usually shaped like a brick
ingrained attitudes or behaviour are firmly established and therefore difficult to change
Sense.TRAN: 〔态度或行为〕根深蒂固的﹐难以改变的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The idea of doing our duty is deeply ingrained in most people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 恪尽职守这一信念在大多数人的心里根深蒂固。

Sense.DEF: ingrained dirt is under the surface of something and very difficult to remove
an ungrateful person
to try very hard to get someone’s approval – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 讨好﹐巴结﹐奉承〔某人〕〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: His policy is to ingratiate himself with anyone who might be useful to him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的为人之道是巴结任何可能对他有用的人。

Sense.DEF: trying too hard to get someone’s approval – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 极力讨好奉承的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ingratiating smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿谀奉承的微笑

Sense.DEF: the quality of not being grateful
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never seen such ingratitude!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从未见过这样的忘恩负义！

Sense.DEF: one of the foods that you use to make a particular food or dish
Sense.EXAMPLE: Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把所有食材都放在一个大碗里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The food is home-cooked using fresh ingredients.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种食物是用新鲜的食材在家里烹制的。

Sense.DEF: a quality you need to achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: John has all the ingredients of a great player.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰具备一个伟大运动员的一切素质。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Investment in new product development is an essential ingredient of corporate success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 注入资金开发新产品是公司成功的重要因素。

Sense.DEF: the substance in a product such as a medicine that causes the product’s intended result
Sense.EXAMPLE: Acetic acid is the chief active ingredient in vinegar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 醋酸是醋的主要有效成分。

Sense.DEF: the right to enter a place, or the act of entering it
a small group of people involved in an organization or activity who like the same things and are friendly with each other, but do not want other people to join them
an ingrowing toenail grows inwards, cutting into the surrounding skin
Sense.TRAN: 〔脚趾甲〕向内生长的﹐长到肉里去的

Sense.DEF: if animals or people inhabit an area or place, they live there
Sense.EXAMPLE: The woods are inhabited by many wild animals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多野生动物栖居在这片森林里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: inhabited islands
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人居住的岛屿

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Inhabit is mainly used in formal or scientific contexts. In everyday English, people usually say someone lives in a place.
F2NBox.TRAN: inhabit主要用于正式或科学语境下。在日常英语中﹐人们一般用live in指某人住在某地
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Millions of people live in these shantytowns.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 数百万人居住在这些贫民区内。

Sense.DEF: one of the people who live in a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: a city of six million inhabitants
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有600万居民的城市

Sense.DEF: a medicine or drug that you breathe in, for example when you have a cold
to breathe in air, smoke, or gas
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is dangerous to inhale ammonia fumes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸入氨气是很危险的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Myra lit another cigarette and inhaled deeply breathed in a lot of smoke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈拉又点上一支烟﹐深深地吸了一口。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: One man was treated for smoke inhalation when you breathe smoke from a fire.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名男子因吸入浓烟而接受治疗。

Sense.DEF: a small plastic tube containing medicine that you breathe in, in order to make breathing easier
Sense.TRAN: 吸入器〔内含药品的小型塑料管﹐用于使呼吸变得较顺畅〕

Sense.DEF: to be a natural part of something
a quality that is inherent in something is a natural part of it and cannot be separated from it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid the problems you mention are inherent in the system.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你提及的这些问题恐怕本来就存在于这个体制中。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Every business has its own inherent risks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每笔生意本身都有风险。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Firefighting is an inherently dangerous occupation.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防灭火本身是个非常危险的职业。

Sense.DEF: to receive money, property etc from someone after they have died

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He inherited a fortune from his grandmother.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从祖母那儿继承了一大笔财产。

Sense.EXAMPLE: inherited wealth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 继承的财富

Sense.DEF: if you inherit a situation, especially one in which problems have been caused by other people, you have to deal with it
Sense.TRAN: 接手﹐接过﹐承担〔由别人造成的问题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The present government inherited a closed, state-dominated economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现任政府接手了一个封闭的﹑由政府主导的经济制度。

Sense.DEF: to have the same character or appearance as your parents
Sense.TRAN: 经遗传得到〔父母的性格﹑外貌〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mr. Grass inherited his work ethic from his father.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格拉斯先生的职业道德遗传自他父亲。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I inherited my mother’s curly hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我遗传了母亲的鬈发。

Sense.DEF: to get something that someone else does not want any more
Sense.TRAN: 接收〔别人不再需要的东西〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We inherited the furniture from the previous tenants.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们从先前搬走的房客那里接收了这些家具。

Sense.DEF: money, property etc that you receive from someone who has died
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lucinda has to fight for her life and her inheritance in this gripping novel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这部扣人心弦的小说里﹐露辛达不得不为自己的生命与所继承的遗产进行抗争。

Sense.DEF: physical or mental qualities that you inherit from your family
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our genetic inheritance cannot be changed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的基因遗传特征是无法改变的。

Sense.DEF: ideas, skills, literature etc from the past that influence people in the present
Sense.TRAN: 遗产〔指对现在的人有影响的过去的思想﹑技艺﹑文学等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ideas that have become part of our cultural inheritance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已成为我们文化遗产一部分的思想

Sense.DEF: a tax that you have to pay when you receive money or property from someone who has died
someone who receives money, property etc from someone who has just died
someone who follows in an established way of life or thinking
Sense.TRAN: 〔生活或思想方式的〕后继者﹐继承人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These writers are inheritors of his work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些作家是他作品风格的继承者。

Sense.DEF: to prevent something from growing or developing well
Sense.EXAMPLE: An unhappy family life may inhibit children’s learning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不幸福的家庭生活可能会阻碍儿童的学习。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel embarrassed or nervous so that they cannot do or say what they want to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Recording the meeting may inhibit people from expressing their real views.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对会议进行录音记录可能会使人们不敢表达他们的真实想法。

Sense.DEF: too embarrassed or nervous to do or say what you want

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many people are inhibited about discussing sexual matters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人谈论性时都很拘束。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of shyness or embarrassment that stops you doing or saying what you really want
Sense.TRAN: 〔羞怯﹑窘迫造成的〕压抑﹐顾忌﹐拘谨
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had no inhibitions about saying what she felt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她毫不顾忌地说出自己的感觉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: People tend to lose their inhibitions when they’ve drunk a lot of alcohol.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们在喝多了酒之后往往会无所顾忌。

Sense.DEF: when something is restricted or prevented from happening or developing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a marked inhibition of cell growth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对细胞生长的显著抑制

Sense.DEF: an inhospitable place is difficult to live or stay in because the weather conditions are unpleasant or there is no shelter
Sense.TRAN: 〔地方〕不适宜居住的〔由于天气恶劣或缺乏遮蔽处〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an inhospitable climate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不宜人的气候
Sense.EXAMPLE: He trekked across some of the most inhospitable terrain in the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他长途跋涉﹐穿越了世界上一些最荒凉的地带。

Sense.DEF: an inhospitable person does not welcome visitors in a friendly way
Sense.TRAN: 不殷勤待客的﹐不好客的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some governments are inhospitable to aid workers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些政府不欢迎救援人员。

Sense.DEF: working within a company or organization
Sense.TRAN: 公司[组织]内部的﹔在机构内部
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have an in-house training unit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有一个内部培训部。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The keyboarding is done in-house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 资料输入是在公司内部完成的。

Sense.DEF: very cruel or without any normal feelings of pity
Sense.EXAMPLE: The refugees had suffered degrading and inhuman treatment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难民遭受了侮辱性和非人的待遇。

Sense.DEF: lacking any human qualities in a way that seems strange or frightening
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strange inhuman sound
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不像人发出的奇怪声响

Sense.DEF: extremely cruel and causing unacceptable suffering
Sense.EXAMPLE: the inhumane treatment of political prisoners
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对政治犯的虐待
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was shocked by the inhumane conditions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对这非人的条件感到震惊。

Sense.DEF: very cruel behaviour or actions
Sense.TRAN: 残酷的行为[行动]﹔无人性﹔野蛮
Sense.EXAMPLE: the inhumanity of some political systems
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 某些政治制度的不人道

GramExa.EXAMPLE: conditions inimical to development
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对发展不利的条件

Sense.DEF: making it difficult for something to exist or happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cold, inimical climate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 寒冷严酷的气候

Sense.DEF: too good or skilful for anyone else to copy with the same high standard
Sense.TRAN: 〔高超得〕难以模仿的﹐无与伦比的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the inimitable Billie Holliday
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盖世无双的比利·霍利戴

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He entertained us in his own inimitable style.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以其独特的方式把我们逗乐了。

Sense.DEF: very unfair and morally wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: an iniquitous system of taxation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种极不公正的税收制度

Sense.DEF: the quality of being very unfair or evil, or something that is very unfair
Sense.TRAN: 极不公正﹔邪恶﹔不公正的事

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He went on and on about the iniquities of bourgeois oppression.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没完没了地述说资产阶级压迫的罪恶。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They were trying to protect their son from iniquity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们竭力保护儿子免受不公正待遇。

Sense.DEF: happening at the beginning
Sense.EXAMPLE: an initial investment of £5,000
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 5,000英镑的初始投资

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the initial stages of the disease
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 疾病的早期阶段

Sense.EXAMPLE: The initial response has been encouraging.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最初的反应情况很乐观。

Sense.DEF: the first letter of someone’s first name
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can I have your initial, Mr Davies?’ ‘It’s G, Mr G Davies.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “戴维斯先生﹐您名字的首字母是什么？”“是G﹐G. 戴维斯。”

Sense.DEF: the first letters of all your names in order
Sense.EXAMPLE: His initials are DPH: they stand for David Perry Hallworth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他姓名的首字母是 DPH﹐代表戴维 · 佩里 · 霍尔沃思。

Sense.DEF: to write your initials on a document to make it official or to show that you agree with something
Sense.TRAN: 在〔文件〕上签上姓名的首字母〔使其成为正式文件或表示同意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two countries have initialled a new defence co-operation agreement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国签署了新的防御合作协议。

Sense.DEF: at the beginning
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stan initially wanted to go to medical school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯坦最初想进医学院。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Initially, I thought I would only stay there a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 起初﹐我以为我只会在那儿待一年。

Sense.DEF: to arrange for something important to start, such as an official process or a new plan
Sense.TRAN: 开始实施﹐发起〔重要的事﹐如正式的程序或新计划〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have decided to initiate legal proceedings against the newspaper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们决定向该报提起法律诉讼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Intellectuals have initiated a debate on terrorism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 知识分子就恐怖主义发起了辩论。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone about something or show them how to do something
Sense.TRAN: 使认识﹔向〔某人〕传授〔技巧〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Those kids were initiated into heroin use at a young age.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些孩子很小就被教会如何吸食海洛因。

Sense.DEF: to introduce someone into an organization, club, group etc, usually with a special ceremony
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过特殊仪式〕使〔某人〕加入〔组织﹑俱乐部﹑团体等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At the age of thirteen, the boys in the tribe are initiated into manhood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 部落里的男孩到13岁就经由成人礼而步入成人之列。

Sense.DEF: someone who has been allowed to join a particular organization, club, or group and has been taught its secrets
Sense.TRAN: 新加入的人﹔新入会的人

Sense.DEF: the process of officially introducing someone into a club or group, or of introducing a young person to adult life, often with a special ceremony
Sense.TRAN: 〔常指通过特别仪式的〕入会﹔〔青年男女的〕成年
Sense.EXAMPLE: The club has an initiation ceremony for new members.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该俱乐部会为新成员举行入会仪式。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: initiation rituals for young boys at puberty
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为青春期男孩举行的成年仪式

GramExa.EXAMPLE: rites of initiation into their religion
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加入他们教派的仪式

Sense.DEF: the act of starting something such as an official process, a new plan etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔正式程序﹑新计划等的〕发起﹐实施

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the initiation of criminal proceedings
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 提起刑事诉讼

Sense.DEF: the ability to make decisions and take action without waiting for someone to tell you what to do
Sense.TRAN: 自主决断的能力﹔主动性
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish my son would show more initiative.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望我的儿子能表现得再主动一些。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t keep asking me for advice. Use your initiative.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别老是要我给你出主意﹐发挥一下你自己的决断能力吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lt. Carlos was not obeying orders. He acted on his own initiative he was not told what to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡洛斯中尉没有服从命令﹐而是自作主张。

Sense.DEF: an important new plan or process to achieve a particular aim or to solve a particular problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: a government initiative to help exporters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扶助出口商的政府计划
Sense.EXAMPLE: an education initiative
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项教育计划

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a new initiative for peace in the Middle East
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 中东和平新方案

Sense.DEF: if you have or take the initiative, you are in a position to control a situation and decide what to do next
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you take the initiative and ask him out?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么你不主动约他出去呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Politicians need to seize the initiative from the terrorists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治家需要对恐怖分子主动出击。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government must not lose the initiative in the fight against terrorism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府在打击恐怖主义方面不能失去主动权。

Sense.DEF: a process by which ordinary citizens can officially suggest a change in the law by signing a petition
Sense.TRAN: 公民提案程序〔公民联名提出修改法律〕

Sense.DEF: someone who thinks of and starts a new plan or process

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the initiator of the proposal
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该项提议的发起人

Sense.DEF: to put liquid, especially a drug, into someone’s body by using a special needle

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The drug is injected directly into the base of the spine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 药物被直接注射入脊柱末端。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have to inject myself with insulin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我必须给自己注射胰岛素。

Sense.DEF: to improve something by adding excitement, interest etc to it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Traditional handbag makers are injecting more fun into their designs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统的手袋制作者在他们的设计中注入了更多有趣的元素。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A market building can inject new life into an area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 市场大楼能给一个地区增添生气。

Sense.DEF: to provide more money, equipment etc for something
Sense.TRAN: 投入〔更多的资金﹑设备等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They need to inject more money into sports facilities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们需要在体育设施上投入更多的资金。

Sense.DEF: an act of putting a drug into someone’s body using a special needle
Sense.EXAMPLE: The nurse gave me a tetanus injection.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士给我打了破伤风预防针。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an injection of insulin
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 胰岛素的注射

Sense.EXAMPLE: The children hate having injections.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们讨厌打针。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The only sure treatment is antibiotics, preferably by injection.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唯一有效的治疗方法是使用抗生素﹐最好是注射使用。

Sense.DEF: an addition of money to something in order to improve it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a massive injection of public funds
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共基金的大量注入

Sense.EXAMPLE: Our local football club may fold unless it gets a cash injection.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除非有现金投入﹐否则我们当地的足球俱乐部将倒闭。

Sense.DEF: the act of forcing a liquid into something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fuel injection system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 燃料注入系统

Sense.DEF: a process of making something in which plastic is forced into a particular shape, using a lot of pressure
a joke that is only understood by a particular group of people
Sense.TRAN: 〔只有某圈子里的人才能听懂的〕行内笑话

Sense.DEF: an injudicious action, remark etc is not sensible and is likely to have bad results
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为﹑言论等〕不明智的﹐不谨慎的〔可能产生不良后果〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has apologized for his injudicious remarks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已为他的不当言论道歉。

Sense.DEF: an order given by a court, which tells someone not to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The family is seeking an injunction against the book’s publication.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个家族正申请强制令来阻止该书的出版。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The judge refused to grant an injunction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官拒绝发出禁令。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They failed to obtain an injunction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们未能获得禁令。

Sense.DEF: a piece of advice or an order from someone in authority
to hurt yourself or someone else, for example in an accident or an attack
Sense.EXAMPLE: Angus injured his leg playing rugby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安格斯在打橄榄球时弄伤了腿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two people have been critically injured in an accident.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一次事故中﹐有两个人身受重伤。

Sense.DEF: to say unfair or unpleasant things that hurt someone’s pride, feelings etc
Sense.TRAN: 伤害某人的自尊/情感等

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say hurt rather than injure.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说hurt﹐而不说injure
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He hurt his leg playing rugby.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打橄榄球时伤了腿。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He really hurt my feelings.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他严重伤害了我的感情。

Sense.DEF: having a wound or damage to part of your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: an injured bird
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受伤的鸟
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chelsea have three injured players.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 切尔西队有三名受伤队员。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Grandpa was badly injured in the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 祖父在战争中受过重伤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car accident left him seriously injured.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在这场车祸中受了重伤。

Sense.DEF: the people who have been hurt
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of the injured are still in a serious condition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多伤者仍然情况危殆。

Sense.DEF: a look that shows you feel you have been treated unfairly
a feeling of being upset or offended because you think you have been unfairly treated
Sense.TRAN: 受到伤害的自尊/情感等〔由于觉得受委屈〕

Sense.DEF: the person who has been unfairly treated in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 受到不公正待遇的一方

Sense.DEF: causing injury, harm, or damage

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Smoking is injurious to health.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟危害健康。

Sense.DEF: a wound or damage to part of your body caused by an accident or attack
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was taken to hospital with serious head injuries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她头部受重伤被送到医院。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The driver of the truck suffered injuries to his legs and arms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡车司机的腿和手臂受了伤。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Beckham has missed several games through injury because of injury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝克汉姆因伤错过了几场比赛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a lawyer who specializes in personal injury claims.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个专门从事人身伤害索赔的律师。

Sense.DEF: damage to someone’s reputation, career, or feelings
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某人名誉﹑事业或情感的〕伤害﹐损害

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He says that the allegations caused serious injury to his reputation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说那些指控使他的名誉受到了严重损害。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The injury wasn’t serious.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 伤势并不严重。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very bad
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Some of the victims suffered terrible injuries.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些受害者伤势很严重。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that kills someone
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Fortunately, his injuries weren’t fatal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸运的是他的伤并不致命。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A man was treated in hospital for minor injuries.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名男子受了轻伤在医院治疗。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The brain can be affected by permanent injury after a serious accident.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 严重事故可能对大脑造成永久性伤害。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: quite bad
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Fairground rides can cause some nasty injuries.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在游乐场乘过山车等可能造成严重的伤害。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He suffered a shoulder injury while playing rugby.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打橄榄球时伤了肩部。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an injury to the spine
an injury to the face
one you get while doing sport
one that happens at work
injuries inside your body
large number of injuries at the same time

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Tom was OK, and had just a few minor injuries.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆没事﹐只是受了点轻伤。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He suffered a serious leg injury in a motorcycle accident.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一起摩托车事故中腿部受了重伤。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: suffer an injury
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He couldn’t take the chance of getting an injury.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不能冒受伤的危险。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: suffer an injury
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She sustained an injury to her hip.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她臀部受了伤。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The injury was treated at the local hospital.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 伤是在当地那家医院治疗的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It took her six months to recover from the injury.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的伤经过六个月才康复。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Two workmen narrowly escaped injury when a wall collapsed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一堵墙倒塌时两名工人险些被砸到。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The injury was caused by flying glass from the car windscreen.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 伤是由小汽车挡风玻璃飞出的碎片造成的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make someone have an injury
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Jenkins was accused of inflicting a head injury on one of his former colleagues.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹金斯被指控打伤以前同事的头部。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: accidentally hurt yourself
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Be careful with that knife or you’ll do yourself an injury.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 当心那把小刀﹐别把自己弄伤了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The injury occurred five minutes into the game.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 受伤在比赛开始五分钟后发生。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: often get injuries
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was rather prone to injury and often missed matches as a result.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很容易受伤﹐结果常常无法参加比赛。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He suffered injury problems throughout his career as a footballer.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他整个足球职业生涯中都受到伤患的困扰。

Exponent.DEF: damage to part of your body caused by an accident or an attack
Exponent.TRAN: 〔意外事故或袭击造成的〕伤﹐损伤
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The passengers were taken to hospital with minor injuries.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘客受了轻伤﹐被送往医院。

Exponent.DEF: an injury, especially a deep cut in your skin made by a knife, bullet, or bomb
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指刀﹑枪或炸弹造成的深入皮肤的〕伤﹐创伤
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He died of a gunshot wound to the head.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他死于头部的枪伤。

Exponent.DEF: a small injury made when a sharp object cuts your skin
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Blood was running from a cut on his chin.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 血从他下巴的伤口流出。

Exponent.DEF: a dark mark on your skin that you get when you fall or get hit
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jack often comes home from playing rugby covered in bruises.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克打完橄榄球回家常常身上到处青一块紫一块的。

Exponent.DEF: a small injury that marks your skin or breaks the surface slightly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She fell off her bike and got a few grazes on her legs and knees.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从自行车上摔下来﹐腿和膝盖有几处擦伤。

Exponent.DEF: a long deep cut
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had a deep gash across his forehead.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他额头上有条长而深的切口。

Exponent.DEF: an area of skin that is swollen because you have hit it against something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How did you get that bump on your head?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你头上怎么起了个包？

Exponent.DEF: an injury to your ankle, wrist, knee etc, caused by suddenly twisting it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s a slight sprain – you should rest your ankle for a week.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这属于轻微扭伤﹐你要让脚踝休息一周。

Exponent.DEF: an injury to a muscle caused by stretching it or using it too much
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a muscle strain in his neck
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他颈部的一处肌肉拉伤

Exponent.DEF: a crack or broken part in a bone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a hip fracture
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 髋骨骨折

Sense.DEF: playing time added on to a game such as football because of time lost when players are injured
Sense.TRAN: 伤停补时〔足球赛等中因球员受伤耽误而延长的比赛时间〕

Sense.DEF: a situation in which people are treated very unfairly and not given their rights

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the injustice of slavery
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奴隶制的不公正

GramExa.EXAMPLE: innumerable injustices against the black population
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对黑人难以计数的不公正行为

Sense.EXAMPLE: The movie deals with injustices suffered by Native Americans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影讲述印第安人受到的不公正待遇。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had developed a deep sense of social injustice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他深深感到社会的不公。

Sense.DEF: to judge someone’s character or abilities unfairly
Sense.EXAMPLE: To say that you are a poor cook is to do yourself an injustice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你说厨艺不行可是冤枉自己了。

Sense.DEF: a coloured liquid that you use for writing, printing or drawing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please write in black ink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请用黑色墨水书写。

Sense.DEF: the black liquid in sea creatures such as octopuses and squid
Sense.TRAN: 〔章鱼﹑乌贼等海洋生物分泌出的〕墨汁

Sense.DEF: to put ink on something
to make a document, agreement etc official and legal by writing your signature on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two companies have inked a deal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两家公司签署了一项协议。

Sense.DEF: to complete something done in pencil by drawing over it in ink
Sense.TRAN: 在〔铅笔底稿上〕用墨水加描

Sense.DEF: an electronic printer, usually connected to a small computer
a slight idea about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had an inkling that she was pregnant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我隐约知道她怀孕了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had absolutely no inkling of what was going on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她根本不知道发生了什么。

Sense.DEF: a small box containing ink on a thick piece of cloth, used for putting ink onto a stamp that is then pressed onto paper
a container for ink which fits into a hole in a desk
very dark – used especially in poetry
Sense.EXAMPLE: I stared out into the inky blackness of the night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我凝视着外面漆黑的夜色。

Sense.DEF: marked with ink
Sense.EXAMPLE: inky fingers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沾有墨水的手指

Sense.DEF: an inlaid box, table, floor etc has little pieces of another material set into its surface for decoration

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a wooden jewellery box inlaid with ivory
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 嵌有象牙的木制珠宝盒

Sense.DEF: metal, stone etc that is inlaid into the surface of another material is set into its surface as decoration
an inland area, city etc is not near the coast
Sense.EXAMPLE: the largest area of inland water in the southeast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 东南部最大的内陆水域

Sense.DEF: in a direction away from the coast and towards the centre of a country
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mountains are five miles inland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些山位于内陆五英里处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We set off inland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们动身向内陆进发。

Sense.DEF: your relatives by marriage, especially the father and mother of your husband or wife
Sense.TRAN: 姻亲〔尤指公婆或岳父母〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have to spend Christmas with the in-laws.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得和姻亲们一起过圣诞节。

Sense.DEF: a material which has been set into the surface of furniture, floors etc for decoration, or the pattern made by this
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cedarwood casket with gold inlay
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 镶金的雪松木小盒

Sense.DEF: a substance used by a dentist to fill a hole in a decayed tooth
a narrow area of water that reaches from the sea or a lake into the land
Sense.TRAN: 水湾〔海﹑湖伸向陆地的狭长水域〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are several sheltered inlets along the coast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿着海岸线有几处有天然屏障的水湾。

Sense.DEF: the part of a machine through which liquid or gas flows in
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器上液体或气体的〕注入口﹐进口
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fuel inlet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 燃油注入口

Sense.DEF: a special boot for roller skating, with a single row of wheels attached under it
Sense.TRAN: 直排轮旱冰鞋﹐单排轮溜冰鞋

Sense.DEF: having the responsibilities of a parent for someone else’s child
Sense.TRAN: 〔对别人的孩子〕代尽父母的责任
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a teacher, you should regard yourself as being in loco parentis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为教师﹐你应视自己为学生的父母。

Sense.DEF: someone who is being kept in a prison
an expression meaning ‘in memory of’, used especially on the stone above the place where a dead person is buried
Sense.TRAN: 为了纪念〔尤用于墓碑上〕

Sense.DEF: your inmost feelings, desires etc are your most personal and secret ones
Sense.EXAMPLE: In his inmost heart, he knew he didn’t love me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内心深处他知道自己并不爱我。

Sense.DEF: furthest inside a place, and so difficult to see or find
Sense.TRAN: 最深处的〔因而不易看到或发现〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Apparently there are bats in the inmost caves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然洞穴深处有蝙蝠。

Sense.DEF: a small hotel or pub, especially an old one in the countryside
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指乡村中古老的〕小旅馆﹐小酒馆

Sense.DEF: a word used in the names of some pubs and hotels
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于某些酒馆﹑酒店的名称中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re staying at the Holiday Inn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们住在假日酒店。

Sense.DEF: the parts inside your body, especially your stomach
the parts inside a machine
an innate quality or ability is something you are born with
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children have an innate ability to learn language.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童学习语言的能力是与生俱来的。

Sense.DEF: an innate belief is something you feel strongly about and are unlikely to change
Sense.EXAMPLE: the innate conservatism of the farming community
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 农业社区固有的保守主义

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队固有的保守价值观

Sense.DEF: on the inside or close to the centre of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: an inner room
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内室
Sense.EXAMPLE: inner London
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦中心区
Sense.EXAMPLE: the inner ear
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内耳

Sense.DEF: inner thoughts or feelings are ones that you feel strongly but do not always show to other people
Sense.TRAN: 〔想法或情感〕未表达出来的﹐隐藏的﹔内心的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Yoga gives me a sense of inner calm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 练习瑜伽使我感到内心平和。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’ll need great inner strength to get over the tragedy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她需要强大的精神力量来摆脱这一不幸带来的痛苦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She never shared her inner thoughts with anyone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从不告诉别人她内心的想法。

Sense.DEF: relating to things which happen or exist but are not easy to see
Sense.EXAMPLE: the inner workings of the film industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影业内部的运作方式
Sense.EXAMPLE: the fascinating inner life of a political party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引人入胜的政党隐秘生活

Sense.DEF: the few people in an organization, political party etc who control it or share power with its leader
Sense.EXAMPLE: members of the President’s inner circle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统核心集团的成员

Sense.DEF: thoughts or feelings inside your head which seem to warn or advise you
Sense.EXAMPLE: My inner voice told me to be cautious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的内心有个声音告诉我要小心谨慎。

Sense.DEF: the emotions and feelings you had as a child that still form a part of your character as an adult
the part near the middle of a city, especially where the buildings are in a bad condition and the people are poor
Sense.TRAN: 〔市中心周围的〕旧城区﹔(尤指)贫民区
Sense.EXAMPLE: the problems of our inner cities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们贫民区的问题

Sense.DEF: your innermost feelings, desires etc are your most personal and secret ones
Sense.TRAN: 〔情感﹑欲望等〕隐秘的﹐内心深处的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a man who would never share his innermost thoughts with anyone
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个永远不会告诉别人自己内心深处想法的人

Sense.DEF: furthest inside or nearest to the centre
Sense.TRAN: 最深处的﹔最接近中心的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the innermost depths of the cave
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 山洞的最深处

Sense.DEF: a rubber tube filled with air that is inside a tyre
one of the nine playing periods in a game of baseball or softball
Sense.TRAN: 〔棒球或垒球九局比赛的〕一局

Sense.DEF: the period of time in a game of cricket when a team or player bats
Sense.TRAN: 〔板球比赛中球队或球员击球的〕局

Sense.DEF: used about someone who has died to say that they had a long life
Sense.TRAN: 他/她享高寿〔指已逝世的人〕

Sense.DEF: used as a way of saying ‘isn’t it’
Sense.EXAMPLE: It's cold, innit?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很冷﹐是不是？

Sense.DEF: used after a statement for emphasis, instead of any question tag. This use is very non-standard and is grammatically incorrect, but has become common in spoken English among some young people.
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于陈述句后代替附加疑问句表示强调﹐是不规范用法﹐口语中年轻人较常使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a bad man, innit used instead of代替 ‘isn’t he’?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个坏家伙﹐对吧？

Sense.DEF: someone who owns or manages an inn
the fact of being not guilty of a crime
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you prove your innocence?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能证明自己清白吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: say repeatedly that you are not guilty
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The prisoners continued to protest their innocence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯人们一再申明他们无罪。

Sense.DEF: lack of experience of life or of knowledge of the bad things in the world
Sense.EXAMPLE: In our innocence we believed everything we were told.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们太幼稚﹐把听到的一切都信以为真。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the innocence of childhood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 童年的纯真

Sense.DEF: if you do or say something in all innocence, you have no intention of doing harm or of offending anyone
not guilty of a crime
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nobody would believe that I was innocent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没人肯相信我是清白的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s innocent of murder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没犯杀人罪。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The court found him innocent and he was released.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭判他无罪﹐他被释放了。

Sense.DEF: people who get hurt or killed in a war or crime although they are not directly involved in it
Sense.TRAN: 〔战争或犯罪行为中〕无辜的受害者/旁观者/人们等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many innocent civilians are among the casualties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伤亡者当中有很多是无辜的平民。

Sense.DEF: done or said without intending to harm or offend anyone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was startled by their angry reaction to his innocent remark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对他那毫无恶意的话如此愤怒﹐使他大为惊讶。

Sense.DEF: not having much experience of the bad things in the world, so that you are easily deceived
Sense.TRAN: 天真无邪的﹐阅世不深的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was thirteen years old and very innocent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我那时13岁﹐非常单纯无知。

Sense.DEF: someone who does not have much experience of the bad things in life
not offensive, dangerous, or harmful
Sense.TRAN: 无冒犯之意的﹔不危险的﹔无害的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an innocuous remark
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无恶意的话
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a perfectly innocuous young man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个毫无恶意的年轻人。

Sense.DEF: to start to use new ideas, methods, or inventions
Sense.EXAMPLE: the need for large businesses to innovate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大公司革新的需要
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has successfully innovated new products and services.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司成功地创出了新产品和服务。

Sense.DEF: a new idea, method, or invention

GramExa.EXAMPLE: recent innovations in English teaching
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英语教学的新创举

Sense.DEF: the introduction of new ideas or methods
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must encourage innovation if the company is to remain competitive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司要想保持竞争力﹐就必须鼓励革新。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We need to encourage innovation in industry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要鼓励工业创新。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people feel bewildered by the speed of technological innovation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人对技术革新的速度感到不知所措。

Sense.DEF: an innovative idea or way of doing something is new, different, and better than those that existed before
Sense.TRAN: 〔思想或方法〕新颖的﹐创新的﹐革新的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an innovative approach to language teaching
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 创新的语言教学法
Sense.EXAMPLE: innovative schemes for recycling waste materials
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 废物回收利用的创新计划

Sense.DEF: using clever new ideas and methods
Sense.TRAN: 运用新观念和新方法的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an innovative design team
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 具有创新精神的设计团队

Sense.DEF: someone who introduces changes and new ideas

Sense.TRAN: 新颖的﹐创新的﹐革新的﹔运用新观念和新方法的

Sense.DEF: a remark that suggests something sexual or unpleasant without saying it directly, or these remarks in general
Sense.EXAMPLE: His writing is full of sexual innuendoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的作品充满了挑逗性的语言。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a campaign based on rumour, innuendo, and gossip
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以谣言﹑影射和流言蜚语为内容的宣传活动

Sense.DEF: very many, or too many to be counted
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s served on innumerable committees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在多个委员会担任委员。

Sense.DEF: unable to do simple calculations or understand basic mathematics
Sense.TRAN: 不会计算的﹔不会基础数学的

Sense.DEF: to protect someone against a disease by putting a weak form of the disease into their body using a needle
Sense.TRAN: 给〔某人〕接种﹐给〔某人〕作预防注射

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All the children had been inoculated against hepatitis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有孩子都注射了肝炎预防针。

Sense.DEF: unlikely to offend or upset anyone
Sense.TRAN: 不冒犯人的﹐不会得罪人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her husband was a small, inoffensive-looking man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她丈夫个子不高﹐看上去很随和。

Sense.DEF: an inoperable illness or medical condition cannot be treated by an operation
Sense.EXAMPLE: an inoperable brain tumour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不能动手术的脑肿瘤

Sense.DEF: something that is inoperable cannot be used
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bombing rendered the airfield inoperable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轰炸导致机场无法使用。

Sense.DEF: a machine that is inoperative is not working, or is not in working condition
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器〕不运转的﹐不在工作状态的

Sense.DEF: a system or a law that is inoperative does not work any more or cannot be made to work
Sense.TRAN: 〔系统或法律〕不能实施的﹐无效的

Sense.DEF: an inopportune moment or time is not suitable or good for something
Sense.TRAN: 〔时机或时间〕不合适的﹐不适宜的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid you’ve called at rather an inopportune moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕你的电话打得相当不是时候。

Sense.DEF: happening at an unsuitable or bad time
Sense.EXAMPLE: an inopportune visit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不合时宜的探访

Sense.DEF: far more than you would reasonably or normally expect
Sense.TRAN: 超出合理限度的﹐过分的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Testing is taking up an inordinate amount of teachers’ time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 测验占去了教师们太多的时间。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She’s inordinately fond of her parrot.

Sense.DEF: not consisting of anything that is living
Sense.EXAMPLE: inorganic matter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无机物

Sense.DEF: the part of chemistry concerning the study of substances that do not contain carbon
someone who stays in a hospital while they receive treatment
information that is put into a computer
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the input data specified it, the file will close and the process terminates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果输入数据指定﹐该文件就会关闭﹐数据处理终止。

Sense.DEF: ideas, advice, money, or effort that you put into a job or activity in order to help it succeed
Sense.TRAN: 投入(物)〔指对某项工作或活动所提供的意见﹑建议﹑资金或努力〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Farmers contributed most of the input into the survey.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次调查收集的意见大都是农场主提供的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll need input from community nurses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将需要社区护士的帮助。

Sense.DEF: electrical power that is put into a machine for it to use
to put information into a computer

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The information is input to our computer system.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 信息被输入我们的电脑系统中。

Sense.DEF: a legal process to find out the cause of someone’s death

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The coroner will hold an inquest into the deaths.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 验尸官将对死因进行调查。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The inquest heard that she died from multiple injuries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 死因调查表明她死于多处受伤。

Sense.DEF: an unofficial discussion about the reasons for someone’s defeat or failure to do something
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某人的失败进行的非正式的〕讨论

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Tories will hold a private inquest into why they were defeated.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 托利党将对他们失败的原因进行内部讨论。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of anxiety
to ask someone for information
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Why are you doing that?’ the boy inquired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你为什么这么做？”男孩问道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I am writing to inquire about your advertisement in ‘The Times’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贵方在《泰晤士报》刊登广告﹐特此致函问询。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The waiter inquired whether we would like to sit near the window.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 侍者问我们是否想靠窗坐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Where’s the station?’ she inquired of a passer-by.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “车站在哪儿？” 她问一名过路人。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Toby would have liked to inquire further ask more questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 托比本想问更多的问题。

Sense.DEF: to ask about someone’s health, what they are doing etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He called me aside to inquire after my daughter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把我叫到一旁﹐打听我女儿的情况。

Sense.DEF: to ask questions in order to get more information about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The investigation will inquire into the company’s financial dealings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此次调查将会涉及公司的财务往来。

Sense.DEF: an inquiring look or expression shows that you want to ask about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She raised an inquiring eyebrow towards Murray.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她朝默里扬了一下眉毛﹐露出探询的神色。

Sense.DEF: someone who has an inquiring mind is very interested in finding out more about everything
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a child, he had a lively inquiring mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他小时候凡事都爱问个明白。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 维克多以探询的目光看着她。

Sense.DEF: a question you ask in order to get information

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re getting a lot of inquiries about our new London-Rio service.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人来打听我们新开设的伦敦－里约热内卢的航班情况。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: inquiries from potential applicants
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自潜在申请者的询问

Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know who sent the gift, but I’ll make some inquiries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道礼物是谁送的﹐但我会打听一下。

GramExa.PROPFORM: help the police with their inquiries
GramExa.GLOSS: to answer questions about a crime

Sense.DEF: the act or process of asking questions in order to get information
Sense.EXAMPLE: On further inquiry, it emerged that Malcolm had not been involved in the incident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 进一步的调查表明﹐马尔科姆没有参与该事件。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The local council set up a committee of inquiry to look into policing arrangements.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地市政会成立了一个调查委员会来对治安维护措施进行调查。

Sense.DEF: an official process to find out about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a judicial inquiry into the deaths
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对死因的司法调查

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Civil Aviation Authority has agreed to hold an inquiry into the accident.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 民航局同意对事故进行调查。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The police have launched a murder inquiry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方已开始对谋杀案展开调查。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parents have called for an independent inquiry into the accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长要求对事故进行独立调查。

Sense.DEF: a Roman Catholic organization in the past whose aim was to find and punish people who had unacceptable religious beliefs
Sense.TRAN: 〔昔日天主教惩罚异教徒的〕宗教法庭﹐异端裁判所

Sense.DEF: a series of questions that someone asks you in a threatening or unpleasant way
Sense.TRAN: 〔带威胁或令人不快的〕盘问﹐查问
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had to face a two-hour inquisition from my parents about where I’d been.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只得面对父母长达两小时的盘问﹐问我去了哪儿。

Sense.DEF: asking too many questions and trying to find out too many details about something or someone
Sense.TRAN: 过分好奇的﹔爱打听的﹔好追根究底的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d have asked more questions, but I didn’t want to seem inquisitive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我本想问更多的问题﹐但我不想看上去那么爱打听。

Sense.DEF: interested in a lot of different things and wanting to find out more about them
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cheerful, inquisitive little boy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个快乐﹑好问的小男孩
Sense.EXAMPLE: an inquisitive mind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好钻研的性格

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He peeped inquisitively into the drawer.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他好奇地往抽屉里窥视。

Sense.DEF: someone who is asking you a lot of difficult questions and making you feel very uncomfortable
Sense.TRAN: 〔提出很多难题﹐令人极不舒服的〕盘问者﹐询问者

Sense.DEF: an official of the Inquisition

Subsense.DEF: to have an important effect or influence on something, especially by taking something away from it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Video is making huge inroads into attendance figures at movie theaters taking away its customers.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 录像正大量夺走电影院的观众。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They have made significant inroads into the European market.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们已成功占领欧洲市场。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The administrative workload is making massive inroads into our working day taking away time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 行政事务占去了我们大量的工作时间。

Subsense.DEF: to make some progress towards achieving something difficult
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We haven’t made much of an inroad into the backlog of work.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没有完成多少积压的工作。

Sense.DEF: a sudden flow of something that enters a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The inrush of fresh air filled the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 涌入的新鲜空气充满了房间。

Sense.DEF: all the exact details of a complicated situation, problem, system etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔复杂的局面﹑难题﹑体系等的〕详情﹐细节

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t really know all the ins and outs of the matter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我并不知道这件事的来龙去脉。

Sense.DEF: completely stupid or crazy, often in a way that is dangerous
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s an insane risk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是疯狂的冒险之举。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole idea sounds absolutely insane to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个主意在我看来荒谬至极。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why did you do that? Have you gone insane?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么这么做？你疯了吗？

Sense.DEF: someone who is insane is permanently and seriously mentally ill so that they cannot live in normal society
Sense.TRAN: 精神错乱的﹔精神失常的﹔疯癫的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The killer was declared criminally insane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名杀人犯被判定为精神失常犯罪。

Sense.DEF: people who are mentally ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hospital for the insane
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神病院

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel more and more annoyed or angry, usually over a long period of time
Sense.TRAN: 〔一般指经过长时间〕逼得某人发疯
Sense.EXAMPLE: My little brother’s been driving me insane all weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的小弟弟整个周末逼得我发疯。

Sense.DEF: insanitary conditions or places are very dirty and likely to cause disease
Sense.TRAN: 肮脏的﹐不衞生的﹐危害健康的

Sense.DEF: the state of being seriously mentally ill, so that you cannot live normally in society
Sense.EXAMPLE: The court acquitted Campbell on the grounds of temporary insanity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭以坎贝尔一时精神错乱为由判他无罪释放。

Sense.DEF: very stupid actions that may cause you serious harm
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can’t they see the insanity of dumping radioactive waste in the sea?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难道他们看不出把放射性废弃物倾倒进海里是十分愚蠢的行为吗？

Sense.DEF: always wanting more and more of something
Sense.TRAN: 贪得无厌的﹐不能满足的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his insatiable appetite for power
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对权力的贪得无厌
GramExa.EXAMPLE: our insatiable thirst for knowledge
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对知识永无止境的渴求

Sense.DEF: to carefully cut, print, or write words on something, especially on the surface of a stone or coin
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在石头或硬币表面〕雕刻﹐印制﹐题写
Sense.EXAMPLE: Inside the cover someone had inscribed the words ‘To Thomas, with love’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在书的内封上﹐有人题写了“托马斯惠存”几个字。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The team’s name is inscribed on the base of the trophy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队的名字刻在奖杯的底座上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tomb was inscribed with a short poem.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 墓碑上刻有一首短诗。

Sense.DEF: a piece of writing inscribed on a stone, in the front of a book etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Latin inscription on the memorial stone
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纪念碑上的拉丁语碑文

Sense.DEF: someone who is inscrutable shows no emotion or reaction in the expression on their face so that it is impossible to know what they are feeling or thinking
Sense.TRAN: 〔因面无表情而〕难以理解的﹐莫测高深的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stood silent and inscrutable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他静静地站着﹐让人难以捉摸。

Sense.DEF: a small creature such as a fly or ant, that has six legs, and sometimes wings
Sense.EXAMPLE: an insect bite
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昆虫的叮咬
Sense.EXAMPLE: flying insects
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞虫
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget to bring insect repellant a chemical to keep insects away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要忘记带上驱虫剂。

PIC.HEADING: INSECTS 昆虫
PIC.PICCONTENT: antenna 触须；thorax胸；wing 翅膀；abdomen 腹；grasshopper 蚱蜢；bee 蜜蜂；wasp 黄蜂；fly 苍蝇；mosquito 蚊子；ant 蚂蚁；beetle 甲虫；earwig 蠼螋；butterfly 蝴蝶；dragonfly 蜻蜓；moth 蛾；ladybird BrE【英】/ladybug AmE【美】瓢虫

Sense.DEF: a chemical substance used for killing insects
a creature that eats insects for food
not feeling at all confident about yourself, your abilities, or your relationships with people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s very insecure about her appearance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对自己的外表很不自信。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt lonely and insecure away from her family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 远离家人使她觉得孤独﹐没有安全感。

Sense.DEF: a job, investment etc that is insecure does not give you a feeling of safety, because it might be taken away or lost at any time
Sense.TRAN: 〔工作﹑投资等〕无保障的﹐不安全的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of them work in low-paid insecure jobs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们当中的许多人都做着薪水低﹑不稳定的工作。

Sense.DEF: a building or structure that is insecure is not safe, because it could fall down

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Student teachers often suffer from a great sense of insecurity.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 实习教师往往自信心严重不足。
她深深的恐惧和不安全感

Sense.DEF: to put sperm into a woman or female animal in order to make her have a baby
not able to feel things
unreasonable and crazy
Sense.EXAMPLE: an insensate hatred of America
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对美国缺乏理性的仇恨

Sense.DEF: the state of being unconscious
inability to experience feelings such as love, sympathy, anger etc
not knowing about something that could happen to you
Sense.TRAN: 没意识到的﹐没觉察到的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She remained insensible of the dangers that lay ahead.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她依然对即将出现的危险毫无觉察。

Sense.DEF: unable to feel something or be affected by it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: insensible to the cold
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 感觉不到寒冷

Sense.DEF: not conscious
Sense.EXAMPLE: He fell to the ground, insensible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他跌倒在地﹐失去了知觉。

Sense.DEF: not noticing, or not taking the care to notice other people’s feelings, and not realizing when they are upset or when something that you do will upset them
Sense.TRAN: 〔对他人的感受〕麻木不仁的﹐漠不关心的
Sense.EXAMPLE: One insensitive official insisted on seeing her husband’s death certificate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位不近人情的官员非要看看她丈夫的死亡证明。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an insensitive remark
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺乏同情心的言论

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s totally insensitive to Jack’s feelings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她根本不理会杰克的感受。

Sense.DEF: not paying attention to what is happening or to what people are saying, and therefore not changing your behaviour because of it
Sense.TRAN: 〔对发生的事或别人的话〕置之不理的﹐没有反应的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Companies that are insensitive to global changes will lose sales.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对全球变化无动于衷的公司﹐其销售额会下降。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The service is insensitive to the needs of local people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个机构对当地人的需求无动于衷。

Sense.DEF: not affected by physical effects or changes

GramExa.EXAMPLE: insensitive to pain
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 无疼痛感

Sense.DEF: people who are inseparable are always together and are very friendly with each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jane and Sarah soon became inseparable companions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简与萨拉很快就形影不离了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tom was inseparable from his dog Snowy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆和他的狗“雪儿”形影不离。

Sense.DEF: things that are inseparable cannot be separated or cannot be considered separately

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Britain’s economic fortunes are inseparable from the world situation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的经济命运和世界局势密不可分。

Sense.DEF: to put something inside or into something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His hand shook slightly as he inserted the key into the lock.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把钥匙插进锁里﹐手微微颤抖。

Sense.DEF: to add something to the middle of a document or piece of writing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His manager inserted a new clause into his contract.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经理把一项新的条款加进他的合同里。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Insert your comments in the space below.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的意见写在下面空白处。

Sense.DEF: printed pages that are put inside a newspaper or magazine in order to advertise something
Sense.TRAN: 〔夹在报纸杂志中的〕插页广告
Sense.EXAMPLE: a six-page insert on computer software
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于电脑软件的六页插页广告

Sense.DEF: something that is designed to be put inside something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wore special inserts in his shoes to make him look taller.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在鞋里垫了专用垫块﹐让他显得高一点。

Sense.DEF: the act of putting something inside something else
something that is added to the middle of a document or piece of writing
Sense.TRAN: 〔文件或文稿中的〕插入物﹐插入内容

Sense.DEF: training etc that you do while you are working in a job
a small picture, map etc in the corner of a page or larger picture etc, which shows more detail or information
Sense.TRAN: 小图﹐小地图〔套印在页面﹑大图片角位上﹐以提供更详细的资料〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The venture earned Mr Taylor (inset) millions of dollars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项风险投资使泰勒先生(见小图)赚了数百万美元。

Sense.DEF: something which is fixed into or onto the surface of something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pendant with a diamond inset
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嵌有钻石的坠子

Sense.DEF: if something is inset with decorations or jewels, they are fixed into or on its surface

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a wooden box inset with ivory
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 嵌有象牙的木盒子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: spotlights inset into the ceiling
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 嵌入天花板的聚光灯

Sense.DEF: to put a small picture, map etc on a printed page
near, towards, or to the shore
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fishing boats usually stay close inshore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 渔船通常停留在近岸海域。

Sense.DEF: in or into a container or other closed space so as to be completely covered or surrounded
Sense.TRAN: 在〔容器或其他封闭的空间〕里面﹔往里面
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jewels were locked away inside the safe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珠宝锁入了保险箱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sent the money inside an envelope addressed to Ann.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把钱装在写有安的名字和地址的信封内寄出。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carl picked up the book and stuffed it inside his jacket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡尔把书捡起来塞进自己的夹克里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her car was locked and the keys were inside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的车锁上了﹐钥匙在车里。

Sense.DEF: in or into a building or room
Sense.TRAN: 在〔建筑物﹑房间〕内﹔往里面
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s raining. We’ll have to go inside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外面在下雨﹐我们不得不进屋去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She could hear voices inside, but no one came to the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她能听到里面有说话声﹐但没人应门。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mail was piled up just inside the doorway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在入口处堆满了信件。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sound was coming from inside the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 声音是从房子里面传出来的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were 20 people packed inside of her dorm room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的寝室里挤了20个人。

Sense.DEF: in a country or area – used when you want to emphasize that something is happening there and not in other places
Sense.TRAN: 在〔国家﹑地区〕内部〔用于强调某事只在那里发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Very little is known of events inside this mysterious country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们对这个神秘国家内部发生的事情知之甚少。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The guerrillas were said to be operating from bases inside the war zone.
