Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说游击队员是从战区内的基地出来活动的。

Sense.DEF: if someone is inside a group or organization, they are part of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: women’s influence inside the party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妇女在党内的影响力
Sense.EXAMPLE: The information comes from sources inside the company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消息来自公司内部。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Discussions should involve local people both inside and outside the school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参加讨论的人应该包括校内校外的当地民众。

Sense.DEF: if something happens inside you, or inside your head or mind, it is part of what you think and feel, especially when you do not express it
Sense.EXAMPLE: You just don’t understand how I feel inside!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真不理解我内心的感受！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steve’s a strange guy – you never know what’s going on inside his head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫是个奇怪的人——你永远都不知道他脑子里在想些什么。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anger bubbled up deep inside her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她满腔怒火。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Something inside of me told me not to trust him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的内心深处告诉我不要相信他。

Sense.DEF: in your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: She could feel the baby kicking inside her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感到胎儿在腹内踢蹬。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll feel better once you’ve got a good meal inside you after you have eaten something.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要好好吃一顿﹐你就会感觉好一些。

Subsense.DEF: in less than a particular amount of time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A full report is expected inside three months.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 完整的报告要在三个月内完成。

GramExa.GLOSS: before an hour, month etc has passed
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 一个小时/一个月等之内
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll be back inside the hour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一小时内回来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our aim is to get the whole job finished inside of a week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的目标是一周内完成全部工作。

Subsense.DEF: less than a particular amount of time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Jonson’s time of 9.3 seconds was just inside the world record.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼森9.3秒的成绩刚好破了世界纪录。

Sense.DEF: in prison
Sense.EXAMPLE: My boyfriend’s been inside for a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的男友已经在监狱里服刑一年了。

Sense.DEF: the inner part of something, which is surrounded or hidden by the outer part

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The apple’s rotten on the inside.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 苹果里面已经腐烂。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: condensation on the inside of the window
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗户内壁的水珠

Sense.EXAMPLE: The door had been locked from the inside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门从里面锁上了。

Sense.DEF: with the usual outside parts on the inside
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve got that jumper inside out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把套头毛衣里外穿反了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her umbrella blew inside out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的伞被吹翻了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always turn my jeans inside out to wash them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总是把牛仔裤翻过来洗。

Sense.LEXUNIT: turn a room/building etc inside out
Sense.DEF: to search a place very thoroughly by moving everything that is in it
Sense.TRAN: 对房间/建筑物等进行彻底搜查
Sense.EXAMPLE: The drug squad turned the apartment inside out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缉毒队把公寓翻了个底朝天。

Sense.DEF: to know something in great detail
Sense.TRAN: 对某事物知道得一清二楚
Sense.EXAMPLE: She knows her subject inside out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对她的课题了如指掌。

Sense.DEF: someone who is on the inside is a member of a group or an organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone on the inside must have helped with the robbery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定有内应为这次抢劫提供了帮助。

Sense.DEF: if a car passes another car on the inside, it passes on the side that is away from the driver
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车超车时〕从内侧﹐从里道﹐从内圈

Sense.DEF: someone’s stomach
Sense.EXAMPLE: My insides are beginning to complain about the lack of food.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的肚子开始饿的咕咕叫了。

Sense.DEF: in or facing the inner part of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the inside pages of the newspaper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸的内页
Sense.EXAMPLE: the inside pocket of his jacket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的夹克的内袋

Sense.DEF: information that is available only to people who are part of a particular group or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police believe the robbers may have had inside information.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方认为劫匪可能得到了内部消息。

Sense.DEF: the lane that is furthest away from the middle of the road
someone who has a special knowledge of a particular organization because they are part of it
Sense.TRAN: 〔团体〕内部的人﹔圈内人﹔业内人士
Sense.EXAMPLE: an insider’s view of the way that a Japanese company works
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 业内人士对日本公司运作方式的看法

Sense.DEF: the crime of using secret information that you have about a company, or knowledge of a situation, to buy or sell shares at a profit
Sense.TRAN: 〔股票的〕内幕交易﹐内线交易〔指利用内幕消息来非法买卖股票〕

Sense.DEF: the part of a circular track for racing that is nearest to the centre of the circle and is therefore shorter
a position that gives someone an advantage over the people they are competing against
Sense.TRAN: 〔竞争中的〕有利地位﹐有利形势
Sense.EXAMPLE: the inside track to success in business
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在商界成功的有利形势

Sense.DEF: an insidious change or problem spreads gradually without being noticed, and causes serious harm
Sense.TRAN: 〔变化或问题〕暗中为害的﹐不知不觉间加剧的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an insidious trend towards censorship of the press
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实行新闻审查的潜在趋势

Sense.DEF: a sudden clear understanding of something or part of something, especially a complicated situation or idea
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指对复杂情况﹑看法的〕顿悟﹐猛醒

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The article gives us a real insight into the causes of the present economic crisis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇文章分析了目前经济危机的原因﹐发人深省。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The research provides new insights into the way we process language.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该研究对我们处理语言的方式提出了新的深刻见解。

Sense.DEF: the ability to understand and realize what people or situations are really like
Sense.EXAMPLE: a woman of great insight
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位极有眼光的妇女

Sense.DEF: able to understand, or showing that you understand, what a situation or person is really like
Sense.TRAN: 领悟力强的﹔富有洞察力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an insightful analysis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有见地的分析

Sense.DEF: a badge or sign that shows what official or military rank someone has, or which group or organization they belong to
Sense.TRAN: 〔表示官衔﹑军阶的〕徽章﹔〔隶属某个团体或组织的〕标志
Sense.EXAMPLE: the royal insignia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皇家的徽章
Sense.EXAMPLE: military insignia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队证章

Sense.DEF: too small or unimportant to consider or worry about
Sense.TRAN: 微不足道的﹐无足轻重的
Sense.EXAMPLE: You realize that your problems are insignificant in comparison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要知道﹐你的问题相对来说微不足道。

Sense.DEF: pretending to be pleased, sympathetic etc, especially by saying nice things, but not really meaning what you say
Sense.EXAMPLE: an insincere smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虚伪的微笑
Sense.EXAMPLE: an offer which she knew to be impractical and insincere
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个她认为不实际﹑不真诚的建议

Sense.DEF: to say something which seems to mean something unpleasant without saying it openly, especially suggesting that someone is being dishonest
Sense.TRAN: 暗示﹐暗指〔令人不快的内容﹐尤指某人不诚实〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you insinuating that the money was stolen?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是在暗示钱被偷了吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: What are you trying to insinuate?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想暗示什么？

Sense.DEF: to gradually gain someone’s love, trust etc by pretending to be friendly and sincere
Sense.TRAN: 〔假装友善和诚实〕使逐渐取得〔某人的喜爱﹑信任等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He managed to insinuate his way into her affections.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他终于设法赢得了她的芳心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He insinuated himself into Mehmet’s confidence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他设法取得了穆罕默德的信任。

Sense.DEF: to move yourself or a part of your body into a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: a large cat insinuated itself through the gap
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只从缺口处钻进来的大猫

Sense.DEF: something that someone says which seems to mean something unpleasant, but does not say this openly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She rejected the insinuation that she was partly to blame.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对暗示她要负部分责任的说法予以驳斥。

Sense.DEF: when someone says something insinuating
food or drink that is insipid does not have much taste
Sense.EXAMPLE: an insipid pasta dish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一盘没有味道的意大利面食

Sense.DEF: not interesting, exciting, or attractive
Sense.TRAN: 枯燥无味的﹐不吸引人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: insipid colours
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单调的颜色

Sense.DEF: to say firmly and often that something is true, especially when other people think it may not be true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mike insisted that he was right.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克坚决认为自己是对的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His friends insisted he had no connection with drugs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的朋友坚持说他和毒品无关。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She kept insisting on her innocence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她再三坚称自己无罪。

Sense.DEF: to demand that something should happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stay for supper – I insist!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 留下来吃晚餐——一定的！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They insisted that everyone should come to the party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们坚持要每个人都参加聚会。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He insisted I should take a taxi.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一定要我乘出租车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We insist on the highest standards of cleanliness in the hotel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们坚持宾馆要达到最高的清洁标准。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He insisted upon checking everything himself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坚持要亲自检查一切。

Sense.DEF: used when agreeing to do something that you do not really want to do
Sense.TRAN: 如果你一定要这样〔用来对你并不真正想做的事表示同意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Why don’t you call them up today?’ ‘Oh, if you insist!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你何不今天就给他们打电话？”“噢﹐如果你一定要我这样办的话！”

Sense.DEF: to keep doing something, especially something that is inconvenient or annoying
Sense.TRAN: 坚持做某事〔尤指麻烦或令人讨厌的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She will insist on washing her hair just when I want to have a bath.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想洗澡的时候﹐她一定要洗头。

Exponent.DEF: to say firmly that someone should do something or that something should happen
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She insisted that it was her turn to drive.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坚持说该轮到她来开车了。

Exponent.DEF: to say very strongly and sometimes angrily that you want something or that something must happen
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I wrote a letter to the company, demanding an apology and a refund.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我写信给这家公司﹐坚决要求道歉并退款。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The guards demanded to see her ID.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警卫坚持要看她的身份证。

Exponent.DEF: if you are required to do something, a rule or law says that you must do it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The successful applicant will be required to sign a two-year contract.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 成功的申请人要签一份为期两年的合同。

Exponent.DEF: to say very firmly that something must happen or is right, and refuse to change your mind when other people try to persuade you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The actress has always been adamant about keeping her private life private.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位女演员始终坚持使自己私生活不受打扰。

Exponent.EXP: won’t take no for an answer
Exponent.DEF: to insist that someone must do what you say or ask
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You’re coming home with me – I won’t take no for an answer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得和我一起回家﹐这事不容商量。

Exponent.DEF: to say very firmly that someone must not do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Ed was talking about dropping out of school, but Mom and Dad put their foot down.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃德总说要辍学﹐但妈妈和爸爸坚决反对。

Sense.DEF: when you demand that something should happen and refuse to let anyone say no

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his insistence that they discuss the problem
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坚持要他们讨论这个问题

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an insistence on punctuality
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 坚决主张守时

GramExa.GLOSS: because someone insisted
GramExa.EXAMPLE: At her father’s insistence, she joined them for a drink.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在父亲的坚持下﹐她和他们一起喝了一杯。

Sense.DEF: demanding firmly and repeatedly that something should happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was insistent that they should all meet for dinner.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坚持要大家聚在一起吃晚餐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were insistent on good manners.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们坚持举止要有礼貌。

Sense.DEF: making a continuous pattern of sounds that is difficult to ignore
Sense.EXAMPLE: the music’s insistent rhythm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐持续不断的节拍

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 铃声又响了起来﹐没完没了的。

Sense.DEF: if something remains in situ, it remains in its usual place
the inside part of a shoe, or a piece of cloth, leather etc which is the same shape as your foot that you put inside your shoe
rude and not showing any respect
Sense.EXAMPLE: an insolent tone of voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 傲慢的语气
Sense.EXAMPLE: You insolent child!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这个没礼貌的孩子！

Sense.DEF: an insoluble problem is or seems impossible to solve
Sense.EXAMPLE: insoluble conflicts within the department
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部门内难以调和的冲突

Sense.DEF: an insoluble substance does not become a liquid when you put it into a liquid
an insolvable problem is or seems impossible to solve
not having enough money to pay what you owe
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company was later declared insolvent officially said to be insolvent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司随后被宣布破产。

Sense.DEF: if you suffer from insomnia, you are not able to sleep
someone who cannot sleep easily
to such a degree that
another form of the word inasmuch
a cheerful feeling of not caring or worrying about anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: an air of insouciance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无忧无虑的神态

Sense.DEF: to examine something carefully in order to find out more about it or to find out what is wrong with it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got out of the car to inspect the damage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我下车查看损坏情况。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police inspected the scene and interviewed all the staff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察仔细检查了现场并询问了所有员工。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police will inspect the venue for safety.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察将检查会场的安全性。

Sense.DEF: to make an official visit to a building, organization etc to check that everything is satisfactory and that rules are being obeyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building is regularly inspected by the fire-safety officer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防安全官定期巡视这座大楼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: General Allenby arrived to inspect the troops.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伦比将军前来检阅部队。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say take a look at sth/sb or, in British English, have a look at something or someone rather than inspect something or someone.
F2NBox.TRAN: 日常英语一般说take a look at﹐英国英语则说have a look at﹐而不说inspect
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Can I take a look at your ticket, please?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 请让我看一下你的票好吗？

Sense.DEF: an official visit to a building or organization to check that everything is satisfactory and that rules are being obeyed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: regular inspections of the prison
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对监狱的定期视察

Sense.EXAMPLE: An inspection was carried out at the school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人来学校视察了一遍。

GramExa.GLOSS: an official visit to inspect something

Sense.DEF: a careful examination of something to find out more about it or to check for anything wrong

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Copies of the documents are available for inspection people can look at them at local libraries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地图书馆里有文件可供查阅。

GramExa.GLOSS: when looked at in detail
GramExa.EXAMPLE: However, on closer inspection, a number of problems emerged.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 然而﹐经进一步检查﹐很多问题冒了出来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Close inspection of the plane’s engines revealed several small defects.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机引擎经严格检查后﹐暴露出几处小缺陷。

Sense.DEF: an official whose job is to check that something is satisfactory and that rules are being obeyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: ticket inspectors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查票员
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Health and Safety inspector
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 健康安全督察员
Sense.EXAMPLE: Standards of discipline at the school were strongly criticized in the inspector’s report.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 督察员在报告里狠狠地批评了这所学校的纪律水准。

Sense.DEF: a police officer of middle rank
Sense.EXAMPLE: Inspector Blake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 督察布莱克

Sense.DEF: the group of inspectors who officially inspect schools, factories etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔学校﹑工厂等的〕检查团﹐督察队

Sense.DEF: a government official who calculates what tax each person should pay
a good idea about what you should do, write, say etc, especially one which you get suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Malvern Hills have provided inspiration for many artists and musicians over the decades.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几十年来﹐莫尔文丘陵为很多艺术家和音乐家提供了灵感。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He raised his eyes to the altar as if seeking inspiration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抬头看看祭坛﹐似乎在寻求灵感。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He draws inspiration from ordinary scenes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从日常生活中得到灵感。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mary Quant’s inspiration comes from the glam style of the seventies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛莉·官的灵感来自70年代的魅惑风格。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a sudden flash of inspiration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然灵感闪现。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has always been a source of inspiration for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直是我灵感的源泉。

Sense.DEF: a person, experience, place etc that gives you new ideas for something you do
Sense.TRAN: 给人以灵感的人物[经历﹐地点等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The seascapes of Cape Cod were her inspiration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科德角的海景给她灵感。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was the inspiration for Wordsworth’s poem ‘The Old Huntsman’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是华兹华斯诗作《老猎人》的原型。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel encouraged to be as good, successful etc as possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: People like Tara are an inspiration to us all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像塔拉这样的人鼓舞着我们大家。

Sense.DEF: used to say who made a person or group want to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the spread of improved nursing under the inspiration of Florence Nightingale
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在弗洛伦斯·南丁格尔的鼓舞下﹐改善后的护理工作得以传播

Sense.DEF: providing encouragement or new ideas for what you should do
Sense.TRAN: 启发灵感的﹔鼓舞人心的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jones proved an inspirational figure in Welsh rugby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事实证明﹐琼斯是威尔士橄榄球运动中有感召力的人物。

Sense.DEF: to encourage someone by making them feel confident and eager to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need someone who can inspire the team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要一个能鼓舞团队士气的人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He inspired many young people to take up the sport.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他激励了很多年轻人参与这项运动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I hope this success will inspire you to greater efforts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望这次成功能激励你更加努力。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Inspired by the sunny weather, I decided to explore the woods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阳光明媚的天气令人振奋﹐我决定到森林里寻幽探胜。

Sense.DEF: to make someone have a particular feeling or react in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕产生〔某种感情或反应〕﹐激起﹐唤起
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gandhi’s quiet dignity inspired great respect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 甘地不怒自威﹐令人肃然起敬。

GramExa.GLOSS: make people feel confident because they trust your ability
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His driving hardly inspires confidence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开车的技术让人难以放心。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hospital’s record does not inspire confidence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院以往的记录让人难以信任。

Sense.DEF: to give someone the idea for something, especially a story, painting, poem etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The story was inspired by a chance meeting with an old Russian duke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个故事的创作灵感来自与一位俄国老公爵的不期而遇。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a range of designs inspired by wild flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从野花中得到灵感的一系列设计

Sense.DEF: to breathe in
having very exciting special qualities that are better than anyone or anything else
Sense.EXAMPLE: an inspired leader
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卓越的领导人
Sense.EXAMPLE: an inspired performance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激动人心的表演

Sense.DEF: a good or successful guess, choice etc that is based on inspiration not facts
Sense.TRAN: 凭灵感[直觉]的正确猜测/选择等
Sense.EXAMPLE: In an inspired move, they took on the relatively inexperienced Ray Unwin as director.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们灵机一动﹐让相对来说经验较浅的雷·昂温担任导演。

Sense.DEF: started for political, religious etc reasons
Sense.EXAMPLE: We suspect that the violence was politically inspired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们觉得这次暴力事件是政治因素所致。

Sense.DEF: giving people a feeling of excitement and a desire to do something great
Sense.TRAN: 鼓舞人心的﹔启发灵感的
Sense.EXAMPLE: inspiring music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激励人心的音乐
Sense.EXAMPLE: King was a great orator and an inspiring leader.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金是伟大的演说家和鼓舞人心的领袖。

Sense.DEF: when a situation is not certain because there is the possibility of sudden change
Sense.EXAMPLE: the instability of the market
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市场的变化无常
Sense.EXAMPLE: political instability in the region
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区的政局不稳

Sense.DEF: mental problems that are likely to cause sudden changes of behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 〔可能导致行为突然改变的〕精神不稳定
Sense.EXAMPLE: nervous instability
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 神经错乱

Sense.DEF: to put a piece of equipment somewhere and connect it so that it is ready to be used
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve installed the new computer network at last.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们终于安装了新电脑网络。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Security cameras have been installed in the city centre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在市中心已安装了一些监控摄像机。

Sense.DEF: to add new software to a computer so that it is ready to be used
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve installed new anti-virus software.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经安装了新的杀毒软件。

Sense.DEF: to put someone in an important job or position, especially with a ceremony
Sense.EXAMPLE: Churchill was installed as Chancellor of the university.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丘吉尔被任命为那所大学的名誉校长。

Sense.DEF: to settle somewhere as if you are going to stay for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔打算逗留很长一段时间〕把自己安顿[安置]在〔某地〕

Sense.DEF: when someone fits a piece of equipment somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: the installation and maintenance of alarm systems
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警报系统的安装和维护

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that has been fitted in its place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole computer installation was nearly new.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整套电脑设备几乎是全新的。

Sense.DEF: a place where industrial or military equipment, machinery etc has been put
Sense.EXAMPLE: nuclear installations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 核设施

Sense.DEF: a piece of modern art which can include objects, light, sound etc
Sense.TRAN: 现代雕塑装置〔除物体外还包括光﹑声等〕

Sense.DEF: the ceremony of putting someone in an important job or position
Sense.EXAMPLE: the installation of the new bishop
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新主教的就职仪式

Sense.DEF: a system of paying for goods by a series of small regular payments
one of a series of regular payments that you make until you have paid all the money you owe
Sense.EXAMPLE: the second instalment of a loan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项贷款的第二期还款
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re letting me pay for the washing machine by monthly instalments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们允许我以每月分期付款的方式买下这台洗衣机。

Sense.DEF: one of the parts of a story that appears as a series of parts, especially in a magazine, newspaper etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指报刊等上的连载故事的〕一期
Sense.EXAMPLE: the first instalment of a science fiction trilogy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科幻三部曲小说的第一部

Sense.DEF: for example
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to rethink the way we consume energy. Take, for instance, our approach to transport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要重新考虑我们使用能源的方式﹐例如我们的运输方式。

Sense.DEF: an example of a particular kind of situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They came across many instances of discrimination.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们遇到很多歧视的事例。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: instances where safety regulations have been breached
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 违反安全规章的例子

Sense.EXAMPLE: In this instance I think she was mistaken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这一点上我认为她弄错了。

Sense.DEF: at the beginning of a series of actions
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anyone wishing to join the society should apply in the first instance to the secretary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何人想加入协会都得先向干事提出申请。

Sense.DEF: because of someone’s wish or request
to give something as an example
Sense.EXAMPLE: She instanced the first chapter as proof of his skill in constructing scenes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她以第一章为例阐述他构思情节的技巧。

Sense.DEF: happening or produced immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: an instant success
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马到成功
Sense.EXAMPLE: a system that provides instant access to client information
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能立即查到客户信息的系统
Sense.EXAMPLE: The women took an instant dislike to one another.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些女人立刻就彼此厌恶起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The programme brought an instant response.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 节目立即引起了反响。

Sense.DEF: instant food, coffee etc is in the form of powder and prepared by adding hot water
Sense.TRAN: 〔食物﹑咖啡等〕即食的﹐食用[调制]方便的
Sense.EXAMPLE: instant coffee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 速溶咖啡
Sense.EXAMPLE: instant soup
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 方便汤

Sense.DEF: a moment
Sense.EXAMPLE: She caught his eye for an instant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她刹那间便吸引了他的目光。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the rain started, the crowd vanished in an instant immediately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始下雨了﹐人群转眼间消失无踪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an instant of panic
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 片刻的恐慌

Sense.EXAMPLE: She stepped towards the door and, in that very same instant, the doorbell rang.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走向门口﹐就在此时门铃响了。

Sense.DEF: as soon as something happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: The instant I saw him, I knew he was the man from the restaurant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一看到他就认出他是餐馆里的那个人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jen burst out laughing the instant she walked in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一走进来﹐珍就大笑起来。

Sense.DEF: used when telling someone, especially a child, to do something immediately
Sense.TRAN: 立即﹐现在就〔尤用于催促小孩〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come here this instant!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 立刻过来！

Sense.DEF: happening immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: modern methods of instantaneous communication
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代的即时通信方法

Sense.DEF: immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: All four victims died instantly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 四名受害人全部当即死亡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The information was instantly available.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 信息即时可得。

Sense.DEF: a type of service available on the Internet that allows you to quickly exchange written messages with people that you know
Sense.TRAN: 即时消息〔因特网上让彼此认识的人能够快速交换书面信息的服务〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: instant messaging services
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即时消息服务

Sense.DEF: an important moment in a sports game on television that is shown again immediately after it happens
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视中体育比赛重要画面的〕即时重放﹐即时重播

Sense.DEF: used to say what is not used, does not happen etc, when something else is used, happens etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: You probably picked up my keys instead of yours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可能没拿你的钥匙而错拿了我的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could I have tuna instead of ham?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可否要金枪鱼来代替火腿？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Instead of being annoyed, he seemed quite pleased.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有生气﹐反而似乎很高兴。

Sense.DEF: used to say what is done, when you have just said that a particular thing is not done
Sense.EXAMPLE: Geoff didn’t study law. Instead, he decided to become an actor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰夫没学法律﹐相反﹐他决定当演员。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If Jo can’t attend the meeting, I could go instead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果乔不能去开会﹐我可以代他去。

Sense.DEF: the raised part of your foot between your toes and your ankle
the part of a shoe that covers your instep
to make a process start, especially one relating to law or politics
Sense.TRAN: 开始﹐发起〔尤指与法律或政治有关的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charles instigated a programme of reforms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查尔斯发起改革计划。

Sense.DEF: to persuade someone to do something bad or violent
Sense.EXAMPLE: He accused union leaders of instigating the disturbances.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他指责工会领导人煽动骚乱。

Sense.DEF: because of someone’s suggestion, request, or demand
Sense.TRAN: 在某人的建议[请求﹐要求]下
Sense.EXAMPLE: an inquiry set up at the instigation of the White House
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在白宫的要求下开始进行的调查

Sense.DEF: the act of starting something
to teach someone to think, behave, or feel in a particular way over a period of time
Sense.TRAN: 逐渐灌输[培养]〔思想﹑行为方式或感受〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A manager’s job is to instil determination into his players.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 主教练的工作就是向他的队员灌输必胜的决心。

Sense.DEF: a natural tendency to behave in a particular way or a natural ability to know something, which is not learned

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Animals have a natural instinct for survival.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 动物有求生的自然本能。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the human instinct to form relationships
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类建立起相互关系的天性

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Birds build nests by instinct.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸟凭本能筑巢。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Her instinct told her that something was wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直觉告诉她有些不对劲。

GramExa.GLOSS: what someone feels like doing first when something happens
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His first instinct was to rush back to Isobel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的第一直觉是赶快回到伊莎贝尔那儿。

Sense.DEF: based on instinct and not involving thought
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mother’s instinctive love
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母亲本能的爱

Sense.DEF: instinctive
an organization that has a particular purpose such as scientific or educational work, or the building where this organization is based
Sense.TRAN: 〔从事科研或教育等的〕机构﹔学院﹔研究院
Sense.EXAMPLE: research institutes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究所

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Institute for Space Studies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 太空研究所

Sense.DEF: to introduce or start a system, rule, legal process etc
Sense.TRAN: 制定〔制度﹑规则等〕﹔提出〔诉讼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had no choice but to institute court proceedings against the airline.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们别无选择﹐只能对航空公司提起诉讼。

Sense.DEF: a large organization that has a particular kind of work or purpose

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the government and other political institutions
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府和其他政治机构

Sense.EXAMPLE: powerful institutions such as world banks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诸如世界银行之类的强大机构
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Institution of Electrical Engineers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电机工程师学会

Sense.DEF: an important system of organization in society that has existed for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: social institutions such as the family and religion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家庭和宗教这一类社会制度

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The scandal threatened to undermine the institution of the presidency.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 丑闻可能削弱总统制。

Sense.DEF: a building that people are sent to when they need to be looked after, for example old people or children with no parents – often used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 慈善机构﹔社会福利机构〔常含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was determined not to put my mother in an institution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决意不送母亲去养老院。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mental institution for the mentally ill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神病院

Sense.DEF: when something is started or introduced, especially something relating to the law or politics
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指与法律或政治有关的〕开创﹐制定

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the institution of divorce proceedings
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 离婚诉讼程序的制定

Sense.DEF: if a person, place, event etc is an institution, they have been an important part of a place for a very long time – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 是〔某地长期以来〕重要[出名]的人[地点﹐事件等]〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The British pub isn’t just somewhere to drink – it’s an institution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家英式酒吧不仅仅是喝酒的地方——它享有盛名。

Sense.DEF: relating to an institution
Sense.TRAN: 社会公共机构的﹔机构的
Sense.EXAMPLE: children in institutional care
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受福利机构照顾的儿童

Sense.DEF: institutional attitudes and behaviour have existed for a long time in an organization and have become accepted as normal even though they are bad
Sense.TRAN: 〔态度和行为因存在已久〕已形成制度的﹔惯例的
Sense.EXAMPLE: accusations of institutional racism in the police force
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对警察队伍中已形成风气的种族主义的谴责

Sense.DEF: to put someone in an institution for old people, a mental hospital etc
to make something a normal, accepted part of a social system or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: the struggle to institutionalize equality for women
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使妇女平等制度化的斗争

Sense.DEF: institutionalized attitudes and behaviour have existed for a long time in an organization and have become accepted as normal even though they are bad
Sense.TRAN: 〔态度和行为〕习以为常的﹔约定俗成的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: institutionalized corruption within the state
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国习以为常的腐败风气

Sense.DEF: someone who has become institutionalized has lived for a long time in a prison, mental hospital etc and now cannot easily live outside one
Sense.TRAN: 〔因长期坐牢﹑待在精神病院等而〕无法适应外界生活的

Sense.DEF: forming part of a society or system
Sense.EXAMPLE: institutionalised democracy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 制度化的民主

Sense.DEF: happening within a large shop or store
Sense.EXAMPLE: an in-store bakery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大商场内的面包店

Sense.DEF: to officially tell someone what to do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His secretary was instructed to cancel all his engagements.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的秘书接到通知﹐取消他所有的预约。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The judge immediately instructed that Beattie be released.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官立即宣布释放贝蒂。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Eva went straight to the hotel, as instructed as she had been told.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊娃按照指示径直去了宾馆。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had instructed the slaves what to say when questioned.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他指示奴隶们在受到盘问时要说些什么。

Sense.DEF: to teach someone something, or show them how to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Greater effort is needed to instruct children in road safety.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在指导儿童注意道路安全方面需要更大的努力。

GramExa.PROPFORM: instruct sb how to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Employees are instructed how to make a complaint.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇员接受如何投诉的训练。

Sense.DEF: to officially tell someone about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was instructed that £20,000 had been paid into my account.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得到通知两万英镑已存入我的账户。

Sense.DEF: to employ a lawyer to represent you in court
the written information that tells you how to do or use something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Press ‘Enter’ and follow the on-screen instructions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按回车键﹐然后按照电脑屏幕上的指示来操作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Both products come with instructions for use.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个产品都附有使用指南。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are there any instructions on how to plant the trees?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有没有植树指南？

Sense.DEF: a statement telling someone what they must do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had specific instructions to check everyone’s identity cards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他接到明确指示﹐要检查每个人的身份证。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mrs Edwards gave instructions that she was not to be disturbed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱德华兹夫人吩咐不要打扰她。

GramExa.GLOSS: having been told by someone to do something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: On the landlord’s instructions, the barmaid refused to serve him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 按照店主的指示﹐这位酒吧女侍应拒绝为他服务。

Sense.EXAMPLE: My instructions are I have been told to give the package to him personally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我接到的指示是亲手把包裹交给他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure you carry out the doctor’s instructions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一定要遵照医生的嘱咐。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be under instruction to do sth
GramExa.GLOSS: to have been told to do something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police were under instruction to fire if necessary.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察得到指示﹐在必要的情况下可以开枪。

Sense.DEF: teaching that you are given in a particular skill or subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: religious instruction
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宗教教义
Sense.EXAMPLE: driving instruction
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 驾驶技术指导

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The school gives instruction in first aid.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所学校教授急救课。

GramExa.GLOSS: being taught
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This group of trainees is still under instruction.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这组实习生还在受训。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do what the instructions tell you to do
Collocate.EXAMPLE: You should follow the instructions on the packet.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该遵照包装上的用法说明。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Always read the instructions before switching on the machine.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 启动机器之前一定要阅读操作指南。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: give someone instructions
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Detailed instructions are supplied with the software.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 软件附有详细的操作指南。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The tent comes with instructions on how to put it up.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 帐篷附有如何搭建的使用指南。

Collocate.COLLOC: the instructions say/tell you to do sth
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 说明上写着如何做某事
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The instructions say that you should take the tablets after meals.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 说明书上说这药片应饭后服用。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The instructions that I got with the phone weren&apos;t very clear.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我拿到的手机上所附的使用指南说得不很清楚。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There are detailed instructions on the back of the box.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 盒子背面有详细的使用说明。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Each member of the team was issued with written instructions.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个队员都发给了书面指示。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very detailed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There are comprehensive instructions for completing and filing the new tax form.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如何填写并提交新税表有很详细的说明。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: giving details of each thing you should do in order
Collocate.EXAMPLE: This book gives step-by-step instructions for making curtains.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书一步步教你制作窗帘。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the instructions given by the company that made something
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 生产商提供的使用说明

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The instruction manual for the camera is over 150 pages long.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这相机的使用说明书长达150多页。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 使用说明的小册子/散页印刷品/单页纸片

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘instructions how to do something’ or 或 'instructions to do something’. Say 而要说 instructions on how to do something.

Sense.DEF: providing instruction

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a free instructional video
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 免费教学录像带

Sense.DEF: providing a lot of useful information
Sense.TRAN: 有教育意义的﹔有启发性的﹔增长知识的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thank you, that was very instructive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢﹐这很有启发性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an instructive comparison
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有启发性的比较

Sense.DEF: someone who teaches a sport or practical skill
Sense.TRAN: 〔运动或技艺的〕指导员﹐教练﹐导师
Sense.EXAMPLE: a driving instructor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 驾驶教练
Sense.EXAMPLE: ski instructors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滑雪教练

Sense.DEF: someone who teaches in an American college or university and who has a rank below assistant professor
Sense.EXAMPLE: a social studies instructor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会科学讲师

Sense.DEF: a small tool used in work such as science or medicine
Sense.TRAN: 〔科学﹑医学等工作用的小巧的〕器械﹐器具
Sense.EXAMPLE: surgical instruments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外科(手术)器械

Sense.DEF: an object used for producing music, such as a piano or violin
Sense.EXAMPLE: electronic instruments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子乐器

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 铜管乐器/管乐器/打击乐器/弦乐器等

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment for measuring and showing distance, speed, temperature etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a failure of the flight instruments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞行仪表的失灵
Sense.EXAMPLE: sensitive earthquake-detecting instruments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灵敏的地震探测仪

Sense.DEF: something or someone that is used to get a particular result
Sense.TRAN: 促成某事的物[人]﹔手段﹐方法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Interest rates are an important instrument of economic policy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利率是经济政策的重要调控手段。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Good management should be an instrument for innovation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 良好的管理应当是创新所必需的手段。

Sense.DEF: something that is used to hit or hurt someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Death was due to a blow on the head with a blunt instrument.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 死亡是由于钝器击中头部所致。

GramExa.GLOSS: an object used to make people suffer pain until they give information

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is used by a power beyond our control
Sense.TRAN: 受命运/上帝摆布的人[物]

Sense.DEF: formal to be important in making something happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was instrumental in developing links with European organizations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在建立与欧洲各组织之间的联系中起了重要作用。

Sense.DEF: instrumental music is for instruments, not for voices
a piece of music in which no voices are used, only instruments
someone who plays a musical instrument
the way in which a piece of music is arranged to be played by several different instruments
the set of instruments used to help in controlling a machine
Sense.EXAMPLE: aircraft instrumentation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机仪表

Sense.DEF: the board in front of the pilot of an aircraft, where all the instruments are
when someone refuses to obey a person who has more authority than them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Howell was fired for gross insubordination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 豪厄尔因为严重违抗命令被开除。

Sense.DEF: not solid, large, strong, or definite
Sense.TRAN: 不坚实的﹔不大的﹔脆弱的﹔不明确的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The evidence seemed very insubstantial.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 证据看起来很不可靠。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an insubstantial meal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不丰盛的一顿饭
Sense.EXAMPLE: the insubstantial outline of a ship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一艘船不清晰的轮廓

Sense.DEF: not existing as a real object or person
Sense.EXAMPLE: insubstantial ghosts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虚幻的幽灵

Sense.DEF: extremely annoying or unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: an insufferable bully
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人讨厌的欺凌弱小者
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heat was insufferable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酷热难耐。

Sense.DEF: not enough, or not great enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: Insufficient resources have been devoted to the health service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用于医疗保健服务的资源不足。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His salary was insufficient for their needs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的薪水不足以满足他们的需求。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The heating is insufficient to kill the bacteria.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加热不足以杀死这种细菌。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: At the moment, there’s insufficient evidence to arrest anyone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在证据不充分﹐不能逮捕任何人。

Sense.DEF: interested in your own group, country, way of life etc and no others – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 思想狭隘的﹔保守的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an insular community
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保守封闭的社团
Sense.EXAMPLE: the insular world of the law
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保守的法律界

Sense.DEF: relating to or like an island
to cover or protect something with a material that stops electricity, sound, heat etc from getting in or out

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pipes may need insulating against the cold.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 管道可能需要隔温以防冰冻。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an insulated attic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 隔热[隔音]的阁楼

Sense.DEF: to keep someone apart from particular experiences or influences, especially unpleasant ones
Sense.TRAN: 使免除〔尤指不愉快的经历〕﹔使免受〔尤指不良影响〕﹔隔离

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The royal family tried to insulate him from the prying eyes of the media.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 王室想使他避开媒体窥视的目光。

Sense.DEF: a type of sticky tape used for wrapping around electric wires to insulate them
when something is insulated or someone insulates something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good insulation can save you money on heating bills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好的隔热效果能节省暖气费。

Sense.DEF: material used to insulate something, especially a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: glass-fibre insulation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玻璃纤维绝缘材料

Sense.DEF: a material or object which does not allow electricity, heat, or sound to pass through it
Sense.TRAN: 绝缘体﹔隔热材料﹔隔音材料
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wood is an excellent insulator.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 木材是很好的绝缘体。

Sense.DEF: a substance produced naturally by your body which allows sugar to be used for energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: diabetic patients requiring insulin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胰岛素依赖型糖尿病患者

Sense.DEF: to offend someone by saying or doing something they think is rude
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nobody insults my family and gets away with it!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁也别想侮辱了我的家人之后就这么算了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope Andy won’t be insulted if I don’t come.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我不来﹐希望安迪不要介意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They insult us by ignoring our complaints.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对我们的投诉不理不睬﹐这是在侮辱我们。

Sense.DEF: to say or do something that suggests you think someone is stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: I won’t insult your intelligence by lying. Yes, I told him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想撒谎来侮辱你的智商。是﹐我告诉他了。

Sense.DEF: a remark or action that is offensive or deliberately rude
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was shouting insults at her boyfriend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她正对她的男朋友高声辱骂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: $200 for all that work? It’s an insult.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干那么多工作才给200美元？这简直是侮辱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their offer was so low I took it as an insult thought it was meant to be an insult.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的出价太低﹐我认为是一种侮辱。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be an insult to sb’s intelligence
Sense.DEF: to offend someone by being too simple or stupid
Sense.TRAN: 〔因过于简单或愚蠢而〕是对某人智商的侮辱
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some advertising is an insult to our intelligence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些广告对我们的智商是一种侮辱。

Sense.DEF: very rude and offensive to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: insulting remarks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 侮辱性的言论

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sexist language is insulting to women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 性别歧视的语言对妇女有冒犯意味。

Sense.DEF: an insuperable difficulty or problem is impossible to deal with
Sense.TRAN: 〔困难或问题〕不能克服的﹐无法解决的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were insuperable obstacles, and the plan was abandoned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于存在无法克服的障碍﹐计划被放弃了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As usual, the hero was facing insuperable odds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 照例﹐男主角遇到了无法克服的困难。

Sense.DEF: extremely bad or annoying
Sense.EXAMPLE: insupportable pain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难以忍受的疼痛
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her behaviour was insupportable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的举止令人讨厌。

Sense.DEF: an arrangement with a company in which you pay them money, especially regularly, and they pay the costs if something bad happens, for example if you become ill or your car is damaged
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your father took out insurance to cover the mortgage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你父亲购买了抵押借款保险。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: insurance against loss of income due to unemployment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业造成的收入损失保险

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you have insurance on your house and its contents?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你买住房和家庭财产险了吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: get an insurance company to pay for something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We can probably claim the damage on our insurance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们也许可以向保险公司索赔损失。

Sense.DEF: the business of providing insurance
Sense.EXAMPLE: My brother works in insurance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的兄弟从事保险业。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the insurance industry
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保险业

Sense.DEF: the money that you pay regularly to an insurance company

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How much is the insurance on your car?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你车子的保险费是多少？

Sense.DEF: protection against something bad happening

GramExa.EXAMPLE: An extra lock on the door is an added insurance against burglars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 门上再加一把锁是额外的防盗保障。

Sense.DEF: someone who is employed by an insurance company to decide how much to pay people who have had an accident, had something stolen etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔保险公司聘请的〕损失理算师

Sense.DEF: someone who arranges and sells insurance as their job
Sense.TRAN: 保险经纪人﹐保险代理人

Sense.DEF: a written agreement for insurance with an insurance company
the money that you pay regularly to an insurance company
to buy insurance so that you will receive money if something bad happens to you, your family, your possessions etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you insured the contents of your home?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你给家庭财产投保了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is wise to insure your property against storm damage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为防风暴造成损毁而给财产买保险是明智之举。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You should insure the painting for at least £100,000.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画你至少应该投保十万英镑。

Sense.DEF: to provide insurance for something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many companies won’t insure young drivers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多公司都不愿意为年轻的司机承保。

Sense.DEF: an American spelling of ensure
to protect yourself against the risk of something bad happening by planning or preparing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take advice to insure yourself against being misled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听取意见以免被误导。

Sense.DEF: if someone or something is insured, there is insurance relating to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Apparently the jewellery wasn’t insured.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些珠宝似乎没有投保。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m not insured to drive Anne’s car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 开安妮的车﹐我不享受保险。

Sense.DEF: the person or people who are insured
a person or company that provides insurance
an attempt by a group of people to take control of their government using force and violence
one of a group of people fighting against the government of their own country, or against authority
Sense.EXAMPLE: communist insurgents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 共产党起义者

Sense.DEF: an insurmountable difficulty or problem is too large or difficult to deal with
Sense.TRAN: 〔困难〕难以克服的﹐不可逾越的﹔〔问题〕难以处理的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The language difference proved an insurmountable barrier.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言差异是难以克服的障碍。

Sense.DEF: an attempt by a large group of people within a country to take control using force and violence

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an armed insurrection against the party in power
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对执政党的武装暴动

Sense.DEF: not broken, damaged, or spoiled
Sense.TRAN: 完好无损的﹐未受损伤的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only the medieval tower had remained intact.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有这座中世纪塔楼保存完好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His reputation survived intact.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的声望丝毫未受影响。

Sense.DEF: the art of cutting patterns into a hard substance, or the pattern that you get by doing this
the amount of food, drink etc that you take into your body
Sense.TRAN: 〔食物﹑饮料等的〕摄入量﹐摄取量﹐吸入量

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Try to reduce your intake of fat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量减少脂肪的摄入量。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a high intake of carbohydrates
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 碳水化合物的大量摄入

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sickness may develop from inadequate fluid intake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 液体摄入不足会诱发疾病。

Sense.DEF: the number of people who join a school, profession etc at a particular time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an intake of around 120 students each year
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年大约120人的招生名额

Sense.DEF: a tube, pipe, etc through which air, gas, or liquid enters a machine
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器上空气﹑气体或液体注入的〕管道﹐进口
Sense.EXAMPLE: a leak on the air intake to the carburettor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽化器进气口的裂缝

Sense.DEF: a sudden act of breathing in, especially when you are shocked
Sense.TRAN: 倒吸一口气〔尤在吃惊时〕

Sense.DEF: an intangible quality or feeling is difficult to describe exactly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The island has an intangible quality of holiness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该岛屿有一种难以形容的神圣感。

Sense.DEF: intangible things have value but do not exist physically – used in business
Sense.TRAN: 无形的〔指东西有价值但没有实体存在﹐用于商业中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: intangible assets such as customer goodwill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诸如顾客信誉之类的无形资产

RunOn.EXAMPLE: intangibles like pension schemes and holidays
RunOn.REGISTERLAB: 像养老金计划和假期之类的无形福利

Sense.DEF: a whole number
Sense.EXAMPLE: 6 is an integer, but 6.4 is not.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 6是整数﹐而6.4不是。

Sense.DEF: forming a necessary part of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于构成整体〕必需的﹐不可缺少的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vegetables are an integral part of our diet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蔬菜是我们膳食中不可缺少的一部分。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Statistics are integral to medical research.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 统计数字是医学研究中不可或缺的。

Sense.DEF: provided as part of something, rather than being separate
Sense.TRAN: 作为组成部分的﹔内置的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a TV and integral video recorder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内置录像机的电视

Sense.DEF: if two or more things integrate, or if you integrate them, they combine or work together in a way that makes something more effective（
Sense.TRAN: 使）合并﹐（使）结合〔从而变得更有效〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Colourful illustrations are integrated into the text.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 课文里配有彩色插图。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Transport planning should be integrated with energy policy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 运输计划应与能源政策结合起来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: computers of different makes that integrate with each other
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 连接在一起的不同品牌的电脑

Sense.DEF: to become part of a group or society and be accepted by them, or to help someone do this（
Sense.TRAN: 使）融入〔某群体或社会〕﹔（使）成为一体

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re looking for people who can integrate with a team.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在寻求能融入团队的人。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many children with learning difficulties are integrated into ordinary schools.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多有学习障碍的儿童融入到普通学校里了。

Sense.DEF: to end the practice of separating people of different races in schools, colleges etc
an integrated system, institution etc combines many different groups, ideas, or parts in a way that works well
Sense.TRAN: 〔各组成部分〕相互协调的﹐综合的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an integrated public transport system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 综合公共交通体系
Sense.EXAMPLE: a racially integrated community
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个各种族和谐相处的社会

Sense.DEF: a very small set of electronic connections printed on a single piece of semiconductor material instead of being made from separate parts
the combining of two or more things so that they work together effectively

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the integration of data from other surveys
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对其他调查数据的整合

Sense.DEF: when people become part of a group or society and are accepted by them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The family unit is supported by its integration into a wider social network.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个家庭由于融入更广阔的社会关系网而得到帮助。

Sense.DEF: the process of getting people of different races to live and work together instead of separately
Sense.EXAMPLE: problems of racial integration
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 种族融合的问题

Sense.DEF: the quality of being honest and strong about what you believe to be right

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a man of great moral integrity
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 道德高尚﹑正直诚实的人

Sense.DEF: the state of being united as one complete thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: the territorial integrity of the country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国家的领土完整

Sense.DEF: something such as a shell which covers something else
the ability to understand things and to think intelligently
Sense.TRAN: 智力﹔领悟力﹔理解力﹔思维能力

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He combined a formidable intellect with a talent for speaking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不但智力超群﹐而且口才出众。

Sense.DEF: someone who is very intelligent
relating to the ability to understand things and think intelligently

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a job that requires considerable intellectual effort
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 颇费脑力的工作

Sense.DEF: an intellectual person is well-educated and interested in serious ideas and subjects such as science, literature etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark’s very intellectual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克很聪明。

Sense.DEF: needing serious thought in order to be understood
Sense.EXAMPLE: an intellectual film
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高智商电影

Sense.DEF: an intelligent, well-educated person who spends time thinking about complicated ideas and discussing them
Sense.EXAMPLE: a leading British intellectual
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位顶尖的英国知识分子

Sense.DEF: to think or talk about something in a serious complicated way, especially rather than expressing your feelings（
Sense.TRAN: 对…）作理论性探究﹔（使）理智化

Sense.DEF: something which someone has invented or has the right to make or sell, especially something that cannot legally be copied by other people

Subsense.DEF: the ability to learn, understand, and think about things
Subsense.EXAMPLE: To be good at the game, you need a reasonable level of intelligence.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要想把这种游戏玩好﹐需要一定的智力水平。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: John showed high intelligence from an early age.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰很早就显现出高智力。

Subsense.DEF: a high level of this ability
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a woman who had both beauty and intelligence
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 秀外慧中的女子

Subsense.DEF: information about the secret activities of foreign governments, the military plans of an enemy etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: According to our intelligence, further attacks were planned.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据我们的情报﹐还会有更进一步的攻击。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Intelligence sources denied the reports.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 消息人士否认该报告的真实性。

Subsense.DEF: a group of people or an organization that gathers this information for their government

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In Britain there are three main intelligence organizations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国有三个主要的情报机构。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: US Military Intelligence
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国军事情报处

Sense.DEF: an intelligent person has a high level of mental ability and is good at understanding ideas and thinking clearly
Sense.TRAN: 有智慧的﹐聪明的﹐悟性强的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a group of highly intelligent very intelligentstudents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一组聪明异常的学生
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sontag was once famously described as the most intelligent woman in America.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑塔格曾被称为美国最聪明的女人﹐这是众人皆知的事。

Sense.DEF: an intelligent comment, question, conversation etc shows that you have thought about something carefully and understand it well
Sense.TRAN: 〔评论﹑问题﹑谈话等〕机智的﹐有才智的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an intelligent question
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机智的问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t have an intelligent conversation with him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不可能和他进行有见地的谈话。

Sense.DEF: an intelligent creature is able to think and understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are there intelligent beings on other planets?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在其他行星上是否存在着有智力的生物？
Sense.EXAMPLE: forms of intelligent life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有智慧的生命形式

Sense.DEF: an intelligent machine, system etc is able to learn and use information

Exponent.DEF: having a high level of mental ability, and good at thinking clearly and understanding ideas
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The top universities aim to select the most intelligent students.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 顶尖的大学力争挑到最聪明的学生。

Exponent.DEF: intelligent, so that you can think and learn quickly and find ways to solve problems
Exponent.EXAMPLE: That was very clever of you. How did you do that?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真聪明,你是怎么做到的？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I wasn’t smart enough to be a lawyer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不够聪明,当不了律师。

Exponent.DEF: intelligent – used especially about children and young people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s a very bright kid.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个很聪明的小孩。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the brightest student in the class
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 班上最聪明的学生

Exponent.DEF: extremely intelligent and good at the work you do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a brilliant scientist
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位才华横溢的科学家

Exponent.DEF: a gifted child is much more intelligent than most other children
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a special school for gifted children
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 天才儿童学校

Exponent.DEF: able to make good decisions and give sensible advice, especially because you have a lot of experience
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指因阅历丰富〕有智慧的,明智的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a wise old man
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位睿智的老人

Exponent.DEF: good at using your intelligence to get what you want, often by making secret plans or tricking people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was cunning enough to keep this latest piece of information secret.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很有心计,对这条最新消息秘而不宣。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s a crafty old devil!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个诡计多端的老狐狸。

Exponent.DEF: intelligent and good at studying
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My sister is the brainy one in our family.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我姐姐是我们家里的聪明人。

Sense.DEF: the belief that living things were designed by an intelligent god, rather than developing by natural processes
Sense.TRAN: 智能设计论﹐智慧设计论〔认为生物是由智慧的神设计的﹐而非通过自然过程进化而成的一种理论〕

Sense.DEF: the people in a society who are most highly educated and who are most interested in new ideas, especially in art, literature, or politics
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指艺术﹑文学或政界的〕知识分子﹔知识阶层

Sense.DEF: if speech, writing, or an idea is intelligible, it can be easily understood
Sense.TRAN: 〔言语﹑文章或想法〕明白易懂的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His reply was barely intelligible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的回复几乎让人听不懂。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The report needs to be intelligible to the client.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告得让客户能看懂。

Sense.DEF: intemperate language or behaviour shows a lack of control, which other people think is unacceptable
Sense.TRAN: 〔语言或行为〕无节制的﹐过度的﹐放纵的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the judge’s intemperate outburst
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 裁判员的情绪失控

Sense.DEF: regularly drinking too much alcohol
to have something in your mind as a plan or purpose

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I intend to spend the night there.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打算在那儿过夜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I didn’t intend her to see the painting until it was finished.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不打算在画还没有完成时就让她看。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I never intended things to turn out the way they did.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从未想过事情的结果是那样的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is intended that these meetings will become a regular event.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 计划中这些会议将定期召开。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We intend looking at the situation again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们想再次审视局势。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I fully intend definitely intend to return home next year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已打定主意明年回家。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say plan to dosomething or plan on doingsomething, rather than intend to do something or intend doing something.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说plan to do something或plan on doing something,而不说intend to do something或intend doing something
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I plan tospend the night there.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打算在那里过夜。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I didn’t plan on things taking so long. OR 或 I didn’t plan forthings to take so long.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没想过事情要花那么长时间。

Sense.DEF: to be provided or designed for a particular person or purpose
Sense.TRAN: 是为某人/某事物而提供[设计]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book is intended for children aged 5-7.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书是专为五至七岁儿童写的。

Sense.DEF: the person, thing, result etc that an action is intended to affect or reach
Sense.TRAN: 预期的目标/被害人/目的地等
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seems likely that General Rogers was the killer’s intended victim.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗杰斯将军看来是杀手袭击的目标。

Exponent.DEF: to have decided that you want to do something at some time in the future
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He intends to appeal against the decision.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打算对判决提出上诉。

Exponent.DEF: to intend to do something – used when you have made definite arrangements to do it
Exponent.TRAN: 〔已作出确切安排〕打算做某事
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We’re going to have a meeting about it next week.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 下周我们打算为此事开个会。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m going to start karate lessons.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打算开始上空手道课。

Exponent.DEF: to intend to do something – used especially when you forget to do something or when something does not happen in the way you intended
Exponent.TRAN: （原来）打算做某事〔尤用于忘了做某事或事情发生的方式与原先设想的不同时〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve been meaning to call you for ages.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直想给你打电话来着。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sorry, I didn’t mean to scare you.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 很抱歉,我没想要吓着你。

Exponent.DEF: to intend to do something – used especially when you have thought carefully about how and when you will do it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The airline plans to start flights to Thailand in July.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 航空公司计划7月开通去泰国的航班。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jane and Rob are planning to get married next year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 简和罗布计划明年结婚。

Exponent.DEF: to intend to do something – used when someone is very determined and knows clearly what they want to do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He set out to make a movie that would challenge people’s prejudices.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一心要拍一部挑战大众偏见的影片。

Exponent.DEF: to intend to do something – used when saying what someone hopes to achieve
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We aim to finish the work by next week.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们力争到下周把工作完成。

Exponent.DEF: to intend to do something – used when saying what someone suggests doing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How do you propose to deal with the situation?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于如何处理这一情况你有何建议？

Exponent.DEF: to imagine that something is the kind of thing that you want to happen, or that someone is the person you want to choose
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘How about going out for a pizza?’ ‘That wasn’t exactly what I had in mind.’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “出去吃比萨怎么样？”“我原来想吃的并不是比萨。”
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Who do you have in mind?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想选的是谁？

Exponent.EXP: have no intention of doing sth
Exponent.DEF: to have decided that you will definitely not do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Tom has no intention of retiring just yet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆还不想退休。

Sense.DEF: having a very strong effect or felt very strongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young people today are under intense pressure to succeed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今的年轻人面临要出人头地的巨大压力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the intense heat of the desert
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙漠的炽热
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pain was so intense I couldn’t sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疼得我都睡不着觉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took an intense interest in all religious matters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对所有宗教事宜都很感兴趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a look of intense dislike
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极端厌恶的表情

Sense.DEF: intense activity is very serious, uses a lot of effort, and often involves doing a great deal in a very short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The job demands intense concentration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这工作需要全神贯注。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At least 3,000 people were killed in a week of intense fighting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一周的激战至少有3,000人死亡。

Sense.DEF: someone who is intense is serious and has very strong feelings or opinions – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔感情或意见〕极为强烈的﹐极为严肃的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a little too intense for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对我来说她有点太严肃了。

Sense.DEF: a word, usually an adverb, that is used to emphasize an adjective, adverb, or verb, for example the word ‘absolutely’ in the phrase ‘that’s absolutely wonderful’
Sense.TRAN: 强调成分﹔强调语〔一般是副词﹐用于强调形容词﹑副词或动词﹐如that’s absolutely wonderful中的absolutely〕

Sense.DEF: to increase in degree or strength, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: In Junethe civil war intensified.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 6月份内战更加激烈了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His mother’s death intensified his loneliness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母亲的过世使他感到更加孤单。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: an intensification of fighting in the region

Sense.DEF: the quality of being felt very strongly or having a strong effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: The intensity of the hurricane was frightening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飓风的猛烈程度令人恐惧。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being serious and having very strong feelings or opinions
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spoke with great intensity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他言辞激烈。

Sense.DEF: the strength of something such as light or sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: an instrument which measures light intensity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 测量光的强度的仪器

Sense.DEF: involving a lot of activity, effort, or careful attention in a short period of time
Sense.TRAN: 〔在短时间内〕强化的﹐加强的﹔密集的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a one-week intensive course in English
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为期一周的英语强化课程
Sense.EXAMPLE: a day of intensive negotiations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧张谈判的一天

Sense.DEF: farming which produces a lot of food from a small area of land
involving or needing a lot of energy, knowledge etc
Sense.TRAN: 能源密集型的/知识密集型的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a knowledge-intensive industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 知识密集型的行业

Sense.DEF: a department in a hospital that treats people who are very seriously ill or badly injured, or the continuous and thorough treatment given to patients there
Sense.TRAN: 〔医院里的〕重症监护（部）﹐特别护理（部）

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is still in intensive care in Bristol General Hospital.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他仍住在布里斯托尔综合医院的重症监护病房。

Sense.DEF: to be determined to do something or achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was intent on pursuing a career in business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决意要在商界谋求一职。

Sense.DEF: giving careful attention to something so that you think about nothing else
Sense.EXAMPLE: his intent gaze
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他专注的凝视

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Intent upon her work, she didn’t notice the cold.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她专注于工作﹐忘记了寒冷。

Sense.DEF: what you intend to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: She behaved foolishly but with good intent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她干了蠢事﹐却是出于一片好意。

Sense.DEF: the intention to do something illegal

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jones was found guilty of wounding with intent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼斯被裁定犯有蓄意伤害罪。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is charged with possession of a gun with intent to commit a robbery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被控持枪意图抢劫。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a situation is not exactly as you describe it, but the effect is the same as if it were
Sense.EXAMPLE: The war was, to all intents and purposes, over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争实际上已结束。

Sense.DEF: a plan or desire to do something

GramExa.PROPFORM: have no/every intention of doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have no intention of retiring just yet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在还没打算退休。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They went into town with the intention of visiting the library.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们进了城﹐打算参观图书馆。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is our intention to be the number one distributor of health products.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的目标是成为保健产品第一大批发商。

GramExa.GLOSS: intentions to do something good or kind, especially when you do not succeed in doing it
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 良好的意向〔尤用于事情没做成时〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He thinks the minister is full of good intentions that won’t be carried out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他认为部长的想法是出于一片好意﹐却很难付诸实践。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say that不要说someone ‘has no intention to do something’. Say that而要说someone has no intention of doing something.

Sense.DEF: done deliberately and usually intended to cause harm
Sense.EXAMPLE: I did trip him, but it wasn’t intentional.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的确把他绊倒了﹐但不是故意的。

Sense.DEF: to bury a dead person
between or involving two or more different things, places, or people
Sense.EXAMPLE: interdepartmental between or involving different departments in a company, government etc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各部门之间的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an interstate a road that goes between states
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 州际公路

Sense.DEF: if people interact with each other, they talk to each other, work together etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lucy interacts well with other children in the class.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 露西和班里的其他孩子相处得很好。

Sense.DEF: if one thing interacts with another, or if they interact, they affect each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The immune system interacts with both the nervous system and the hormones.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 免疫系统与神经系统及激素相互影响。

Sense.DEF: a process by which two or more things affect each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Price is determined through the interaction of demand and supply.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格是通过供需消长而定的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the complex interaction between mind and body
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 身心之间复杂的相互作用

Sense.DEF: the activity of talking to other people, working together with them etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the degree of interaction between teacher and student
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 师生之间交流的程度

Sense.DEF: an interactive computer program, television system etc allows you to communicate directly with it, and does things in reaction to your actions
Sense.TRAN: 〔人与计算机程序﹑电视系统等〕交互的﹐互动的
Sense.EXAMPLE: interactive computer systems
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 交互式电脑系统
Sense.EXAMPLE: the museum’s interactive exhibits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 博物馆的互动展品

Sense.DEF: involving talking and working together
Sense.EXAMPLE: interactive teaching methods such as role playing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诸如角色扮演等的互动教学法

Sense.DEF: a large board, for example in a classroom, which is connected to a computer so that information from the computer can be shown on it and controlled by touching the board
Sense.TRAN: 交互式电子白板﹐互动式电子白板〔教室内与计算机连接的一种大型电子板﹐可显示计算机内的信息﹐以触摸板面的方式进行操控〕

Sense.DEF: between or involving different organizations or different departments within a government
Sense.TRAN: 〔政府内〕组织之间的﹔部门间的
Sense.EXAMPLE: interagency co-operation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部门间的合作
Sense.EXAMPLE: an interagency task force
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跨部门特别工作组

Sense.DEF: among other things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The paper discussed, inter alia, political, economic, and social issues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了其他方面之外﹐这篇论文还讨论了政治﹑经济和社会问题。

Sense.DEF: to produce young animals from parents of different breeds or groups （
to speak in support of someone, especially in order to try to prevent them from being punished
Sense.TRAN: 代为请求﹐说情〔尤指使免受惩罚〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My good friend, Senator Bowie, interceded with the authorities on my behalf.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的好友鲍伊参议员为我向当局求情。

Sense.DEF: to stop something or someone that is going from one place to another before they get there
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to intercept drugs being smuggled over the border
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阻截毒品走私入境的努力
Sense.EXAMPLE: His phone calls were intercepted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的电话被截听了。

Sense.DEF: when someone talks to a person in authority in order to prevent something bad happening to someone else
a prayer asking for someone to be helped or cured
an exchange, especially of ideas or thoughts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the interchange of ideas between students and staff
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生与教职员之间的意见交换

Sense.DEF: a point where two or more motorways or main roads meet
Sense.TRAN: 〔高速公路的〕立体交叉道﹐互通式立交

Sense.DEF: to put each of two things in the place of the other, or to be exchanged in this way（
Sense.TRAN: 使）〔两者〕交换位置﹔（使）互换

Sense.DEF: things that are interchangeable can be used instead of each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: These two words are almost interchangeable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个单词几乎可以互换使用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a camera with interchangeable lenses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可换镜头的照相机

Sense.DEF: happening between two or more cities, or going from one city to another
Sense.TRAN: 城市之间的﹔往来于城市之间的
Sense.EXAMPLE: intercity rivalry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市之间的竞争
Sense.EXAMPLE: intercity trains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城际火车

Sense.DEF: intercollegiate competitions, especially sports competitions, happen between teams from different colleges
Sense.TRAN: 学院之间的〔尤指体育比赛〕

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 大学校际田径运动/体育运动等

Sense.DEF: a communication system by which people in different parts of a building, aircraft etc can speak to each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔楼房﹑飞机等的〕内部通话系统
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pilot’s voice came over the intercom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内部通话系统里传来了飞行员的声音。

Sense.DEF: if two systems, places etc are interconnected, or if they interconnect, they are joined together（
Sense.TRAN: 使）〔两个系统﹑地方等〕相连
Sense.EXAMPLE: a series of interconnected lakes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一连串相互连接的湖泊
Sense.EXAMPLE: interconnecting rooms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相连的房间
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our operating system can now interconnect with other networks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的操作系统现在能和其他网络相连。

Sense.DEF: if two facts, ideas, events etc are interconnected, or if they interconnect, they are related and one is affected by or caused by the other（
Sense.TRAN: 使）〔两个事实﹑思想﹑事件等〕相互联系﹐（使）相互关联
Sense.EXAMPLE: In Freud’s theory, the two areas of sexuality and violence are interconnected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按照弗洛伊德的理论﹐性和暴力这两个方面是相互关联的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a number of separate but interconnected issues
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些独立但相互关联的问题

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the interconnection between rich and poor countries
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 富有国家和贫穷国家之间的相互联系

Sense.DEF: going from one continent to another, or happening between two continents
Sense.TRAN: 洲际的﹔往来于洲与洲之间的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an intercontinental flight
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洲际飞行
Sense.EXAMPLE: intercontinental trade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洲际贸易

Sense.DEF: the act of having sex
an exchange of ideas, feelings etc which make people or groups understand each other better
Sense.EXAMPLE: social intercourse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社交

Sense.DEF: if a film is intercut with particular pictures, sounds, or music, they appear in different places during the film
between or involving Christians from different groups
Sense.TRAN: 〔基督教〕教派之间的﹐涉及不同教派的

Sense.DEF: between or involving different departments of a company, government etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司﹑政府等〕部门之间的﹐牵涉不同部门的
Sense.EXAMPLE: intense interdepartmental rivalry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部门之间的激烈竞争

Sense.DEF: a situation in which people or things depend on each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the interdependence of our body’s immune and nervous systems
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人体免疫系统和神经系统之间的相互依存

Sense.DEF: depending on or necessary to each other
Sense.TRAN: 互相依存的﹔互相需要的
Sense.EXAMPLE: countries with interdependent economies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济上相互依赖的国家

Sense.DEF: an official order from a court telling someone not to do something
a punishment in the Roman Catholic Church, by which someone is not allowed to take part in church ceremonies
Sense.TRAN: 禁罚〔天主教禁止某人参加教会仪式作为惩罚〕

Sense.DEF: involving ideas, information, or people from different subjects or areas of study
Sense.EXAMPLE: an interdisciplinary research centre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跨学科研究中心

Sense.DEF: if you have an interest in something or someone, you want to know or learn more about them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My parents encouraged my interest in science.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母激励了我在自然科学方面的兴趣。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d recommend this book to anyone who has an interest in jazz.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我向所有喜欢爵士乐的人推荐这本书。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ben has shown an interest in learning French.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本表现出想学法语的兴趣。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My mother had never expressed any interest in the garden.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲从未表示对园艺有兴趣。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Babies soon begin to take an interest in the world around them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 婴儿很快就开始对周围的事物产生兴趣。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: John appeared to have no interest in girls.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰看起来对女孩没有兴趣。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I watched the first few episodes, but soon lost interest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看了前几集﹐但很快就失去了兴趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The last round of bidding aroused considerable interest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后一轮竞价引起人们相当大的兴趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our survey reveals a disturbing lack of interest in teacher training.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的调查显示人们对教师培训失去了兴趣﹐这很令人不安。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I read your article with great interest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我兴致勃勃地拜读了您的文章。

Sense.DEF: an activity that you enjoy doing or a subject that you enjoy studying
Sense.EXAMPLE: His interests include walking and golf.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的爱好包括散步和打高尔夫球。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a biologist, my main interest has been human genetics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为一名生物学家﹐我主要的兴趣是人类遗传学。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her outside interests interests that are not part of her work were numerous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的业余爱好非常广泛。

Sense.DEF: a quality or feature of something that attracts your attention or makes you want to know more about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: A Persian rug will add colour and interest to your hallway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 波斯地毯将给你的门廊增添色彩和情趣。

GramExa.GLOSS: be interesting or not interesting to someone
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a book that will be of interest to a wide range of readers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一本广大读者都会感兴趣的书。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: What you do in your private life is of no interest to me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对你的私生活毫无兴趣。

Sense.EXAMPLE: art galleries, museums and other places of interest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美术馆﹑博物馆和其他有意思的地方
Sense.EXAMPLE: topics of general interest that everyone wants to know about
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们普遍感兴趣的话题

Subsense.DEF: the extra money that you must pay back when you borrow money

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The interest on the loan is 16% per year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贷款年利率为16%。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: How much are the monthly interest payments?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每月所付的利息是多少？

Subsense.DEF: money paid to you by a bank or financial institution when you keep money in an account there
Subsense.EXAMPLE: an account that pays higher interest
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 支付更高存款利息的账户
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The more you save, the more interestyou’ll earn.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 存款越多﹐所得的利息就越多。

Sense.DEF: the things that bring advantages to someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The regulations were introduced in order to safeguard the interests of local fishing communities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 实施这些规章是为了保护当地渔民社区的利益。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be in sb’s (best) interest(s) (to do sth)
GramExa.GLOSS: be the best thing for someone
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The court decided that it was in the girl’s best interests to remain with her grandparents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭作出判决﹐对小女孩最妥善的安置就是把她留在其祖父母身边。

GramExa.GLOSS: care about someone and want to do what is best for them
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has your best interests at heart, you know.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要知道﹐他是在替你着想。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve got to balance economic interests and environmental interests.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须兼顾经济利益和环境利益。

Sense.DEF: to be good or necessary for the safety or success of a country and its people
Sense.EXAMPLE: I believe it is in the public interest that these facts are made known.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我相信公布这些真相是符合公众利益的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: in the interest(s) of justice/safety/efficiency etc
Sense.DEF: in order to make a situation or system fair, safe etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The race was postponed in the interests of safety.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了安全起见﹐比赛延期了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: (just) out of interest/as a matter of interest
Sense.DEF: used to say that you are asking a question only because you are interested and not because you need to know
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just out of interest, how much did they offer you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是好奇地问一下﹐他们打算给你多少钱？

Sense.DEF: if you have an interest in a particular company or industry, you own shares in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is believed to be keen to sell its extensive brewing interests.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据信该公司急于出售其大量酿酒业股份。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His business interests are spread throughout Europe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的公司股份遍及欧洲。

GramExa.GLOSS: enough shares to control what decisions are taken
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In 1986 GM acquired a controlling interest in the sports car maker Lotus.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1986年通用汽车获得了跑车生产商路特斯的控股权。

Sense.DEF: a group of people in the same business who share aims or ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: Farming interests now dominate many of the National Park committees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 农场经营利益集团现在控制着许多国家公园委员会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The majority of Brazil’s huge commercial interests support the measure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数巴西的大型商业利益集团都支持这项措施。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the need to reduce the influence of special interests groups who are concerned about particular subjects
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 减少特殊利益集团影响力的需要

Sense.LEXUNIT: have no interest in doing sth
Sense.DEF: to not want to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have no interest in continuing this conversation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想再谈下去了。

Sense.DEF: to officially state that you are connected with something or someone, and so cannot be completely fair and independent when making a decision involving them
Sense.TRAN: 宣布（与某事物）有利害关系﹐声明（与某事物）有利益关系

Sense.DEF: the part of a story, film, or event which is interesting because it shows things about people’s lives or romantic relationships
Sense.TRAN: 〔小说﹑影片或事件中的〕人们的生活/风流韵事情节
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a trainee reporter, she spent most of her time on human interest stories.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为实习记者﹐她把大部分时间都投入在有人情味的新闻报道上。

Sense.DEF: to make someone want to pay attention to something and find out more about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here’s an article which might interest you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里有一篇文章﹐也许你会感兴趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What interests me is all the history of these places.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使我感兴趣的是这些地方的历史。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It may interest you to know that a number of scholarships are available.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你也许有兴趣知道将提供多项奖学金。
