Sense.DEF: to give something a lot of attention because you want to find out more about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had always interested himself in foreign affairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一向对外交事务感兴趣。

Sense.DEF: to try to persuade someone to buy, do, or eat something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The salesman tried to interest me in the higher-priced model.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售员劝我买价格较高的型号。

GramExa.PROPFORM: Could I interest you in a drink/dessert etc?
GramExa.GLOSS: used as a polite way of offering someone a drink etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 你要喝一杯/吃甜点等吗？

Sense.DEF: giving a lot of attention to something because you want to find out more about it or because you enjoy it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve always been interested in music.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直对音乐感兴趣。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: All she’s interested in is clothes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只对服装感兴趣。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I wasn’t sure if he was really interested or if he was just being polite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不敢肯定他是真的感兴趣﹐还是出于礼貌而已。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d be very interested to hear your opinion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常想听听你的意见。

Sense.DEF: if you are interested in doing or having something, you want to do it or have it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a spare ticket for the opera, if you’re interested.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你感兴趣﹐我这里多了一张歌剧票。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sheila’s interested in starting her own business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 希拉很想开办自己的公司。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you be interested in a second-hand car?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对二手车感兴趣吗？

Sense.DEF: a person or group that is directly or personally concerned with a situation and is likely to be affected by its results
Sense.TRAN: 有利害关系的一方/团体
Sense.EXAMPLE: All interested parties are invited to attend the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有有关人员都被邀请来参加会议。

Sense.DEF: an interest-free loan has no interest charged on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: interest-free credit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 免息贷款

Sense.DEF: a group of people who join together to try to influence the government in order to protect their own particular rights, advantages etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔试图左右政府决策以保护自身利益的〕利益集团

Sense.DEF: if something is interesting, you give it your attention because it seems unusual or exciting or provides information that you did not know about
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s an interesting question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是一个有趣的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a really interesting TV programme
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十分有趣的电视节目

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I found his talk very interesting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他的讲话很引人入胜。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you meet any interesting people?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你见过什么有意思的人吗？

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is interesting to see/know etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It will be interesting to see what happens when he gets a bit older.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看看他年纪大些时是什么样子会很有趣。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s interesting that no one remembers seeing the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 竟然没人记得见过这辆车﹐真是有趣。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse interested, which describes a feeling, and interesting, which describes something that interests you. 不要混淆 interested（指一种感受）和 interesting（指某事使你感兴趣）: Are you interested in ballet? 你对芭蕾舞感兴趣吗？ | an interesting talk on photography 关于摄影的有趣演讲

Exponent.DEF: keeping your attention and making you want to know more
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s an interesting article in the newspaper today.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天的报上有一篇有趣的文章。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The lecture was really interesting.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这讲座非常吸引人。

Exponent.DEF: very interesting
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a fascinating subject
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 引人入胜的话题
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Everything about ancient Egypt is absolutely fascinating.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 和古埃及有关的一切都非常吸引人。

Exponent.DEF: giving you new ideas or experiences in a way that is interesting and enjoyable
Exponent.TRAN: 饶有趣味的,激发思考的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a stimulating conversation
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 饶有趣味的对话
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I found him very stimulating to be with and full of ideas.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发觉和他在一起很有意思,而且他点子很多。

Exponent.DEF: interesting because of being unusual, mysterious, or unexpected, so that you want to find out more
Exponent.TRAN: 〔由于不寻常﹑神秘或出人意料而〕非常有趣的,引人入胜的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Their research has produced some intriguing results.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的研究得出了一些很有趣的结果。

Exponent.DEF: interesting in a way that keeps your attention completely or for a long time
Exponent.TRAN: 很吸引人的,引人入胜的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Growing your own vegetables can be an absorbing hobby.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 自己种蔬菜是一种很有意思的爱好。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: her engrossing first novel
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那引人入胜的第一部小说

Exponent.DEF: used about a very interesting story, film etc that you feel you must keep reading or watching
Exponent.TRAN: 〔故事﹑电影等〕扣人心弦的,引人入胜的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a gripping story of love and death
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本有关爱与死的扣人心弦的小说
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He gives a riveting performance as a tough street cop.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他饰演一个硬汉巡警,演得非常精彩。

Exponent.DEF: very interesting and exciting – used especially about a performance you are watching or listening to
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指表演〕精彩的,迷人的,非常有趣的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Pakistan won an enthralling match by two wickets.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴基斯坦以两名击球手未被判出局赢了一场精彩的比赛。

Exponent.DEF: very interesting because of being so strange, unusual, or wonderful
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The book is a spellbinding tale of her life in China.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书讲述她在中国生活的趣事。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that a book was so interesting that you could not stop reading it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s a great book – I found that I couldn’t put it down.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是本了不起的书,我发现自己读得爱不释手。

Sense.DEF: used to introduce a fact that you think is interesting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Interestingly, none of their three children ever married.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有趣的是﹐他们的三个孩子都一直没有结婚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Interestingly enough, Pearson made no attempt to deny the rumour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很有趣的是﹐皮尔逊没有试图否认谣传。

Sense.DEF: in an interesting way
Sense.EXAMPLE: His essay was clearly and interestingly written.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的散文思路清晰﹐趣味盎然。

Sense.DEF: the percentage amount charged by a bank etc when you borrow money, or paid to you by a bank when you keep money in an account there
the way in which you see the information from a computer program on a screen, or how you type information into the program
Sense.TRAN: 界面〔指计算机屏幕布局〕

Sense.DEF: the part of a computer system that connects two different machines
the way in which two subjects, events etc affect each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book deals with the interface between accountancy and law.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书论及会计工作和法律的关系。

Sense.DEF: the surface where two things touch each other
if you interface two parts of a computer system, or if they interface, you connect them
if two people or groups interface with each other, they communicate with each other and work together
between or involving people of different religions
Sense.TRAN: 不同宗教信仰者（间）的﹔不同宗教团体（间）的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an interfaith Thanksgiving service
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不同宗教信仰者参加的感恩节宗教仪式

Sense.DEF: to deliberately get involved in a situation where you are not wanted or needed
Sense.EXAMPLE: My daughter-in-law said that I was interfering, but I was only trying to help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的儿媳说我多管闲事﹐但我只是想帮忙。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s not the church’s job to interfere in politics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 干预政治不是教会应做的事。

Sense.DEF: to prevent something from succeeding or from happening in the way that was planned
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anxiety can interfere with children’s performance at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 焦虑会影响孩子在学校的表现。

Sense.DEF: if something interferes with a radio or television broadcast, it spoils the sound or picture that you receive
to touch a child sexually
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was arrested for interfering with young boys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因猥亵男童而被捕。

Sense.DEF: an act of interfering

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I resent his interference in my work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我讨厌他干预我的工作。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Industrial relations should be free from state interference.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳资关系应不受政府干预。

Sense.DEF: unwanted noise on the radio, television, or on the telephone, or faults in the television picture
Sense.TRAN: 〔收音机﹑电视机或电话受到的声音〕干扰﹔〔电视图像受到的〕干扰

Sense.DEF: the act of blocking or touching another player in a sports game, for example by standing in front of them or holding on to them, when you are not supposed to

Subsense.DEF: to protect a player who has the ball in American football by blocking players from the opposing team
Subsense.TRAN: 〔美式橄榄球比赛中为掩护本方持球队员而〕掩护阻挡

Subsense.DEF: to help someone to achieve something by dealing with people or problems that might cause them trouble
Subsense.TRAN: 〔为帮助某人成就某事而〕插手﹔介入

Sense.DEF: a chemical substance that is produced by your body to fight against viruses that cause disease
Sense.TRAN: 〔体内产生的抗病毒的〕干扰素

Sense.DEF: between the large groups of stars in space
between or involving people from different age groups
Sense.EXAMPLE: intergenerational communication
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跨代交流

Sense.DEF: between or involving governments of different countries
Sense.EXAMPLE: an intergovernmental conference
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府间的会议

Sense.DEF: intended to be used or accepted for a short time only, until something or someone final can be made or found
Sense.EXAMPLE: an interim report
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中期报告
Sense.EXAMPLE: He received an interim payment of £10,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他收到暂时支付的一万英镑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: An interim government was established.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个临时政府成立了。

Sense.DEF: the period of time between two events
Sense.EXAMPLE: During the interim period, air quality has deteriorated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这期间﹐空气质量下降了。

Sense.DEF: in the period of time between two events
Sense.EXAMPLE: The child will be adopted, but a relative is looking after him in the interim.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子将由人领养﹐但现在这段时间暂由一名亲属照管。

Sense.DEF: the inner part or inside of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The interior of the church was dark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教堂里很暗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the car’s warm interior
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车里很暖和

Sense.DEF: the part of a country that is farthest away from the coast
Sense.EXAMPLE: The interior of the country is mainly desert.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家的内陆地带主要是沙漠。

Sense.DEF: the government minister or department that deals with matters within a country rather than abroad
inside or indoors
Sense.EXAMPLE: The interior walls are all painted white.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 室内墙壁都粉刷成了白色。

Sense.DEF: an interior designer
someone whose job is to plan and choose the colours, materials, furniture etc for the inside of buildings, especially people’s houses
to interrupt what someone else is saying with a sudden remark
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘That’s absolute rubbish!’ he interjected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那全是废话！”他突然插话道。

Sense.DEF: a word or phrase used to express a strong feeling such as shock, pain, or pleasure
an interruption, or the act of interrupting
things that are interlaced are joined together, with parts of the one thing going over or around parts of the other
Sense.EXAMPLE: patterns of interlaced squares
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正方形交叠的图案

Sense.DEF: to connect or be connected with something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: a chain of interlinking loops
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由圆环连接而成的链子

Sense.DEF: if two or more things interlock, or if they are interlocked, they fit firmly together
Sense.TRAN: （使）连锁﹔（使）相互扣住﹔（使）紧密连接
Sense.EXAMPLE: a puzzle with 500 interlocking pieces
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由500个紧密相扣的块组成的拼图

Sense.DEF: your interlocutor is the person you are speaking to
someone who enters a place or group where they should not be
a period of time between two events or situations, during which something different happens
Sense.TRAN: 〔两件事情﹑两种形势之间的〕间歇﹔插曲
Sense.EXAMPLE: a brief interlude of peace before a return to the battlefield
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重返战场之前的短暂平静

Sense.DEF: a short period of time between the parts of a play, concert etc
a short piece of music, talk etc used to fill such a period
a short romantic or sexual meeting or relationship
Sense.EXAMPLE: a romantic interlude
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 短暂的恋情

Sense.DEF: if people from two social, racial, or religious groups intermarry, people from one group marry people from the other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Over the centuries, these Greeks intermarried with the natives.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多世纪以来﹐这些希腊人和当地人通婚。

Sense.DEF: to marry someone within your own group or family
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is not unusual for royal cousins to intermarry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 王室成员堂表亲之间结婚并不少见。

Sense.DEF: a person or organization that tries to help two other people or groups to agree with each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jackson acted as an intermediary between the two parties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克逊充当双方的调解人。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: an intermediary role in the talks

Subsense.DEF: an intermediate class, course etc is at a level of knowledge or skill that is between the basic level and the advanced level
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a book aimed at students at the intermediate level and above
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本适用于中等及以上程度学生的书

Subsense.DEF: intermediate students, sports players etc have reached a level of knowledge or skill that is between the basic level and the advanced level
Subsense.TRAN: 〔学生﹑运动员等〕中级程度的﹐中等水平的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: intermediate learners of English
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中等程度英语学习者

Sense.DEF: an intermediate stage in a process of development is between two other stages
Sense.EXAMPLE: an intermediate stage during which the disease is dormant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疾病处于潜伏状态的中期

Sense.DEF: a student, sports player etc who has reached a level of knowledge or skill that is between the basic level and the advanced level
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ski resort suited to beginners and intermediates
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 适合初学者和中等水平滑雪者的滑雪度假胜地

Sense.DEF: a junior high school or middle school
the act of burying a dead body
very long and boring
Sense.TRAN: 冗长乏味的﹐没完没了的
Sense.EXAMPLE: interminable delays
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无休止的拖延

Sense.DEF: to mix together, or mix something with something else（
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pain and the anger were intermingled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疼痛和愤怒交织在一起。

Sense.DEF: a short period of time between the parts of a play, concert etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔戏剧﹑音乐会等中间的〕休息时间﹐幕间休息

Sense.DEF: stopping and starting often and for short periods
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weather forecast is for sun, with intermittent showers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气预报为晴﹐有阵雨。

Sense.DEF: to mix together, or mix things together（
to put someone in prison without charging them with a crime, for political reasons or during a war
Sense.TRAN: 〔战时或出于政治原因〕拘留﹐扣押

Sense.DEF: someone who has nearly finished training as a doctor and is working in a hospital
someone, especially a student, who works for a short time in a particular job in order to gain experience
within a particular country
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have no interest in interfering in the internal affairs of other countries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对干涉其他国家内政不感兴趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the threat to internal security
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对国内安全的威胁
Sense.EXAMPLE: internal markets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国内市场

Sense.DEF: within a company or organization rather than outside it
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s to be an internal inquiry into the whole affair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对整个事件将进行内部调查。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the internal mail
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内部邮件

Sense.DEF: inside your body
inside something rather than outside
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve knocked down a couple of internal walls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们已拆掉了几面内墙。

Sense.DEF: existing in your mind
Sense.EXAMPLE: internal doubts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内心的疑虑

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The matter will be dealt with internally.
This medicine must not be taken internally.

Sense.DEF: an engine that produces power by burning petrol, used in most cars
if you internalize a particular belief, attitude, behaviour etc, it becomes part of your character
Sense.TRAN: 使〔信仰﹑态度﹑行为等〕内在化〔成为性格的一部分〕

Sense.DEF: a type of medical work in which doctors treat illnesses that do not need operations
the government organization in the US which is responsible for collecting national taxes
relating to or involving more than one nation
Sense.EXAMPLE: the response of the international community
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际社会的反响
Sense.EXAMPLE: the UN and other international organizations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国和其他国际组织

Sense.DEF: an international sports game
someone who plays for one of their country’s sports teams
an imaginary line that goes from the north pole to the south pole, to the east of which the date is one day later than it is to the west
Sense.TRAN: 国际日期变更线﹐日界线

Sense.DEF: the belief that nations should work together and help each other
to make something international or bring it under international control
Sense.TRAN: 使国际化﹔把…置于国际共管之下

Sense.DEF: in many different parts of the world
Sense.EXAMPLE: These days businesses have to be able to compete internationally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今﹐企业必须要有实力参与国际竞争。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an internationally famous sculptor
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际知名的雕刻家

Sense.DEF: the imf
the political relationships between countries, or the study of this
internecine fighting or struggles happen between members of the same group or nation
Sense.EXAMPLE: internecine warfare
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内战

Sense.DEF: someone who is put into prison during a war or for political reasons, without having had a trial
a computer system that allows millions of computer users around the world to exchange information
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have access to the Internet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你上得了网吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can find all kinds of information on the internet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在因特网上你可以找到各种信息。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: More and more companies are using the Internet to conduct their business.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 越来越多的公司在使用因特网做生意。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I went on the Internet to find some information for my assignment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上网查找资料来写作业。

Collocate.COLLOC: access the Internet/connect to the Internet
Collocate.EXAMPLE: You can access the Internet from your mobile phone.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以用手机上网。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: look at different websites
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She spends hours surfing the Internet every evening.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她每天晚上花好几个小时在网上冲浪。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I downloaded the file from the Internet.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从网上下载了这个文档。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He bought the chairs on the Internet.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从网上买了这些椅子。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: a high-speed Internet connection
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 高速因特网连接

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Not everyone has Internet access at home.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 不是每个人都能在家里上网。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the address of a website
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company charges $100 to register a new internet address.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司对注册一个新的网址收费100美元。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a company that allows you to connect to the Internet
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Your Internet service provider should be able to solve the problem.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的因特网服务提供商应该能够解决这个问题。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The new regulations will increase customer confidence in Internet shopping.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些新规定将增加客户对网上购物的信心。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The number of Internet users is doubling every six months.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 因特网用户数量每六个月就要增加一倍。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The software allows parents to control children’s Internet use.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一软件能让家长对子女使用因特网加以管控。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the number of people using the Internet
using the Internet to meet people for a romantic relationship
a café with computers, where people can pay to use the Internet

Sense.DEF: a service provided by banks so that people can find out information about their bank account, pay bills etc using the Internet
using the Internet to arrange meetings with other people in the hope of finding someone to have a romantic relationship with

a very informal style of written language, used in emails or chat room messages etc, that does not follow the normal rules of grammar and does not, for example, use capital letters, punctuation etc – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 网络语言〔一种不依照语法规则﹑极不正式的书面语﹐用于电子邮件或聊天室信息﹐含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a doctor who has a general knowledge about all illnesses and medical conditions of organs inside your body, and who treats illnesses that do not need operations
the practice of keeping people in prison during a war or for political reasons, without charging them with a crime
Sense.TRAN: 〔战时或出于政治原因的〕扣押﹐拘留
Sense.EXAMPLE: an internment camp
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拘留营

Sense.DEF: a job that lasts for a short time, that someone, especially a student, does in order to gain experience
a job that someone who has nearly finished training as a doctor does in a hospital
Sense.TRAN: 实习医生[医师]的工作 [职位]

Sense.DEF: to spread through something or spread through each other
relating to relationships between people
Sense.TRAN: 人与人之间的﹔人际关系的
Sense.EXAMPLE: interpersonal skills
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人际交往技巧
Sense.EXAMPLE: interpersonal communication
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人际沟通

Sense.DEF: between the planets
Sense.EXAMPLE: interplanetary space missions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星际太空飞行任务

Sense.DEF: the way in which two people or things affect each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the interplay of ideas
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不同观点的相互影响

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the interplay between military and civilian populations
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队和平民百姓之间的相互影响

Sense.DEF: an international police organization that helps national police forces to catch criminals
to put additional words into a piece of writing
to interrupt someone by saying something
to put yourself or something else between two other things
Sense.TRAN: 使介入〔两者之间〕﹔使插入
Sense.EXAMPLE: She interposed herself between the general and his wife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她挡在将军和他妻子之间。

Sense.DEF: to say something when other people are having a conversation or argument, interrupting them
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘That might be difficult,’ interposed Regina.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那可能有困难。”雷吉娜插嘴说。

Sense.DEF: to translate spoken words from one language into another
Sense.EXAMPLE: They spoke good Spanish, and promised to interpret for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们西班牙语说得很好﹐答应替我翻译。

Sense.DEF: to believe that something someone does or something that happens has a particular meaning

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His refusal to work late was interpreted as a lack of commitment to the company.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拒绝加班被认为是对公司缺少奉献精神。

Sense.DEF: to explain the meaning of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Freud’s attempts to interpret the meaning of dreams
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗洛伊德对梦的含义的解析

Sense.DEF: to perform a part in a play, a piece of music etc in a way that shows your feelings about it or what you think it means
Sense.TRAN: 〔根据自己对戏剧﹑音乐作品等的感受或理解来〕表演﹐演绎

Sense.DEF: the way in which someone explains or understands an event, information, someone’s actions etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: One possible interpretation is that they want you to resign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种可能的解释是﹐他们想要你辞职。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult to put an accurate interpretation on explain the survey results.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对调查结果难以作出确切的解释。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What exactly the author meant by that statement is open to interpretation able to be understood or explained in different ways.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作者这句话的确切含义可有各种理解。

Sense.DEF: the way in which someone performs a play, a piece of music etc and shows what they think and feel about it
Sense.TRAN: 〔对戏剧﹑音乐作品等的〕表演﹐演绎﹔处理方式
Sense.EXAMPLE: Laurence Olivier’s brilliant interpretation of Henry V
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳伦斯 · 奥利弗对亨利五世的精彩演绎

Sense.DEF: relating to, explaining, or understanding the meaning of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某事的意思〕解释的﹐理解的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Reading is an interpretative process.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阅读是一个理解的过程。

Sense.DEF: relating to how feelings are expressed through music, dance, art etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔感情通过音乐﹑舞蹈﹑艺术等〕表演的﹐演绎的
Sense.EXAMPLE: interpretive dance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诠释舞蹈

Sense.DEF: someone who changes spoken words from one language into an-other, especially as their job
Sense.EXAMPLE: Speaking through an interpreter using an interpreter, Ahmed said, ‘I’m very worried about my wife and children.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾哈迈德通过口译者说:“我很担心我的妻子和孩子们。”

Sense.DEF: a computer program that changes an instruction into a form that can be understood directly by the computer

Sense.TRAN: 解释的﹔理解的﹔表演的﹐演绎的

Sense.DEF: between different races of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: interracial marriage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 种族间的通婚

Sense.DEF: an InterRail pass allows you to travel around several European countries. People often talk about students ‘going interrailing’ travelling using this pass.
Sense.TRAN: 持欧洲火车通票的﹔持欧洲火车通票旅游
Sense.EXAMPLE: We spent three weeks InterRailing around Europe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们用火车通票在欧洲旅游了三周。

Sense.DEF: a period of time when a country or organization has no ruler or leader, and they are waiting for a new one
Sense.TRAN: 政权 [权力]空白期〔新领导人尚未接任﹐国家或组织没有领导人的一段时期〕

Sense.DEF: if two things interrelate, they are connected and have an effect on each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: We will be discussing how the interests of state, parent and child interrelate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将讨论国家﹑父母和儿童之间的利益是如何相互关联的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Each part of the course interrelates with all the others.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 课程的每个部分都与其他所有的部分有关联。

Sense.DEF: things that are interrelated are connected and have an effect on each other
Sense.TRAN: 相互关联的﹔相互影响的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unemployment and inflation are interrelated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业与通货膨胀是相互联系的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many interrelated factors are at work here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这里许多相互关联的因素在起作用。

Sense.DEF: a connection between two things that makes them affect each other
to ask someone a lot of questions for a long time in order to get information, sometimes using threats
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police interrogated the suspect for several hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察盘问了这名嫌疑犯好几个小时。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He refused to tell his interrogators anything.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拒绝向审问者透露任何信息。

Sense.DEF: an interrogative sentence, pronoun etc asks a question or has the form of a question. For example, ‘who’ and ‘what’ are interrogative pronouns.
if someone gives you an interrogative look or uses an interrogative voice, they want to know the answer to a question
the form of a sentence or verb that is used for asking questions
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put this statement into the interrogative.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把这个陈述句改为疑问句。

Sense.DEF: a word such as ‘who’ or ‘what’ that is used in asking questions
to stop someone from continuing what they are saying or doing by suddenly speaking to them, making a noise etc
Sense.TRAN: 打断〔某人的〕讲话﹔中断〔某人的〕行动﹔打扰
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you stop interrupting me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别打断我的话！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry to interrupt, but I need to ask you to come downstairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很抱歉打扰了﹐我得请你下楼来。

Sense.DEF: to make a process or activity stop temporarily
Sense.TRAN: 使〔过程或活动〕暂时停止
Sense.EXAMPLE: My studies were interrupted by the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的学业由于战争而中断。

Sense.DEF: if something interrupts a line, surface, view etc, it stops it from being continuous
Sense.TRAN: 中断﹐阻碍〔线条﹑平面﹑风景等的连续性〕

RunOn.EXAMPLE: We can talk here without interruption.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在这儿谈话不会被打断。

Tail.HINTTRAN: Do not use interruption to mean a short period when students or workers can stop working and relax. Use break. 不要用 interruption 来指学生或工人的小憩﹐而要用 break: Between the two classes there is a 15-minute break. 两节课之间有15分钟休息时间。

Sense.DEF: if two lines or roads intersect, they meet or go across each other
to divide an area with several lines, roads etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用线﹑道路等把一个区域〕分隔
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plain is intersected by a network of canals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个平原布满纵横交错的运河。

Sense.DEF: a place where roads, lines etc cross each other, especially where two roads meet
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指两条道路的〕交叉口﹐十字路口﹔〔线的〕交叉点

Sense.DEF: the act of intersecting something
if something is interspersed with a particular kind of thing, it has a lot of them in it
Sense.TRAN: 大量点缀着某物﹐大量散布着某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: sunny periods interspersed with showers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晴天﹐间或有阵雨

Sense.DEF: to put something in between pieces of speech or writing, parts of a film etc
Sense.TRAN: 在某物〔如演讲﹑文章﹑电影等〕中夹杂[穿插]某物

Sense.DEF: a wide road that goes between states, on which cars can travel very fast
involving different states, especially in the US
Sense.EXAMPLE: interstate commerce
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 州际贸易

Sense.DEF: happening or existing between the stars
a small space or crack in something or between things
if two situations, ideas etc are intertwined, they are closely related to each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The problems of crime and unemployment are closely intertwined.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪问题与失业问题密切相关。

Sense.DEF: if two things intertwine, or if they are intertwined, they are twisted together（

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a necklace of rubies intertwined with pearls
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 缠着珍珠的红宝石项链

Sense.DEF: the period of time between two events, activities etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔两件事情﹑两项活动等之间的〕间隔﹐间歇
Sense.EXAMPLE: He left the room, returning after a short interval with a message.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他离开房间﹐过了一会儿就带回来一条消息。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The interval between arrest and trial can be up to six months.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从逮捕到审判之间的间隔时间可达六个月。

Sense.DEF: short periods of fine weather between cloudy, rainy weather etc
every week, 20 minutes etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trains run at half-hourly intervals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车每半小时开出一班。

Subsense.DEF: something that happens at regular intervals happens often
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The phone rang at regular intervals all afternoon.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个下午每隔一定时间电话铃就响一次。

Subsense.DEF: objects that are placed at regular intervals have all been placed at the same distance from each other
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Trees had been planted at regular intervals.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树已按均距栽种。

Sense.DEF: a short period of time between the parts of a play, concert etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔戏剧﹑音乐会等中间的〕休息时间﹐幕间休息
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can get some drinks in the interval.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以在幕间休息时喝点什么。

Sense.DEF: the amount of difference in pitch between two musical notes
to become involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police don’t usually like to intervene in disputes between husbands and wives.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方通常不愿意介入夫妻之间的争吵。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The army will have to intervene to prevent further fighting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队将不得不干预以阻止进一步的战斗。

Sense.DEF: to interrupt someone when they are speaking
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Stop shouting, Emily,’ John intervened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “别再喊了﹐埃米莉。”约翰打断道。

Sense.DEF: if an event intervenes, it delays or interrupts something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was just establishing his career when the war intervened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他刚刚开始创建自己的事业﹐却因战争爆发受阻。

Sense.DEF: if a period of time intervenes, it comes between two events
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the six years that intervened, I saw them once.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 期间的六年中我见过他们一次。

Sense.DEF: time that passes between two events
Sense.TRAN: 〔两件事情之间的〕那些年/数个月/那段时期等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hadn’t seen him since 1980, and he had aged a lot in the intervening years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我自1980年以来就没见过他﹐这些年里他老了不少。

Sense.DEF: the act of becoming involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: government intervention to regulate prices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府介入控制物价

Sense.DEF: based on the belief of a government or organization that it should take action or spend money to influence the economyfinancial system or what happens in other countries
Sense.TRAN: 干预主义的〔认为政府或组织应采取行动或投入资金干预经济或别国的事务〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The UN have adopted a more interventionist approach in the region.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国在该地区采取了干预性更强的手段。

Sense.DEF: a formal meeting at which someone is asked questions in order to find out whether they are suitable for a job, course of study etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an interview for a job on the Los Angeles Times
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 《洛杉矶时报》的一次求职面试

Sense.EXAMPLE: a portfolio of work presented at interview
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在面试时呈递的工作成果样本

Sense.DEF: an occasion when a famous person is asked questions about their life, experiences, or opinions for a newspaper, magazine, television programme etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an interview with the president
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对总统的采访

Sense.EXAMPLE: Elton John gave an interview to Barbara Walters he answered her questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃尔顿 · 约翰接受了芭芭拉 · 沃尔特斯的采访。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an exclusive interview one that is given to only one newspaper, programme etc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 独家采访

Sense.DEF: an official meeting with someone who asks you questions
Sense.TRAN: 〔与提问者的〕正式会谈﹐面谈﹐会见
Sense.EXAMPLE: a police interview
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方问讯

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She has an interview next week for a teaching job in Paris.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 下周她要参加巴黎一份教职的面试。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I went for an interview at a software company yesterday.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天我去了一个软件公司参加面试。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was one of only five people to get an interview out of more than 100 people who applied.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一百多名申请者中仅5名获得面试机会,他是其中之一。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Applicants who are called for interview may be asked to have a medical exam.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 被通知前去参加面试的申请者可能要做一次体检。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The interview was conducted in French.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 此次面试以法语进行。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: interview someone
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We gave her an interview, but decided not to offer her the job.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对她进行了面试,但决定不把这份工作给她。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Try to predict the questions you might get in your job interview.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量预想一下求职面试时可能会被问到的问题。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Applicants will normally have an informal interview with the manager.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 申请人通常将接受经理的一次非正式面谈。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He felt the first interview had gone well.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他感觉第一次面试表现得不错。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a more detailed interview after you have been successful in a previous interview
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was asked back for a second interview.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被叫回去进行第二次面试。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that you do for practice, rather than a real interview
in which people meet in person

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The book gives some useful advice on interview technique.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书就面试技巧提供了一些实用的建议。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the group of people interviewing someone

Sense.DEF: to ask someone questions during an interview
Sense.TRAN: 对〔某人〕进行面试﹔采访﹐访问﹔提问

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re interviewing six candidates for the job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份工作我们要面试六名申请人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police want to interview you about the accident.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方想就这起事故向你问话。

Sense.DEF: the person who answers the questions in an interview
the person who asks the questions in an interview
Sense.TRAN: 主持面试者﹔采访者﹔提问者

Sense.DEF: happening or relating to the period between the First and the Second World Wars
Sense.TRAN: 在第一次与第二次世界大战之间的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the interwar years
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两次世界大战之间的岁月

Sense.DEF: if two things are interwoven, they are closely related or combined in a complicated way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The two themes are inextricably interwoven in the book.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个主题在书中紧密交织在一起。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: practical help for the bereaved interwoven with emotional support
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对丧失亲友的人提供的实际帮助和情感支持

Sense.DEF: to weave two or more things together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: silk interwoven with gold and silver threads
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用金线和银线交织而成的丝绸

Sense.DEF: to die without having made a willa statement about who you want to have your property after you die
the long tube in your body through which food passes after it leaves your stomach
to be very fashionable at the moment
a state of having a close personal relationship with someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the intimacy of marriage
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚姻缔结的亲密关系

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a close sense of intimacy between parent and child
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母和孩子之间的亲密感

Sense.DEF: things you say or do to someone you have a close personal relationship with
Sense.EXAMPLE: She thought back over the intimacies they’d shared and the plans they’d made.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她回想起他们之间曾经有过的亲密言行以及他们设想的计划。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which you feel you are in private with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: the cosy intimacy of the café
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咖啡馆的温馨气氛

Sense.DEF: sex – used especially by lawyers and police when they want to avoid using the word ‘sex’
Sense.TRAN: 亲密行为﹐性行为〔尤为律师和警方使用的委婉用语〕

Sense.DEF: private and friendly so that you feel comfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: the intimate atmosphere of a country pub
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乡村酒吧亲切宜人的气氛
Sense.EXAMPLE: an intimate meal for two
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温馨的两人餐
Sense.EXAMPLE: The collection has been moved from its intimate setting to the British Museum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些收藏品已从私人藏处移到了大英博物馆。

Sense.DEF: having an extremely close friendship
Sense.EXAMPLE: an intimate friend of Picasso’s
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毕加索的一个密友
Sense.EXAMPLE: an intimate relationship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲密的关系
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s on intimate terms with people in government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她与政府官员关系密切。

Sense.DEF: very detailed knowledge of something as a result of careful study or a lot of experience
Sense.TRAN: 〔因细心研究或经验丰富而〕精通某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: his intimate knowledge of the coal industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对煤炭业的透彻了解

Sense.DEF: relating to very private or personal matters
Sense.EXAMPLE: the publication ofintimate details of their affair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们暧昧关系中隐秘细节的公开

Subsense.DEF: relating to sex
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The virus can only be transmitted through intimate contact.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种病毒只能通过性接触来传播。

Subsense.DEF: to have sex with someone

Sense.DEF: a very close connection between two things
Sense.EXAMPLE: the intimate connection between physical and mental health
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生理健康和精神健康的密切联系

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The two aspects are intimately connected.
I am intimately acquainted with the state of my bank account.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对自己银行账户的情况十分清楚。

Sense.DEF: to make people understand what you mean without saying it directly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He intimated, politely but firmly, that we were not welcome.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有礼貌但很坚决地暗示﹐我们是不受欢迎的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had already intimated to me her wish to leave.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已向我暗示过她想离开。

Sense.DEF: a close personal friend
an indirect or unclear sign that something may happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: the first intimations of the approaching conflict
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冲突即将发生的最初预兆

Sense.DEF: the act of officially telling someone about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Without early intimation of the dates of the training sessions, enthusiasm for training could decrease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果不提早通知训练班的开班日期﹐人们对培训的热情可能会减弱。

Sense.DEF: to frighten or threaten someone into making them do what you want
Sense.TRAN: 恐吓﹐恫吓﹐威胁〔某人做某事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They tried to intimidate the young people into voting for them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们试图胁迫年轻人投票给他们。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Attempts to intimidate her failed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐吓她的企图失败了。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel worried and not confident
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole idea of going to Oxford intimidated me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一想到要去牛津大学﹐我就信心全无。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She had endured years of intimidation and violence.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她忍受了多年的恐吓和暴力。

Sense.DEF: feeling worried and lacking confidence because of the situation you are in or the people you are with
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was shy, and felt intimidated by the older students.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很腼腆﹐看见年纪比我大的学生就胆怯。

Sense.DEF: making you feel worried and not confident
Sense.TRAN: 令人紧张不安的﹔令人胆怯的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some people find interview situations very intimidating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人认为面试的情形很吓人。

PronCodes.LINKWORD: before vowels 在元音前读作

Sense.DEF: to the inside or inner part of a container, place, area etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come into the office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到办公室里来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He thrust his hand into his coat pocket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把手插进大衣口袋里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There must be another way into the cave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定有其他的路可以进入洞穴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sue got back into bed and pulled the quilt over her head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休回到床上﹐拉过被子蒙住头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got to go into town this morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今天上午得进城去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We dived into the sea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们跳进海里。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone becomes involved in a situation or activity, or becomes part of a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the age of 16, I went into the printing trade as an apprentice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我16岁进入印刷业当学徒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They tried to drag me into their quarrel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们试图把我卷入他们的争吵中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a player who deserves to get back into the England team
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名应该重返英格兰队的运动员

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something starts being in a different state or form
Sense.EXAMPLE: She fell into a deep sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她睡着了﹐睡得很沉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole banking system was thrown into confusion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个银行系统陷入一片混乱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I screwed my wet handkerchief into a ball.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把我的湿手帕拧成一团。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cut the cake into pieces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把蛋糕切成几块。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Neruda’s poems have been translated into English.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 聂鲁达的诗已被翻译成英语。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a person or vehicle hits someone or something after moving towards them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He almost bumped into me as he rushed past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他飞奔而过﹐差点撞到我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car swerved and crashed into the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车突然转向﹐撞在墙上。

Sense.DEF: in a particular direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: They rode off into the sunset.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夕阳下他们策马西行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure you’re speaking directly into the microphone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说话时一定要对准话筒。

Sense.DEF: at or until a certain time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Andy and I talked well into the night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安迪和我一直谈到深夜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: John was well into his forties before he got married.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰四十多岁了才结婚。

Sense.DEF: used to say what someone is trying to find out information about
Sense.EXAMPLE: an investigation into the events leading up to his death
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对导致他死亡的事件的调查
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been doing some research into this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直在研究这事。

Sense.DEF: used when you are dividing one number by another
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eight into twenty-four is three.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 二十四除以八等于三。

Sense.DEF: to like and be interested in something
Sense.TRAN: 对某事物感兴趣﹔喜欢某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m really into folk music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很喜欢民间音乐。

Sense.DEF: to owe someone money
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s into me for $50.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他欠我50美元。

Sense.DEF: too difficult, bad, annoying etc for you to accept or deal with
Sense.TRAN: 无法忍受的﹐不能容忍的
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘This is intolerable!’ exclaimed Sir Rufus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这真令人难以忍受！”鲁弗斯爵士喊道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pain had become intolerable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 痛得不能忍受。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Caring for an elderly relative can become an intolerable burden.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 照看年迈的亲戚可能成为无法承受的重负。

Sense.DEF: unwillingness to accept ways of thinking and behaving that are different from your own
an inability to take particular medicines or eat particular foods without suffering bad effects
Sense.TRAN: 〔对食物或药物的〕过敏﹐不耐受

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an intolerance of alcohol
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒精过敏

Sense.DEF: not willing to accept ways of thinking and behaving that are different from your own
Sense.TRAN: 偏执的﹔偏狭的﹔不容异己的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: people who are intolerant of other people’s political beliefs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不能容忍他人政治信仰的人

Sense.DEF: not able to take particular medicines or eat particular foods without suffering bad effects
Sense.TRAN: 〔对药物或食物〕过敏的﹐不耐受的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A number of patients were intolerant of the diet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些病人对这些食物过敏。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s lactose-intolerant unable to drink particular types of milk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对乳糖过敏。

Sense.DEF: the way in which the level of your voice changes in order to add meaning to what you are saying, for example by going up at the end of a question
Sense.EXAMPLE: intonation patterns
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 语调类型

Sense.DEF: the playing or singing of correct musical notes
to say something slowly and clearly without making your voice rise and fall much as you speak
Sense.EXAMPLE: The priest intoned the blessing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 神父庄重地念了祷文。

Sense.DEF: as a whole
Sense.EXAMPLE: They accepted the plan in toto.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们完全接受这个计划。

Sense.DEF: something that makes you drunk
drunk
Sense.EXAMPLE: The driver was clearly intoxicated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 司机显然喝醉了。

Sense.DEF: happy, excited, and unable to think clearly, especially as a result of love, success, power etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因爱情﹑成功﹑权力等而〕极为兴奋的﹐陶醉的﹔得意忘形的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He rapidly became intoxicated with his own power.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很快就沉醉于自己的权力之中。

Sense.DEF: intoxicating drinks can make you drunk
making you feel happy, excited, and unable to think clearly
Sense.TRAN: 令人极兴奋的﹔令人陶醉的﹔使人得意忘形的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the intoxicating combination of her beauty and wit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美貌和智慧在她身上迷人的结合

Sense.DEF: inside
Sense.EXAMPLE: intra-departmental within a department
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部门内的

Sense.DEF: into
Sense.EXAMPLE: an intravenous injection into a vein
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 静脉注射

Sense.DEF: an intractable problem is very difficult to deal with or solve
Sense.EXAMPLE: the seemingly intractable problem of human greed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 似乎难以解决的人性贪婪问题

Sense.DEF: having a strong will and difficult to control
happening within one school, or intended for the students of one school
Sense.EXAMPLE: an intramural softball competition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 校内垒球比赛

Sense.DEF: a computer network used for exchanging or seeing information within a company
unwilling to change your ideas or behaviour, in a way that seems unreasonable
Sense.EXAMPLE: an intransigent attitude
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不妥协的态度

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He accused the government of intransigence.

Sense.DEF: an intransitive verb has a subject but no object. For example, in the sentence ‘They arrived’, ‘arrived’ is intransitive. Intransitive verbs are marked [I] in this dictionary.
Sense.TRAN: 〔动词〕不及物的〔即有主语而无宾语的动词﹐如They arrived中的arrived。在本词典中﹐不及物动词以[I]标明〕

Sense.DEF: someone who works for a large company and whose job is to develop new ideas or ways of doing business for that company
Sense.TRAN: 内部企业家〔在大公司内负责开发新计划和新的经营方式〕

Sense.DEF: within one US state
Sense.EXAMPLE: intrastate commerce
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 州内贸易

Sense.DEF: through or into a veintube in the body taking blood back to the heart
Sense.EXAMPLE: an intravenous injection
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 静脉注射
Sense.EXAMPLE: intravenous drug users
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使用静脉注射的吸毒者

Sense.DEF: a container on your desk for work and letters that need to be dealt with
Sense.TRAN: 〔存放待处理文件或信件的〕公文格﹐收件盘

Sense.DEF: willing to do dangerous things or go to dangerous places – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 无畏的﹐勇敢的〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: intrepid explorers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 勇敢的探险家

Sense.DEF: the complicated details of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the intricacies of private banking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 私人银行业务的错综复杂

Sense.DEF: the state of containing a large number of parts or details
Sense.EXAMPLE: designs of amazing intricacy and sophistication
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人称奇的复杂精妙的设计

Sense.DEF: containing many small parts or details that all work or fit together
Sense.EXAMPLE: intricate patterns
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 繁复的图案

PIC.HEADING: INTRICATE 错综复杂的
PIC.PICCONTENT: an intricate pattern 繁复的图案

Sense.DEF: if something intrigues you, it interests you a lot because it seems strange or mysterious
Sense.TRAN: 〔因奇特或神秘而〕激起…的兴趣﹐引起…的好奇心﹔迷住
Sense.EXAMPLE: Other people’s houses always intrigued her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别人的房子总令她好奇。

Sense.DEF: to make secret plans to harm someone or make them lose their position of power
Sense.TRAN: 密谋﹔施诡计〔伤害某人或夺去其权位〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: While King Richard was abroad, the barons had been intriguing against him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 理查王在国外时﹐贵族们一直在密谋反对他。

Sense.DEF: the making of secret plans to harm someone or make them lose their position of power, or a plan of this kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s an exciting story of political intrigue and murder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是一个关于政治阴谋和谋杀的故事﹐扣人心弦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a web of intrigue complicated set of secret plans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套阴谋诡计

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the political intrigues of the capital
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 首府里的政治阴谋

Sense.DEF: very interested in something because it seems strange or mysterious
Sense.TRAN: 〔由于奇特或神秘而〕深感好奇的﹐有极大兴趣的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was intrigued by her reaction.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对她的反应很好奇。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was intrigued to know what he planned to do next.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很想知道他下一步是如何打算的。

Sense.DEF: something that is intriguing is very interesting because it is strange, mysterious, or unexpected
Sense.TRAN: 〔由于奇特﹑神秘或出人意料而〕非常有趣的﹐迷人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The magazine carries an intriguing mixture of high fashion, gossip and racing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本杂志内容丰富有趣﹐有关时尚﹑花边新闻和赛马的内容都有。

Sense.DEF: being part of the nature or character of someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the intrinsic interest of the subject
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该话题本身的趣味

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is nothing in the intrinsic nature of the work that makes it more suitable for women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项工作本质上并没有什么使得它更适合女性来做。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Flexibility is intrinsic to creative management.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 灵活变通是创新管理的基本特质。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Science is seen as intrinsically good.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学就其本身而言被认为是件好事。

Sense.DEF: a short part at the beginning of a song, piece of writing etc
into, especially into the inside
Sense.EXAMPLE: introspection examining your own feelings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内省﹐反省

Sense.DEF: if you introduce someone to another person, you tell them each other’s names for the first time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you two been introduced? Tom, this is Greg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人给你们俩互相介绍了吗？汤姆﹐这位是格雷格。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: June, let me introduce you to Bob.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼﹐我来把你介绍给鲍勃。

GramExa.GLOSS: formally tell someone who you are
GramExa.EXAMPLE: May I introduce myself? My name is Meg Johnson.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来自我介绍一下吧。我的名字叫梅格 · 约翰逊。

Sense.DEF: to bring a plan, system, or product into use for the first time
Sense.EXAMPLE: They want to introduce a system of identity cards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想推行身份证制度。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The store have introduced a new range of food for children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家商店推出了一系列新的儿童食品。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday British English, people often say bring in a plan, law, system etc rather than introduce it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英国英语中,表示推行某项计划﹑法律﹑制度等时,人们常说bring in,而不说introduce
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They want to bring in a system of identity cards.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想推行身份证制度。

Sense.DEF: to bring a type of thing somewhere for the first time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The grey squirrel was introduced into Britain from North America.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 灰松鼠是由北美引入英国的。

Sense.DEF: to show someone something or tell them about it for the first time
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕初次接触〔某事物〕

GramExa.PROPFORM: introduce sb to sth/introduce sth to sb
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Malcolm introduced me to the joys of wine-tasting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马尔科姆让我初次尝到品酒的乐趣。

Sense.DEF: to speak at the beginning of and sometimes during a television or radio programme, or at the beginning of a public event
Sense.TRAN: 介绍 〔电视或广播节目﹑公众活动等〕﹔作开场白
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim Adams will introduce tonight’s programme.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆 · 亚当斯将为今晚的节目作开场介绍。

Sense.DEF: to make something new start to happen or exist in a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The peace agreement has introduced a feeling of optimism here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和平协议给这里带来了乐观的气氛。

Sense.DEF: to formally present a possible new law to be discussed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several senators introduced legislation aimed at sexual harassment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几位参议员提交了针对性骚扰的立法议案。

Sense.DEF: to put something carefully into something else
Sense.TRAN: 〔小心地〕把〔某物〕放入〔另一物里〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fuel was introduced into the jet pipe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 燃油被注入喷管。

Sense.DEF: the act of bringing something into use for the first time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the introduction of a range of new products
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一系列新产品的推出
GramExa.EXAMPLE: With the introduction of independent taxation, a married woman’s position is much clearer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 独立税收制度的推行使已婚妇女的地位更为明晰。

Subsense.DEF: the act of bringing something somewhere for the first time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the introduction of Buddhism to China nearly 2,000 years ago
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约2,000年前佛教传入中国

Subsense.DEF: a type of thing that is brought somewhere for the first time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The potato was a 16th-century introduction.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马铃薯是16世纪传入的。

Sense.DEF: the act of formally telling two people each other’s names when they first meet
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pete, are you going to make the introductions?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮特﹐你来作一下介绍吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our first contestant needs no introduction everyone already knows the person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的第一位参赛者就不用介绍了。

Sense.DEF: a written or spoken explanation at the beginning of a book, speech etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the introduction, he explains why he wrote the book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在引言里﹐他解释了写这本书的原因。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Brown gave a brief introduction to the course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布朗先生简单介绍了这门课程。

Sense.DEF: a short part at the beginning of a song or piece of music
something that explains the basic facts of a subject

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book is a useful introduction to British geology.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书是英国地质的实用入门读物。

Sense.DEF: someone’s first experience of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an introduction to water sports
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 水上运动的初次体验

Sense.DEF: a letter by someone else that explains who you are, which you can give to a person you have not met before
said or written at the beginning of a book, speech etc in order to explain what it is about

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the objectives described in the introductory chapter
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该书序篇里所描述的写作目的

Sense.EXAMPLE: as the chairman said in his introductory remarks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正如主席在开场白中所说的

Sense.DEF: intended for people who have never done a particular activity before
Sense.EXAMPLE: an introductory course in data processing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数据处理的入门课程

Sense.DEF: a special low price that is charged for a new product for a limited period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t miss our introductory offer!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要错过我们的试销优惠！

Sense.DEF: the process of thinking deeply about your own thoughts, feelings, or behaviour
tending to think deeply about your own thoughts, feelings, or behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shy and introspective person
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个腼腆自省的人

Sense.DEF: someone who is quiet and shy, and does not enjoy being with other people
Sense.TRAN: 性格内向的人﹐不爱交际者

Sense.DEF: someone who is introverted is quiet and shy and does not enjoy being with other people
Sense.TRAN: 性格内向的﹐不爱交际的

Sense.DEF: to interrupt someone or become involved in their private affairs in an annoying and unwanted way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would I be intruding if I came with you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要是和你一起去﹐会不会打扰你？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Employers should not intrude into the private lives of their employees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇主不应干涉雇员的私生活。

Sense.DEF: to come into a place or situation, and have an unwanted effect

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is to be hoped that TV cameras never intrude on this peaceful place.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望电视摄像机永远不要打扰这一宁静祥和之地。

Sense.DEF: someone who illegally enters a building or area, usually in order to steal something
Sense.TRAN: 非法闯入者〔通常指小偷〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police think the intruder got in through an unlocked window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察认为闯入者是从一扇没上锁的窗子进入的。

Sense.DEF: someone who is in a place where they are not wanted
Sense.EXAMPLE: At first I felt like an intruder in their family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 起初我觉得自己是他们家的不速之客。

Sense.DEF: when someone does something, or something happens, that affects your private life or activities in an unwanted way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I resented this intrusion into my domestic affairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我讨厌这种干涉我家事的行为。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the unwelcome intrusion of the press
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不受欢迎的新闻界的侵扰

Sense.DEF: when something comes into a place or situation and has an unwanted effect
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某种情况或地区的〕闯入﹐侵入
Sense.EXAMPLE: the intrusion of badly designed new buildings in the historic high street
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设计拙劣的新楼群建在有历史意义的大街上显得不伦不类

Sense.DEF: affecting someone’s private life or interrupting them in an unwanted and annoying way
Sense.EXAMPLE: They found the television cameras too intrusive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们认为电视摄像机太烦人了。

Sense.DEF: to know or guess something because of a feeling you have, rather than because of facts you know
the ability to understand or know something because of a feeling rather than by considering the facts
Sense.EXAMPLE: feminine intuition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性的直觉
Sense.EXAMPLE: Intuition told her it was unwise to argue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直觉告诉她争吵是不理智的。

Sense.DEF: an idea about what is true in a particular situation based on a feeling rather than facts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had an intuition there was trouble brewing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他凭直觉感到要有麻烦了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We should trust our intuitions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该相信自己的直觉。

Sense.DEF: an intuitive idea is based on a feeling rather than on knowledge or facts
Sense.EXAMPLE: He seemed to have an intuitive awareness of how I felt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他好像凭直觉就知道我的感受。

Sense.DEF: someone who is intuitive is able to understand situations without being told or having any proof about them
relating to the Inuit
someone who belongs to a race of people who live in the very cold northern areas of North America
Sense.TRAN: 伊努伊特人〔居住在北美北部严寒地区〕

Sense.DEF: the people who belong to this race
another word for an Inuit
to receive so much of something that you cannot easily deal with it all
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the broadcast, we were inundated with requests for more information.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 节目播出之后﹐太多人来询问详情﹐令我们应接不暇。

Sense.DEF: to cover an area with a large amount of water
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tidal wave inundated vast areas of cropland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海啸淹没了大片农田。

Sense.DEF: to make someone become used to something unpleasant, so that they are no longer upset by it
Sense.TRAN: 使习惯[适应]〔令人不愉快的事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nurses soon become inured to the sight of suffering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士们很快就习惯了那些病痛的场面。

Sense.DEF: to enter a country, town, or area using military force, in order to take control of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Romans invaded Britain 2,000 years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 2,000年前古罗马人入侵了英国。

Sense.DEF: to go into a place in large numbers, especially when you are not wanted
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指不受欢迎地〕大量涌入﹐蜂拥而入
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every summer the town is invaded by tourists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年夏天﹐大量游客涌入这个小镇。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fans invaded the pitch at half time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球迷在中场休息时冲入球场。

Sense.DEF: to get involved in something in an unwanted and annoying way
Sense.EXAMPLE: What right does he have to invade my privacy?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有什么权利侵犯我的隐私？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Patients are given the feeling that they mustn’t try to invade medical territory try to deal with things that are not their responsibility.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给病人的感觉是﹐他们决不可以插手医疗事务。

Sense.DEF: a soldier or a group of soldiers that enters a country or town by force in order to take control of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Invaders ransacked the town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 侵略军洗劫了小镇。

Sense.DEF: a contract, ticket, claim etc that is invalid is not legally or officially acceptable
Sense.TRAN: 〔合约﹑票﹑所有权等〕无效的﹐作废的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Without the right date stamped on it, your ticket will be invalid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 票上若没有加盖正确日期就是废票。

Sense.DEF: an argument, reason etc that is invalid is not based on true facts or clear ideas, and lacks good judgment
if something you type into a computer is invalid, the computer does not recognize or accept it
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机〕不能识别的﹔不接受的
Sense.EXAMPLE: filename in invalid format
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无效格式的文件名

Sense.DEF: someone who cannot look after themselves because of illness, old age, or injury
Sense.EXAMPLE: I resented being treated as an invalid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我讨厌别人把我当病人看待。

Sense.DEF: to have to leave the army, navy etc because you are ill or injured
to make a document, ticket, claim etc no longer legally or officially acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Failure to disclose all relevant changes may invalidate your policy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未能披露所有的相关变化会令保单无效。

Sense.DEF: to show that something such as a belief or explanation is wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: Later findings invalidated the theory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后来的发现推翻了这一理论。

Sense.DEF: the state of being too ill, old, or injured to work
Sense.EXAMPLE: invalidity benefit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伤残救济金

Sense.DEF: the state of being not legally or officially acceptable
extremely useful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your advice has been invaluable to us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的建议对我们非常宝贵。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This help was invaluable in focussing my ideas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一帮助对于整理我的思绪很有益处。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The internet is an invaluable source of information.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因特网是十分有价值的信息来源。

Sense.DEF: always happening in the same way, at the same time etc
Sense.TRAN: 恒定的﹐不变的﹔始终如一的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His invariable answer was ‘Wait and see.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的回答总是那句话:“等着瞧吧。”

Sense.DEF: never changing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mass, unlike weight, is invariable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与重量不同﹐质量是不变的。

Sense.DEF: if something invariably happens or is invariably true, it always happens or is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: It invariably rains when I go there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每次去那儿都下雨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The security guards were invariably ex-servicemen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保安人员毫无例外地都是退伍军人。

Sense.DEF: when the army of one country enters another country by force, in order to take control of it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the invasion of Normandy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对诺曼底的入侵

Sense.DEF: the arrival in a place of a lot of people or things, often where they are not wanted
Sense.TRAN: 〔不受欢迎的人或物的〕涌入﹔蜂拥而来
Sense.EXAMPLE: the annual invasion of teenagers for the Glastonbury Festival
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年前来参加格拉斯顿伯里音乐节的青少年的涌入

Sense.DEF: a situation in which someone tries to find out details about another person’s private affairs in a way that is upsetting and often illegal
invasive medical treatment involves cutting into someone’s body
Sense.TRAN: 〔治疗〕有创（性） 的﹐需手术的
Sense.EXAMPLE: invasive surgery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开刀手术

Sense.DEF: an invasive disease spreads quickly and is difficult to stop
Sense.EXAMPLE: invasive bladder cancers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扩散性膀胱癌

Sense.DEF: an invasive plant spreads quickly in a garden or other area, so that it becomes a problem
rude and insulting words that someone says when they are very angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: He let out a stream of invective.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他连声咒骂。

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone or something strongly
to persuade someone to do what you want, especially in a dishonest way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had inveigled me into taking messages to her lover.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她骗我给她的情人送信。

Sense.DEF: to make, design, or think of a new type of thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone in 1876.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚历山大 · 格雷厄姆 · 贝尔于1876年发明了电话。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse with discover to be the first person to find something or to know that it exists . 不要与discover（发现）混淆: Scientists have discovered a new type of bacteria. 科学家发现了一种新的细菌。

Sense.DEF: to think of an idea, story etc that is not true, usually in order to deceive people
Sense.TRAN: 捏造﹐虚构〔观点﹑故事等﹐通常为了欺骗别人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They invented a very convincing alibi.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们编造了很有说服力的不在犯罪现场的证据。

Exponent.DEF: to think of an idea for a new product, machine etc, and design it or make it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The telephone was invented by Alexander Graham Bell.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话是亚历山大·格雷厄姆·贝尔发明的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Who invented the Internet?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 因特网是谁发明的？

Exponent.DEF: to make or design something new and original
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We decided to create the software ourselves.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决定自己来设计这个软件。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: For her latest book, she has created a whole new group of characters.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在自己的新书中塑造了一批全新的人物。

Exponent.DEF: to produce a new idea, plan, method, excuse etc by thinking
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve thought of an idea.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想出了一个主意。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They’re always trying to think up new ways to improve efficiency.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们总是在探索提高效率的新方法。

Exponent.DEF: to produce a new idea, a way of dealing with something etc, especially a good one
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How did you come up with that idea?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是怎么想出那个主意的？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Ellis came up with the solution to the problem immediately.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃利斯马上就想出了解决问题的办法。

Exponent.DEF: to invent a story, song, game, excuse etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My mother used to make up bedtime stories for us.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我妈妈以前常常给我们编睡前故事。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I didn’t want to go to the class, so I decided to make up an excuse.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想去上课,因此决定编个借口。

Exponent.DEF: to think of an idea or plan, especially one that seems unusual or even crazy
Exponent.TRAN: 想出〔不同寻常的甚至疯狂的〕主意[计划]
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It can’t be easy dreaming up new advertisements all the time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 要不断地琢磨出新的广告绝非易事。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I wonder who dreamt up that idea!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在想是谁想出了那个点子！

Exponent.DEF: to invent a way of doing something, especially one that is clever or complicated
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This system was devised as a way of measuring students’ progress.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这套系统是为了评估学生的进步情况而设计的。

Exponent.DEF: to think of a new idea, plan etc and develop it in your mind
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The project was originally conceived by a Dutch businessman two years ago.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个计划最初是两年前由一位荷兰商人设想出来的。

Sense.DEF: a useful machine, tool, instrument etc that has been invented
Sense.TRAN: 发明（物）〔如机器﹑工具﹑仪器等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dishwasher is a wonderful invention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洗碗机是一项奇妙的发明。

Sense.DEF: the act of inventing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The invention of the computer has revolutionized the business world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑的发明使商界发生了根本变化。

Sense.DEF: a story, explanation etc that is not true
Sense.TRAN: 虚构的故事﹔编造的解释﹔假话
Sense.EXAMPLE: They subsequently admitted that the story was pure invention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们后来承认他们说的纯属虚构。

Sense.DEF: the ability to think of new and clever ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: With such powers of invention, he should get a job easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他创造力这么强﹐应该很容易找到工作。

Sense.DEF: able to think of new, different, or interesting ideas
Sense.TRAN: 有创造力的﹐善于创新的
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the most talented and inventive drummers in modern music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代音乐界最有才华﹑最有创造力的鼓手之一

Sense.DEF: someone who has invented something, or whose job is to invent things
a list of all the things in a place
Sense.TRAN: 〔一个地方所有东西的〕详细目录﹐清单

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We made an inventory of everything in the apartment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把这公寓里的所有东西开列了一份详细清单。

Sense.DEF: all the goods in a shop
if there is an inverse relationship between two amounts, one gets bigger at the same rate as the other gets smaller
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clearly, the amount of money people save increases in inverse proportion to the amount they spend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然﹐人们储蓄的增加与消费成反比。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the inverse relationship between prices and interest rates
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格和利率之间的反比关系

Sense.DEF: exactly opposite
the complete opposite of something
the act of changing something so that it is the opposite of what it was before, or of turning something upside down the bottom is on the top and the top is on the bottom
a type of weather condition in which the air nearest the ground is cooler than the air above it
Sense.TRAN: 逆温〔指越接近地面气温越低〕

Sense.DEF: to put something in the opposite position to the one it was in before, especially by turning it upside down the bottom is on the top and the top is on the bottom
Sense.TRAN: 使反向﹔使上下颠倒﹐使倒置

Sense.DEF:
a living creature that does not have a
backbone
one of a pair of marks (‘…’) that are put at the beginning and end of a written word, sentence etc to show that someone said it or wrote it, or when writing the title of a book, song etc
used to show that a word you are using to describe something is only what it is usually called, and not what you think it really is
Sense.TRAN: 所谓的〔表示用来描述某物的词只是它通常的名称﹐而不是你所认为的意思〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her friends, in inverted commas, all disappeared when she was in trouble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当她陷入困境时﹐她那些所谓的“朋友”全都消失了。

Sense.DEF: the idea that everything that is typical of the upper classes must be bad
Sense.TRAN: 反向势利﹐倒转的势利（观点）〔认为属于上层社会的一切事物都必然是坏的〕

Sense.DEF: to buy shares, property, or goods because you hope that the value will increase and you can make a profit
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a few thousand dollars I’m looking to invest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有几千美元想作投资。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Oliver made a fortune by investing in antique furniture.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥利弗投资古董家具发了财。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Williams invested a large sum of money in Swiss stocks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 威廉斯投资了一大笔钱购买瑞士股票。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had invested heavily invested a lot of money in the bond market.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在债券市场作了大量投资。

Sense.DEF: if a government, business, or organization invests in something, they spend a large amount of money to improve it or help it succeed
Sense.TRAN: 〔政府﹑企业或机构〕把〔资金〕投入﹐投资

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The city has invested millions of dollars in the museum.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城市对该博物馆已投入了数百万美元。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The factory plans to invest in new computers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该工厂计划投资购买新电脑。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say put money in/into something rather than invest in something.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们常说put money in/into something,而不说invest in something
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He put money into his brother’s business.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把钱投资到他弟弟的企业里。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The government put in millions of pounds.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府投资了几百万英镑。

Sense.DEF: to use a lot of time, effort etc or spend money in order to make something succeed
Sense.TRAN: 投入〔大量时间﹑精力﹑金钱等以成就某事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was very difficult to leave a home we had invested so much in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个家我们投入得太多﹐要离开真的很难。

Sense.DEF: to buy something or spend money or time on something, because it will be useful for you
Sense.TRAN: 购买﹔投入〔金钱或时间〕在〔对自己有用的东西上〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s about time you invested in a new shirt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你该买件新衬衫了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone here has a lot invested in their careers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的每个人都在自己的事业上投入大量时间。

Sense.DEF: to officially give someone power to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jody has invested Alan with great power over her career.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事业方面的事﹐乔迪几乎都听艾伦的。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something seem to have a particular quality or character
Sense.TRAN: 使似乎具有〔某种特性或品性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Richard’s heavy-rimmed glasses invested him with an air of intelligence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理查德的厚边眼镜使他看上去很有智慧。

Sense.DEF: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem
Sense.TRAN: 查明﹔调查﹔侦查〔犯罪﹑事故或科学问题等的真相〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The state police are investigating the incident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 州警察正调查此事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The study investigates the impact of violent TV programming on children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该研究调查暴力电视节目对儿童的影响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I heard a noise and went downstairs to investigate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听见响声﹐就下楼去看个究竟。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say look into something rather than investigate something.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们常说look into something,而不说investigate something
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I’ll ask my colleague to look into it.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会请同事查一下这件事。

Sense.DEF: to try to find out more about someone’s character, actions etc, because you think they may have been involved in a crime
Sense.TRAN: 调查〔某人﹐因认为某人可能卷入了罪案〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Penney was already being investigated by the police on suspicion of murder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彭尼因涉嫌谋杀已在接受警方调查。

Sense.DEF: an official attempt to find out the truth about or the cause of something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem
Sense.TRAN: 〔对犯罪﹑事故或科学问题等进行的正式的〕调查﹐侦查
Sense.EXAMPLE: The investigation continued for nearly three years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调查持续了近三年。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The authorities are planning to launch a full-scale investigation into the crash.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当局计划对这桩坠机事件展开全面调查。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Baker demanded an investigation of the district attorney’s office.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝克要求对地方检察官的办公室进行搜查。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a criminal investigation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刑事调查
Sense.EXAMPLE: A private detective was hired to conduct the investigation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇了一名私人侦探进行调查。

Sense.DEF: the act of investigating something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the investigation of computer fraud
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对电脑诈骗的调查

GramExa.GLOSS: being investigated
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The whole issue is still under investigation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个事件仍在调查中。

Sense.DEF: work or activities that involve investigating something
Sense.TRAN: 调查研究报道/报告/工作

Sense.DEF: someone who investigates things, especially crimes
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指针对犯罪的〕调查员﹐调查者
Sense.EXAMPLE: police investigators
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警探

Sense.DEF: relating to investigating something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the investigatory powers of the Office of Fair Trading
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公平贸易署的调查权力

Sense.DEF: a ceremony at which someone is given an official title

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the investiture of the Prince of Wales
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 册封威尔士亲王的仪式

Sense.DEF: the use of money to get a profit or to make a business activity successful, or the money that is used
Sense.EXAMPLE: We plan to buy some property as an investment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们打算买些房地产作为投资。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: That year, Japanese investment in American real estate totaled $13.06 billion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那年﹐日本投资美国房地产的总额达到了130.6亿美元。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Each of us was required to put up a minimum investment of $5,000.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每个人都要至少投资5,000美元。

Sense.DEF: something that you buy or do because it will be useful later

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The lessons cost me over $500, but I consider them a good investment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些课程花了我五百多美元﹐但我认为这是一笔很好的投资。

Sense.DEF: when you spend a large amount of time, energy, emotion etc on something
Sense.TRAN: 〔大量时间﹑精力﹑情感等的〕投入
Sense.EXAMPLE: a huge investment of time and effort
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时间和精力的大量投入

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We have made a huge investment in our website.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们投资了一大笔钱到我们的网站。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company is trying to attract investment from overseas.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司在争取吸引海外投资。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government has cut taxes in order to stimulate investment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府已减税以刺激投资。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It's best to invest in several funds, in order to protect your investment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好投资几项基金以保障你的投资。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: get back the money that you have invested

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Property is usually a good investment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 房地产通常是很好的投资。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The shares turned out to be a poor investment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些股票最终表明是糟糕的投资。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Developing a new computer system is always a big investment for any organisation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 开发新电脑系统对任何机构来说都是一项重大的投资。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in which you are unlikely to lose money
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Electricity shares are still a safe investment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 电力股仍是安全的投资对象。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in which you are likely to lose money
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Risky investments usually have higher yields.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有风险的投资一般都有高回报。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government is eager to attract foreign investment to fund building projects.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府很想吸引海外投资为建筑项目筹集资金。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that will give you profit after a long time
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Buying a house is a long-term investment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 买房是一项长期投资。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that will give you profit in a short time
investment by private individuals
investment by the government or state
investment in machines, equipment etc

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Most investment schemes are subject to tax.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数的投资计划都要缴税。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She took advantage of a unique investment opportunity.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她抓住了一次难得的投资机会。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: money that you earn from your investments

Collocate.COLLOC: the (rate of) return on an investment
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: profit from an investment
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We expect a high return on our investment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们期待丰厚的投资回报。

Sense.DEF: a bank that buys and sells securities, stocks or bonds
a group of people who meet regularly to decide which investments to buy and sell together, with money that they all put into the group
Sense.EXAMPLE: O’Hara belongs to an investment club in Detroit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥哈拉是底特律一家投资俱乐部的成员。

Sense.DEF: someone who gives money to a company, business, or bank in order to get a profit
someone who lies a lot, smokes a lot etc and cannot stop
Sense.TRAN: 惯于说谎的人/烟瘾很大的人/沉迷女色的人等

Sense.DEF: an attitude or feeling that you have had for a long time and cannot change
Sense.TRAN: 根深蒂固的喜爱/怀疑/仇恨等

Sense.DEF: unpleasant, especially because it is likely to offend people or make you unpopular
Sense.TRAN: 令人不快的﹐惹人反感的
Sense.EXAMPLE: By innocently lying to detectives, she’d put herselfinaninvidious position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于无意间向侦探撒了谎﹐她把自己置于一个尴尬的境地。

Sense.DEF: to watch people who are taking an examination and make sure that they do not cheat
if something invigorates you, it makes you feel healthier, stronger and have more energy
Sense.TRAN: 使生气勃勃﹔使精神焕发
Sense.EXAMPLE: At my age, the walk into town is enough to invigorate me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我这个年龄﹐走路进城足以让我感到精神振作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt invigorated after a day in the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在乡村待了一天后感觉精神焕发。

Sense.DEF: to make the people in an organization or group feel excited again, so that they want to make something successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carey’s hope was that the church would be renewed and invigorated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯里希望教会能复兴。

Sense.DEF: making you feel healthy and giving you a lot of energy
Sense.TRAN: 使人精力充沛的﹐使人生气勃勃的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an invigorating swim before breakfast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早餐前令人精神振作的游泳

Sense.DEF: too strong to be destroyed or defeated
Sense.EXAMPLE: an invincible army
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无敌的军队
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young athletes think of themselves as invincible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻的运动员自认为是战无不胜的。

Sense.DEF: an invincible belief, attitude etc is extremely strong and cannot be changed
Sense.TRAN: 〔信念﹑态度等〕不可改变的﹐坚定不移的

Sense.DEF: an inviolable right, law, principle etc is extremely important and should be treated with respect and not broken or removed
Sense.TRAN: 〔权利﹑法律﹑原则等〕不可违背的﹐不可侵犯的

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the inviolability of the country’s borders

Sense.DEF: something that is inviolate cannot be attacked, changed, or destroyed
something that is invisible cannot be seen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house was surrounded by trees, and invisible from the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所房子树木环绕﹐从路上是看不见的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The plane is meant to be invisible to radar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这飞机在雷达上应该监测不到。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Using a telescope, Galileo discovered stars that were invisible to the naked eye.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伽利略用望远镜发现了肉眼看不到的恒星。

Sense.DEF: not noticed, or not talked about
Sense.TRAN: 未意识到的﹔避而不谈的﹔无形的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s an invisible barrier that keeps women out of top jobs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性想进入职场高层存在着无形的障碍。

Sense.DEF:
money that is made from services and
tourism
rather than from products
ink that cannot be seen on paper until it is heated, treated with chemicals etc, and is used for writing secret messages
Sense.TRAN: 〔加热或经化学品处理等之后才能看到的〕隐形墨水

Sense.DEF: a written or spoken request to someone, inviting them to go somewhere or do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an invitation to speak at a scientific conference
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在科学大会上发言的邀请

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Roger never turns down an invitation to dinner.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人请吃饭罗杰从不拒绝。

Sense.DEF: the act of being invited or of inviting someone to go somewhere or do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Attendance at the seminars is by invitation only only those people who have been invited can attend.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 研讨会凭邀请函方可参加。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They were always dropping by, usually without invitation.
