Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们常常来串门﹐通常不请自来。

GramExa.PROPFORM: at sb’s invitation/at the invitation of sb
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kegl traveled to Nicaragua at the invitation of the Education Minister.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯格尔应教育部长的邀请前往尼加拉瓜。

Sense.DEF: a card inviting someone to attend a party, wedding etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We sent out more than 300 wedding invitations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们发出了超过300份婚礼请柬。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you get an invitation to Jason’s party?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有收到贾森的聚会请柬？

Sense.DEF: encouragement to do something

GramExa.PROPFORM: take sth as an invitation to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He seemed to take my silence as an invitation to talk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他似乎把我的沉默理解为鼓励他讲话。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be an open invitation for/to sb
Sense.DEF: to make it very easy for someone to rob you or harm you
Sense.TRAN: 让某人易于〔抢劫或伤害〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leaving the car unlocked is just an open invitation to thieves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不锁汽车就离开是摆明了让窃贼来偷。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1, 2 & 3

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Did you get an invitation to Janet's party?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你收到珍妮特的聚会邀请了吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The following week, I had an invitation to give a talk in Cambridge.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二个星期我收到了去剑桥大学演讲的邀请。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She accepted his invitation to dinner.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她接受了他的晚宴邀请。

Collocate.COLLOC: take up sb's invitation/take sb up on their invitation
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: accept someone's invitation
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I decided to take them up on their invitation to dinner.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定接受他们的晚宴邀请。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She turned down an invitation to take part in a televised debate.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拒绝了参加电视辩论的邀请。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He has issued an invitation to the Chinese president to come to Washington.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向中国国家主席发出了访问华盛顿的邀请。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 对某人的邀请表示感谢

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He had a wedding invitation from Rob and Jen.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他接到罗布和珍的婚礼请柬。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Fred's wife has accepted the dinner invitation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗雷德的妻子接受了晚宴邀请。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The president received a formal invitation to visit Nigeria.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统收到了访问尼日利亚的正式邀请。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Each parent was sent a personal invitation for the school's open day.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 给每位家长发出了参加学校开放日的邀请。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It gives me great pleasure to accept your kind invitation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 能接受您的盛情邀请是我莫大的荣幸。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an invitation to do something at any time you like
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Phillip kindly gave me an open invitation to stay at his villa in Tuscany.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲利普盛情邀请我随时去他在托斯卡纳的乡间别墅。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an invitation which someone has had for a long time
a card with an invitation printed on it
a lot of invitations
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He got a flood of invitations to appear on TV and radio shows.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他收到了大量请他上电视和电台节目的邀请。

Sense.DEF: to ask someone to come to a party, wedding, meal etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Who should we invite to the party?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们该邀请谁来参加聚会？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gail invited me to stay with her while her husband was out of town.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 盖尔邀请我在她丈夫出城时住在她家。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you invite her for a drink at the club one evening?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你何不找个晚上请她到俱乐部去喝一杯？

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid I wasn’t invited.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕我没有受到邀请。

Sense.DEF: to politely ask someone to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anyone interested in contributing articles is invited to contact the editor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凡是有兴趣投稿的人请和编辑联系。

Sense.DEF: to encourage something bad to happen, especially without intending to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Any government that sells arms to dictators is inviting trouble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何向独裁者出售武器的政府都是在自找麻烦。

Sense.DEF: to ask someone if they would like to come with you when you are going somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you invite Barbara along?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不请芭芭拉和你一同前往？

Sense.DEF: to ask someone to come to your home, hotel etc after you have been out somewhere together
Sense.TRAN: 〔在与某人一同外出之后〕邀请…到自己家中

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Richard often used to invite me back for coffee after the show.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去理查德常常在看完演出后请我到他家里喝咖啡。

Sense.DEF: to ask someone to come to your home, your office etc again
Sense.TRAN: 再次邀请〔某人到家里﹑办公室等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you keep arguing with Gerry, they won’t invite us back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你继续和格里争吵﹐他们就不会再邀请我们了。

Sense.DEF: to ask someone to come into your home
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a few seconds, the door opened and Mrs Barnes invited me in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几秒钟后﹐门开了﹐巴恩斯夫人请我进屋。

Sense.DEF: to ask someone to go somewhere with you, especially to a restaurant or film
Sense.TRAN: 邀请〔某人〕外出〔尤其是去饭店或看电影〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We invited Clarissa out for ice cream.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们邀请克拉丽莎一起去吃冰激凌。

Sense.DEF: to ask someone to come to your home, usually for a drink or a meal
Sense.TRAN: 邀请〔某人〕来家里〔通常来喝酒或吃饭〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Max has invited me over for dinner.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克斯已邀请我去他家吃晚饭。

Sense.DEF: an invitation to a party, meal etc
something that is inviting is very attractive and makes you want to be near it, try it, taste it etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The log fire looked warm and inviting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 篝火看上去温暖诱人。

Sense.DEF:
a process in which a human egg is
fertilized
outside a woman’s body
taking place in the body
a speech or prayer at the beginning of a ceremony or meeting
Sense.TRAN: 〔仪式或集会开始时的〕发言﹐祷文

Sense.DEF: a request for help, especially from a god
a list of goods that have been supplied or work that has been done, showing how much you owe for them
Sense.TRAN: 发票﹔发货清单﹐已完成工作的清单〔单上注明应支付的款项〕

Sense.DEF: to send someone an invoice
if you invoke a law, rule etc, you say that you are doing something because the law allows or forces you to
Sense.EXAMPLE: The UN threatened to invoke economic sanctions if the talks were broken off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国威胁说﹐如果谈判破裂将采取经济制裁。

Sense.DEF: to make a particular idea, image, or feeling appear in people’s minds by describing an event or situation, or by talking about a person
Sense.TRAN: 〔在脑海中〕唤起﹐引起﹐激发出〔某个想法﹑形象或感觉〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a painting that invokes images of the Rocky Mountains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使人联想到落基山脉的画
Sense.EXAMPLE: During his speech, he invoked the memory of Harry Truman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他演讲时使人想起哈里 · 杜鲁门。

Sense.DEF:
to use a law, principle, or
theory
to support your views
Sense.TRAN: 援引〔法律﹑原则或理论以支持自己的论点〕

Sense.DEF: to operate a computer program
to ask for help from someone more powerful than you, especially a god
Sense.TRAN: 向〔有权力者﹐尤指神灵〕祈求帮助
Sense.EXAMPLE: St. Genevieve is often invoked against plagues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们经常祈求圣女日南斐法来消除瘟疫。

Sense.DEF: to make spirits appear by using magic
Sense.EXAMPLE: invoking the spirits of their ancestors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为他们的先人招魂

Sense.DEF: an involuntary movement, sound, reaction etc is one that you make suddenly and without intending to because you cannot control yourself
Sense.TRAN: 〔动作﹑声音﹑反应等〕无意识做出的﹐非故意的
Sense.EXAMPLE: When Willie tapped on the window, Miguel gave an involuntary jump.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威利敲了敲窗户﹐米格尔不由自主地跳了起来。

Sense.DEF: happening to you although you do not want it to
Sense.EXAMPLE: involuntary part-time workers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无奈从事非全时工作的人

Sense.DEF: if an activity or situation involves something, that thing is part of it or a result of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: What will the job involve?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份工作包括什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t realize putting on a play involved so much work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没想到上演一出戏剧需要做这么多的工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Running your own business usually involves working long hours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 自己经营企业往往要经常加班。

Sense.DEF: to include or affect someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: These changes will involve everyone on the staff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些变化将影响每一位职员。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There have been four accidents involving Forest Service planes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已有四次事故涉及（美国）林务局的飞机。

Sense.DEF: to ask or allow someone to take part in something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Try to involve as many children as possible in the game.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量让多一些孩子参与游戏。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We want to involve the workforce at all stages of the decision-making process.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望让职员全程参与决策。

Sense.DEF: to take part actively in a particular activity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Reilly involves himself in every aspect of his company’s business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 赖利积极参与公司经营的各项业务。

Sense.DEF: to take part in an activity or event, or be connected with it in some way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: More than 30 software firms were involved in the project.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 三十多家软件公司参与了这项工程。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to get involved in some lengthy argument about who is to blame.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想卷入谁该承担责任的冗长争论。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid your son’s been involved in an accident he is one of the people in an accident.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕事故牵涉到了你的儿子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Landel has been involved with the Hercules project for years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 朗代尔参加海格立斯计划已有好几年了。

GramExa.GLOSS: involved very much
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mrs. Cummings has been actively involved with the church for years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡明斯太太积极参与教会事务有好几年了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: work/effort etc involved in doing sth
Sense.DEF: the amount of work, effort etc that is needed in order to make something succeed
Sense.TRAN: 为成就某事必须做的工作/付出的努力等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most people don’t realize the amount of effort involved in writing a novel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数人都不明白写一本小说要花多少心血。

Subsense.DEF: to be having a romantic relationship with someone, especially a sexual one
Subsense.TRAN: 和某人恋爱〔尤指有性关系〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The senator denied that he was romantically involved with a member of his staff.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参议员否认和他的某位员工有染。

Subsense.DEF: to spend time with someone that you have a relationship with
Subsense.TRAN: 与〔有亲属关系的人〕一起
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Fathers are encouraged to be more involved with their families.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做父亲的受到鼓励要多和家人在一起。

Sense.DEF: having so many different parts that it is difficult to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plot was so involved that very few people knew what was going on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情节太复杂﹐几乎没人知道是怎么回事。

Sense.DEF: the act of taking part in an activity or event, or the way in which you take part in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: School officials say they welcome parental involvement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 校方说他们欢迎学生父母参与。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His new book examines the United States’ involvement in World War II.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的新书探讨美国参与第二次世界大战的始末。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Carey’s possible involvement with a series of robberies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯里可能参与了一连串抢劫案

Sense.DEF: something that you take part in or spend time doing
Sense.TRAN: 参与的事物﹔投入时间的事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: sporting involvements
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参加体育运动
Sense.EXAMPLE: her political involvements
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在政治方面的参与

Sense.DEF: the feeling of excitement and satisfaction that you get from an activity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Weaver admitted a strong emotional involvement in her client’s case.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 韦弗承认她从委托人的案件中获得了极大的情感满足。

Sense.DEF: a romantic relationship between two people, especially when they are not married to each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Donna knew nothing of her husband’s involvement with another woman.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 唐娜根本不知道丈夫和另一个女人有染。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is invulnerable cannot be harmed or damaged if you attack or criticize them
Sense.TRAN: 〔人或物〕无法伤害的﹐攻不破的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gerry’s confidence made him feel invulnerable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自信让格里觉得自己无懈可击。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We will not be satisfied until this city is safe and invulnerable to attack.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有这城市安全可靠﹑牢不可破时﹐我们才会满意。

Sense.DEF: felt or experienced in your own mind but not expressed to other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a feeling of inward satisfaction
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内心的满足感
Sense.EXAMPLE: inward panic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内心的恐慌

Sense.DEF: towards the inside or centre of something

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I managed to smile, but inwardly I was furious.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我勉强露出笑容﹐心里却很气愤。

Sense.DEF:
investment
in a country’s industry or businesses that comes from foreign countries
an inward-looking person or group is more interested in themselves than in other people – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔人或团体〕只关注自身的〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: towards the inside of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: A breeze blew the curtains inwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微风把窗帘吹向屋里。

Sense.DEF: a word that is popular at a particular time, or among a particular group of people, but that does not usually continue to be popular for long
Sense.EXAMPLE: the latest in-word amongst teenagers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 青少年中最新的流行语

Sense.DEF: in-your-face behaviour is intended to be noticed and to shock or upset people
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为〕令人震惊的﹐故意惹人生气的

Sense.DEF:
a dark blue chemical substance that is used on wounds to prevent infection. It is a chemical
element
:symbol I
Sense.TRAN: 碘〔一种化学元素﹐符号为 I〕

Sense.DEF:
an atom which has been given a positive or negative force by adding or taking away an
electron
the act, state, or result of doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the completion of the task act of finishing it
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任务完成
Sense.EXAMPLE: his election he was elected to the post
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他当选该职位
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young children demand a lot of attention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幼儿需要很多关注。

Sense.DEF: made in the simply decorated style of ancient Greek buildings
Sense.TRAN: 〔古希腊〕爱奥尼亚建筑风格的〔一种简洁的装饰风格〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an Ionic column
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱奥尼亚式柱子

Sense.DEF: to form ions or make them form

a machine used to make the air in a room more healthy by producing negative
ions
Sense.TRAN: 负离子发生器〔用于使室内空气清新〕

Sense.DEF:
the part of the
atmosphere
which is used to help send radio waves around the Earth
not even a small amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: It won’t make an iota of difference.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这不会有丝毫区别。

Sense.DEF: a note that you sign to say that you owe someone some money
a system of special signs, used to represent the sounds made in speech

a special number that is used to
identify
a computer, and which the computer needs in order to be able to connect to the Internet
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机的〕网际协议地址﹐IP地址

Sense.DEF: the crime of illegally copying and selling something which is another person’s work

the first time that
stock
in a company is available for the public to buy on the
stock market

a small piece of electronic equipment for playing music, made by the Apple computer company. You can carry an iPod around with you and it can store a very large amount of music which you get from the Internet, from a CD, or from another iPod. iPods can also store videos and games.
Sense.TRAN: iPod〔苹果电脑公司生产的便携式数码音乐播放器﹐也可储存视频﹑玩游戏〕

Sense.DEF: used to show that something is known from or proved by the facts
Sense.TRAN: 根据事实本身〔用于表示某事是根据事实得知或有事实依据〕

Sense.DEF: your level of intelligence, measured by a special test, with 100 being the average result
Sense.TRAN: 智商〔用特殊测验测试﹐100为平均数〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an IQ of 130
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 智商130

Sense.DEF:
used instead of
in-
before the letter r
Sense.EXAMPLE: irregular not regular
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不规则的

Sense.DEF: an illegal organization that wants to unite Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland
Sense.TRAN: 爱尔兰共和军〔企图把北爱尔兰与爱尔兰共和国统一起来的非法组织〕

Sense.DEF:
a special bank account in which you can save money for your
retirement
without paying tax on it until later
easily becoming angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: an irascible old man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位脾气暴躁的老人

Sense.DEF: extremely angry, especially because you think you have been treated unfairly
Sense.TRAN: 尤因认为受到不公平待遇而〕极愤怒的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an irate customer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极愤怒的顾客

Sense.DEF: anger

GramExa.GLOSS: make someone angry
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The proposal has drawn the ire of local residents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那项提议激怒了当地居民。

Sense.DEF: showing colours that seem to change in different lights
Sense.TRAN: 〔因光线不同而〕色彩斑斓的﹐彩虹色的
Sense.EXAMPLE: small iridescent blue flies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 色彩变幻的蓝色小苍蝇

Sense.DEF:
a hard and very heavy metal that is combined with
platinum
to make jewellery and is used in scientific instruments. It is a chemical
element
: symbol Ir
Sense.TRAN: 铱〔一种化学元素﹐符号为 Ir〕

Sense.DEF: a tall plant with long thin leaves and large purple, yellow, or white flowers

the round coloured part of your eye, that surrounds the black
pupil
relating to Ireland or its people
people from Ireland

coffee with cream and
whisky
Sense.TRAN: 爱尔兰咖啡〔加奶油和威士忌的咖啡〕

Sense.DEF: a man from Ireland
a dish of meat, potatoes, and onions boiled together
a woman from Ireland

a very high-quality print that is made using a special
printer
which is controlled by a computer and which
sprays
very small drops of coloured ink onto the paper

an examination of someone’s
iris the round coloured part in the centre of the eye
using special computer equipment in order to
identify
them. Iris scans are done by the police and
immigration
officials at some airports to check the information on someone’s
passport
or
id card
.
if something irks you, it makes you feel annoyed
annoying
Sense.EXAMPLE: an irksome journey
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次恼人的旅行

Sense.DEF:
a common hard metal that is used to make steel, is
magnetic
, and is found in very small quantities in food and blood. It is a chemical
element
: symbol Fe
Sense.TRAN: 铁〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Fe〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the iron and steel industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钢铁工业
Sense.EXAMPLE: a driveway with large iron gates
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安装了大铁门的私家车道

GramExa.GLOSS: rock that contains iron

Sense.EXAMPLE: the absorption of iron from food
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对食物中铁的吸收

Sense.DEF: a thing used for making clothes smooth, which has a heated flat metal base

Sense.LEXUNIT: have several irons in the fire
Sense.DEF: to be involved in several different activities or have several plans all happening at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 同时从事数种不同活动﹔同时有数项计划
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has several economic irons in the fire, including gold and diamond mines.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他同时经营数个赚钱的项目﹐包括金矿和钻石矿。

Sense.DEF:
a
golf club
made of metal rather than wood
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 5-iron
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 5号铁头球杆

Sense.DEF: a chain used to prevent a prisoner from moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: leg irons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脚镣

Crossrefto.REFLEX: a will of iron/an iron will
rule sb/sth with a rod of iron
strike while the iron is hot

Sense.DEF: to make clothes smooth using an iron
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you ironed my shirt?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的衬衫你熨过了吗？

Sense.DEF: to solve or get rid of problems or difficulties, especially small ones
Sense.TRAN: 消除﹐解决〔尤指小问题或困难〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to iron out a few problems first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要先解决几个问题。

Sense.DEF: very firm and strong or determined
Sense.EXAMPLE: He runs the company with an iron fist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以铁腕经营着公司。

Sense.DEF: the period of time about 3,000 years ago when iron was first used for making tools, weapons etc
an ironclad agreement, proof, defence etc is so strong and sure that it cannot be changed or argued against
Sense.TRAN: 〔协议﹑证据﹑辩词等〕不能改变的﹐无法反对的﹐铁定的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ironclad guarantee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绝对的保证

Sense.DEF: covered with iron
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ironclad battleship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 装甲战列舰

Sense.DEF: the name that was used for the border between the Communist countries of Eastern Europe and the rest of Europe
Sense.TRAN: 铁幕〔原指东欧共产主义国家与其他欧洲国家之间的边界〕

Sense.DEF: iron-grey hair is dark grey
an ironic situation is one that is unusual or amusing because something strange happens, or the opposite of what is expected happens or is true
Sense.TRAN: 〔情况〕有讽刺意味的﹐出乎意料的﹐令人啼笑皆非的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your car was stolen at the police station! How ironic!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的车在警察局被偷！真让人哭笑不得！
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s ironic that her husband smoked for thirty years, and yet she’s the one who died of lung cancer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 具有讽刺意味的是﹐她丈夫吸烟30年﹐而死于肺癌的却是她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In an ironic twist , the most trustworthy character in the film turned out to be the thief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影片中故事情节来了一个出乎意料的转折﹐最可信赖的人原来是小偷。

Sense.DEF: using words that are the opposite of what you really mean, often in a joking way
Sense.TRAN: 〔遣词用字〕讽刺的﹐用反语的〔常以开玩笑方式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ironic comments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带讽刺意味的评论
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I told Lucy I loved her book, she thought I was being ironic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当我告诉露西我喜欢她的书时﹐她以为我在讥讽她。

Sense.DEF: used when talking about a situation in which the opposite of what you expected happens or is true
Sense.TRAN: 具有讽刺意味的是﹔出乎意料的是﹔让人哭笑不得的是
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ironically, his cold got better on the last day of his holiday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 具有讽刺意味的是﹐他的感冒竟在假期的最后一天有所好转。

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows you really mean the opposite of what you are saying
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Oh, no problem!’ said Terry, ironically.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “哦﹐没问题！”特里挖苦道。

Sense.DEF: the activity of making clothes smooth with an iron
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate doing the ironing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我讨厌熨衣服。

Sense.DEF: clothes that are waiting to be ironed or have just been ironed
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m tired and there’s still a pile of ironing to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我累了﹐但还有很多衣服要熨。

Sense.DEF: a small narrow table used for ironing clothes
a large machine with a metal case used to help people to breathe
someone who works in or owns a shop that sells tools and equipment for your home and garden
a shop that sells this equipment
small amounts of high-energy food, carried by soldiers, mountain climbers etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔士兵﹑登山者等随身携带的〕应急口粮〔量小但热量高的食品〕

Sense.DEF: articles made of iron
fences, gates etc made of iron bent into attractive shapes
a situation that is unusual or amusing because something strange happens, or the opposite of what is expected happens or is true
Sense.TRAN: 具有讽刺意味[出乎意料﹐令人啼笑皆非]的情况
Sense.EXAMPLE: Life is full of little ironies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活中充满了小小的讽刺。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tragic irony is that the drug was supposed to save lives.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可悲的讽刺在于﹐这药本来是用来挽救生命的。

Sense.DEF: when you use words that are the opposite of what you really mean, often in order to be amusing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Wagner calls his program ‘the worst talk show in America,’ without a hint of irony.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 瓦格纳不带一丝讽刺﹐称他的节目是“美国最糟糕的访谈节目”。

GramExa.GLOSS: a lot of irony
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Of course Michael won’t be late; you know how punctual he always is,’ she said with heavy irony.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “当然﹐迈克尔不会迟到﹐你知道他一贯是多么守时。”她用强烈的讽刺口吻说道。

Sense.DEF:
if someone or something is irradiated,
x-rays
or
radioactive
beams are passed through them
Sense.TRAN: 〔用 X 射线或放射线〕照射

Sense.DEF:
if food is irradiated, it is treated with
radiation
in order to kill
bacteria
and make it last longer
Sense.TRAN: 用放射线照射〔食物以延长贮存时间〕

Sense.DEF: to make something look bright as if a light is shining onto it
not based on clear thought or reason
Sense.TRAN: 非理性的﹐不合理的﹐荒谬的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an irrational fear of flying
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对飞行非理性的恐惧
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s becoming increasingly irrational.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他变得越来越不可理喻了。

Sense.DEF: irreconcilable positions etc are so strongly opposed to each other that it is not possible for them to reach an agreement
Sense.TRAN: 〔立场等〕不能一致的﹐势不两立的﹐不可调和的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The differences between the landowners and the conservationists were irreconcilable from the start.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从一开始土地所有者和环境保护工作者之间的分歧就不可调和。

Sense.DEF: if two beliefs or ideas are irreconcilable, it is not possible to believe both of them
Sense.TRAN: 〔信仰或观点〕相对立的﹐相反的﹐矛盾的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This belief was irreconcilable with the Church’s doctrine of salvation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种信仰与教会的救赎教义是不相容的。

Sense.DEF:
strong disagreements between two people who are married, given as a legal reason for getting a
divorce
Sense.TRAN: 〔夫妇之间〕无法调和的分歧〔作为法律上离婚的一条理由〕

Sense.DEF: something that is irrecoverable is lost or has gone and you cannot get it back
Sense.TRAN: 不能挽回的﹐无法补救的
Sense.EXAMPLE: irrecoverable loss of sight
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可恢复的失明
Sense.EXAMPLE: The insurance premium is wholly irrecoverable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该保险费是完全不可取回的。

Sense.DEF: too bad to be corrected, repaired, or saved
Sense.TRAN: 〔因太糟而〕不能纠正的﹔无法补救的﹔不可救药的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Very few children are irredeemable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子很少有不可救药的。

Sense.DEF:
irredeemable
bonds
pay interest to the person who is lending money but do not have a set date saying when the money being lent must be paid back
Sense.TRAN: 〔债券〕不能偿还的﹐不可赎回的

Sense.DEF: an irreducible sum, level etc cannot be made smaller or simpler
Sense.TRAN: 〔金额﹑水平等〕不能缩减的﹐不能简化的

Sense.DEF: an irrefutable statement, argument etc cannot be proved to be wrong, and must be accepted
Sense.TRAN: 〔声明﹑论点等〕无可辩驳的﹐无法推翻的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: irrefutable proof of his innocence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 证明他清白的无可辩驳的证据

Sense.DEF: having a shape, surface, pattern etc that is not even, smooth, or balanced
Sense.TRAN: 〔形状〕不规则的﹔〔表面〕不平整的﹔〔图案〕不对称的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a jagged, irregular coastline
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锯齿状不规则的海岸线
Sense.EXAMPLE: It has a highly irregular shape, covered in bumps and indentations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它的外形极不规则﹐满是凸起和凹陷的地方。

Sense.DEF: not happening at times that are an equal distance from each other
Sense.TRAN: 无规律的﹐间隔不均匀的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s receiving medication for an irregular heartbeat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因心律不齐正在接受药物治疗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beamish only returned to Britain at irregular intervals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比米什只是不定期地回到英国。

Sense.DEF: not happening or done at the normal time for doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Funeral directors often work long, irregular hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 殡仪业人员的工作时间经常很长﹐而且不定时。

Sense.DEF: not obeying the usually accepted legal or moral rules
Sense.TRAN: 不合法的﹔不合道德规范的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would be highly irregular extremely irregular for a minister to accept payments of this kind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身为部长接受这类报酬是极不恰当的。

Sense.DEF: a verb or a form of a word that does not follow the usual pattern of grammar, such as the verb ‘catch’ or the plural ‘fish’
Sense.TRAN: 不规则动词/复数形式等

Sense.DEF:
a word meaning
constipated
unable to easily pass food waste from your body , used in order to be polite

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The club were found guilty of financial irregularities.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 该俱乐部被判存在财务违规行为。

Sense.DEF: a soldier who is not an official member of a country’s army
a lack of importance in a particular situation
someone or something that is not important in a particular situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: debates on the irrelevance of the education system
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于教育体制中无关紧要部分的争论

Sense.DEF: not useful or not relating to a particular situation, and therefore not important
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re focussing too much on irrelevant details.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们过于关注不相干的细节。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students viewed Latin as boring and irrelevant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生认为拉丁语无聊且无关紧要。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His age is completely irrelevant if he can do the job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他能胜任这份工作﹐年龄完全不重要。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The defendant’s lawyer argued that his past offenses were irrelevant to this case.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被告律师辩称他的前科和本案无关。

Sense.DEF: opposed to religion, or not having any religious feeling
Sense.TRAN: 反宗教的﹔无宗教信仰的

Sense.DEF: so bad that it is impossible to make it better
Sense.TRAN: 不可救药的﹔无法纠正的

Sense.DEF: irreparable damage, harm etc is so bad that it can never be repaired or made better
Sense.TRAN: 〔破坏﹑伤害等〕不能修复的﹐无法弥补的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Extensive mining will cause irreparable damage to the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量采矿会对该地区造成无法弥补的损害。

Sense.DEF: too special, valuable, or unusual to be replaced by anything else
Sense.TRAN: 〔因太特别或贵重而〕不可代替的﹐独一无二的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Works of art were lost, many of them irreplaceable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多艺术品丢失了﹐其中有许多都是独一无二的。

Sense.DEF: full of energy, confidence, and happiness so that you never seem unhappy
Sense.TRAN: 开朗乐观的﹔充满精力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an irrepressible optimist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精力充沛的乐观主义者

Sense.DEF: something, such as someone’s behaviour, that is irreproachable is so good that you cannot criticize it
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为等〕无可指责的﹐无可挑剔的

Sense.DEF: so attractive, desirable etc that you cannot prevent yourself from wanting it
Sense.TRAN: 无法抗拒的﹔非常诱人的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tax-cutting proposals could prove irresistible to lawmakers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 减税议案可能最终会让立法者无法抗拒其诱惑。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Men find Natalie irresistible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男人们觉得无法抗拒纳塔莉的魅力。

Sense.DEF: too strong or powerful to be stopped or prevented
Sense.TRAN: 〔力量太强大而〕不可遏止的﹔不可避免的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was overcome by an irresistible urge to cry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我控制不住想大哭一场。

Sense.DEF: unable to decide what to do
Sense.TRAN: 没有决断力的﹔犹豫不决的

Sense.DEF: used when saying that a particular fact has no effect on a situation and is not important
Sense.TRAN: 不受某事物影响﹔不考虑某事物﹔不问某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The course is open to anyone, irrespective of age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门课任何人都可参加﹐没有年龄限制。

Sense.DEF: doing careless things without thinking or worrying about the possible bad results

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When it comes to money, Dan is completely irresponsible.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 说到钱﹐丹完全不负责任。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is irresponsible (for sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It would be irresponsible not to turn up for work without calling.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不打电话说一声就不去上班是不负责任的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It was highly irresponsible of him to leave the children on their own in the pool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把孩子们独自留在游泳池里﹐真是太不负责任了。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的所作所为完全不负责任。

Sense.DEF: an irretrievable situation cannot be made right again
Sense.TRAN: 不能挽回的﹔无法复原的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the irretrievable breakdown of their marriage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的婚姻无法挽救

Sense.DEF: the loss of something that you can never get back
someone who is irreverent does not show respect for organizations, customs, beliefs etc that most other people respect – often used to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 〔对组织﹑习俗﹑信仰等〕不尊敬的﹐不恭的〔常含褒义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: his irreverent sense of humour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他失礼的幽默感
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has an irreverent attitude towards marriage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对婚姻有一种不当回事的态度。

Sense.DEF: irreversible damage, change etc is so serious or so great that you cannot change something back to how it was before
Sense.TRAN: 〔损害﹑变化等〕不可挽回的﹐不可逆转的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fossil fuels have caused irreversible damage to the environment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 矿物燃料已对环境造成了不可挽回的破坏。

Sense.DEF: if an illness or bad physical condition is irreversible, it will continue to exist and cannot be cured
Sense.TRAN: 不能治愈的﹔不能挽救的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Miller is in an irreversible coma.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米勒一直昏迷不醒﹐无法挽救了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: irreversible blindness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可逆性失明

RunOn.EXAMPLE: His reputation was irreversibly damaged by the affair.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事使他的名誉蒙受了无法挽回的损害。

Sense.DEF: an irrevocable decision, action etc cannot be changed or stopped
Sense.TRAN: 〔决定﹑行动等〕不可更改的﹐不可取消的﹐不可撤回的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Think about the situation carefully before you take an irrevocable step.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在你踏出不能回头的一步之前要三思。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: machines that irrevocably changed the pattern of rural life
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 使乡村生活模式发生不可逆转的变化的机械

Sense.DEF: to supply land or crops with water
Sense.EXAMPLE: The water in Lake Powell is used to irrigate the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 包尔湖的水被用来灌溉该地区。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 灌溉过的土地/农场/庄稼

Sense.DEF: to wash a wound with a flow of liquid
getting annoyed quickly or easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jo was tired, irritable, and depressed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔疲惫暴躁﹐而且情绪低落。

Sense.DEF:
a medical condition in which you have problems with your
bowels
, typically including pain,
diarrhoea
, and
constipation
Sense.TRAN: 肠易激综合征〔典型症状为疼痛﹑腹泻和便秘〕

Sense.DEF: something that keeps annoying you over a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Low flying aircraft are a constant irritant in this area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低空飞行的飞机使这个地区终日不得安宁。

Sense.DEF: a substance that can make a part of your body painful and sore
Sense.TRAN: 〔使身体某部位肿痛的〕刺激物
Sense.EXAMPLE: a skin irritant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刺激皮肤的东西

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel annoyed or impatient, especially by doing something many times or for a long period of time
Sense.TRAN: 使烦躁〔尤因重复或长时间做某事〕﹔激怒
Sense.EXAMPLE: It really irritates me when he doesn’t help around the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家里的事情他一点都不帮忙﹐真让我恼火。

Sense.DEF: to make a part of your body painful and sore
Sense.TRAN: 使〔身体的某一部位〕疼痛
Sense.EXAMPLE: This cream may irritate sensitive skin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种润肤霜对敏感性皮肤可能有刺激。

Sense.DEF: feeling annoyed and impatient about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: John was getting irritated by all her questions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰对她提的那些问题越来越恼火了。

Sense.DEF: painful and sore
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her throat and eyes were irritated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的喉咙和眼睛发炎疼痛。

Sense.DEF: an irritating habit, situation etc keeps annoying you
Sense.TRAN: 〔习惯﹑情况等〕烦人的﹐使人恼火的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s the most irritating man I’ve ever met.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是我遇到过的最烦人的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was smiling in a way I found very irritating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他笑的样子使我恼火。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has an irritating habit of interrupting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有个烦人的习惯﹐就是老打断别人的话。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a dry irritating cough
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人痛苦的干咳

Sense.DEF: the feeling of being annoyed about something, especially something that happens repeatedly or for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 恼怒﹐生气〔尤指被反复发生或长时间发生的事激怒〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heavy traffic is a constant source of irritation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拥挤的交通一向是令人头痛的问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The doctor’s irritation at being interrupted showed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生被打扰﹐表现出了不耐烦的样子。

Sense.DEF: something that makes you annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children are just an irritation for him when he’s trying to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想工作的时候﹐那些孩子就会让他觉得很恼火。

Sense.DEF: a painful sore feeling on a part of your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: The astringent can cause irritation to sensitive skin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧肤水可使敏感性皮肤产生疼痛感。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a throat irritation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喉咙痛

Sense.DEF: a sudden rush of people or things into a place

the third person singular of the present tense of
be
Sense.TRAN: 动词 be 的第三人称单数现在式

Sense.DEF:
a British spelling of
-ization

a number that is given to every book that is
published
a system that is used to send computer information at very high speed along an electronic wire similar to a telephone line

a British spelling of
-ize
the people or language of a particular country or place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are the British unfriendly?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国人不友善吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: learning to speak Turkish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学说土耳其语
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s Swedish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是瑞典人。

Sense.DEF: of a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Spanish food from Spain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西班牙食品

Sense.DEF: typical of or like a particular type of person
Sense.EXAMPLE: foolish behaviour typical of a fool
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 愚蠢的行为
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be so childish! do not behave like a child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别这么孩子气！
Sense.EXAMPLE: snobbish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 势利的

Sense.DEF: the ending of some adjectives that show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔作为一些形容词的后缀表示贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: selfish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自私的

Sense.DEF: rather
Sense.EXAMPLE: youngish not very young, but not old either
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还算年轻的
Sense.EXAMPLE: tallish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 略高的
Sense.EXAMPLE: reddish hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 淡红色的头发

Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll expect you eightish at about 8 o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望你8点左右来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s fortyish about 40 years old.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他40岁左右。

Sense.DEF: the Muslim religion, which was started by Muhammad and whose holy book is the Quran (Koran)
Sense.TRAN: 伊斯兰教〔由穆罕默德创立﹐奉《古兰经》为圣典〕

Sense.DEF: the people and countries that follow this religion
Sense.TRAN: 伊斯兰教徒﹔伊斯兰教国家

Sense.DEF: someone who strictly follows the teachings of Islam and believes it should have more influence
hatred or fear of Muslims
a piece of land completely surrounded by water
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Cayman Islands
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开曼群岛
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Greek island of Crete
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希腊克里特岛

GramExa.EXAMPLE: No cars are allowed on the island.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 岛上禁止驾驶汽车。

PIC.HEADING: ISLAND 岛
PIC.PICCONTENT: island 岛屿；archipelago 群岛；peninsula 半岛

Sense.DEF: someone who lives on an island
a word for an island, used in poetry or in names of islands
Sense.EXAMPLE: the British Isles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不列颠群岛

Sense.DEF: a very small island
a political belief or religion based on a particular principle or the ideas and beliefs of a particular person
Sense.EXAMPLE: socialism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会主义
Sense.EXAMPLE: Buddhism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 佛教

Sense.DEF: the action or process of doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: his criticism of my work
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对我工作的批评

Sense.DEF: an action or remark that has a particular quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: her witticisms funny remarks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的俏皮话

Sense.DEF: the state of being like something or someone, or having a particular quality
Sense.TRAN: 〔与某物或某人的〕相似性﹔特征
Sense.EXAMPLE: heroism being a hero; bravery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英雄气概﹔勇气
Sense.EXAMPLE: magnetism being magnetic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 磁性

Sense.DEF: illness caused by too much of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔由于某物过多而引起的〕疾病
Sense.EXAMPLE: alcoholism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酗酒

Sense.DEF: the practice of treating people unfairly because of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: sexism making unfair differences between men and women
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 性别歧视
Sense.EXAMPLE: racism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 种族歧视

Sense.DEF: used to describe a set of ideas or beliefs whose name ends in ‘ism’, especially when you think that they are not sensible or practical
Sense.TRAN: 主义﹐学说〔用来描述以ism结尾的思想或信仰﹔尤用于你认为这种理论不合理或不实际时〕
the short form of 缩略式= ‘is not’

Sense.DEF: the same all through or in every part
Sense.EXAMPLE: an isotherm line joining places of equal temperature
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等温线

Sense.DEF: a line on a weather map joining places where the air pressure is the same
to separate one person, group, or thing from other people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The town was isolated by the floods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洪水使该镇与外界隔绝。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The US has sought to isolate Cuba both economically and politically.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国一直想在经济和政治上孤立古巴。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Presley’s phenomenal early success isolated him from his friends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 普雷斯利年纪轻轻就成就非凡﹐这使他在朋友中陷于孤立。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: New born babies must be isolated from possible contamination.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新生儿必须隔离﹐以免受感染。

Sense.DEF: if you isolate an idea, problem etc, you consider it separately from other things that are connected with it
Sense.TRAN: 分隔﹐区别看待〔观点﹑问题等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is impossible to isolate political responsibility from moral responsibility.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可能把政治责任和道德责任分离开来。

Sense.DEF: to separate a substance, disease etc from other substances so that it can be studied
Sense.TRAN: 分离〔物质﹑疾病等以进行研究〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hepatitis B virus has been isolated from breast milk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乙型肝炎病毒已从母乳中分离出来。

Sense.DEF: an isolated building, village etc is far away from any others
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物﹑村庄等〕孤零零的﹐偏僻的
Sense.EXAMPLE: small isolated communities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偏僻的小社区
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not many people visit this isolated spot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有多少人到这个偏僻的地方来。

Sense.DEF: feeling alone and unable to meet or speak to other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young mothers often feel isolated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻的妈妈常常感到孤独。

Sense.DEF: an isolated action, event, example etc happens only once, and is not likely to happen again
Sense.TRAN: 〔行动﹑事件﹑例子等〕单独的﹐个别的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Police say that last week’s protest was an isolated incident.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方说上周的抗议只是个别事件。

Sense.DEF: when one group, person, or thing is separate from others
Sense.EXAMPLE: Because of its geographical isolation, the area developed its own unique culture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于地理上的隔绝﹐该地区发展了自己独特的文化。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the isolation of rural areas
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乡村地区的偏僻

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the country’s continuing political isolation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家政治上的持续孤立

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The political prisoner had been held in complete isolation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名政治犯被完全隔离﹐单独监禁。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The mansion sits in splendid isolation on top of the hill it is far from everything and looks impressive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宅邸位于山顶﹐远离尘嚣。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Scarlet fever victims had to go to the isolation hospital.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 猩红热患者必须进隔离医院。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a patient’s isolation period
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 病人的隔离期

Sense.DEF: when someone feels alone and unable to meet or speak to other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Retirement can often cause feelings of isolation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 退休生活常让人感到孤独。
Sense.EXAMPLE: elderly people living in social isolation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活在与社会隔绝状态中的老人

Sense.DEF: if something exists or is considered in isolation, it exists or is considered separately from other things that are connected with it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The future of health care cannot be considered in isolation from economic factors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不能脱离经济因素而孤立地看待保健服务的未来。

Sense.DEF: beliefs or actions that are based on the political principle that your country should not be involved in the affairs of other countries
Sense.TRAN: 孤立主义〔指一个国家不应卷入其他国家的事务〕

Sense.DEF: exercises that make your muscles stronger by pushing against each other

a
triangle
in which two of the sides are the same length
a line on a weather map joining places where the temperature is the same

a drink made especially for people who are exercising or playing sport, containing
electrolytes
which help your body take in liquid effectively, and
carbohydrates
that give your body extra energy
Sense.TRAN: 等渗饮料〔含电解液和碳水化合物〕

Sense.DEF:
one of the possible different forms of an atom of a particular
element
simple chemical substance
a business that provides a connection to the Internet for people’s computers
relating to Israel or its people
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Israeli government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以色列政府

Sense.DEF: someone from Israel
someone who lived in Israel in the past when it was ruled by kings, or relating to this country or its people
Sense.TRAN: 古以色列人﹔古以色列王国的﹔古以色列人的

Sense.DEF: a subject or problem that is often discussed or argued about, especially a social or political matter that affects the interests of a lot of people
Sense.TRAN: 尤指社会或政治方面的〕议题﹔争论的问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: Abortion is a highly controversial issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 堕胎是个很有争议的话题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We should raise the issue of discrimination with the council.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应提请市政会讨论歧视的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The key issue is whether workers should be classified as ‘employees’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关键问题是工人是否应该界定为“雇员”。

Sense.DEF: a magazine or newspaper printed for a particular day, week, or month

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the January issue of Newsweek
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 《新闻周刊》1月号

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Have you seen the latest issue?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看过最新的那一期吗？

Sense.DEF: to disagree or argue with someone about something
Sense.TRAN: 不同意某人/某事﹔与某人争论
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is difficult to take issue with his analysis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他的分析很难有不同看法。

GramExa.PROPFORM: take issue with sb over sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I must take issue with you over what you said yesterday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我必须对你昨天所说的提出异议。

Sense.DEF: to argue about something, especially in a way that annoys other people because they do not think it is important
Sense.TRAN: 就某事挑起争端〔尤指小题大做〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was upset by Eleanor’s remarks, but didn’t make an issue of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对埃莉诺的话很恼火﹐但我没把事情闹大。

Subsense.DEF: to have problems dealing with something because of something that happened in the past
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There’s a self-help group for people who have issues with money.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为有经济困难的人设立了一个自助小组。

Subsense.DEF: if you have issues with someone or something, you do not agree with or approve of them
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I have a few issues with Marc.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对马克有些异议。

Sense.DEF: the problem or subject at issue is the most important part of what you are discussing or considering
Sense.EXAMPLE: At issue here is the extent to which exam results reflect a student’s ability.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考试成绩能在多大程度上反映学生的能力是问题的焦点。

Sense.DEF: the act of officially giving people something to use
Sense.EXAMPLE: the issue of identity cards to all non-residents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给非永久居民发身份证

Sense.DEF:
a new set of something such as
shares
or stamps, made available for people to buy
Sense.TRAN: 新发行的一套〔股票﹑邮票等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We launched the share issue on March 1.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 3月1日我们发行了股票。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new issue of bonds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新发行的债券

Sense.DEF: to die without having any children

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They met to discuss the issue of working conditions at the factory.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们碰头讨论厂里工作条件的问题。

Collocate.COLLOC: raise an issue/bring up an issue
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say an issue should be discussed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Some important issues were raised at the meeting.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 会上提出了一些重要的问题。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government must deal with the issue of gun crime.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府必须解决枪械犯罪的问题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: solve it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The issue was settled after some tough negotiations.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过几轮激烈的谈判之后这个问题得到了解决。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: accept that an issue exists and deal with it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Politicians seem to be reluctant to face the issue.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治家们好像不愿面对这个问题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: avoid discussing an issue
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is no point in evading the issue any longer.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 没理由再对这个问题避而不谈了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make an issue more difficult to understand or deal with than it needs to be
Collocate.EXAMPLE: You must not let your feelings cloud the issue.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你决不要让个人感情把这个问题复杂化。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: bring attention to it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The minister used his speech to highlight the issue of global warming.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位部长通过演讲强调全球变暖问题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: people started to discuss it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The issue arose during a meeting of the Budget Committee.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在预算委员会的一次会议上这个问题被提起讨论。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: This chapter discusses the ethical issues surrounding genetically modified foods.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 本章讨论转基因食品在道德方面的问题。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They discussed a number of political issues.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们讨论了一些政治问题。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The committee met several times to discuss this important issue.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会开了好几次会来讨论这一重要问题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very important
Collocate.EXAMPLE: For me, the big issue is cost.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 对我来说,最大的问题是费用。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was able to grasp complex issues quickly.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他能迅速搞懂复杂的问题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an issue that causes strong feelings and arguments
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Abortion is a controversial issue.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 堕胎是一个有争议的问题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a difficult one that causes disagreement
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Illegal immigration is always a thorny issue.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 非法移民一直是个棘手的问题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a very important and urgent issue
Collocate.EXAMPLE: For country-dwellers, transport is a burning issue.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 对乡村居民来说,交通问题是当务之急。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: more general issues, that affect more people or things
Collocate.EXAMPLE: This is a question that raises much wider issues.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事引发了更为广泛的问题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an issue that is important at the present time
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The magazine discusses topical issues in science.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该杂志讨论热门的科学话题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the cause, or a more important problem that is related to something
a basic and important issue
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 基本的问题,重要的问题

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that has not been dealt with

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A range of issues were debated at the meeting.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 会上就一系列问题进行了讨论。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: something is not the most important problem or part
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Price alone is not the issue.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 单价格一项并非问题所在。

Sense.DEF: to officially make a statement, give an order, warning etc
Sense.TRAN: 发表〔声明〕﹔颁布﹐发出〔命令﹑警告等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Silva issued a statement denying all knowledge of the affair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西尔瓦发表声明﹐宣称对此事一无所知。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a warning issued by the Surgeon General
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: （美国）卫生局局长发出的警告

Sense.DEF: if an organization or someone in an official position issues something such as documents or equipment, they give these things to people who need them
Sense.TRAN: 〔组织或官员〕发给﹐分发〔文件﹑设备等所需之物〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The US State Department issues millions of passports each year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年美国国务院都签发数百万份护照。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All the workers were issued with protective clothing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有工人都配发了防护服。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The policy document will be issued to all employees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政策文件会发给所有的雇员。

Sense.DEF:
to officially produce something such as new stamps, coins, or
shares
and make them available to buy
Sense.TRAN: 正式发行〔新邮票﹑硬币或股票〕

Sense.DEF: if something issues forth, it comes out of a place or thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A low grunt issued forth from his throat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喉咙里发出一阵低沉的咕哝声。

Sense.DEF: if something issues from a place or thing, it comes out of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smoke issued from the factory chimneys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟从工厂烟囱中冒出。

Sense.DEF: someone who believes in a particular religion or set of principles or ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Buddhist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 佛教徒
Sense.EXAMPLE: an atheist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无神论者
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Scottish Nationalist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏格兰民族主义者

Sense.DEF: relating to or showing a particular political or religious belief
Sense.TRAN: 与某政治[宗教]信仰有关的﹔表明某政治[宗教]信仰的
Sense.EXAMPLE: her socialist views
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的社会主义观点
Sense.EXAMPLE: rightist parties political parties with right-wing opinions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 右翼政党

Sense.DEF: someone who studies a particular subject, plays a particular instrument, or does a particular type of work
Sense.TRAN: 〔某学科的〕研究者﹔〔某乐器的〕演奏者﹔〔某工作的〕从事者
Sense.EXAMPLE: a linguist someone who studies or learns languages
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言学家
Sense.EXAMPLE: a novelist someone who writes novels
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小说家
Sense.EXAMPLE: a guitarist someone who plays the guitar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉他手
Sense.EXAMPLE: a machinist someone who operates a machine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机械师

Sense.DEF: treating people unfairly because of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very sexist remark making unfair differences between men and women
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严重的性别歧视言论

Sense.DEF: someone who treats people unfairly because of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re a bunch of racists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们是一群种族主义分子。

Sense.DEF: a narrow piece of land with water on both sides, that connects two larger areas of land
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Isthmus of Panama
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴拿马地峡

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a thing, animal, situation, idea etc that has already been mentioned or is already known about
Sense.TRAN: 它﹐这﹐那〔指已经提及或已为对方所知晓的事物﹑动物﹑情况﹑想法等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Where’s your office?’ ‘It’s on the third floor.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你的办公室在哪儿？”“在三楼。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: I love the spring – it’s a wonderful time of the year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢春季——这是一年里最美妙的时节。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were people crying, buildings on fire. It was terrible!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人在哭喊﹐楼房在燃烧―太可怕了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t blame me. It wasn’t my idea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要责备我﹐这不是我的主意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This little beast is a lemur and it lives in Madagascar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这小动物是狐猴﹐生活在马达加斯加。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to the situation that someone is in now, or what is happening now
Sense.TRAN: 〔指某人目前所处的境况或正在发生的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t stand it any longer. I’m resigning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我再也忍受不了啦﹐我要辞职。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How’s it going, Bob? I haven’t seen you for ages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍勃﹐近况如何？我们好久不见了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: And the worst of it is the car isn’t even paid for yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最糟糕的是这辆车子还没有付款。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop it, you two. You’re just being silly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别闹了﹐你们俩。你们真愚蠢。

Sense.DEF: used as the subject or object of a verb when the real subject or object is later in the sentence
Sense.TRAN: 〔用作动词的主语或宾语﹐而真正的主语或宾语在句子的后部〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It worries me the way he keeps changing his mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他老是改变主意﹐这让我很厌烦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s it like being a sailor?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当水手是什么滋味？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Apparently it’s cheaper to fly than to go by train.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然﹐乘飞机比坐火车便宜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a pity you couldn’t come.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你来不了﹐真遗憾。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seems that we are not welcome here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来我们在这里不受欢迎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I found it hard to concentrate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得难以集中精神。

Sense.DEF: used as the subject of a sentence when you are talking about the weather, the time, a distance etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔谈论天气﹑时间﹑距离等时作为句子的主语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is it still raining?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还在下雨吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was 4 o’clock and the mail still hadn’t come.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 4点钟了﹐邮件还没到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s my birthday today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天是我的生日。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s over 200 miles from London to Manchester.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从伦敦到曼彻斯特有两百多英里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It gets dark very early in the winter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冬天天黑得很早。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s three years since I last saw her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上次见到她至今已有三年了。

Sense.DEF: used with the verb ‘be’ to emphasize that you are talking about one particular thing, person, group etc and not any other
Sense.TRAN: 〔与动词 be 连用﹐强调你所讲的是某物﹑某人或某团体等﹐而不是任何其他的人或事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s Lawrence you should be talking to.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该和劳伦斯谈谈﹐而不是其他人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was malaria that killed him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他死于疟疾。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was in New Zealand that Elizabeth first met Mr Cronje.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊丽莎白是在新西兰初识克龙涅先生的。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a baby when you do not know what sex the baby is
Sense.TRAN: 〔指婴儿﹐用于不知道其性别时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What will you call it if it’s a boy?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是男孩的话﹐你想给他取个什么名字？

Subsense.DEF: used to say who a person is
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Who’s that over there?’ ‘It’s Robert Morley.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那边的人是谁？” “是罗伯特 · 莫利。”

Subsense.DEF: used to say who is speaking, especially on the telephone
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于指说话的人﹐尤指打电话或接电话的人〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Hello, it’s Frank here.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你好﹐我是弗兰克。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s all right, it’s only me.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没事﹐是我呀。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to sex
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you done it with him yet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你和他上床了吗？

Variant.LEXVAR: if it hadn’t been for sb/sth

Sense.DEF: used to say who or what prevents or prevented something from happening
Sense.TRAN: 要不是某人﹔要是没有某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: We would have arrived much earlier if it hadn’t been for the snow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要不是下雪﹐我们早就到了。

Sense.DEF: a particular ability or quality that is needed in order to do something
Sense.TRAN: 〔做某事所需的〕特殊能力[品质]
Sense.EXAMPLE: In a job like advertising, you’ve either got it or you haven’t!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像广告这种职业﹐你要么有这份才能﹐要么没有！

Sense.DEF: used to say that something you expected to happen is actually going to happen
Sense.TRAN: 就是它〔表示预计发生的事真要发生了〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is it, boys – the moment we’ve been waiting for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时候到了﹐男孩们﹐我们一直等的就是这一刻。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that something is completely finished or that a situation cannot be changed
Subsense.TRAN: 完了﹐没有了〔表示某事已结束或情况不可改变〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: That’s it then. There’s nothing more we can do.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那就结束了。 我们再没什么可做了。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone that they are doing something correctly
Subsense.TRAN: 做得对﹐就是这样〔用于告诉某人做得对〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Slowly...slowly. Yeah, that’s it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慢点﹐慢点。对﹐就是这样。

Subsense.DEF: used when you are angry about a situation and you do not want it to continue
Subsense.TRAN: 够了〔表示愤怒﹐不想某事继续〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: That’s it. I’m leaving.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 够了﹐我要离开了。

Sense.DEF: to think you are more important than you are
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just because he got a higher mark, he really thinks he’s it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只因为分数比别人高他就自以为很了不起。

Sense.DEF: a bag, dress etc that is very fashionable and desirable
Sense.TRAN: 时髦而抢手的一个包/一件连衣裙/一双鞋等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve managed to get my hands on this season’s it bag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我好不容易买到了本季度很流行的一个包。

Sense.DEF: the study or use of electronic processes and equipment for storing information and making it available
relating to Italy, its people, or its language
Sense.TRAN: 意大利的﹔意大利人的﹔意大利语的

Sense.DEF: someone from Italy
the language used in Italy
with an Italian style or appearance
Sense.TRAN: 意大利风格的﹔意大利特色的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an Italianate villa
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一栋意大利风格的别墅

Sense.DEF: to put or print something in italics
Sense.TRAN: 把…排成斜体﹔用斜体字印刷〔某物〕

Sense.DEF: a type of printed letters that lean to the right, often used to emphasize particular words
Sense.TRAN: 斜体字〔常用来表示强调〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This example is written in italics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个例句是用斜体书写的。

Sense.DEF: Italian and something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: a joint Italo-German proposal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项意（大利）德（国）联合提议

Sense.DEF: if part of your body or your clothes itch, you have an unpleasant feeling on your skin that makes you want to rub it with your nails
Sense.EXAMPLE: My feet were itching terribly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的脚痒得厉害。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The label on this shirt itches me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件衬衫上的标签刺得我痒痒的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be itching to do sth/be itching for sth
Sense.DEF: to want to do something very much and as soon as possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was itching for a fight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很想打架。

Sense.DEF: an uncomfortable feeling on your skin that makes you want to rub it with your nails
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scratch my back – I have an itch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我挠挠背——我觉得痒。

Sense.DEF: a strong desire to do or have something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an itch for adventure
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想要探险的强烈愿望

Sense.DEF: if part of your body is itchy, it feels slightly unpleasant and you want to rub it with your nails
Sense.EXAMPLE: My eyes sometimes get red and itchy in the summer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到夏天我的眼睛有时会发红发痒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an itchy rash
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发痒的皮疹

Sense.DEF: if clothes are itchy, they make your skin feel slightly unpleasant, so that you want to rub your skin with your nails
Sense.EXAMPLE: These tights are all itchy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条连裤袜穿着好痒。

Sense.DEF: wanting to go somewhere new or do something different
Sense.TRAN: 渴望〔去新的地方﹑做不同的事情〕的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s had that job now for about eight years, and he’s starting to get itchy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他做那份工作快八年了﹐现在开始感到腻烦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve only been back home for a few months and I’ve already got itchy feet the desire to go somewhere new.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我回家才几个月﹐脚又痒痒地想出门了。

Sense.DEF: someone with itchy fingers is likely to steal things
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tucked the bills deep into my pocket, away from itchy fingers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把钞票塞进口袋深处﹐以防扒手偷走。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘it would’ or 或 ‘it had’
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d do it if I thought it’d help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我认为有用﹐我就会去做的。

Sense.DEF: a follower or supporter of a particular idea or person – often used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔某个观念或人的〕支持者﹐追随者 〔常含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a group of Trotskyites followers of Trotsky’s political ideas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群托洛茨基分子
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Pre-Raphaelites
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉斐尔前派艺术家

Sense.DEF: relating to a particular set of religious or political ideas, or with the ideas of a particular person
Sense.TRAN: 具有〔某宗教﹑政治或某人〕观点的
Sense.EXAMPLE: his Reaganite opinions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的里根主义观点

Sense.DEF: someone who lives in a particular place or belongs to a particular group
Sense.TRAN: 住在…的人﹔属于…组织的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Brooklynite someone from Brooklyn
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布鲁克林区的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Israelites in the Bible
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 〔《圣经》中的〕古代以色列人

Sense.DEF: a single thing, especially one thing in a list, group, or set of things
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指清单上﹑一群或一组事物中的〕一项﹐一件﹐一条
Sense.EXAMPLE: He opened the cardboard box and took out each item.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打开纸板箱把里面的物品一一拿出来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The store is having a sale on furniture and household items.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家商店正在减价出售家具和家居用品。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We went on to the next item on the agenda.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们继续议程的下一项。

GramExa.GLOSS: a single piece of clothing, furniture, jewellery etc

Sense.EXAMPLE: luxury items such as exotic spices and perfumes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 异国香料和香水之类的奢侈品
Sense.EXAMPLE: The original 1965 bottle is now a collector’s item one of a set of objects people like to collect because they are interesting or valuable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这瓶1965年生产的原装酒现在是收藏品。

Sense.DEF: a single, usually short, piece of news in a newspaper or magazine, or on television
Sense.TRAN: 〔报纸﹑杂志或电视上的〕一条（短）消息
Sense.EXAMPLE: I also saw that news item in the Sunday Times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在《星期日泰晤士报》上也看到了那条新闻。

Sense.DEF: if two people are an item, they are having a romantic or sexual relationship
to make a list and give details about each thing on the list
Sense.EXAMPLE: an itemized bill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 逐项开列的账单

Sense.DEF: if a computer iterates, it goes through a set of instructions before going through them for a second time
to say or do something again

a fashionable and attractive young woman, especially one from a rich
upper-class
family, who is well-known because she goes to a lot of fashionable events that people read about in newspapers and magazines
travelling from place to place, especially to work
Sense.EXAMPLE: itinerant labourers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 流动劳工

Sense.DEF: a plan or list of the places you will visit on a journey
an illness or infection that effects a particular part of your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: tonsillitis infection of the tonsils
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扁桃体炎

Sense.DEF: the condition of having too much of something or liking something too much
Sense.EXAMPLE: televisionitis watching too much television
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视迷

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘it will’
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll be dark before they get back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们还没回来天就会黑了。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘it is’
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s raining.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正在下雨。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘it has’
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s been cloudy all day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一整天阴云密布。

Entry.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse with its, which is the possessive form of ‘it’. 不要和its混淆。its 是it的所有格形式。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to something that belongs to or is connected with a thing, animal, baby etc that has already been mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 它的﹔他的﹔她的〔指东西﹑动物﹑婴儿等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Salzburg is famous for its beautiful buildings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨尔茨堡以美丽的建筑闻名。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel has its own pool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店有自己的游泳池。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse with it’s . ‘it is’ or ‘it has’ . 不要和it’s混淆。

Sense.DEF: used to show that a thing, organization, animal, or baby that does something is affected by its own action
Sense.TRAN: 自己﹐自身〔用于表示施动者受本身动作影响〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cat lay on the sofa, washing itself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫躺在沙发上把自己舔干。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The machine switches itself off when the process is complete.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作程序结束﹐机器会自动关闭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small local enterprise that has transformed itself into a highly successful company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已发展为业绩喜人的公司的一家小型地方企业

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you are talking about one particular thing, organization etc
Sense.TRAN: 自身﹐本身〔用以强调某事物等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve checked the wiring, so the problem may be the television itself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已检查过线路﹐所以问题也许出在电视机本身。

Sense.DEF: considered separately from any other facts
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a slight infection in the lung, which in itself is not serious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肺部有轻微的感染﹐这本身并不严重。

Subsense.DEF: alone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Will the dog be safe left in the car by itself?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把狗独自留在车里安全吗？

Subsense.DEF: without help or without a person making it work
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The door seemed to open all by itself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那扇门好像是自己打开的。

Sense.DEF: not shared with other things
Sense.EXAMPLE: This idea deserves a chapter to itself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个观点值得单独写一章。

Sense.DEF: to be very patient, kind, simple etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Loading the software is simplicity itself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 载入这个软件很简单。

Sense.DEF: very small – used humorously
a type of television programme that allows people who are watching at home to answer questions or find out more information by using a computer or special equipment
a group of British television companies that are paid for by advertising
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国〕独立电视公司〔由几家电视公司组成﹐靠广告收入维持〕

Sense.DEF: the state of having a particular quality, or something that has that quality
Sense.TRAN: 具有某种特性的状态﹔具有某种特性的事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: with great regularity regularly
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很有规律地
Sense.EXAMPLE: such stupidities stupid actions or remarks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如此荒谬的言行

Sense.DEF:
a small plastic or metal object used inside a woman’s
uterus place where a baby develops
to prevent a baby being born
medical equipment that is used to put liquid directly into your blood

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘I have’
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never been here before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以前从未来过这儿。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that does something or can do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: an explosive substance that can explode
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸药
Sense.EXAMPLE: a detective someone who tries to discover facts about crimes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 侦探
Sense.EXAMPLE: the adoptive parents who adopt a child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 养父母

Sense.DEF:
a process in which a human egg is
fertilized
outside the woman’s body
covered with ivy
Sense.TRAN: 常春藤覆盖的﹐爬满常春藤的

Sense.DEF:
the hard smooth yellowish-white substance from the
tuskslong teeth
of an
elephant
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ivory chess set
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一副象牙国际象棋

Sense.DEF: a yellowish-white colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ivory silk wedding gown
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乳白色真丝婚纱

Sense.DEF: something made of ivory, especially a small figure of a person or animal
Sense.TRAN: 象牙制品〔尤指小型人像或动物像〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a collection of ivories
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 象牙制品藏品

Sense.DEF: a place or situation where you are separated from the difficulties of ordinary life and so are unable to understand them, used especially to describe a college or university
Sense.TRAN: 象牙塔〔脱离现实生活的小天地﹐尤用于描述大学〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an academic in an ivory tower
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 象牙塔中的学者

Sense.DEF: a climbing plant with dark green shiny leaves
a group of eight old and respected universities in the northeastern US
Sense.TRAN: 常春藤联盟〔指美国东北部的八所历史悠久﹑声誉卓著的名牌大学〕

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一所常春藤联盟的大学

Sense.DEF:
makes nouns from verbs ending in
-ize
Sense.EXAMPLE: civilization
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文明
Sense.EXAMPLE: crystallization
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结晶

Sense.DEF: to make something have more of a particular quality
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某物〕更大程度地具有〔某种特点〕﹔使…化
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to modernize our procedures make them more modern.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要使我们的程序现代化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Americanized spelling spelling made more American
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美式拼写
Sense.EXAMPLE: privatized transport bus or train services that are owned and operated by private companies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 私有化的运输服务

Sense.DEF: to change something to something else, or be changed to something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The liquid crystallized turned into crystals .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 液体结晶了。

Sense.DEF: to speak or think in the way mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: to soliloquize speak a soliloquy, to yourself
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自言自语
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sat and listened to him sermonizing speaking solemnly, as if in a sermon .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我坐着听他说教。

Sense.DEF: to put into a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was hospitalized after the accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事故发生后她被送进医院。
